I asked you to search for your brother Andor and you did not find out anything and instead you are bringing me a necklace? Go and search for your brother!

conversationlist.message: Oh, you are such a good son.

conversationlist.message: No, sorry, but I haven't. I spend most of my time indoors working on my trade though. He could have passed though town without me noticing.

replies.text: Do you get many travelers here?

conversationlist.message: We get quite a few, yes. We are not on the main road, but many paths pass through Brimhaven.

replies.text: OK. Thanks for the information. I need to go.

conversationlist.message: Rrrrrraaaaaaa

conversationlist.message: I see you talking to your brother, somewhere far from here in a big city. Feygard or Nor City, I think.
I see your brother bound by dark forces.

He needs your help. Something horrible ... argh.
I can't see more. My view seems to be blocked.
I see you walking up a path on a mountain. Beware! There is something wating for you ahead. I see you being attacked by monsters and they kill you.
I see you frozen to stone on a pedestal admist many flowers. Or is it a statue with your looks?
I see a thief. He will take something from you.
I can see you in a prison cell but I cannot be sure where it is.
I can see you talking to some nobles in a big city. Feygard or Nor City, I think.
I see you picking up a lot of coins from a hole in the ground. Can it be behind your father's house?
I see a man pacing up and down in a little house. He seems to be waiting for someone.

replies.text: That must be my father Mikhail, he is waiting for me and my brother!

conversationlist.message: Then go and get your brother and go home to him.
Don't disturb our game. Go away!

replies.text: Explain to me the rules, please.

Hello and welcome to Loneford. Please have a seat, I'll be right there.

replies.text: Do you have anything to eat around here?

conversationlist.message: Sure, have a look.

Arngyr grabs you by the shoulder and pulls you back.
If you want to rest over there, you need to check with me first.
Yes, can I help you?

replies.text: Mind if I use one of the beds back there?

conversationlist.message: Oh no, not at all. Go ahead. After all you have done for us here in Loneford, it would be a privilege to be able to give something back to you.
These beds are mostly used by us guards. But I guess I could make an exception since you're just a kid. Shall we say, 600 gold and you may use it?

replies.text: What?! That's a bit much, don't you think?

conversationlist.message: Thank you.
Use the bed in the back over there as much as you like.
Look, kid. I make the rules around here. If that's my price then that's my price. Take it or leave it.
Hello again. I hope the bed is comfortable enough.
Walk with the Shadow, child.
Oh, poor old Selgan. Why did it have to be him? I wonder who is next, and I fear for the worst.
I can't see how we could make it without the help of those nice guards from Feygard around here. We are truly lucky to have their assistance.
We are lucky to have Feygard here helping us.
Who are you? Have you seen my father Selgan? They all tell me he will be back shortly, but they are all lying! I know it, I know it! He wasn't home yesterday, and he isn't home today.
This is no place for a kid like you. I think you better leave now.

The sign says:
Welcome to Vilegard, the friendliest town around.
Welcome to the Foaming Flask tavern!

North: Loneford

East: Nor City
West: Vilegard
Welcome, traveller.
You must be the newcomer that I heard about that traveled up the mountainside.
We need your help in dealing with some ... problems.
Oh sorry, I did not introduce myself properly. I am Harlenn, battle master of the people living in this mountain settlement.

replies.text: I was told to see you by the guide that led me up the mountain.

conversationlist.message: Oh yes, we are lucky he found you. You see, we seldom travel that far down the mountain.
We spend most of our time in the settlement up here on the mountain.
However, recent events have forced us to send for help. We are lucky you found us.

replies.text: What problems are you referring to?

conversationlist.message: I am sure you noticed just by getting here. The monsters of course!
Those damn beasts outside our very settlement. The white wyrms and the aulaeth, and their trainers are even deadlier.

replies.text: Those? They were no match for me.
I can see where this is going. You need me to deal with them for you I guess?
At least they aren't anything like those gornaud beasts at the bottom of the mountain.

conversationlist.message: Well, yes. But just killing them won't have any effect. We have tried that, to no avail. They just keep coming back.
You sound like my kind of type!
Gornaud? I haven't heard about those. But I'm sure they couldn't possibly be worse than these beasts up here.
Anyway, the beasts are really starting to cut down our numbers. But they are not our only concern.
On top of that, we are being attacked by raids from those bastards down in that low-life town of Prim at the base of the mountain.
Oh, those treacherous, fake bastards.

replies.text: I talked to Guthbered in Prim. They say you are the ones doing the attacks, and that you are behind the gornaud attacks on Prim.
Is there anything I can do to help?

conversationlist.message: They come here at night and sabotage our supplies.
We are almost certain they are the ones behind these monsters also.

replies.text: I talked to Guthbered in Prim. They say you are the ones doing the attacks, and that you are behind the gornaud attacks on Prim.
Is there anything I can do to help?

conversationlist.message: Why, yes. Of course. If you are up to it.
Considering you made it up here alive, I'm pretty sure you can handle yourself.
We?! Hah! It figures he would say that. They are always lying and cheating to get things their way. We have certainly not attacked them!
It is, of course, *they* who are the ones causing all the trouble.
They even captured one of our fellow scouts. Who knows what they have done to him.
I'm telling you, they are treacherous and lying!

replies.text: Sure, I believe you. What do you need from me?
What would I gain by helping you instead of them?
I'm not buying this. I think I would rather help the people of Prim than you people.

conversationlist.message: Gain? Our trust of course. You would always be welcome here in our camp. Our traders have some excellent equipment.

replies.text: OK, I'll help you deal with them.
I'm still not convinced, but I'll help you for now.

conversationlist.message: Good. We will need an able fighter to help us deal with the monsters and the Prim bandits.
Bah. Then you are useless to me. Why did you even bother to come up here and waste my time? Begone.
OK, this is the plan. I want you to go talk to Guthbered down in Prim, and give him our ultimatum:
Either they stop their attacks, or we will have to deal with them.

replies.text: Sure. I will go tell him your ultimatum.
No. In fact, I think I should help the people of Prim instead.

conversationlist.message: Good. Now hurry! We don't know how much time we have left before they attack again.
You again? I want no business with you. Leave me.

replies.text: Why are you people attacking the village of Prim?

conversationlist.message: Welcome back, traveller. What's on your mind?

replies.text: I talked to Guthbered in Prim. They say you are attacking Prim, and that you are behind the gornaud attacks on Prim.
What was that you said earlier about the monsters that are attacking your settlement?

conversationlist.message: Welcome back, traveller. Did you talk to that deceiving Guthbered down in Prim?

replies.text: What was I supposed to do again?
Yes, I talked to him. He denies that they are behind any of the attacks.
I talked to Guthbered in Prim. They say you are the ones doing the attacks, and that you are behind the gornaud attacks on Prim.

conversationlist.message: My scouts have given me a most interesting report. They say you are working for Prim.
Of course we can't have that here. We can't have a spy in our midst. You should leave our settlement while you still can, traitor.
Thank you, friend. Your help is greatly appreciated. Everyone in the Blackwater mountain settlement will want to talk to you now.
I'm sure the monster attacks will stop now when we kill the last few monsters that are outside the settlement.
He denies it?! Bah, that treacherous fool. I should have known that he wouldn't dare tell the truth.
I am still sure that they somehow are behind all these attacks on us. Who else could there be? There are no other settlements around here for quite a walk.
Besides, they have always been treacherous. No, of course they are behind the attacks.
OK, this leaves us with no choice. We will have to step this up to another level.
Are you sure you are up to it? You are not one of their spies are you? If you are working for them, then you should know that they are not to be trusted!

replies.text: I am ready for anything. I will help your settlement.
Actually, now that you mention it...
Yes, I am working for Prim also. They seem like sensible people.

conversationlist.message: What? Are you working for them or not?

replies.text: No, never mind. I am ready to help your settlement.
I was. But I have decided to help you instead.
Yes. I am helping them get rid of you people.

conversationlist.message: Good.
We believe they are planning to attack us any day now. But we lack the proof that we would need to do anything about it.
This is where I think an outsider like you might help.
I want you to go investigate Prim for any signs that you might find of them preparing an attack on us.
Good. Try not to be seen. You should go look for any clues around where that deceiving Guthbered stays.
Hello again. Did you find any clues in Prim that they are planning to attack us?

replies.text: Yes. I found plans that they are recruiting mercenaries and will attack your settlement.
What was I supposed to do again?

conversationlist.message: Keep looking. I am sure they are planning something wicked.
I knew it! I knew they were up to something.
Oh that lying pig Guthbered.
Anyway, thank you for your help in finding this evidence.
This calls for drastic measures. We have to act quickly before they can have time to complete their plan.
An old saying goes something like 'The only way to truly kill the Gorgon is by removing the head'. In this case, the head of those bastards down in Prim is that fellow Guthbered.
We should do something about him. You have proven your worth so far. This will be your final assignment.
I want you to go ... deal ... with him. Guthbered. Preferably in the most painful and gruesome way you can think of.

replies.text: Are you sure more violence will really solve this conflict?
He is as good as dead.

conversationlist.message: You saw the plans yourself. They are going to attack us if we don't do something about them. Of course we have to kill him!

replies.text: I will remove him, but I will try to find a peaceful solution to this.
Very well. He is as good as dead.

conversationlist.message: Excellent. Return to me once the deed is done.
Fine. Do whatever you need to remove him, but I don't want to deal with their attacks anymore.
Your expression tells me you have blood on your mind.

replies.text: I am sent by the people of Prim to stop you.
I am sent by the people of Prim to stop you. However, I have decided not to kill you.

conversationlist.message: Stop me?! Ha ha. Very well, let's see who is the one being stopped here.
How interesting... Please continue.

replies.text: It's obvious that this conflict will only end in more bloodshed. That should stop here.

conversationlist.message: What are you proposing?

replies.text: My proposal is that you leave this settlement and find a new home somewhere else.

conversationlist.message: Now why would I want to do that?

replies.text: These two towns will always fight each other. By you leaving, they will think they have won, and stop their attacks.

conversationlist.message: Hmm, you might have a point there.
OK, you have convinced me. I will leave this settlement for another to find my home. The survival of my people here is more important than me.
Thank you friend, for talking some sense into me.
Hello again. Have you gotten rid of that lying Guthbered down in Prim?

replies.text: Not yet, but I am working on it.
What was I supposed to do again?

conversationlist.message: Ha ha! He is finally gone! Now we can rest comfortably in our settlement.
They will no longer attack us now that their lying leader is gone!
Thank you friend. Here, have these items as a token of our appreciation for your help.
Hi again, welcome back to the ... Oh wait, I thought you were someone else.

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?
What do you know about the Thieves' Guild?

conversationlist.message: How interesting that you should ask. What if I had seen him? Why would I tell you?
No, I can't tell you. Now please leave.
Wh, what? No, I don't know anything about that.
OK kid. You've proven yourself to me. Yes, I saw some other kid by that description running around here a few days ago.
I don't know what he was up to though. He kept asking a lot of questions. Kind of like you do. *snicker*
Anyway, that's all I know. You should go talk to Umar, he probably knows more. Down that hatch over there.

Who told you that? Argh.

OK so you found us. Now what?

replies.text: Can I join the Thieves' Guild?

conversationlist.message:
Hah! Join the Thieves' Guild?! You?!

You're one funny kid.
OK, tell you what kid. Do a task for me and maybe I'll consider giving you more info.

replies.text: What kind of task are we talking about?
As long as this leads to some treasure, I'm in!

conversationlist.message: Bring me the key of Luthor and we can talk more. I don't know anything about the key itself, but rumor has it that it is located somewhere in the catacombs beneath Fallhaven Church.
How is the search for the key of Luthor going?

replies.text: What was I supposed to do again?
Here, I have it. The key of Luthor.
I'm still looking for it. Bye.

conversationlist.message: Wow, you actually got the key of Luthor? I didn't think you would make it out of there.
Well done kid.
So, let's talk. What do you want to know?

replies.text: What do you know about my brother Andor?

conversationlist.message: Halt! No one is allowed down the pathway to the Duleian Road!

replies.text: Never mind. Shadow be with you.

conversationlist.message: Because a storm recently knocked over some trees that now block the passage. A villager even got hurt. And now the woodcutter that should be responsible doesn't want to cut the fallen trees away.

replies.text: Why doesn't he want to do this work?

conversationlist.message: You're really curious boy... Well our superior, the warden, only wants to pay the woodcutter when he has done his work.

replies.text: Well, this is your problem. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: You? You're just a kid!

replies.text: You're right, but I'd really love to be able to take this path.

conversationlist.message: OK, maybe you can be of use. Talk to the warden. Maybe you can convince him to pay the woodcutter first. But I have to warn you, he is a stubborn beast.

replies.text: OK, thanks for your advice. I'm going to do that!

Hello again. It seems like you have sorted things out. Now the passage isn't blocked anymore. You have my gratitude for doing that.

replies.text: You're welcome. I'm glad the way is opened again!

conversationlist.message: You see a horrifying wolf leader and stumble back.
You have found Jakrar's axe next to the body of the beast.
Hello kid. Did you make any progress on your task?

replies.text: I wasn't able to convince the warden but I'm going to talk to the woodcutter now.
The woodcutter is going to help me if I retrieve his axe!

conversationlist.message: Well good luck with that. Maybe you can convince him.
That sounds great! Good luck!
Are you sure you should be here? Maybe you should go play with ... your toys or something?

replies.text: Watch it. Do you even know who you're talking to?
Hey, no need to be rude.
Hey, those look like some nice items you have there. Care to trade?

conversationlist.message: Ha ha. I can be as rude as I want!

replies.text: Watch it. Do you even know who you're talking to?

conversationlist.message: Hah! Please enlighten me.

replies.text: I was the one who slew the lich Toszylae between Loneford and Brimhaven.
See this amulet that I'm wearing? This is Marrowtaint.
See this ring that I am wearing? This is the Ring of lesser Shadow.
I was the one who helped solve the mystery in Loneford.
I saved the settlement of Prim from the attacks from Blackwater mountain.
I helped the Blackwater mountain settlement make the attacks from Prim stop.
I am the son of an ordinary farmer in a minor settlement called Crossglen, not far west from here! I've even killed a rat or two!

conversationlist.message: That was you? Hah! And you expect me to believe that?
Good for you. It looks just like any other trinket to me.
Ha ha! Now, that's funny!
You have my best wishes, kid. Hope you'll get to see the world some day.
If you're such an experienced adventurer, I'm sure a small task of mine wouldn't be any problem for you?
I've lost an amulet of mine. I was out in the woods around the cabin here and heard a noise coming from the east.
Tired as I was, I didn't notice the things coming out from behind the trees fast enough.
Undead things. Yuck, that smell.
I saw this hole in the ground that they seemed to come out of. The ground had been completely corrupted around it.
Anyway, I ran away and my amulet must have gotten stuck on a branch or something like that.

replies.text: I'll go look for your amulet.

conversationlist.message: Yeah, that's what I though as well.
Good.
Go look just east of my cabin here. You probably need to take the path north when you exit the cabin, and then head east.
Hi again. Did you find my amulet?

replies.text: Can you tell me your story again?

conversationlist.message: OK then. I won't keep you.
Yes, that's the one. It's good to see it back in my hands again.
Thank you for finding my amulet.
Maybe you really are an experienced adventurer after all.
Anyway, see this table here? It's just some old trinkets that I've gathered along the years. Maybe some of them could come in handy for you?

replies.text: Let me see what you have.

conversationlist.message: With you? No way. You look way to inexperienced.

replies.text: Watch it. Do you even know who you're talking to?

conversationlist.message: Hello there. I am Hjaldar.
I used to be a potion-maker. In fact, I used to be the only potion-maker here in Remgard.
That was good business. People even travelled here from other cities down the mountain.
Well, two things. Firstly, I am getting older and don't have the desire to be working full days, making potions for gold.
Secondly, I ran out of most of the ingredients. Some of them are really hard to get.

replies.text: Too bad. Nice talking to you, goodbye.
I am looking for a potion of accuracy focus for the Elwille sisters, can you help with that?

conversationlist.message: Oh, potions of accuracy focus. Yes, those were popular. Unfortunately, I can't help you with that now.
My supply of Lyson marrow extract has gone dry. Without some of that, I can't make potions that are useful for anything really.

replies.text: Is there somewhere I can get some, and bring it to you?

conversationlist.message: Hello again. Sorry about not being able to help you with those potions of accuracy focus that you asked for.
I doubt that. It is really hard to find. Only the most well-stocked potion-makers have it.
I used to get my supply from my old friend Mazeg. I have no idea where he might be these days though.
I guess, if you can find him, he might be able to provide you with some Lyson marrow extract.

replies.text: Any ideas on where I might find him?
This sounds like too much trouble. Never mind that potion.

conversationlist.message: OK then. Sorry I couldn't help you. Goodbye.
No, I don't know. Last time I saw him, he was headed west. From the looks of his backpack, it looked like he was getting ready for quite a long trip to the west.
He even had gear for travelling through colder climates - snow and ice and that sort of thing.

replies.text: Thanks for the info. I will try to find him.
This sounds like too much trouble. Never mind that potion.

conversationlist.message: Good luck finding him. If you do find him, which I doubt you do, please say hello to him from me, and tell him that I am well.
Hello again. Did you find my old friend Mazeg?

replies.text: Yes, I brought you some Lyson marrow extract.
What was that you were saying about those potions of accuracy focus?
What made you stop making potions?
Any ideas on where I might find Mazeg?

conversationlist.message: Oh wow. Yes, this is indeed some of that marrow extract. Nice work finding it!
Thanks for bringing me some of that marrow extract. Nice work finding it!
Tell me, did you find Mazeg or did you get it from somewhere else?

replies.text: I visited Mazeg up in the Blackwater mountain settlement.
You made me run all the way to Blackwater mountain, I sure hope those potions are worth it!

conversationlist.message: Blackwater mountain? I'm afraid I don't know where that is. Never mind, I hope that all is well with my old friend.

replies.text: He told me to send you his warmest greetings.
He seemed like a pitiful old man that has seen the best of his days.

conversationlist.message: Good. Good. I am glad to hear he is well.
Time has not been on his side, I see.
Anyway. Let's make that potion that you asked for earlier. I even prepared the other ingredients for another potion beforehand.

Now, let's see. Some of these...
[Hjaldar pulls out some dried up berries and puts them in his mortar]
Add some of this into some clean vials...
Just a pinch of these into one of these vials...
Finally, the Lyson marrow extract...
There. Now we just need to give them a good shake.
[Hjaldar shakes the vials vigorously, one in each of his hands]
Ah, that should do it. Here you go. One potion of accuracy focus and one potion of damage focus. I hope they will be useful to you.

replies.text: Whatever. I sure hope all this work is worth it!

conversationlist.message: Thanks for contacting Mazeg for me earlier. With this Lyson marrow extract that you brought me, I can now make other potions for you if you want.

replies.text: Let me see what potions you have.

conversationlist.message: What's this, a visitor? How unexpected.
Tell me, what can Thorin do for you?

replies.text: Mind if I use your bed over there to rest?
Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: Oh, not much. Well actually, I am waiting for someone - or rather, some people.
You see, me and my fellow gatherers were out investigating the poisonous nature of the irdegh.
Apparently, I was the only one that was careful enough when handling our wares.
The others got ill quite quick, and we hid in this cave to rest up. However, we had not anticipated these bugs in here.
Those 'scaradon' things are tough! They did not even seem to take any damage when I hit them.
So, that's where I am now. The people that sent us to investigate told us to set up camp if we encountered any problems, and they would come help us.
So far, you are the first visitor here for quite a while.

replies.text: You don't seem all that upset that your friends died.
Anything I can do to help you meanwhile?
Tough luck. I bet help will be here any day now. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: Nah, it's just business. Just business.

replies.text: Anything I can do to help you?
Tough luck. I bet your rescue will be here any day now. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: Hmm. Yes, actually there is something that you could do for me.
The others that I was travelling with, they did not make it this far into the cave, but got attacked by those bugs closer to the entrance.
Considering how they died, I would be very interested in seeing what effects both the irdegh and the scaradons had on them.
If you could find me their remains, I would be most grateful. Maybe I could continue my investigation based on their remains. Hmm, yes that would be great.

replies.text: Sure, find their remains. Sounds easy enough, I'll do it.
I'm all for finding dead things. I'll do it.
Hmm, this sounds a bit shady to me. I'm not sure I should do this.

conversationlist.message: Excellent. Bring me back the remains of all six of them. I would go search myself if those nasty bugs weren't there.
Oh, I did not introduce me, my apologies. I am Thorin.
Too bad. Good day to you then.
Welcome back. Did you find all six of them?

replies.text: No, not yet. I am still looking.
Yes, this is what I found.
Mind if I use your bed over there to rest?
Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: OK then. Please return when you have found them all. I would go search myself if those nasty bugs weren't there.
Please, go ahead. You may rest here as much as you like.
My bed? No, that's mine. Maybe I will let you use it if you help me with a small task.
Oh yes. The upside of this cave is that it literally is crawling with dead bodies of those scaradon bugs.
By chance, I happened to find out that with the right mixture, they can be made into a healing substance.

replies.text: Let's see what you have to trade.

conversationlist.message: No. I might have something to trade if you help me with a small task.
Thank you. I would have gone myself if those nasty bugs weren't there. This turned out to be much easier though.
As a token of my appreciation, you are welcome to use the bed over there to rest. Also, if you are interested in healing, I might be able to provide some help.

replies.text: I think I should use the bed to rest right now. Thank you.
Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: My friend returns. What can Thorin do for you?

replies.text: Mind if I use your bed over there to rest?
Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: Hello again my Shadow friend. How may I help you?

replies.text: Let me see what you have to trade.

conversationlist.message: Sigh, it's you. What do you want?

replies.text: Let me see what you have to trade.

conversationlist.message: Psst, hey. Interested in doing some trading? I am always looking for acquiring ... well, items of others...

replies.text: Sure, let me see what you have.

conversationlist.message: Oh yes. You see, these Feygard patrol guards carry some really interesting things. They don't seem to care much if some of their shipments ... well, disappear.

replies.text: OK, let me see what you have.
I should really not get involved in this. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: Psst, hey you! I saw you talking to Gandoren over there, and I happened to notice that you exchanged some items. Anything interesting?

replies.text: Never mind that, let me see what you have to trade.
I better not talk about it.
Gandoren specifically asked me not to talk to you about it.
Yes, Gandoren wants me to deliver some equipment for Feygard. Do you want a part of the deal?

conversationlist.message: Hah, of course. Gandoren would not like it if I were to get a glimpse into his business. I assume you are helping him deliver those items somewhere. Tell me this, what did he promise you in return? Gold? Honor? No?

replies.text: Now that you mention it, he didn't actually say there would be a reward.
I am doing this for the glory of Feygard.
Helping Feygard seems like the right thing to do.

conversationlist.message: As usual, Feygard keeps all its riches to itself. What if I were to tell you there was a way for you to gain from all this as well?

replies.text: I have no problem helping Feygard without any personal gain.
I better not get involved in this, goodbye.

conversationlist.message: By the Shadow, you sound like one of those deceptive snobs from Feygard.
Shadow help you, child. You should question yourself whether you really are making the right choice here.
Let me tell you my plan. As you might know, everyone believes there will be some coming conflict between the deceptive snobs of Feygard and the glorious people of Nor City.
Any help we can bring to Nor City in this matter is welcome. These items that Gandoren gave you would be useful to our people in the southern lands.
These items, if you were to deliver them to our allies down in Vilegard, then the Shadow would look favorably upon you.
This way, the people could get back some piece of the riches that Feygard has stolen from all of us.
If you indeed are walking in the Shadow, then deliver these items to the smith in Vilegard. He will be able to make good use of them. He might also have some other task for you.

replies.text: I will see what I can do.
No. I will help Feygard instead.
Whatever, I choose my own path.

conversationlist.message: Shadow be with you. May the Shadow guide you on the clouded paths that you walk.
Hello again. Did you deliver those items to the smith in Vilegard?

replies.text: Never mind that, let me see what you have to trade.
No. I will help Feygard instead.
Can you tell me again what I was supposed to do?

conversationlist.message: Good. You should also try to convince Gandoren into thinking that you helped him.
Excellent! You do indeed walk with the Shadow my friend. I am glad to hear that there are at least a few decent folk still around.
Your help will be most appreciated by the people of Nor City, and you will be welcome among us.
Hi, who are you? I have never seen you here.

replies.text: My name is $playername. I am from Crossglen.
My father always told me not to talk to strangers.

conversationlist.message: Cool. I am Burhczyd afgz Dtaloumiye. Nice to meet you.

replies.text: Burh... - eh, OK. Do you live here in this town?

conversationlist.message: Yes. At least until now. My parents gave me some money so that I could tour the world. This morning I set off, and I'm staying here in the inn. However, I will have to earn some more money, otherwise it will be a short trip.

replies.text: Yes, some gold always helps. Hmm, maybe you can kill two birds with one stone.

conversationlist.message: What are you talking about?

replies.text: Take a cart and start a transport company. You can deliver goods to different cities and get some money.

conversationlist.message: Wow, splendid idea! I will take my father's cart. Then all I need is a name for my company. Thanks for this tip.
I am still thinking about what to call my company. As soon as I have a name, I'll start.
Hi, we know each other! Unfortunately I forgot your name. Come, have a drink with me. How are you?

replies.text: My name is $playername. And you are called something with Brr, as far as I can remember.

conversationlist.message: Yes, almost: My name is Burhczyd afgz Dtaloumiye. I opened a transport company, as you suggested.

replies.text: Great to hear! Is it going well? Do you already have many customers?

conversationlist.message: Well, there are not too many yet.
More precisely, none at all.
I have no idea. My beautiful cart with BURHCZYD AFGZ DTALOUMIYE - TRANSPORTS written in big white letters always runs empty.

replies.text: Good grief! What did you name your company?!

conversationlist.message: 'Burhczyd afgz Dtaloumiye - Transports'. Is there a problem with that?

replies.text: Nobody can pronounce that name, let alone remember it. No wonder you do not get any orders!

conversationlist.message: Do you really think so?

replies.text: Sure. You have to use a short and catchy name.

conversationlist.message: OK, I'll think about a better company name.
I am still thinking about a better name for my company. As soon as I have it, I'll leave.
Hello ... eh, sorry, I forgot your name. How are you?
Don't ask. Still no orders. And I have now idea why.

replies.text: That's horrible! What did you call your company? It should be short and memorable.

conversationlist.message: Yes, that's what I've done. You said 'Burhczyd afgz Dtaloumiye' was be too long and hard to remember, so I simply chose the initials of my name. Clever, right?
It is now: 'B.A.D. TRANSPORTS' - it looks great!

replies.text: You can't be serious!  BAD TRANSPORTS? Tell me that's just a joke!

conversationlist.message: Oh no! Did I get it wrong again? Nothing I do ever works. (sob)

replies.text: Look, just call your company 'Easy Transports'. That will do.

conversationlist.message: OK, thank you. I'll try. Later. Tomorrow. Maybe. (sob)
Only one more beer, then I'll leave.
Hello, what's-your-name? How are you?

replies.text: I am fine. And my name is $playername, as you should know by now.

conversationlist.message: I am Burhczyd afgz Dtaloumiye, proud owner of Easy Transports.

replies.text: The last time we saw each other, you did not have any transport orders yet.

conversationlist.message: Oh, that has completely changed. I am into big business now.
I just got a cartload of fresh fish in Remgard. I think I will sell it here with a high profit.
In the last two cities, they could not afford to buy this quality fish. But it will work here. Certainly.
Of course from Remgard, their fish is the best - a rare delicacy in this area!
What?

replies.text: Nothing. Because we have known each other for so long, I will suggest something.

conversationlist.message: Fire away. Your ideas are always good.

replies.text: I will buy your fish for, say, 1000 gold pieces.
I will buy your fish for, say, 100 gold pieces.
I will buy your fish for, say, 10 gold pieces.
I will take your fish, but I can't give you any money.

conversationlist.message: Oh.
Well. Take it.

replies.text: No, no! It is not for me. Unload the fish in the nearest forest and make a burnt offering.

conversationlist.message: That is a great idea! The better the offering, the greater the help will be.

replies.text: I hope it doesn't work the other way around

conversationlist.message: Let's have a drink on this splendid idea!
Let's have another drink on this splendid idea, before I leave to do the offering.
Hi Jakora.
Is it? Anyway. Nice to meet you here. I want to thank you for your good advice.
Yes. Immediately after the burnt offering, I was able to complete a very profitable trade.
Just look at this heavy bag of gold!

replies.text: I am very impressed. What was the trade?

conversationlist.message: It was a very simple thing. Fast and easy gold.

replies.text: Tell me, what was the trade for?

conversationlist.message: I sold my cart! Together with the horse - now I even save the money for its food.

replies.text: Ah. OK, but what do you intend to use to transport the next load?

conversationlist.message: Oh, right. I hadn't thought of that. My father doesn't have another cart, so I will look for something else to do.

replies.text: So we have to think about what else you might do. Do you have any musical talent?

conversationlist.message: Oh yeah! I always liked to play the lute and sing! With the money I have I can buy the best lute in the country!

replies.text: I wish you the best of luck!

conversationlist.message: Before I leave, we should drink to a good start.
... THERE WAAAS A GIIIRL AT THE GAAAATE ...
... WITH TEAAAAARS IN HER EYEEES ...
... AAAAAAND IT WAS NIIIIGHT!

replies.text: Finally. Bravo! More! But not now, please.

conversationlist.message: Hey, my biggest fan. How did you find me?
Thank you, I know. What is your name again?
Eh, wait. Do you have any idea why the landlord is coming for me with a thick wooden club?

replies.text: It's probably best that you promise him that you will not sing anymore.

conversationlist.message: Was it that bad?

replies.text: You could sing in a troll band.

conversationlist.message: Sigh. My mother always loved my music.

replies.text: Your lute skills are actually quite good. Maybe just try it without singing.

conversationlist.message: OK, I will try that. But I think it would be better if it were not here. The landlord is still looking at me suspiciously.
The landlord is still watching me - I had better not move.
Hey, nice to meet you again!

replies.text: You forgot my name again, didn't you? I am $playername.

conversationlist.message: Yes. Sigh.
Look here, my lute. The best instrument in the country. And I'm not allowed to play here.
I played so well and charmingly, that the guests forgot everything around them.
They even forgot to order something to drink.

replies.text: And the landlord was not amused?

conversationlist.message: Yes. Sigh. He forbade me to continue making music.
Now I have to think again about what to do next.

replies.text: I am sure you will come up with something.

conversationlist.message: As soon as I know what I'm going to do next, I'll leave.
Hi $playername.

replies.text: Hi Burhczyd. You remembered my name!

conversationlist.message: Sure I did. And I also have learned a new profession. I am already rather good.

replies.text: Great to hear! Tell me more.

conversationlist.message: I talk to people in places like this. Taverns and such.
We talk about everything; the world, magic rings, dragons, everything. We become more and more familiar.

replies.text: And by doing that you get a beer or two?

conversationlist.message: Ha ha ha. Much better. People start to trust me. A great feeling.
And when they leave, they don't even miss their purse or jewels.
Hush, not so loud. No, I'm not an ordinary pickpocket. I became a master thief.

replies.text: Oh dear. I didn't expect that from you.

conversationlist.message: I am finished here for now. As soon as the moment is right, I will disappear.
As soon as the moment is right, I will go.
Hi $playername.
I have a bad conscience.

replies.text: Why? Did you do something wrong?

conversationlist.message: Yes, I did something very wrong.
I never should have done that to a friend.
I 'borrowed' some things from you the last time we met.
Oh, it was just a few trifles, nothing important. Here you go, have them all back again.
First of all, you can have back your 100 pieces of gold.
Here is your Necklace of the Undead. I didn't even wear it once.
This is your father's ring, I think.
Then we have a ruby gem - not of much worth, really.
Last but not least I proudly present: The Dagger of the Shadow Priests!
I am really sorry.

replies.text: I did not expect that from you. But OK, you did a good job as master thief.

conversationlist.message: That's what I wanted to hear.

replies.text: And you are naughty in addition to that.
I don't suppose you are a member of the Thieves' Guild? I never heard of you.

conversationlist.message: You talk of Umar and his little gang? Are you also no one and nobody has seen you?
Don't look so irritated. Of course I know such internals. But no, I am no member of the guild. I prefer to be independent.
Honestly, I don't even know if this job is the right thing for me.

replies.text: By the way - did you meet my brother Andor on your journeys?

conversationlist.message: Sure. I even trailed him for some time, because he had exhibited some interesting behaviour.

replies.text: Interesting? Or perhaps strange? What did he do?

conversationlist.message: No no no, I won't tell you of course.
But here, take this little thing that I 'borrowed' from him.

replies.text: A stuffed rat? Urgh. I will give it back to him as soon as possible.

conversationlist.message: Well, it's time to say goodbye. Farewell now.
Before I leave, I have some business to do here.
Who art thou that disturbeth the peace of an Elythom knight?

replies.text: Oh, sorry. I'm already gone again.
I am looking for my brother Andor. Do you have seen him? He looks a bit like me.

conversationlist.message: No, $playername. I have not seen Andor lately.

replies.text: How do you know my name?

conversationlist.message: Oops. Eh, well, we Elythom knights know many things.

replies.text: That's not the whole truth. Now?

conversationlist.message: All right, $playername. Of course I know you well. I am Burhczyd afgz Dtaloumiye.

replies.text: Burhczyd? You - a knight of the Elythom?

conversationlist.message: One should have that impression. But not everything is as it seems.
You know, once I feasted with the Lord Commander of the Elythom. A very pleasant man.
We got merry, and in high spirits I 'borrowed' a few little things from him.
Now the whole order is looking for the thief. So I thought it wise to disguise myself.
Indeed. They'd never suspect this. I already talked with some knights and asked about their progress.
It was really hard to hold back my laughter.
But now you should leave. Otherwise we may arouse suspicion.

replies.text: You are right. We'll surely meet another time.

conversationlist.message: We'd better not be seen together anymore.
Sorry, I have to leave.

replies.text: Burhczyd, is it really you? Wait, don't run away ...

conversationlist.message: As soon as ...todo..., I will go.
Sorry, I have to leave.

replies.text: Burhczyd, is it really you? Wait, don't run away ...

conversationlist.message: As soon as ...todo..., I will go.
No! Stay away! You shall not defeat me!
Oh wait, you are not one of them. You ... you are not one of those spawns.

replies.text: Relax, I am not here to hurt you.

conversationlist.message: Oh, how long have I been down here? I can't remember.
No matter. I must finish my work here. You see this shrine here?
If my understanding is correct, this shrine is a remnant of Kazaul.
The writings on it have almost vanished, but I have managed to read parts of it. It speaks in an ancient Kazaul tongue, so all parts are not clear to me.
I am sure that this shrine is part of the cause for these ... these ... things ... that lurk in this cave. I will do anything in my power to defeat whatever mischief that comes from it.

replies.text: How come these creatures do not attack you?
What have you translated so far?

conversationlist.message: Ah, the allaceph. I had not seen one for many years until I entered this cave. They are a remnant of the guardians of Kazaul.
Have you noticed how they seem to feed upon whoever tries to fight them? Cursed things, almost got a hold of me, they did.

replies.text: How come these creatures do not attack you?
What have you translated from the shrine so far?

conversationlist.message: I have placed a blessing of the Shadow upon this small island here, so that I may work uninterrupted. Strangely enough, it seems to be very effective on them.
They seem to be very cautious about it. So far, not even one has dared to approach me. Even those pesky lizards are keeping their distance.

replies.text: What have you translated from the shrine so far?

conversationlist.message: It speaks of Kazaul and of the misery that comes to anyone that opposes the will of Kazaul.
Something about 're-birth from within the followers'. Not sure I have translated that part correctly, but I think that is what it says. Definitely something about re-birth or birth.
It also speaks of someone or some ... thing called the 'Dark protector'. Most parts of the text for that is missing from the shrine however.
Whatever it means, it seems important. It is also obvious that the 'Dark protector' brings power to Kazaul, and misery to any opposition.

Regardless, it must be stopped, whatever it means. Maybe it refers to something deeper down this cave? I have not ventured further into the cave to the east since I could not get past those ... things.
Forgive me, I must continue translating the few readable parts left on this shrine.

replies.text: Would you like any help with that?

conversationlist.message: Thank you. Goodbye.
Hmm, maybe. I need to figure out what this last part should be. Hmm...
The last part of this piece has been eroded from the rock. It begins with 'Kulauil hamar urum Kazaul'te'. But what is the rest of that?
Argh, if this cave wasn't so damp, I bet the rest of the text would still be there.

replies.text: I could go look for other clues about the missing parts if you want?

conversationlist.message: Sure, you do that.
I have looked thoroughly for any clues in the western part of this cave, but have not found any. I have not entered the eastern parts of the cave however.

Also, I should warn you that I believe the shrine talks of a powerful creature somewhere in this cave. Maybe if you find that creature, it will provide some clue as to what the missing parts are? You need to be careful though.

replies.text: I will go look in the eastern parts of the cave then.

conversationlist.message: Hello again. Did you find any clues about what the missing parts are?

replies.text: No, I have not found any clues yet.
Can you tell me again what you have translated from the shrine?
Yes, I encountered a creature to the east that spoke the words you told me.

conversationlist.message: If you really want to help, then please go look for any other clues you might find.
Oh good, tell me, did you find any more clues?

replies.text: Yes, the creature also spoke the words 'Kazaul hamat urul', maybe that is part of the missing piece?

conversationlist.message: Hmm ... 'hamat urul' ... yes of course! That's what it says on the eroded parts of the shrine!
Excellent work my friend! Now I just need to translate it.
I wonder what this whole piece means. 'Kulauil hamar urum Kazaul'te. Kazaul hamat urul' - that's the part you heard the creature speak.
The next part is 'Klatam ur turum Kazaul'te', and I am not sure what that means. Something about handing over some item?
Maybe the creature you encountered responds to that phrase if you speak to it? If you want to help, you could go and try speaking that phrase to it.

replies.text: Sure, I will go speak those words to the creature.
Whatever, I'll do it, but I hope this is the last time that I have to run back and forth!
No way, I have helped you enough now.
I had better not get involved in this.

conversationlist.message: No matter, I will find out myself then. Thank you for your help so far. Goodbye.
Good. Please return as soon as possible.
Hello again. Did you speak those words to the creature you encountered?

replies.text: What was I supposed to do again?

conversationlist.message: Sure. It's 'Klatam ur turum Kazaul'te'.

replies.text: No, I am not well. My stomach is turning and I feel weaker than usual. I encountered a lich down there that did something to me.

conversationlist.message: Nooo! What have I done?

The part that the creature spoke basically means 'No offering is worthy for Kazaul'.
Furthermore, the last part, that I made you speak to the creature, 'Klatam ur turum Kazaul'te', means 'My body for Kazaul'.
Oh, what have I done? I made you say it, and now you are touched by its vile essence.

replies.text: It's not that bad. I have had worse.
What can I do to get rid of this affliction?
You better have a plan for how you should repay me for this trickery!
I at least defeated the lich that infected me with this thing.
I found a strange looking helmet among the remains of the lich that I defeated. Do you know anything about it?

conversationlist.message: Let me have a look at you.
No ... can it be? Are they actually real?
You show all the signs. If this is true, then you are in great danger.
Long ago, I read a book on Kazaul rituals. The first part of one particular ritual I read about talks about 'the carrier', that supposedly is infected with Kazaul rotworms.

The Kazaul rotworms need a living being to feed upon, before their eggs can hatch. Their eggs can slowly kill a person from the inside, and the worms themselves cause the carrier to become weak during the whole process.

The ritual proceeds with the carrier being eaten from the inside by the rotworms and their eggs, in effect, giving birth to the creatures within. Also, the process can have ... shall we say ... unusual effects on the carrier before that.
Needless to say, you are in great danger, and you should seek help immediately.

The ritual proceeds with the carrier being eaten from the inside by the rotworms and their eggs, in effect, giving birth to the creatures within. Also, the process can have ... shall we say ... unusual effects on the carrier before that.
You should hurry and seek help from one of the priests of the Shadow as quickly as possible. My dear friend Talion in the temple of Loneford should be able to help you.
Seek him out immediately. Hurry! You might not have much time.

replies.text: OK, I will go to Talion in the Loneford temple at once. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: I should also tell you that it is of great importance that you first destroy whatever creature that infected you with this.

replies.text: OK, I will defeat the lich first. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: Yes, you told me that you killed the lich. Excellent work.

replies.text: I found a strange looking helmet among the remains of that lich. Do you know anything about it?

conversationlist.message: Oh, that is good news indeed. A lich you say? With your help, the people of the surrounding towns should be safe from whatever mischief the lich could have caused now.

conversationlist.message: That's good to hear. I hope that ... thing ... didn't have any permanent side-effects on you.

replies.text: I defeated the lich in the depths of the eastern cave.

conversationlist.message: Could it be? Hmm. Let me look at that thing.
Those markings on it are most peculiar. It was found by the lich that you spoke of?
Hmm. You know what, this could actually be connected to what the shrine speaks of - The Dark Protector
I am not certain of what the term 'The Dark Protector' refers to. At first I thought it might be some creature protecting something, but this helmet seems to better fit what the shrine speaks of.
It could either be the helmet itself, or that the helmet has some effect on whoever wears it, meaning that the wearer will become the Dark Protector.
Nevertheless, I am almost certain that this artifact is connected to what this shrine speaks of, and that the artifact is rich with Kazaul influence.
As such, it would most certainly bring misery to the surroundings of whoever carries it. Directly or indirectly, I do not know.
I say, we must destroy that item immediately to make sure that the Kazaul taint is forever cleansed from this place and to make sure it does not fall into the wrong hands.

replies.text: He he, a powerful item you say? How much would you think it is worth?

Absolutely. I will do anything to protect the people from this thing.
Interesting. How powerful could someone become by wearing this thing?

conversationlist.message: Worth!? What difference would that make? We need to destroy it immediately!

replies.text: How powerful could someone become by wearing this thing?
What should we do in order to destroy it?
No. I will keep this item for myself instead.

conversationlist.message: I don't even want to think about that. It would surely bring misery to the surroundings of whoever wears it. We must destroy it immediately!

replies.text: He he, sounds powerful. How much would you think it is worth?
What should we do in order to destroy it?
No. I will keep this item for myself instead.

conversationlist.message: I'm glad to hear that.
To destroy it, I think it will suffice to use what we normally use when removing the taint of Kazaul - a vial of purifying spirit.
Fortunately, I always carry some on me, so that won't be a problem.
What could be a problem however, is the other thing we will need. This artifact is most likely connected to that lich you encountered.
We would need to use the vial of purifying spirit on something powerful from that lich as well.

replies.text: I managed to get the heart of the lich, would that do?

conversationlist.message: The heart? Oh yes, that would surely do.

replies.text: Here is the helmet and the heart.
I think I should give this a second thought before we begin.

conversationlist.message: Think all you want, but please hurry. We need to destroy this thing as soon as possible!
Excellent. I will begin the procedure immediately.
[Ulirfendor places the helmet and the lich's heart on the ground before him, and opens his backpack of items]
[He pulls out a leathery potion case from his backpack, and takes out a vial of clear but almost shining liquid]
[Ulirfendor pours the contents of the vial on the helmet and the heart in circling motions, taking good care to not spill any on the ground]
It should be as simple as that really. Powerful stuff this.
[The surface of the helmet seems to freeze, almost like it had a layer of ice on it]
[After a while, small cracks appear on the surface, making tiny sounds as they appear]
[The cracks start to get larger and more dense along the surface, until the helmet is completely covered by them]
Now, watch this. I love this part.
[Ulirfendor takes aim with his foot and stomps the helmet with the heel of his boot in a powerful motion]
[The helmet completely shatters, leaving nothing but a fine dust]
Ha ha! Look at that!
[He does the same with the heart that also seems to have completely frozen and gotten covered with cracks]
Ah, that sure felt good.
You, my friend, have done a great deed here today. This thing would have brought great misery if it would have fallen into the wrong hands.

replies.text: Thank you, but that will not be necessary. I am just happy to help.

conversationlist.message: You truly have a large heart.
The blessing will grant you the aid of the Shadow while in combat, protecting you from harmful effects that your opponent might inflict upon you.

replies.text: Thank you, but that will not be necessary. I am just happy to help.

conversationlist.message: Very well, I will give you the dark blessing of the Shadow.
[Ulirfendor starts chanting in a tongue that you do not recognize]

replies.text: Who knows what power I could gain from it? I will keep this for myself.

I think I should give this a second thought before we begin.

conversationlist.message: What is this!? I knew there was something wrong about you the first time I saw you.
By the Shadow, I will stop you. Whatever it takes. You will not live to see the next day!

replies.text: I am looking for my brother.

I am sent by Jhaeld to end whatever it is you do to the people of Remgard.

conversationlist.message: Run away, has he? He he.

How noble. Maybe you can be of use to me.
Clever. I like that.

replies.text: Maybe, it depends on what the problem is.

replies.text: I guess you won't get any help either then.

conversationlist.message: You see, I have this slight problem with ... ahem ... vermin.
Always sneaking around, always trying to cause mischief.

replies.text: Sure, some rodents, I can handle that.

conversationlist.message: He he. I bet you sure showed them. Excellent. Thank you for ... ahem ... helping me.

Oh, it's not far from here. Doesn't matter really.
You see, I used to live there. To make a long story short, there were some ... ahem ... misunderstandings.
These days, I think they are looking for me, for some reason. Can't think of any reason why really. But I believe they are.
Because of our previous ... misunderstanding, I think it's best they don't find out that I'm here.
Therefore, I ask of you not to reveal my whereabouts to them.
Thank you. Under no circumstances should you tell them where I am. They will most likely try to persuade you into revealing my location.
Under no circumstances.
Oh, it's you again.
You should probably leave before you tip something over that might ... ahem ... break. He he.

replies.text: I was sent by Jhaeld to end whatever it is you are doing to the people of Remgard.

conversationlist.message: Jhaeld, the fool. He hides behind his guards and his stone walls. Such a pitiful man he is. Yes, I made those people disappear, but they were all worth it. I will have my revenge!
And you, what are you trying to accomplish by running his errands? How fortunate that you entered my house. He he.
Do you really think you can defeat *me*? Ha ha, this will be fun!
Say, despite my previous urging to you to keep my location a secret to the people of Remgard, I have this feeling that this trust has been broken. Please tell me it isn't so.

replies.text: Yes, I have told Jhaeld where you are.

conversationlist.message: I can feel it in me.

Nor can I describe my reasoning behind this task before you are done with it.

replies.text: OK. I will help you with your task.

replies.text: OK. I will agree to help you with your task.
OK, I'll help. I'm always interested in new items.

conversationlist.message: Ah yes. After all, you are just a child and I can understand that all of this must be too much for you. Hee hee.

conversationlist.message: Good, good.
You will tell no one of this task that I am about to give you, and you must be as discreet as possible.
I have in my possession five idols. Five idols with very unique ... qualities. What I want you to do is ... deliver these idols to various people in the town of Remgard.
You will place them by the beds of five particular persons, and you must hide it well so that the person does not find the idol itself.
Remember, it is of utmost importance that you be as discreet as possible about this. The idols must not be found once you have placed them, and no one must notice that you place the idols.
So, the first person that I want you to visit is Jhaeld. I hear that he spends most of his time in the Remgard tavern these days.
Secondly, I want you to visit one of the farmers named Larni. He lives with his wife Caeda here in Remgard in one of the northern cabins.
The third person is Arnal the weapon-smith, that lives in the northwest of Remgard.
Fourth is Emerei, that can probably be found in his house to the southeast of Remgard.
The fifth person is the farmer Carthe. Carthe lives on the eastern shore of Remgard, near the tavern.
Once you have placed these five idols by the beds of these five people, return to me as soon as possible.
Again, I cannot stress this enough - you must not tell anyone about these idols, and you must not be seen while placing them.
Here are the idols.
Now go, and please hurry, we might not have much time.
Tell me, how goes the task of placing the idols?

replies.text: Can you repeat what you wanted me to do?

conversationlist.message: Please hurry, we might not have much time.

replies.text: No, I hid the idols as you instructed.

conversationlist.message: Good. Thank you again for helping me.
Let me tell you my story.

replies.text: Can we just skip to the end?

conversationlist.message: You see, I used to live in the city of Remgard. The times were good, and the city prospered.
Our crops grew well, and some people had very fortunate trading agreements with other cities, making the life for most of us living in Remgard very easy.
I even sold some of the baskets that I used to make to a wealthy merchant that visited us from Nor City.
However, even the easy life gets boring after a while. I believe it is in our nature to strive for new and better things, to free us from the boredom of day-to-day life.
I wanted to learn more of things that I knew nothing about, and wanted to explore things I had only read of in books before.
So I went to Nor City myself, and visited many ... interesting people and ... dark corners.
Naturally, I was thrilled of the knowledge I gained from the experience, and from what I learned while there.
As I got back home, I wanted to continue practicing what I had observed and learned while in Nor City.
You could say I got obsessed with learning more. I guess the others living in Remgard did not ... share my enthusiasm. Some of them even questioned the fact that I wanted to learn more.
So I told myself that others would not hinder me in my curiosity to better myself.
Those books that I bought from the Blackmarrow residence in Nor City - I must have read them all perhaps five times over. This was something completely new to me, and at the same time very exciting.
For some reason, the others in Remgard started giving me strange looks, and I could hear the whispers behind my back.
I was even barred from the tavern. 'People come here for a good time, and we don't want people like you here ruining that' they said. What fools they are.
I heard one woman whispering to her boy, 'Don't look at her, she'll turn you to stone!'. Others just turned the other way when they met me.
What fools they are.
One day, Jhaeld showed up at my doorstep with a group of guards.
The people of Remgard had decided that I could not stay there anymore, he said. The things I did were causing other people harm, he said.
What had I done, I asked myself? I had never hurt anyone, much less affected anyone with my ... experiments. Am I not allowed to do what I wish?
I had little chance to argue, however. The guards led me out of the city. They did not even let me gather my things. All my books, all my notes and all my findings - gone. I lost everything.
All this happened several seasons ago. I knew I had to get revenge for what they did to me.
Oh, how I despise them all. The people that gave me those looks, the people that whispered behind my back, and most of all that fool Jhaeld.
So, I decided to extend my ... experiments ... to larger things. To people, to living things. This is the perfect opportunity to learn even more than what is in the books.
To think that I could do it while at the same time get revenge on those despicable people - it's an excellent plan, if I may say so myself. He he.

replies.text: So, what happened to all those people that have gone missing?

conversationlist.message: I lured them here. Once I managed to trap them, I placed a curse on them that, in theory, should have only made them unable to speak.
Maybe I haven't understood everything correctly from the books that I have read, since instead of making them unable to speak, they were all turned into rats instead.
Practice makes perfect, I suppose. Ha ha.

replies.text: Wait, does this mean that those rats I killed for you were...

conversationlist.message: Oh yes. With your help, they are now one less problem to deal with, so to speak. He he.
So, that's my story. Thank you for listening to it.

replies.text: I understand, and I agree with your actions.

conversationlist.message: Thank you. It is good to know there are more people interested in learning more.

Wear it well, my friend. Do not let others get hold of the power that Marrowtaint provides.
Here you go.

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to ease your pain?

Can't you see I'm busy? Go talk to my brother Jan, he's always slacking off in the house.

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?
Are you a friend of Halvor?

conversationlist.message: I'm Kayla. I love making clothes, shoes and boots.
Don't cause trouble.
This is Stoutford. Our small town was the resting place of choice for many merchants on their way between Fallhaven and the Blackwater mountain.
Yes. It seems the road is closed for some reason. Maybe this is related to the monster attacks we have been suffering from recently.

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to help?

replies.text: Do you know where he was going?

conversationlist.message: I can't really tell. No known trouble at least. He headed straight to the tavern, and I didn't see him again before he left.

replies.text: Do you know where he was going?

Go with the shadow.

conversationlist.message: Walk in the shadow kid. I have to apologize for my master, Tahalendor.

replies.text: Crazy old geezer... What's wrong with him?

replies.text: That must be my brother Andor!

conversationlist.message: He came around here not long ago, with a shady looking travelling companion. He stayed a couple of days from what I heard. Since then, we have been hearing frequent rumbles in the church, coming from underground.
It can be so loud as to make the whole church shake. It has even damaged the walls and the roof.
This church is the refuge for all the villagers when monsters attack. We are really worried now.

replies.text: I can't believe Andor has anything to do with this. Can you tell me more?

conversationlist.message: I told you all I know. Maybe others in town have seen him.

replies.text: Thanks for the advice. I'll take care.

conversationlist.message: You indeed look a lot like him...

replies.text: Can I use one of your beds?

conversationlist.message: Well, you see, I keep some beds for occasions like this one. You can use the one in the corner, near the painting, if you wish to rest.
Sure.

replies.text: I should kill you right now!
