conversationlist.message: You ... you should be dead!
Wait. OK. I stand no chance against you. I'll tell you all I know.
It was Andor. He made us do it, and promised to rid us of the Shadow church if we helped.
When he came, he asked me for a "private" place where he could do his weird stuff undisturbed. It had to be underground, and it had to be in the city. I have no idea why.
I showed him the cellar under the old derelict house.
I think he spent several days in there, as we didn't see him. Around that time, the rumbles in the church began and we knew he would be keeping his promise.
When he returned he put this horrible necklace on me. He told me that thing in the cellar needed lives to grow stronger, and either I could give it those lives or the necklace would take mine.
I'm sorry! How was I to know you could actually kill it? You're just a kid! Anyway, now I can remove the necklace. Please take it. I never want to see it again.
That's all I know, I swear. Please spare me. You can use the bed safely now.

replies.text: I'll spare you. For now. But no more tricks. Or else...
I guess this was all necessary.

conversationlist.message: I swear. You'll be my honored guest for life.
Hello again. Have you found anything about what is causing the noises in the church? It seems they have stopped.

replies.text: Yes. I think I found the cause.
Let us talk about something different.

conversationlist.message: Great. You should talk to my master. I told him you were not who he thought you were.
You! You saved us!

replies.text: That was the right thing to do.
Would you come with me to talk to Blornvale? He wants to confess something important.

conversationlist.message: My sincerest apologies for earlier. I took you for someone else. Do you know what was causing the rumbles?

replies.text: [Show Demon heart] Some monster. Here's what it left when I killed it.

conversationlist.message: Oh my. It's the heart of a lich! These are nasty creatures.

replies.text: These? You mean there are others?

conversationlist.message: They aren't common, but I have heard stories. They are powerful and live underground. They seem to be related to Kazaul somehow.
I'm surprised such a young kid as you managed to survive encountering one, let alone actually kill it.
Too bad. Come back when you know more.
You know, since those monsters' attacks, we don't have much to offer, but take these. By the way, do you have any idea who might be responsible for all this?

replies.text: It was all Glasforn's doing. The tavern owner.
It was my brother Andor. I need to find him.

conversationlist.message: It's a shame we cannot punish the culprits. Thank you for your help kid.
That fool! We'll make him pay. Thank you for your help kid.
That is troublesome. I have no idea where he went when he left Stoutford, but Kazaul has always been linked to the Undertell, south of here. Thank you for your help kid.
Go with the shadow child.

replies.text: Would you come with me to talk to Blornvale? He wants to confess something important.
Yolgen told me that you could provide me with an artifact that could be used against powerful undead.
Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: Thank you for your help. Do you have any idea who might be responsible for all this?

replies.text: It was all Glasforn's doing. The tavern owner.
It was my brother Andor. I need to find him.

conversationlist.message: What are you talking about?

replies.text: I met an undead lord in the castle, but every time it seems that I have destroyed him, he rises again. Do you have any advice?
I want to help you clean the castle of the undead. Yolgen seems to be worried, perhaps because he believes the undead could be too strong.

conversationlist.message: Most undead can be destroyed quite easily, but there is a rare and powerful kind that are much more difficult to permanently destroy.
I think I have a solution though.
First, I need two coins. Please give me 2 gold coins.

Now I will bless them with a special enchantment...
[Tahalendor holds the coins over the altar and mutters something you can't hear]

Here you go. As soon as the undead lord appears to be destroyed, place one coin on each eye. This will prevent him from rising again, and soon after you have placed the coins his remains should disintegrate, as he returns to his natural state.
Boohoohoo ... the whole town hates me now. Even my dear customers left. Just the old hag who only drinks water stayed, and Lord Bourbon who never pays.
Boohoohoo...
No. Sorry.
Halvor? Yes! He's so nice! Do you know him?

replies.text: I hate the guy. He's nothing but trouble...
Sure, we keep meeting around the world in the most unusual places. I even helped him gather some items.

conversationlist.message: He's always been good to me. If you don't like him, I don't like you!
So that's you! He told me about you.
He told me you were of great help.
Anyway. I made these boots with the items he brought me.

I'm really proud of the result.
They are light, but sturdy, thanks to the bones and insect wings.
They are comfortable but tough thanks to the animal hair and venomscale scales.
They are stiff when adjusted, thanks to the rat tails.
Here. Take these. I've given one pair to Halvor, and I'll keep the last one for myself.

replies.text: Wow. I have to try these. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: Do you want to trade?
Hey. Be careful what you do.
Kids should not walk around alone in these times.
It was terrible! I could feel the necklace draining the life out of me, and the only thing that made me feel better was giving it another victim.

replies.text: Why didn't you just take it off?

conversationlist.message: I couldn't. When I tried, and failed, he laughed. He told me it was bound to that thing in the basement, which needed me to be its servant.
Then he laughed some more, and told me that all I had to do was kill that thing, and I would be able to remove the necklace. I'm no fighter though. I was too scared to even go near it.

replies.text: I guess you are lucky I visited, although just asking me to kill it would have been easier. And nicer.

conversationlist.message: I didn't dare. The evening after Andor left his companion returned briefly. He warned me you might come here, and that if you found out what I had done you would kill me. He told me that my only hope was to make you the next victim.
If I must. Well, go ahead, I'll be there when you get there.
What now?
Well, I don't really believe it, but we could try. Blornvale, how did you kill Aryfora's father, your own brother?
Hello again, my friend. You are always welcome here.
Hello there. Welcome to my shop.
How may I be of service?

replies.text: Let me see what you have to trade.

conversationlist.message: Certainly.
It is you! I heard what you did, helping us with that witch Algangror. You have my thanks, friend!
As a token of my appreciation, please accept this hat that I made. May it guide you through the blinding light.
From the looks of you, you don't seem to be from around here. That makes two of us then. He he.

replies.text: I'm from the village of Crossglen, far to the west of here.

conversationlist.message: Crossglen! I know that place, it's not far from Fallhaven, right?
I have an old ... shall we say ... friend ... from Fallhaven. Goes by the name of Unzel.
You wouldn't by any chance have met him, would you?

replies.text: Yes, I've met that fool. He was an easy kill.
Yes, I have met him. I still have some of his blood on my boots.
Yes, I even helped him defeat a scoundrel named Vacor.

conversationlist.message: I guess he keeps to himself. I sure hope he is OK. If you ever run into him, please say hi to him for me.

replies.text: I'm trying to find my brother Andor, have you seen him?

conversationlist.message: Andor? No, I'm sorry. I've never heard of him.
You?! But ... but ... this is terrible! I bet you are one of the goons of that Vacor fellow.
Oh yes, I can feel it. You work for Vacor! He must be stopped!
Excellent, that is good news indeed! May you walk with the Shadow, my friend!
My friend from Fallhaven returns. It's comforting to hear that Unzel is still alive.
Would you be willing to deliver a message to him?
You'd be well compensated for your efforts.

replies.text: Anything for the sake of the Shadow.
No, I am done helping you people.

conversationlist.message: That is unfortunate, you seemed like such a bright boy too.
The friend from Fallhaven returns. Please leave me be, I have things to do.
Good, that's exactly what I wanted to hear.
Make sure this doesn't fall into the hands of Feygard, or her loyalists.
[He gives you a sealed message]

replies.text: You can count on me, Kaverin.

conversationlist.message: Good. Now go deliver that message to Unzel.
It's good to see you again. Have you delivered my message to Unzel?
Please don't take too long. Walk with the Shadow, my friend.
Thank you, my friend. May you walk in the glow of the Shadow.
Take this map as compensation for a job well done.
We've discovered one of Vacor's hideouts, far to the south.
Since you helped us stop him, it's fitting that you have this.
According to the map, the hideout should be just to the northwest of the former prison of Flagstone. Feel free to take whatever is left in there.
Walk with the Shadow, my friend.
Hello again. It's comforting to know that Unzel is still alive, and that you delivered my message to him.
Hello there. I don't think I have seen you here in Remgard before.
Hello again. I hope you enjoy your stay in Remgard.
How may I help you?

replies.text: What is there to do around here?
Is there a shop in town?

conversationlist.message: Oh, there's not much happening around here. We try to keep the town as peaceful as possible.
We don't get many visitors up here in the mountains.
However, lately there has been some trouble here in town.

replies.text: Never mind that, is there a shop in town?

conversationlist.message: Hopefully, we'll get a few more visitors now that you've helped us with figuring out what happened to the people that went missing.

replies.text: Is there a shop in town?

conversationlist.message: Oh, I don't know much about it. The guards say they have seen strange signs outside town, and some people have gone missing.
I try to keep out of it though. Sounds like trouble to me.
Well, there's always the Elwille sisters, fighting as always.
Last night, they must have kept the whole town awake, the way they were shouting at each other.
Oh ... nothing ... everything. I don't know. No one really puts much weight in their squabbling.

They live in one of the cabins on the southern shore.
[Ingus points to the south]

replies.text: Thank you, I might go visit them. Goodbye.
Thank you. I wanted to ask you, is there a shop in town?

conversationlist.message:
Shop? Oh yes, of course. There's Rothses' and Arnal's shops right there.
[Ingus points to the two nearby houses to the west]
Also, if you have the coin, you can always spend it in the tavern down in town.

replies.text: Thank you. What is happening around town?

conversationlist.message: Unfortunately, for whatever reason, people that live in their neighborhood have been reporting the situation between the two of them has recently become more ... shall we say ... 'noticeable'.
I'm afraid that if they don't resolve their differences soon on their own, that the city council will have to act and resolve the matter for them.
It wouldn't be the first time the city council had to intervene in private matters that got out of hand.
The cross reads: Rest in peace, my friend.
You notice that the tree-stump is partially hollow, and looks like an excellent hiding place. It is empty now.
The ground around the grave is full of small holes, probably by something that has slithered its way to its nest down there. The cross has some writing on it, but you cannot understand what it says.
Here lies Kargir the merchant.
The stone is covered with a thin layer of green moss. The writing on the stone has eroded and is completely unreadable.
Rest with the Shadow, one-legged Berth. She lived a full life, but in the end she could not stand up to the illness that befell her.
The remains of Kigrim lies here, after he was killed by wolves south of Fallhaven.
Gimlont the corpulent lies here. May we finally be free from his fat hands being part of all of our businesses.
Here lies Terdar the smith. May he forever be embraced by the comfort of the Shadow.
Here lies O'llath, praised by her fellow citizens of Fallhaven for her delicious cakes.
Sidari the woodcutter lies here. We all told him to be careful with that axe of his, but he never listened.
Tyngose the noble lies here. May her legacy never be forgotten.
Here lies the remains of Sir Eneryth's horse, Shadowsteed.
Here lies Sir Eneryth of house Gellir. Son of Sir Anarogas, and the elder brother of Sir Karthanir.
Here lies Sir Karthanir of house Gellir. Son of Sir Anarogas, and the younger brother of Sir Eneryth.
Here lies Lady Gelythus of house Gellir. Wife of Sir Eneryth of house Gellir.
Here lies ta'Draiden, servant of the Shadow in the chapel of Fallhaven.
Here lies ta'Tembas, servant of the Shadow in the chapel of Fallhaven.
Here lies Elodam, servant of Sir Eneryth of house Gellir.
Here lies the remains of one-eyed Tragdas, servant of Sir Eneryth of house Gellir.
Here lies Lerythal the kind. May she rest with the Shadow.
Here lies Kragnis the second, steward of the chapel of Fallhaven.
The writing on the grave reads: Rest with the Shadow, my dearest.
On the floor is what looks like some torn out pages from a book.
You find some crumpled papers on the floor, containing scribbled notes about the fine arts of pottery making. You decide to leave them be.
The grave reads: Here lies Sir Anarogas of house Gellir, son of Gellir the brave.
The stench coming from the grave is unbearable. Something must have disturbed the grave recently.
The cross reads: ta'Dreg lies here, advisor of the Shadow to king Luthor.
The grave reads: King Luthor, our savior and leader. The grave is also adorned with the golden seal of house Luthor.

Perched under the statue, you find some papers with drawings of what looks like skeletons. The drawings look like they were made by a child, and you start to wonder how they could have ended up in a place such as this.
Someone has written the words 'Rest' and 'Shadow' on the cross, in what looks like dried blood.
The cross reads: Rest with the Shadow, my dear.
The tombstone contains writing in a language that you do not understand.
The cross reads: Here lies Magnir the trader. Another casualty of those beasts.
The grave looks like it has been recently dug.
The cross reads: Here lies Torkurt, loyal servant of the Blackwater mountain settlement.
The cross reads: Here lies o'Rani, the most fierce warrior on this side of the mountain. May she rest in peace.
The cross reads: Unnamed traveller. Found on the cliff-side, killed by one of those beasts.
The cross reads: Here lies Trombul, the famous potion maker.
The cross reads: Here lies the remains of Antagnart, loved by none but remembered by everyone.
On the floor is what looks like some torn out pages from a book.
You find a crude drawing of one of the white wyrms, but you decide not to keep it since it must belong to someone.

The cross shows lots of small indentations, as if someone hit it repeatedly with a sharp object. You can barely make out the words: "Rest with the Shadow, my friend. I will avenge your death by those beasts".
The cross contains symbols that you cannot understand.
The cross contains symbols that you cannot understand. It looks like someone started digging up this grave recently, but stopped halfway.
The cross contains symbols that you cannot understand, in addition to a crude drawing of what you think should resemble an Izthiel beast.
The cross contains symbols that you cannot understand, in addition to a crude drawing of what you think should resemble a frog.
The cross contains symbols that you cannot understand, but you recognize the word 'Iqhan'.
The cross contains symbols that you cannot understand, in addition to a crude drawing of what you think should resemble a sword.
The cross contains symbols that you cannot understand, in addition to a crude drawing of something that you cannot make out what it should resemble.
The cross contains symbols that you cannot understand, in addition to an elaborate drawing of a skull.

You stop to notice a hole in the wall near the ground, large enough to fit something in. The ground here shows recent shoe-prints, which could indicate that the hole in the wall is a hiding place of some sort. However, it seems to be empty now.
The cross reads: Here lies Telban. A beloved friend of many, and a dreaded foe for those that did not pay up.
The cross reads: Tengil the needy lies here, after having succumbed to the nastiest of poisons. Rest with the Shadow, my friend.
The ground around the grave looks like it has been partially dug up by animals. They don't seem to have gotten anywhere yet though.
Here lies the remains of Ilirathos, mother of two.
Ke'roos lies here. No one knew him in life since he always kept to himself, but we all thank him for the generous gifts he left behind for Brimhaven.
Here lies Lawellyn the weak.
The cross is covered with a thick layer of web. You wonder why anyone would choose this place as a grave for their fallen.
Even though the wood on the cross looks like it was cut recently, you see no signs of anything being buried here.
On the wall, you see a plaque that reads: Bring unto me, that which I cannot bear, for it makes me stronger.
Wh ... who ... Have you come to get me?

replies.text: [Lie] Yes, I am here to get you. Follow me.

conversationlist.message: Nooo! I knew the day would come. You people won't be able to catch me!

replies.text: Wait, who are these people you are referring to?

conversationlist.message: The Sakul are coming.
Hey! Whatever you saw us doing here, we're completely innocent.
These aren't even our things. We are only ... uh ... standing around here.

replies.text: What do you do around here?

conversationlist.message: That's right you didn't.

replies.text: What do you do around here?

conversationlist.message: Oh, we ... um ... stay here. Completely legit. Not at all doing anything that's not allowed.

replies.text: What's in those crates back there?

conversationlist.message: Oh nothing. They're ... uh ... empty. Yes, that's it, empty.
I hope you're not here to ask for help, like all those other people that have come by.
I'm no one. You did not see me, or any of my friends here.

replies.text: You guys seem to be up to something.

conversationlist.message: Really? I think you had better leave.
It seems something must have happened up in the Charwood mining town recently.
There have been quite a few people coming by here and asking us for help.
Don't know what happened over there though. Maybe you should go ask the people in the Charwood cabin.
It's just north of here. Take the path west of our camp here, and head straight north. It's just around the bend there [points].

replies.text: Thanks, I'll go check it out.
I have better things to do.

conversationlist.message: Hello there. Should you be here? This is a tavern, you know. The Foaming Flask, to be precise.
I am a member of the royal guard patrol from Feygard.

replies.text: What do you do around here?

conversationlist.message: Go talk to the captain inside if you want to talk. I must stay alert on my post.

replies.text: Why must you stay alert outside a tavern?

conversationlist.message: Really, I cannot talk to you. I could get into trouble.

replies.text: OK. I won't bother you anymore. Shadow be with you.
OK. I won't bother you anymore. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: No really, the captain might see me. I must be aware on my post at all times. *sigh*

replies.text: OK. I won't bother you anymore. Shadow be with you.
OK. I won't bother you anymore. Goodbye.
Do you like your job here?

conversationlist.message: My job? I guess the royal guard is OK. I mean, Feygard is a really nice place to live in.
Standing guard on duty out here in the middle of nowhere is not really what I signed up for.

replies.text: I bet. This place is really boring.
You must get tired of just standing here also.

conversationlist.message: Yeah I know. I would rather be inside in the tavern drinking like the senior officers and the captain. How come I have to stand out here?

replies.text: At least the Shadow watches over you.
Why not just leave if it's not what you want to do?
The greater cause of the royal guard, to keep the peace, is worth it in the long run.

conversationlist.message: Yes, you are right of course. Our duty is to Feygard and to keep the peace from all that want to disrupt it.

replies.text: Yes. The Shadow will not look favorably upon those that disrupt the peace.
Yes. The troublemakers should be punished.

conversationlist.message: No, my loyalty is to Feygard. If I would leave, I would also leave my loyalty behind.

replies.text: What does that mean if you are not satisfied with what you do?
Yes, that sounds right. Feygard sounds like a nice place from what I have heard.

conversationlist.message: Right. I like you, kid. Tell you what, I could put in a good word for you in the barracks when we get back to Feygard if you want.

replies.text: Sure, that sounds good to me.
No thanks. I have enough to do already.

conversationlist.message: Well, I am convinced that we must follow the laws laid down by our rulers. If we don't obey the law, what are we left with?

Chaos. Disorder.

No, I prefer the lawful way of Feygard. My loyalty is firm.

replies.text: Sounds good to me. Laws are made to be followed.
I do not agree. We should follow our heart, even if that goes against the rules.

conversationlist.message: Was there anything else you wanted?

replies.text: I was wondering about why you stand guard here.

conversationlist.message: That troubles me. We might see each other again in the future. But then we might not be able to have this kind of civil discussion.
Right, we went over this before. As I said, I would rather be inside by the fire.

replies.text: I could spot for you if you want to go inside.
Tough luck. I guess you are left out here, while your captain and buddies are inside.

conversationlist.message: Yeah, that's just my luck.
Really? Yes that would be great. Then I can at least get something to eat and a bit of warmth from the fire.
I will go inside in a minute. Will you stand watch while I go inside?
Thanks a lot my friend.
Shadow? How curious that you would mention that. Explain yourself!

replies.text: I did not mean a thing by it. Never mind I said anything.
The Shadow watches over us when we sleep.

conversationlist.message: Good. Now be gone before I will have to deal with you.
What? Are you one of those troublemakers sent here to sabotage our mission?

replies.text: Fine. I better not start a fight with the royal guard.

conversationlist.message: That does it. You better fight or flee right now kid.

replies.text: Good. I have been waiting for a fight!
Never mind. I was just kidding with you.

conversationlist.message: Beware of the dog!

The road is closed.
Signed: Unkorh, Steward of Guynmart Castle

North: Guynmart Castle
Northwest: Feygard
North: Guynmart Castle
South east: Guynmart Castle
This raft does not look very trustworthy.

replies.text: I can't swim. It is better if I do not try this old raft.

conversationlist.message: Oh no, the raft has drifted off!
I could tie this rope to the tree and climb down.
Hello $playername. Do you wish to climb up to me?

replies.text: Yes. Could you drop the rope down?

conversationlist.message:
* Dedicated to $playername * 
 Our help in times of great need

* D A N G E R *
Do not enter the fog!
You have a gut feeling that it would be better to not go any further unprepared.
You need some item that would help you go through there undiscovered.
The Bridge is broken. It would not hold your weight.
The ground under your feet suddenly gives way, a fissure opens, and you fall into it.

replies.text: Good thing I put on these protective boots. Who knows what could have happened otherwise!

conversationlist.message: Again, a crack has opened and you fall into it.

replies.text: My protective boots saved my life another time!
I almost broke my legs. I wish I had better shoes...

conversationlist.message: Another hole in the ground! This time you can't even see the bottom, but somehow you managed to stop your fall after a few meters.

replies.text: I have to remember to thank Bernhar for the boots!
It is really dangerous to walk here!

conversationlist.message:
Some rocks above your head begin to crack.
A moment later a pile of rocks rains down on you.

replies.text: Thanks to my protective cap I am not seriously hurt.

conversationlist.message:
You hear rocks cracking above your head again.
There is no chance to jump away before they hit!

replies.text: Good thing I am wearing this protective cap!
I should take more care where I am going!

conversationlist.message: You fell into another hole hidden in the ground and hurt yourself.

replies.text: I hope my boots are OK.

conversationlist.message: Rocks falling! You jump aside - luckily a very big boulder only grazed your side.

replies.text: That was neat. I fear that not even my protective cap would have helped much against that huge boulder.

conversationlist.message: A huge boulder suddenly breaks, and its pieces fall down from above onto you.

replies.text: Thanks to my protective cap I am not seriously hurt.

conversationlist.message: You fell into a hole and hurt yourself.

replies.text: Will these holes in the ground never end?

conversationlist.message: Several small but sharp edged pieces of rock are coming down. One hits you right on the top of your head.

replies.text: That could have been very bad without my cap!
Ouch! It's like the mountain is out to get me!

conversationlist.message:
A big part of the mountain side above you cracks.
A moment later a pile of rocks rains down on you.

replies.text: Ouch! It could have been worse though, without the cap!

conversationlist.message: You fell into yet another hole and hurt yourself.

replies.text: Good footwear is a prerequisite for successful exploration!
I'm really starting to hate this place!

conversationlist.message: Guess what - you have found another crack in the ground.

replies.text: [singing] How many holes must a man fall down...?

conversationlist.message:
Seven rocks above your head begin to crack.
A moment later a pile of rocks rains down on you.

replies.text: *Sigh* Even with the protective cap, these rocks are really annoying!

conversationlist.message: You stumble over some rocks. As you fall against the wall, it buckles and the whole wall begins to crumble.
When the dust clears a bit you can see a small corridor.
The ground is very slippery. You can't get back onto the solid rock!
You slide slowly into the cold water ... you think of Mikhail, and of Andor ... your senses disappear ...
Shivering you come back to consciousness. The current has taken you a long way, but fortunately you have been washed ashore.
The lava is bubbling and glowing flakes are scorching through your clothes.
Danger! Unstable cliffs. Proceed with caution!
Danger! Cave subject to rockfall. Do not enter!
Oh - a wandering kid! How surprising!
My name is Bernhar. I am an explorer, and I'm trying to find out something about the cave system here.

replies.text: Ah. Interesting. Keep having fun with it. Bye.

conversationlist.message: Oh - the wandering kid! You are still alive? How surprising!

replies.text: Hi Bernhar. I want to talk with you again.

conversationlist.message: Sure! I could tell you things...
Steep mountain flanks and wide, branching, cave passages! But beware - it is dangerous ground! You must not go unprotected!
You are not taking me seriously. Let me tell you...
You are risking your life here. It is not only those Arulir brutes. They are just annoying.
The ground is really dangerous. It's deceptive and life-threatening. And there is always the danger of falling rocks from above.
I was only able to survive this far because I was wearing the proper protective gear.
I have completed my work here though, so I don't need it any more. I could sell it to you for a good price.
If you go in there unprotected, I fear there will be no other time.
Hey kid! The protective gear is of no use if you don't wear it!

replies.text: Oh, yes. Thank you for reminding me!

conversationlist.message: Oh, what a rare surprise!

replies.text: What are you doing in such a lonely place?

conversationlist.message: I am Tjure of Brimhaven. I am ... was ... a successful merchant. But my luck has run out.
All I can do now is hide in this lonely place, far away from any water.

replies.text: Aha. I won't bother you then.

conversationlist.message: I once found a mermaid asleep on the beach of a river, north of here. What a beautiful sight! I could not avert my eyes!
Especially, the colorful tail attracted me so much, that I did something that I have deeply regretted since then.
I pulled out one of her shimmering, dazzling scales, and ran away.
The mermaid immediately awoke and was very angry. But on land she had no chance to catch me.
Crying and sobbing, the mermaid called after me. Finally, she screamed at me that I would never find peace, and that I would never want to approach water again!
At first I was happy with my shimmering scale. But I soon realized that everything in my life was going wrong.
I couldn't think of anything else but the wrath of the people of the river.
What could I do? I tried to throw it away or give it to other people - all in vain.

I traveled all over Dhayavar to find someone to help me. Finally, a wise woman, far in the northeast, listened to my story. She advised me to return the scale to the mermaid. This would break the curse.
But I did not dare to do this.
She told me that my only other option was to find some kind-hearted person to buy it from me, but then they take on the curse.

replies.text: Let me be the one to rescue you. Sell me the scale.

conversationlist.message: I know, I know. When they heard my story, everybody ran away.

replies.text: That's too bad. I hope that you will find someone to buy it. Bye.
Not me. I will buy the scale.

conversationlist.message: So you really won't help me? You will leave me to my misery?

replies.text: Sorry, I can't do it. Bye.
I have to think about it.
OK. maybe I am stupid, but sell me the scale.

conversationlist.message: Here, take it! I have to request gold for it, otherwise it won't work. But one piece of gold should be enough.

replies.text: No problem, here, take the gold.

conversationlist.message: (As soon as you take the scale in your hands, a great sluggishness and a feeling of despair come over you.)
(For a second you feel very dizzy. At least you manage not to faint. As from afar you hear a voice.)
*Sigh* You were my last hope. Leave me now.
Thank you for your help.
Oh, you look better than the last time we met. Thank you for your help.
This seems to be a very strange place. Maybe even dangerous.

replies.text: * Put the scale on the ground *

conversationlist.message: What a relief! You suddenly feel lighthearted again.
Suddenly, you hear someone singing.
You never heard such a beautiful sound before.
You found a heavy bag of gold. 1000 shining pieces of gold!
You have found a small, shiny, metal bar.
You feel that you can no longer hold on. You will have to slide into the cold water ...
You think of Mikhail, and of Andor ... your strength is slowly leaving you. ...
Maybe the current will wash you ashore somewhere?
Go away, kid.
Hi, kid. Wanna visit Guynmart Castle? Ancient walls, and sometimes a ghost at midnight?

replies.text: Might be interesting. And an easy way to get in...

conversationlist.message: Great choice, you won't regret it. Adults 20 gold, kids 12 gold. Bilingual guide would be 3 gold extra.

replies.text: OK, one kid, without guide, please.
One kid and a guide, please.

conversationlist.message:
[Gold taken]
HAHAHA! Once again some stupid person with more money than brains! HAHAHA!
No trespassing! Especially for kids!

replies.text: I just want to pass through.

conversationlist.message: I am not allowed to let anyone in or out. And I am incorruptable below 100 pieces of gold.

replies.text: Well, I think I'll look for another entrance.
Sorry, I don't have that much gold with me.

conversationlist.message: Mind your own business. I hate kids. Just disappear!
I am standing around kicking my heels and answering stupid questions.
Pick? A rose? You? No way! All flowers in this garden are the personal property of Lady Hannah.

replies.text: Come on. With so many plants she will not miss a single flower.

conversationlist.message: Hannah is Guynmart's daughter.
Hannah knows every single plant in her garden. Nobody but herself and old Nuik may touch the plants.
Nuik has been a gardener here for as long as I can remember. And now disappear!
Don't you know anything? Guynmart has been Lord of Guynmart castle for as long as I remember. His wife died early, during the birth of their daughter.
Hannah's beauty is well known all over the country. Many young men asked to marry her. But she only has eyes for Lovis.
Lovis is a good boy. I have not seen him for a while.

replies.text: La la la ... I'm not listening anymore...

conversationlist.message: But when Lovis is back, I am sure he will marry Hannah immediately.

replies.text: This is all very interesting. Are you letting me through now?

conversationlist.message: What? No, of course not!
No trespassing! Especially for kids!

replies.text: Do you not know me anymore? I've already given you enough gold.

conversationlist.message: Gold can never be enough. So it is 200 pieces of gold now.
So do you want to go through or not?

replies.text: Outrageous! But OK, here is 200 gold.
I have to think about it.

conversationlist.message: Well, everything is getting more expensive nowadays. So 200 pieces of gold, please.
I am not allowed to let anyone in or out. And I am incorruptable below 200 pieces of gold.

replies.text: Well, I will really look for another entrance now.
200 gold? Last time it was 100 gold.
Sorry, I don't have that much gold with me.

conversationlist.message: Pick? A rose? You? No way! All flowers in this garden are the personal property of Lady Hannah.

replies.text: Come on. With so many plants she will not miss a single flower.

conversationlist.message: Anyone could say that. But maybe...
Nothing. You don't seem to have enough money. Forget it.
for 100 gold...
And here is the rose. Don't tell anybody that you got it from me.
No trespassing! Especially for kids!

replies.text: Tell me, did many people pass by today?

conversationlist.message: Now that you mention it - not a single one. Bad business today.

replies.text: No wonder with the main gate open.

conversationlist.message: Ah, that is why. OK. I am not allowed to let anyone in or out. And I am incorruptable below 2 pieces of gold.

replies.text: You never give up, do you?

conversationlist.message:
[Gold taken]
Very good. Before you enter maybe you should also know the family names: Lord Guynmart, his beautiful but complicated daughter Hannah and his annoying son Rob. Got it?
Rob is always playing some stupid game, and Hannah is always having problems. See?
Enough talk. No trespassing! I will close my eyes now and count to 10.

[Gold taken]
Very good. I will close my eyes now and count to 10.
...three...
...four...
...five...
...eh, now seven, I think...
...eight...
...nine...
Hmm, you may have not enough money, but you have some nice things with you. I might give you a good price.

replies.text: We'll see. Let's have a look at my belongings.
I would rather starve here on the spot than sell you a single thing.

conversationlist.message: Hi kid! Would you like to play a card game?

replies.text: No thanks. My father warned me that certain card games can become a bad habit.

conversationlist.message: We always play card color guessing. Do you have any money?

conversationlist.message: I will draw a card, and you have to guess whether it is Red or Black.
If you get it right, I will give you gold 100 coins. If your guess is wrong, you owe me 100.

replies.text: Eh, could you explain once more?

conversationlist.message: Hey, you look like you have no money left.

replies.text: Yes indeed, I'm broke. Sorry, then I have to leave.

conversationlist.message: OK. I have drawn a card. Which color is it?

[Gold taken]

I have Red! Sorry for you, kid. I get 100.
[Gold taken]
Let's try another card.

Red! How did you know? Here you get 100 again.
[Gold received]

Black! You guessed it right again. Here you get 100 gold.
[Gold received]
Let's try another card.

How can you think of eating and drinking! My love has gone - I will never eat again! Take it for yourself or throw it away.

conversationlist.message: No problem, see you later.
I don't know myself. He has been uproad for a week now. But he often is, so this is not unusual. I hope that he will take me with him on such missions.
My sister is not in her room. She is probably at the top of the tower again, watching for a sign of Lovis.
They want to marry, but a few days ago he vanished and has not returned. Hannah now weeps all the time. I hope for Lovis that he has a good reason for making my sister so sad.

conversationlist.message:

conversationlist.message: I am checking that the bed of young Robalyrius is still in order.
Since Lady Hannah was married, she never sings anymore.
Since Lady Hannah was married, she is singing all day long. Thank you for your help.

conversationlist.message: Hello $playername! It's a lovely day, isn't it?

conversationlist.message: Hi kid, where are you going in such a hurry?

conversationlist.message: You are lucky! I have just gathered some wonderful fresh herbs. Take these to Hofala.
It is dangerous here. Please stay outside, in front of the signs on the floor, and wait there. I will be with you in a minute.
Welcome, $playername. I am Rorthron, the world's most famous ringmaker. I know Andor, your brother. He sometimes consulted me about newly found rings.

conversationlist.message: A lot. If ever you find one of the strong, old rings, come and show it to me. I might enhance it for you, as I already did for Andor. Don't forget to bring some bonemeal potions as a sign of friendship.
Maybe you want to look at my fine collection of rings? Unfortunately I have no ring of real power available just now. But I sell them for a good price.
No, sorry. I tend not to ask about things that are personal.

replies.text: That's a pity. I have been trailing my big brother for quite some time.
What do you know about magic rings?

conversationlist.message: Ah - just one thing: I know the power some rings can have, and I would prefer you took yours off in my presence.
Be welcome, $playername. I am Rorthron, the world's most famous ringmaker. I know Andor, your brother. He sometimes consulted me about newly found rings.

replies.text: You know me? And my brother?
Andor! Do you know where he was bound?

conversationlist.message: You and Andor are different. You will be legendary. Well do I know your deeds! And I even heard rumors that you gained the legends of legends, the mighty Ring of lesser Shadow!

With the help of some bonemeal potions I could improve it to be an even greater ring. The powers will be similar but greater. It will become the
** Ring of far lesser Shadow **

Really. When my work is done, your ring will be stronger than ever.

Olav! Come Here!
Show our - guest - the special exit.

conversationlist.message: I have had enough of you. This will be your end!

conversationlist.message: Now you will get what you deserve!

conversationlist.message: Pathetic. So run, and never let me set eyes on you again!

conversationlist.message: OK. I will go now. But I will not forget you - fear my revenge! And before I leave, I will stab your beloved Guynmart...

replies.text: Nooo! What did you do? Stay and face me, you coward!

conversationlist.message: Indeed. I am surprised to see you here.

I don't want to hear your lies.

conversationlist.message: Please be patient, and give me a minute. This may be important to you.

replies.text: No. I will never believe you unless you let Guynmart go!

conversationlist.message: Until recently, everything was fine. Guynmart was a righteous man, open-minded and tolerant. And Hannah was supposed to marry me when she was old enough.
Then one unfortunate day this Lovis appeared.
He kept playing on his probably magical flute and thus stole Hannah's heart.
He also began to influence Guynmart more and more, until Guynmart would not make a single decision without hearing from Lovis.
Shadow meetings were banned, and the use of bonemeal potions was prohibited.
People had to hand over all their bonemeal supplies so that they could be destroyed. The farms, their inhabitants, and even visitors were searched.
A young man, who was my guest at that time, gave me his bonemeal potion box and asked me to take care of it. Otherwise it would have been destroyed too.
So I took it for safekeeping. Look here.

replies.text: I know this box - it belongs to my brother Andor!

conversationlist.message: Andor - yes, that was his name. He is your brother? That explains the similarity.
We had long nights of interesting conversation.
Well, Andor had to go on urgent business and left the castle the same night.
Enough talk. Now you have to decide if you want to trust me or rather Guynmart.

replies.text: I think I misjudged you. I will trust you.
You did not convince me. I believe Guynmart more than you.

conversationlist.message: Are you sure? Listen to your heart. It is really important.

replies.text: No, I believe Guynmart more than you.

conversationlist.message: Watch out! Guynmart...
Guynmart tried to get at you from behind. I felt I had to do something quick, but it seems that it wasn't necessary. Obviously he stumbled and fell on his own knife.

replies.text: Thank you. Really, I didn't expect this from Lord Guynmart.

conversationlist.message: Yes, Guynmart had changed a lot recently. Here, please take Andor's bonemeal potion box and return it to him.

replies.text: If only I had finally found my brother.

conversationlist.message: And now stick to your plan. Open the gate. My men will await Norgothla.
Then go to the farm south of here and stay there for the night. May The Shadow be with you!
Hello $playername.
Hello $playername - The Shadow be with you.

Move on!

...and now it is suitable for her. Hurry now, while it is still hot!

conversationlist.message: Hey, get us some bottles of wine! I could tell you things you wouldn't believe!

conversationlist.message: Oh. The wine bottles are all empty. Could you get some more?

replies.text: Yes, of course. I will get some more bottles.

conversationlist.message: You standing over me makes me feel uncomfortable. Take a seat next to me first.
Let's have a sip, then I will tell you my story.

replies.text: I think I had better keep the bottles in my bag.

conversationlist.message:
[Fjoerkard empties a bottle]
Oh yes, I remember it well ... It was a dark and stormy night up in the mountains.
My men and I had been on the road for hours, without a break and without the slightest sign of getting closer to our goal.
We silently trudged one by one up the tortuous path that led up the steep slope, always wary of the treacherous shadows of the bushes on either side, and always listening for signs of danger.
You don't mind if I open another bottle?

[Fjoerkard empties the bottle]
Gornauds were said to be roaming in those mountains. We had not seen any, by the shadow, but we had already crossed their traces several times.
And there were rumors about even more dangerous creatures - I will not even name them.
A lonely hut came into sight. A friendly light in the midst of the wilderness. There we would ask to camp for the night. New strength flowed through us, when suddenly all hell broke loose.
Gornauds jumped out from behind the rocks, so close that we could clearly see their facial features. For a few terrible seconds I thought that those would be our last seconds.

[Another bottle]
But then we realized that the monsters were after an easier prey. A small figure was in front of us on the path. A child? Alone up there?
Shaken, I closed my eyes, despite the great danger. I did not want to look at the slaughter. The dreadful noise lasted only a few seconds.
The ground was soaked with red blood. But - it came from the gornauds! The child just wiped the weapon clean of blood, gave us a quick glance, and disappeared up the path.

[Another bottle]
We had had enough of that cursed march. Panicked, we ran back down the path. Tired as we were, we ran without stopping even once, to the inn in the valley, from which we had departed in the morning.
Never will I forget that useless journey. Often I see it again in a nightmare and then I seek the memory of a friendly inn. Where once there was a little girl, probably the daughter of the landlord.

[Yet another bottle]
She got some wine for an old bearded guest and asked for a tale, and he began: Oh yes, I remember it well ... It was a dark and stormy night up in the mountains.
What are you - a spy? Or just another prisoner?

replies.text: I'm a prisoner too. What is your name?
I'm $playername. Lady Hannah asked me to look for someone called Lovis.

conversationlist.message: No, you must tell me your name first.

replies.text: No, first you will tell me your name.
If you are going to be so rude, I have nothing to say.
I am $playername. Lady Hannah asked me to look for someone called Lovis.

replies.text: Here, I should give you this.

conversationlist.message: My flute! How I have missed it! I believe you now.

replies.text: This is settled then. Let us now look for an exit.

conversationlist.message: What a dreadful place. Time seems endless here.

replies.text: Yes, but we must not give up hope.

conversationlist.message: [Fluting]

Rorthron, the ringmaker, was behaving rather strangely, and so we questioned him. It came to light that he seems to have damaged one of your rings.

He promised never to do such things again and handed the real ring over to us. We want to leave it at that.

replies.text: Yes, what I did was stupid.

conversationlist.message: As you wish. I am very disappointed with you - go now.

replies.text: No, sorry, I didn't mean it.

replies.text: Norgothla is out in the woods and awaits you there with his men. Unkorh persuaded him that you commanded that.

conversationlist.message: Unkorh! I curse the day when I made him my steward.

replies.text: How can I help you now? Shall I search for the keys to your cell?

conversationlist.message: No time for that. I am too weak to be of much help. We need Norgothla now.

replies.text: Lovis is on his way to him. He can probably persuade Norgothla to come to the castle.

conversationlist.message: Good. Norgothla knows and trusts him. Tell me - is the main gate shut?

replies.text: Yes. I came through the garden door.

conversationlist.message:
Then you must open the gate! Go to the gatehouse and open it, so that my men can get in. Be quick.
After that go to the farm south of here. I expect a ferocious battle.
YOU AGAIN!
[Groaning] ...open the gate...
...then go ... to Rhodita...
[Groaning]

replies.text: You don't talk too much, do you?

conversationlist.message: $playername enters!
Who may I please announce?
[Whispering] You should talk to Lovis again.
[Whispering] You should talk again to Unkorh.
No entry!
Come in, and take your time! You may choose one of three things.

On the table there are 5000 shining gold coins.
You feel the pleasant weight of the gold in your bag.
On the table you see a scroll with the texts of wise men.
You feel an immediate benefit from the experience of others.
On the table lies a beautifully crafted shield.
This shield does feel good in your hands.
Hello $playername - great to meet you again!

replies.text: Norgothla! So you made it here.

conversationlist.message: Yes. Unkorh is still on the run, but my men are close behind him, thanks to you.

replies.text: It was you who did all the hard work, I just helped a bit.

conversationlist.message: [You notice a strange helmet on the shrine. It looks like it might be valuable. Perhaps you should take it.]
Welcome to my shop. Please browse my fine selection of everyday potions.

replies.text: Let me see what potions you have available.
Do you have anything to help against food-poisoning?
I was told that I can get some Spotted Hornbeam fungus from you.
Can you sell me a special crystal vial?

conversationlist.message: Oh yes. Really disgusting smell, they have. But good for making potions.
Here, have some. I don't have that much, so don't lose it!
I already gave you some, before. Don't tell me you lost it?
Oh yes, I have a recipe for a mixture that helps against food poisoning. If you want, I could create some of that for you.

replies.text: Sounds good, what do you need from me?

conversationlist.message: I am all out of the ingredients required for it. Maybe you could help me gather some of them?

replies.text: No way, I'm not running your errands.

conversationlist.message: Fair enough. Welcome back if you change your mind.
To make the potion against food-poisoning, I would need one poison gland and two pieces of animal hair. I will also require 50 gold for the work required.

replies.text: I'll be right back with those ingredients.
Any ideas where I can find those ingredients?
I have those ingredients for you.
I have those ingredients for you.
Here, I have enough of those ingredients for five potions.
Here, I have enough of those ingredients for ten potions.

conversationlist.message: Excellent.
Well, animal hair can probably be found on any beast here outside of Fallhaven. I heard some hunters found a pack of wolves a bit south of here.
Poison glands however, can be a bit trickier to find. I don't know really, but any poisonous creature might do. Maybe some snakes around here are poisonous?

replies.text: I'll be right back with those ingredients.
Phew, that sounds like a lot of work. I don't know if I'll do it.

conversationlist.message: Good. Give me a minute to prepare that antidote for you.
[Mixes the ingredients]
There. One potion against food-poisoning for you.
There. Five potions against food-poisoning for you.
There. Ten potions against food-poisoning for you.
I can create more of those potions if you want. You'll have to bring me more of those ingredients then.

replies.text: I sure hope this mixture of your works.

conversationlist.message:
We play with several 32-piece card decks from 7 to 10, jack (2 points), queen (3 points), king (4 points) and ace (11 points).

You can draw as many cards as you want and you will get them face down so only you can take a look at them. After each draw you can decide to draw another card or stop. You lose if you have drawn more than 21 points.
	

After you stop I will draw following the same rules. Then we show each other our cards. You win if you have more points than I have; otherwise you lose.
You win 1 gold.
