Hello there. Please browse my selection of fine armors and protection.

replies.text: Let me see your list of wares.

conversationlist.message: Hello there. I heard you helped us here in Vilegard. What can I help you with?

replies.text: Can I see what items you have for sale?
I have a shipment of Feygard items for you.
On the body of something called the Hira'zinn, I found this peculiar sword. Do you know anything about it?

conversationlist.message: You are an outsider. We don't like outsiders here in Vilegard. Please leave.

replies.text: Why is everyone in Vilegard so suspicious of outsiders?
Can I see what items you have for sale?

conversationlist.message: You are an outsider. We don't like outsiders here in Vilegard. Please leave.

replies.text: Why is everyone in Vilegard so suspicious of outsiders?
Can I see what items you have for sale?
I have a shipment of Feygard items for you.
On the body of something called the Hira'zinn, I found this peculiar sword. Do you know anything about it?

conversationlist.message: I don't trust you. You should go see Jolnor in the chapel if you want some sympathy.
Oh my, a commoner. Get away from me. I might catch something.

replies.text: What is a noble woman such as yourself doing in a place like this?
I would be glad to get away from a snob like you.

conversationlist.message: I am Ambelie of the house of Laumwill in Feygard. I am sure you must have heard of me and my house.

replies.text: Oh yes ... um ... House of Laumwill in Feygard. Of course.
I have never heard of you or your house.

conversationlist.message: Feygard, the great city of peace. Surely you must know of it. Northwest in our great land.

replies.text: What is a noble woman such as yourself doing in a place like this?
No, I have never heard of it.

conversationlist.message: Pfft. That just proves everything I have heard of you savages here in the southern land. So uneducated.
I, Ambelie, of the house of Laumwill in Feygard, am on an excursion to the southern Nor City.
An excursion to see if Nor City really is all that I have heard about it. If it really can compare itself to the glamour of the great city of Feygard.

replies.text: If you like it so much in Feygard, why would you even leave?
Ehh ... I'm here to ... escort you safely to Nor City.

conversationlist.message: Don't you know of Nor City? I will take note that the savages here haven't even heard of the city.
I am beginning to be even more certain that Nor City will never, even in my wildest dreams, be comparable to the great city of Feygard.
All the noblewomen in Feygard keep talking about the mysterious Shadow in Nor City. I just have to see it myself.
Thank you. Now please leave before someone sees me talking to a commoner like you.

replies.text: Commoner? Are you trying to insult me? Goodbye.
Whatever, you probably wouldn't even survive a forest wasp.

conversationlist.message: [Mutter] Just one more...
What? No, you're not it.
[Drool]
[Wipes drool]
[Blank stare]
[Makes slurping sounds with drool still left in the corner of the mouth]
Uhh. Lowyna sure makes the best stuff!
These of course! [swings his jug, nearly spilling some of it]

replies.text: Where can I find this Lowyna?

conversationlist.message: She's over there... No. Over there... No. Oh, she's around here somewhere.
[blank stare]

replies.text: You're all sweaty and pale, what's wrong?

conversationlist.message: Um. Just one more. Please, just one more.
Can you spare some gold?
Oh, oh! I haven't seen that much gold in my whole life. I'm finally rich!
Is that all you have?
I've seen them. Their camps.
The Sakul are watching us. They're coming.
[Grunt]
Our hero enters my shop. I am honored. How may I help you? A new set of boots perhaps, or some new gloves?

replies.text: Let me see what you have for sale.
Jhaeld told me you could help me improve my equipment.

conversationlist.message: Oh yes, I can make modifications to most of our defensive equipment that I sell. Want me to look through your things to see if there's anything I can improve for you?

replies.text: No, I would not want you going through my stuff.

conversationlist.message: Sure. I would be honored to have you back if you change your mind.
Hi. How may I help you? A new set of boots perhaps, or some new gloves?

replies.text: Let me see what you have for sale.
Jhaeld sent me to ask you about the people that have gone missing.

conversationlist.message: It's OK, I guess. Not as good as I would like it to be, now that the gates to the town are closed. But people here still seem to need new pieces of leather every now and then.

replies.text: Let me see what you have for sale.
Jhaeld sent me to ask you about the people that have gone missing.

conversationlist.message:
Oh, I don't know much about that. Funny you should ask.
[Rothses gives you a suspicious look]

replies.text: Are you sure? Anything you know or might have seen may be of interest.

conversationlist.message: Well, you would think that I see most of what is going on here, considering my shop is this close to Remgard's connecting entrance bridge.
However, I don't know anything about it. *cough*

replies.text: Is there something you are not telling me?
Did the guards ask you about what you know?

conversationlist.message: Oh yes, they've been around asking everyone. I told them everything I know, already.
I did see Bethir the night before she disappeared. She had some equipment to sell. Nothing out of the ordinary though.
I did not see where she went after that.
Look, I told all this to the guards before. Are you implying anything?

replies.text: I'll keep my eye on you.

conversationlist.message: Look, I told you before.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have things to do.
Hmm, let me see.
No, you don't seem to have anything that I can improve. Come back later and I might be able to help you.
That's a nice looking Remgard shield you have there. For 700 gold, I am able to improve it so that it blocks blows a bit better.

replies.text: Maybe later. Do I have anything else that you can improve?

conversationlist.message: Here you go. One improved Remgard shield.

replies.text: Do I have anything else that you can improve?

conversationlist.message: That's a nice looking Remgard shield you are wearing. Remove it from your hands and I might be able to help you improve it, if you want.
Those are some nice looking combat gloves you have there. For 300 gold, I am able to improve them so that they block blows a bit better.

replies.text: Maybe later. Do I have anything else that you can improve?

conversationlist.message: Here you go. One pair of improved combat gloves.

replies.text: Do I have anything else that you can improve?

conversationlist.message: Those are some nice looking combat gloves you are wearing. Remove them from your hands and I might be able to help you improve them, if you want.
Now that is one fine looking chain mail you have there! For 3000 gold, I am able to improve it so that it not only blocks blows better, but also hinders your attacks less.

replies.text: Maybe later. Do I have anything else that you can improve?

conversationlist.message: Here you go. One improved chain mail.

replies.text: Do I have anything else that you can improve?

conversationlist.message: Now that is one fine looking chain mail you are wearing. Remove it from your chest and I might be able to help you improve it, if you want.
Welcome to my tavern. Please have a seat anywhere.

replies.text: What can I get to drink around here?

conversationlist.message: Well, unfortunately, with the mine tunnel collapsed, we cannot trade much with the outside villages.
However, I do have a huge supply of mead that I stocked up on before the mine shaft collapsed.

replies.text: Mead? Yuck. Too sweet for my taste.
Alright! Just my kind of taste. Let's see what you have to trade.
Very well, it will have to do. I guess it has some healing potential. Let's trade.

conversationlist.message: Suit yourself. That's what I've got anyway.
Oh, a new one around here.
Welcome kid. Are you here to drench your sorrows like the rest of us?

replies.text: Not really. What is there to do around here?
Yeah, give me some of what you're having.
Stop bumping into me when I'm trying to walk.

conversationlist.message: My my, a feisty one. Very well, I will get out of your way.
Drink, of course!

replies.text: I should have seen that one coming. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: Hey, this one is mine. Buy your own mead from Birgil over there.
*hic* Hey theeere kid. Will you buy an old-timer like me a new round of mead?

replies.text: Yikes, what happened to you? Get away from me.
No way, and stop blocking my way.

conversationlist.message: Hey hey, thanks a lot kid! *hic*
*grumbles*
Claws. Scratching.
Got a hold of poor Kirg they did.
Those damn beasts.
And it's all my fault. *sob*
Welcome friend! Would you like to browse my selection of fine potions and ointments?

replies.text: Sure. Show me what you have.
I am looking for some Lyson marrow extract, for Hjaldar in Remgard.

conversationlist.message: Welcome traveller. Have you come to ask for help from me and my potions?

replies.text: Yes. Please show me what you have.
I am looking for some Lyson marrow extract, for Hjaldar in Remgard.

conversationlist.message: I already sold you some before. Did you lose it? Please tell my old friend Hjaldar that I said hello.
Hjaldar, my old friend! Tell me, how is he these days?

replies.text: He asked me to relay his greetings to you, and to tell you that he is well.
He is sick, and getting worse every day.

conversationlist.message: Oh, I am so glad to hear that! We sure did have some nice times while working together.
I'm sorry to hear that. He always seemed like a tough old boy to me.
You asked for some Lyson marrow extract.
Sure, I have it.

Since you helped us up here in the Blackwater mountain settlement earlier, I am willing to give you a discount on the price for some Lyson marrow extract. For 400 gold, I am willing to sell you some of it for my old friend Hjaldar.

replies.text: Ouch, that much?! Is there anything you can do to lower the price?
I'll return when I have the gold for it.

conversationlist.message: No, 400 gold it is. That's a really good price, considering how hard this stuff is to find. Besides, if it weren't for Hjaldar, I wouldn't even be selling this to you.

replies.text: I'll return when I have the gold for it.

conversationlist.message: For 800 gold, I am willing to sell you some of it for my old friend Hjaldar.

replies.text: Ouch, that much?! Is there anything you can do to lower the price?
I'll return when I have the gold for it.

conversationlist.message: No, 800 gold it is. That's a really good price, considering how hard this stuff is to find. Besides, if it weren't for Hjaldar, I wouldn't even be selling this to you.

replies.text: I'll return when I have the gold for it.

conversationlist.message: Thanks. Here's some of the Lyson marrow extract.
Please give my warmest greetings to my good friend Hjaldar. Tell him that I am well.
I am glad you followed me up the mountain to help us out.

replies.text: How did you get up here so fast?
Those were some tough fights, but I can manage.

conversationlist.message: Oh yes. In fact, our Blackwater mountain settlement is just down these stairs.
Go ahead, I will meet you inside.
We meet again. Well done fighting your way up here.
You should go down these stairs and talk to our battle master, Harlenn. He can usually be found at the third level down.
Yes, you seem like an able fighter.
I learned some shortcuts up and down the mountain a while back. Nothing strange about that right?
Anyway, we are right at the settlement now. In fact, our Blackwater mountain settlement is just down these stairs.
Halt! No one is allowed to enter or exit Remgard.
Wrong? You bet there is. Several of the townspeople have disappeared, and we are still conducting the investigation.
We are searching for them in the town, and questioning everyone for clues on where they might be.
No, I highly doubt that.

Considering our town is surrounded by lake Laeroth, we guards are able to keep a watchful eye on everything going on here. We are able to keep a log of who comes and goes, since this bridge is our only connection to the mainland.
For your sake, it is probably safer for you to remain out of town until our investigation is complete.

replies.text: I am willing to help you with the investigation if you want.
OK, I will leave you to your investigation.
How about you allow me to enter town anyway, so that I can trade. I promise to be quick.

conversationlist.message: No. As I said, no one except us guards are allowed to enter or exit town until our investigation is completed. I suggest you leave now.
Hmm, yes, that might be a good idea actually. Considering you made it up here, you must have some knowledge of the surroundings.
Tell you what. You might be able to help us.
There is an abandoned house some way to the east of here, on a peninsula on the northern shore of lake Laeroth.

We have reason to believe that this cabin is inhabited by someone, since we have seen candlelight coming from there during the night across the lake. We are not certain though, it could just be the moonlight on the water.
That's where you come in, and might be able to help us.
I must stay here and guard the bridge, but you could go over there and peek inside.
Now, I must warn you - this could be dangerous. If it is as we suspected, then the person in the cabin could be a ... shall we say ... persuasive talker.
So, if you really want to help us, the task I ask of you is that you only peek inside that cabin and identify if there's anyone there, and if so who that might be.
Report back to me as soon as possible, and do not speak for too long with anyone that might be there.
Would you be willing to do this task for us?

replies.text: Sure, I would be happy to help.
I'll do it. I sure hope there will be some reward for this though.
No way, this sounds way too dangerous for me.
Actually, I have already been there. There is a woman called Algangror in the cabin.
Actually, I have already been there, but the cabin was empty.

conversationlist.message: I don't blame you for declining. After all, it could be a dangerous task. Didn't hurt to ask though.
Excellent. Report back as soon as possible.
Did you find anything in that abandoned house?

replies.text: Not yet. What was I supposed to do again?
Not yet, I am still working on it.
There is a woman called Algangror in the cabin.
Yes, I have been there, but the cabin was empty.

conversationlist.message: Algangror, sigh. Then it is as we feared. This is terrible news.
You should go visit our village elder, Jhaeld, and talk to him about what we should do next. I will let you enter Remgard to speak to him.
You can probably find him in the tavern to the southeast, since that's where he spends most of his time.
Thank you for scouting that cabin. It's a relief to hear that it is empty. Our fears might not be true then after all.

replies.text: You are welcome. Anything else I can help you with?
You are welcome. Now, about that reward?

conversationlist.message: I guess you have proven yourself to be useful. We might have more work for you if you are interested.
No no, we did not discuss any reward. But there might be one for you if you are willing to help us further.
You there! What are you doing here?
This place is not safe. I urge you to turn back and to venture no further into this cursed forest.

replies.text: I think I can handle myself.
OK, I'll turn back. Thanks for the warning.

conversationlist.message: This place - oh why did we ever agree to go on this mission?
Me and some other guards were sent here to find a madman that is wanted by the Feygard authorities.
The madman is wanted for a number of crimes committed against Feygard, none of which I am allowed to disclose.
At first, it seemed like just any ordinary mission - go find some crazy fool.
But once we got here, it started happening. One by one, my fellow guards got more and more ... well ... I don't know how to put it, but something started to happen to them.
Now, these flies that inhabit these woods can drive a grown man mad, I'll tell you that. But that wasn't it. There was something else.
The first guard said he had seen something among the trees, and went to look for it. We never saw him again.
Some time later, one of the other guards seemed like he didn't know who we were, and ran off into the forest.
Another guard said he'd nearly gotten lost in a what he called the 'green maze'.
Yes, it seems so. None of the scouts have come back. Or rather, the ones that have come back have been ... afflicted by something.

replies.text: What could be causing them to behave that way?

conversationlist.message: I don't know. Maybe something in the woods.
Maybe it's something that the madman that we were looking for has done.

replies.text: That's a really touching story. I really need to get going.

conversationlist.message: No, none.

replies.text: I'll keep my eyes open for any dangers when traveling through the forest myself.
Best of luck on your mission.

conversationlist.message: Oh, before you go. As I told you before, one of the guards mentioned 'the green maze', that apparently is somewhere around here.
Thank you.

I don't know if it's the twisty paths themselves or something that the madman has done that caused my fellow guards to behave the way they have - but consider yourself warned if you venture further into the forest!

replies.text: Your fellow guards must have been weak. I'm surely not as weak as them.
OK, I'll be on the look-out for any dangers.

conversationlist.message: Consider yourself warned. I can't come help you if something happens.
Oh, it's you again.
Oh, it's you again.

Psst, hey.

Wanna trade?

replies.text: I heard that you talked to my brother a while ago.

conversationlist.message: Your brother? Oh you mean Andor? I might know something, but that information will cost you. Bring me a poison gland from one of those poisonous snakes and maybe I'll tell you.

replies.text: Here, I have a poison gland for you.

conversationlist.message: Thanks a lot kid. This will do just fine.
Look kid, I already told you.
I talked to him yesterday. He asked if I knew someone called Umar or something like that. I have no idea who he was talking about.
He seemed really upset about something and left in a hurry. Something about the Thieves' Guild in Fallhaven.
That's all I know. Maybe you should ask around in Fallhaven. Look for my friend Gaela, he probably knows more.
Hello there. Welcome to the Crossroads guardhouse. How may I help you?

replies.text: You guards seem to have a lot of equipment here, anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: I'm sorry, we only trade with allies of Feygard.
This guardhouse is a safe haven for merchants travelling the Duleian road. We keep law and order around here, for Feygard.
Noticed the large road outside? That's the Duleian road. It goes all the way from the glorious city of Feygard up in the northwest down to the wretched Nor City in the southeast.
Oh sure. Recently, we have had to focus our attention to the troubles up in Loneford.
That situation has forced us to be more alert than usual, and we have had to send some guards up there to help them.
This also means that we cannot focus as much on our usual tasks as we normally do, but instead need help with doing basic tasks just to hold our grounds.

replies.text: What troubles in Loneford are you referring to?
Anything I can do to help?

conversationlist.message: Hello again. Welcome to the Crossroads guardhouse. How may I help you?

replies.text: Can you tell me again what you told me before about recent events?

conversationlist.message: Well, we usually do not employ just any civilian. Our tasks are important for Feygard - and by extension, important for the people. Our tasks are usually not suited for commoners like you.
But I guess the recent situation really leaves us no choice. We need to keep the guards in Loneford, and we also need to deliver this shipment. At the moment, we cannot do both.
Tell you what, you might be able to help us after all if you are willing to work.

replies.text: Anything for the glory of Feygard.
If the pay is sufficient, I guess I can help.
I had better not get involved in your Feygard business.

conversationlist.message: I'm glad to hear that.
Pay? Oh, I guess we could pay you.
I need you to take a shipment of equipment to another one of our outposts further south on the Duleian road.
Those outposts further down south are in greater need of equipment than us, them being closer to that wretched Nor City and all.
Take this shipment of 10 iron swords to the guard captain stationed in a tavern called 'The Foaming Flask', near a village called Vilegard.

replies.text: No problem. Anything for the glory of Feygard.
You did not mention any amount that I would be paid.
Why should I help you people? I have only heard bad things about Feygard.
I had better not get involved in your Feygard business.

conversationlist.message: Hello again. Welcome to the Crossroads guardhouse. How may I help you?

replies.text: What was that you told me before about a shipment?

conversationlist.message: I'm sorry to hear that. Good day to you.
Bad things? Who have you been talking to then? I would urge you to make up your own opinion of Feygard by travelling there yourself.
Personally, I cannot think of a greater place to be than in Feygard. Order is kept and people are friendly.
As to why you would help us, I can only say that Feygard would be grateful for your services if you help us.

replies.text: Fine, whatever. I will carry your stupid swords. I still hope there will be some reward for this.
Sounds good to me. Anything for the glory of Feygard.
I had better not get involved in your Feygard business.

conversationlist.message: Excellent.
I cannot promise you any amount on a reward.
OK then.
Here is the shipment that I want you to transport.
As I said, you should deliver those 10 iron swords to the guard captain stationed in a tavern called 'The Foaming Flask', near a village called Vilegard.
Return to me once you are done.
I feel that I should warn you about something also. See that fellow over there in the corner? Ailshara. She seems very interested in our dealings for some reason.
I would urge you to stay away from her at all costs. Whatever you do, do not speak to her about your mission with the shipment.
You return. Good news about the shipment I hope?

replies.text: You guards seem to have a lot of equipment here, anything to trade?
I am still working on transporting that shipment.
What was I supposed to do again?
Yes. I have delivered them as you ordered.

conversationlist.message: I'm sorry, we only trade with allies of Feygard. Help me with the task I gave you and we might be able to work something out.
Splendid! Feygard is in debt to you.
Splendid! Feygard is in debt to you.
I hope you managed to stay away from the savages of Nor City as much as possible while being over there.
From what I hear, things are rough down south.
As for you, you have both my and the rest of the Feygard patrol's gratitude for helping us with this.
You return. Thank you for helping with the shipment earlier.
Is there anything I can do for you?

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: Absolutely, as thanks for the help you provided earlier to both Minarra and me, we could agree to trade with you.
Go up in the lookout tower over there and talk to Minarra about equipment. She has our supply.
I hear that Minarra up in the lookout tower over there wants help with something. Why don't you go up to her and ask her about it, and we might be able to work something out after that.
I am the new Feygard bridge guard. Har har. We do not let beggars through. Understand? Come back, but only if you have more gold with you.
I am the new Feygard bridge guard. Har har. Give me your gold.

replies.text: OK. Here, you can have 50 pieces of gold. Let me pass now.
Come and try to get it.
Hmm, I will think about your offer.

conversationlist.message:
[Gold taken]
Very good. But I need more.

replies.text: Of course. Here, you can have another 50 pieces of gold.
Hmm, I will think about your offer.

conversationlist.message: Sorry, the road to Feygard is closed until further notice.

replies.text: Oh? Is it the fog that is the problem?

conversationlist.message: Yes. Several men already got lost and never reappeared. There is no way through.
Welcome! Nice to see you again.
Good morning! Did you hear the music last night? I think it came from the castle.
What is a kid like you doing all alone on the road?

replies.text: I am looking for my brother Andor. Have you seen him by any chance?
I am tired and hungry. Do you have a place to rest, please?

conversationlist.message: No, sorry. We seldom see strangers in the area. But you could ask at Guynmart Castle. Just follow the road to the north, you can't miss it.

replies.text: Guynmart Castle? I have never heard of it. Please tell me more.

conversationlist.message: Our land belongs to Guynmart Castle, but old Guynmart is a friendly and righteous man. He never takes too much from us.
Young Lady Hannah of Guynmart Castle often comes to visit us. A lovely girl she is. But she has not been here for a week now. I wonder if everything is all right.
I have too much work to do now. But maybe you could check if everything is OK with her?

replies.text: Yes, of course. I will come back and tell you what I find out.
No, sorry. I have to press on again. Bye.
I will go tomorrow. But now I am tired and hungry. Do you have a place to rest, please?

conversationlist.message: Yes of course. Go inside, there is some food left, and some cushions in the corner behind the oven. I will join you later.
Hi! Any news from Guynmart castle?

replies.text: Oh yes, it is a long story. Maybe I could stay overnight and tell you all about it in detail?
Yes, but I want to learn more about what is going on before I am willing to discuss it.

conversationlist.message: With pleasure. Just go inside and make yourself comfortable on the cushions in the corner behind the oven. We will talk when my work is done.
Grrrrrr
Hello stranger. Who are you and where are you going?

replies.text: I am $playername, and come from the castle.

conversationlist.message: From the castle? You did not come here the usual way.

replies.text: You are right. I had a misunderstanding with Unkorh the steward and he threw me off the north wall. Now I am looking for a way back.

conversationlist.message: You were kicked out? And still want to go back? You must explain that.

replies.text: I spoke to Lady Hannah there. She bade me to find her betrothed, who has been missing for a week now.

conversationlist.message:
Lovis is missing? That is bad news.
But where are my manners? I am questioning you and haven't even introduced myself. I am Norgothla, head of Guynmart's personal guard, and these are my men.
You say Lovis is missing? I would like to look around the castle, but we are ordered to stay here.
I take orders only from Lord Guynmart himself. He told me and my men to go to this clearing and wait for him.

replies.text: That is strange. I heard at the castle that Lord Guynmart was uproad for a week now.

conversationlist.message: Yes, Lord Guynmart was already on the way. Unkorh forwarded his order to me.

replies.text: I also heard other things that I dare not tell.

conversationlist.message: You must tell me all that you know or think you know. I promise that you have nothing to fear.

replies.text: I heard Unkorh saying that Guynmart is imprisoned in the dungeons. And Unkorh also wants to marry Lady Hannah.

conversationlist.message: Indeed? These are serious accusations. I hope you can prove them.

replies.text: How can I? You may go to the castle and check for yourself.

conversationlist.message:
Now I am really curious what is going on in the castle. But unfortunately Guynmart's order was very clear. Myself and all my men should wait for him in this clearing.
I can't leave just based on the words of a kid.

replies.text: And let Unkorh's dark plans be fulfilled? Leave Guynmart to probably die?
Maybe I could go back and bring some evidence?

conversationlist.message: Maybe you could go back to the castle and bring some evidence?

replies.text: With pleasure, if this means you will believe me.

conversationlist.message: By doing this, you take a great burden from my heart. I get to know what is happening at the castle, but don't have to disobey my lords order. Please hurry, the path is not difficult to find.

replies.text: OK, I will be as quick as I can.

conversationlist.message: Halt! Talk to Norgothla before you walk around here!
Go away, kid.
Go away, kid. I am depressed.
They have all gone, and forgotten me here. *Sigh*
Hey! You are the first one that has found the way to my clearing!
I like this place very much. Each time I return here, I get a surprise.
Cool place here, isn't it?
I like the clearing best this way.
A little too hot for my taste.
I don't even know what this is supposed to be!
This is strange!
Back to normal.
Hello $playername. Do you wish to climb up to me?

replies.text: Yes. Could you drop the rope down?

conversationlist.message: Of course. There. But I am in a hurry and must leave now.
Grumble ... grumble...

replies.text: He seems to speak mostly to his dogs.

conversationlist.message: Grrumble ... grrrrumble...

replies.text: Maybe he does not like his sheep being killed?

conversationlist.message: GRRRUMMBLE!!!

replies.text: Obviously he does not like his sheep being killed.

conversationlist.message: Baah!
Neigh.
The left beetle will win.
No, the right beetle will win.
Nonsense, the left beetle will win.
The right beetle will win.
Hey, come and join our beetle battle.
*Sob*

replies.text: Don't cry, little one. What's your name?

conversationlist.message: *Sob* ... Stuephant ... *sob*

replies.text: There there now. What's the matter?

conversationlist.message: I have lost my five best marbles!

replies.text: Oh dear, That is all? I will find them for you.
Look, here I have a nice teddy bear for you.
The quicker I leave, the sooner I have silence and peace again.

conversationlist.message: Great - thank you!

replies.text: Much better. Now tell me about your marbles.

conversationlist.message: I have lost them here in the yard or in the field over there.
Five beautiful marbles. Maybe you should look more than once in each place. They are so small you could easily miss them.

replies.text: Don't be so sad, I will find them soon.

conversationlist.message: *Sob* ... so you didn't find my marbles ... *sob*

replies.text: I haven't given up yet. Please be patient.

conversationlist.message: Thank you again for finding my marbles.

My lost marbles! All five! Great, thank you!
[Stuephant takes the marbles]
I found a green marble!
I found a red marble!
I found a pink marble!
Wow - a golden marble!
I found a pearl white marble!
That was the last one. I have found them all. Stuephant will be happy.

replies.text: I will go back to him now.

conversationlist.message: Oh, a visitor. Come closer. Do not be afraid of me.

replies.text: I am not afraid. What happened to you?

conversationlist.message: Oh, it is you again. I am delighted!

replies.text: De-lighted indeed. Might you need anything?

conversationlist.message: It happend in the mines of Mount Galmore. Don't ask any more, I do not wish to recall the memories. It was horrible.
When I returned here at last, people started to avoid me, whispering behind my back. I got very lonely.
Eventually I had enough of all the anxious, disturbed looks, so I came up here on this lonely hill.
From time to time a friendly soul brings me some food, but no one stays for long. I have noticed that their pace uphill is usually much slower than back downhill.
Do you bring bread and wine, together with my favorite cheddar?

replies.text: Yes, finally I got it. I hope the cheddar is still fresh after the long journey.

conversationlist.message: Do you bring bread, cheese and wine?

replies.text: Yes, here you are. Enjoy it!

conversationlist.message: No, thank you.
Just recently my supply of bread has run low again. And I haven't seen eggs for such a long time...

replies.text: I can help with that. I can spare 2 loaves of bread.
I could spare bread, some cheese and a bottle of red wine.
Unfortunately I have nothing I could give you.
Sad for you. I have to go now. Bye.

conversationlist.message: Thank you! Thank you very much!
Would it be really outrageous if I asked you to fulfill my heart's desire?

replies.text: Sorry, I really must go now.
Just say what you would like. What can I do for you?

conversationlist.message: I long for a meal with bread and cheese and a good bottle of wine. Oh, what would I give for that?

replies.text: Here I have bread, some cheese and a bottle of red wine.
Really? That is all? I will come back soon.
Be content with what you got, you greedy old man.

conversationlist.message: Oh yes - you get the best cheese in Charwood, if you don't mind!

replies.text: Charwood? That's not exactly next door...
I have heard of Charwood, but I don't know where it is.
I have heard of Charwood, but I don't know where it is.
Charwood? I have never heard of it.

conversationlist.message: What a feast! I have no words to thank you!
So take this ring as a token of my gratitude. Certain beings in the cellars of Guynmart Castle will not harm you if they see my ring on your finger.

replies.text: The ring looks interesting. Thank you.

conversationlist.message: Eh...
now...

replies.text: Oh dear! Just say what is on your mind. What's up?

conversationlist.message: The cheese that you brought - It was OK. But it is not the best cheese, you know? The best cheese is from Charwood.
Their Cheddar is a dream! But they sell it only when you explicitly ask for it.

replies.text: No problem. I will go and get some.
I am not going to go all the way to Charwood for some cheddar.

conversationlist.message: Great! I will wait for your return.
Cheddar! I can't believe it!
[Eating]
It was nice to talk to you. Come again, as often as you like!
$playername monument - not bad.
What, who are you? Don't bother me, child. We don't want kids running around in here.

replies.text: Are you Jhaeld? I was sent here to help you investigate the missing people.
Hey, watch that tone of yours. It would be a pity if more of your people would ... disappear.

conversationlist.message: Hrmpf. I don't take threats lightly. Especially not from snot-nosed kids like you.

replies.text: I was sent here to help you investigate the missing people.
You better get used to it with an attitude like that.

conversationlist.message: I think you had better leave, before anything bad might happen to you.
Yes, yes. The missing people. What could possibly a kid like you help with, hm?

replies.text: I was thinking you could provide me with some tasks to help you with the investigation.
The bridge guard told me to talk to you.

conversationlist.message: Hmm, now that you are here you might as well make yourself useful instead of just standing there looking stupid. Even if you are a kid, you might be able to gather some information for me.

replies.text: Sure, what do you need help with?
Hey, watch that tone of yours!

conversationlist.message: No, you watch that attitude of yours! Remember where you are and who you are talking to. I am Jhaeld, and you are in Remgard - which could be called *my* city.

replies.text: Fine. What do you need help with?
You don't scare me, old man!

conversationlist.message: Ha ha. You? Killing something?! Now that's about the funniest thing I have heard all day. Just about.

replies.text: Hey, watch that tone of yours!
I can handle myself. What do you need help with?

conversationlist.message: *sigh* To even think that we need to get help from children to run errands now.

I guess you know the background to this situation already. We have had some people disappear on us for some time now. We have no idea what has happened to the people that have disappeared, or even if they are still alive.
Considering how many there are that have disappeared without anyone knowing what happened, it doesn't seem like they are out travelling.

OK, so what I would like you to do for me is ask some people what they know of the missing people. The fact that you are not from around here might help you get information that neither me nor my guards would be able to acquire.

replies.text: Sure, I'll do it. Who do you want me to ask?
I'm not too sure about this. Will there be a reward?
I'm not too sure about this. Why would I want to help you people?

conversationlist.message: What, you have the arrogance to ask for a reward for helping us find the people that are missing? If it's gold you seek, I suggest you look somewhere else.

replies.text: Fine, I'll do it. Who do you want me to ask?

conversationlist.message: I knew you were just trouble. Sigh. Please leave me.

replies.text: Fine, I'll do it. Who do you want me to ask?

conversationlist.message: Why!? It would be the right thing to do, of course. If you can't understand that, you had better go somewhere else.

replies.text: Fine, I'll do it. Who do you want me to ask?
I won't do it. I fail to see why I should help you.

conversationlist.message: There are four people here in Remgard that I believe have more to tell than what we have managed to get out of them. I want you to go ask them what they know of the disappearances.
First, there's Norath and his wife Bethir that lives in the farmhouse on the southwestern shore. Bethir is nowhere to be found, and Norath might know more about where she is.

Secondly, as you might have heard, we have been blessed by a visit from a delegation of the Knights of Elythom here in Remgard. Unfortunately, one of the knights has vanished, which is most embarrassing for us. They can be found here in the tavern.
Third, the old woman Duaina usually has great wisdom to share, considering the experience she has with ... things out of the ordinary. You'll find her in her house to the south.

Lastly, you should go talk to Rothses, the armorer in town. He meets most people now and then, and might have picked up something that he won't dare tell us guards. His house is on the western side of town.
Please be as swift as possible.

replies.text: What about that Algangror woman that lives outside town?

conversationlist.message: As I said, please be as quick as possible.
What was that? Are you still here? I told you to be as quick as possible.

replies.text: What about her? The bridge guard sent me to investigate that house, and seemed very upset when I mentioned that she's there.
I'll go ask those people you mentioned.

conversationlist.message: Did you not hear me? I told you to be as quick as possible! That means you should go talk to those people instead of standing around here blabbing.

replies.text: I'll go ask those people you mentioned.

conversationlist.message: Are you still talking? I knew you were nothing but trouble the moment I saw you. Now, can you please hurry up and go talk to those people?
What now? Look, we don't want kids like you running around here, messing with our things.
Did you talk to those people that I sent you to ask about the missing people?

replies.text: Yes, I have talked to all of them.
Can you repeat the names of those that you wanted me to ask?
I'm not too sure about this. Will there be a reward?
I'm not too sure about this. Why would I want to help you people?

conversationlist.message: Well, what did you find out?

replies.text: Nothing. None of them told me anything new about the missing people.

conversationlist.message: So ... let me get things straight. You went and asked them about the missing people, and they didn't tell you anything new?

replies.text: No. None of them had anything new to say.
You heard me the first time.
Maybe you should have sent me to ask other people than these losers you sent me to.

conversationlist.message: Oh, I knew you were nothing but trouble the moment I saw you.
I sent you to do a simple task, and you return with ... nothing!
[Jhaeld mumbles] Stupid kids...
Fine then.
I suggest you go look in other places if you really want to help us.
Maybe someone else knows something that we haven't taken into account yet. Also, I seem to recall you saying something about Algangror before, is that right?

replies.text: Yes. As I tried to tell you, Algangror is hiding in that abandoned house outside town.

conversationlist.message: Maybe someone else knows something that we haven't taken into account yet.

replies.text: The bridge guard sent me to scout an abandoned house outside town.
Does the name 'Algangror' mean anything to you?

conversationlist.message: Maybe someone else knows something that we haven't taken into account yet.

replies.text: The bridge guard sent me to scout an abandoned house outside town.
I might know something, but I have promised not to tell anyone.

conversationlist.message: A secret, eh? You would do well to tell me what you know. Lives may be at stake here.

replies.text: The bridge guard sent me to scout an abandoned house outside town.
No, I will keep my word and not tell.
Never mind, I'll go ask around if anyone else knows anything.

conversationlist.message: Ah, someone with honor. I respect that, and will not ask any more.
I have nothing more to say to you.
Hmm, yes, and what of it?

replies.text: I met a woman named Algangror in that house.

conversationlist.message: Algangror?! Now that's a name I have not heard in a long time.

replies.text: Algangror is hiding in that abandoned house outside town.

conversationlist.message: If Algangror is here, this is grim news indeed.

To be honest, I had heard about this before, but I dismissed all talk of it since I did not believe it. Now you tell me this also, and I am starting to think that it may be true. She may have returned.
She used to live here in Remgard, during the days of prosperity. She even helped with the crops on some days.

Then something happened. She started getting ideas, and occasionally locked herself in her house for several days. No one really knew what she was doing in there, but we all knew that she was up to no good.
I can still recall the stench that came from her house. Ugh. What could possibly smell that bad?
Anyway, we started questioning her, and tried to persuade her to tell what she was up to. Stubborn and crazy as she is, she refused of course.
Things started getting worse, and the stench spread like a deep fog over the whole town. All of us living here in Remgard knew we had to act before she did something that could hurt us all.
So we forced her to explain herself.
Would you believe it, she told us that what she believed in, and what she was doing was no concern of ours. She even had the stomach to tell us that she wanted to be left alone.
Of course, we did what any sane man would do. We forced her to abandon her house and find somewhere else to live. Somewhere other than Remgard.
You should have seen her. Nails long as your finger, and her face full of unwashed hair. Clearly, she was crazy and could not be reasoned with.
When we marched her out of town, the children started crying out of fear of her.
The worst thing though, is that she said she would put a curse on all of us.
All of this was several seasons ago, and things have gone back to the usual business nowadays.

replies.text: What now then, since she has returned?

conversationlist.message: Yes. Her being back would explain the missing people. She must have done something to them. I fear for the worst.
Considering the people that have disappeared, I frankly don't know what to do. As you know, even one of the Knights of Elythom has disappeared.
Someone that can do that is dangerous indeed. I am not sure I would even risk sending the guards out there for her, in fear of what she might do.
If I were to choose, I would rather not deal with it, and just seal the town bridge as safely as possible, to prevent any more people from disappearing.
I ... I don't know what to do.
I ... I don't know what to do.

replies.text: I could help you if you want.
You pathetic fool. You would rather sit here and do nothing instead of confronting her?

conversationlist.message: I will not see more of my people get hurt, or whatever it is she has done to them. I will keep my people safe.

replies.text: I could help you if you want.

conversationlist.message: Insults won't get you anywhere. The people that have disappeared are still missing, and may be hurt, while you run around handing out insults. I pity you.

replies.text: I could help you if you want.
You pathetic fool. You would rather sit here and do nothing instead of confronting her?

conversationlist.message: If you really want to help us, then please be careful. She can not be trusted.
However, if you were to find a way to make her disappear, we would of course be forever in your debt.

replies.text: I'll see what I can do.
I have dealt with stronger foes.

conversationlist.message: Remember, please be careful! I would not want to be responsible for another person disappearing.
I doubt it.
Hello again. What news do you bring?

replies.text: Can you tell me the story of Algangror again?
I am still trying to find a way to make Algangror disappear.

conversationlist.message: I find this very hard to believe. For you to have killed Algangror would have been a difficult task, given her power.

replies.text: I have brought you her ring as proof that what I say is true.
No, never mind. I haven't actually defeated her yet.

conversationlist.message: I can hardly believe it! Yes, this is indeed her ring.
You actually defeated her? I am so relieved! Tell me, how crazy was she? No, don't tell me, I don't want to hear more of her filth.
This means that the people of Remgard are now safe from her, and it is all thanks to you! Who would have thought.
I ... I don't know what to say. Thank you, that's the least I can say.

replies.text: That was a tough fight. Now, let's talk reward.

conversationlist.message: I would think that the whole town is in your debt, but they may not know it.
Go talk to Rothses over at the west side of town. He should be able to help you improve some of your equipment.
Again, thank you for all your help.
Please leave me be, child. I just had a sudden attack of nausea. I should probably lie down.
You see a bed.
You see a bed. The idol is still where you left it.
You see a bed, that you suppose must be Jhaeld's bed.

replies.text: Hide one of the idols under the bed.

conversationlist.message: You hide the idol under the bed.
You see a bed and nightstand.
You see a bed and nightstand. The idol is still where you left it.
You see a bed and nightstand. This must be Larni's bed.

replies.text: Hide one of the idols under the bed.

conversationlist.message: You hide the idol under the bed.
You see a bed and nightstand.
You see a bed and nightstand. The idol is still where you left it.
You see a bed and nightstand. This must be Arnal's bed.

replies.text: Hide one of the idols under the bed.

conversationlist.message: You hide the idol under the bed.
You see a bed and nightstand.
You see a bed and nightstand. The idol is still where you left it.
You see a bed and nightstand. This must be Emerei's bed.

replies.text: Hide one of the idols under the bed.

conversationlist.message: You hide the idol under the bed.
You see a bed and nightstand.
You see a bed and nightstand. The idol is still where you left it.
You see a bed and nightstand. This must be Carthe's bed.

replies.text: Hide one of the idols under the bed.

conversationlist.message: You hide the idol under the bed.
Would you help an old man please?

replies.text: Sure, what do you need help with?
I might. Are we talking about some kind of reward?
No, I won't help an old timer like you. Bye.

conversationlist.message: I recently lost a very valuable book of mine.
I know I had it with me yesterday. Now I can't seem to find it.
I never lose things! Someone must have stolen it, that's my guess.
Would you please go look for my book? It's called 'Calomyran Secrets'.

I have no idea where it might be. You could go ask Arcir, he seems very fond of his books.
 [Points at the house to the south]

replies.text: OK, I'll go ask Arcir. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: How is the search for my book going? It's called 'Calomyran Secrets'. Have you found my book?

replies.text: No, I have not found it yet.
Could you tell me your story again please?

conversationlist.message: My book! Thank you, thank you! Where was it? No, don't tell me. Here, take these coins for your trouble.
Thank you so much for finding my book!
Oh, this is most unexpected but very welcome. I will not question how you acquired these items, but instead express my gratitude for bringing them to me.
Thank you for bringing me these items, they will be most useful to us here in the southern lands, and Vilegard in particular. We rarely get our hands on Feygard items, so these are really welcome.

replies.text: I was sent to deliver these items to a Feygard patrol stationed in the Foaming Flask tavern.

conversationlist.message: Instead, you brought them to me. You have my thanks.
Hah, this means that we have another opportunity here. What if you were to deliver some other items to the Feygard patrol instead? Hah, this will really make my day.
I might have something that will do just fine... Let me just find them.
Here they are. Ha ha, these will do just fine for those deceiving Feygard snobs.
Take these items and deliver them to wherever you were supposed to deliver the items you gave me.
Excellent, I have been waiting for these. Thank you for bringing them to me.
Belief. Power. Struggle.

replies.text: I was told to see you.

conversationlist.message: Backwards is the burden high and low.

replies.text: Hello? Umar in the Fallhaven Thieves' Guild sent me to see you.

conversationlist.message: Hiding in the Shadow.
Two alike in body and mind.

replies.text: Are you going to make any sense?

conversationlist.message: The lawful and the chaotic.

replies.text: Hello? Do you know how I can reach Lodar's hideaway?

conversationlist.message: Lodar? Clear, tingling, hurt.
Yes. The true form. Behold.
Hiding in the Shadow.

replies.text: Are you even listening to what I say?
Hello? Do you know how I can reach Lodar's hideaway?

conversationlist.message: Lodar, halfway between the Shadow and the light. Rocky formations.

replies.text: OK, halfway between two places. Some rocks?

conversationlist.message: Guardian. Glow of the Shadow.

replies.text: Glow of the Shadow? Are those the words the guardian needs to hear?
'Glow of the Shadow'? I recognize that from somewhere.

conversationlist.message: Turning. Twisting. Clear form.
There you are! I had hoped to see you again after you helped me up in the Charwood heights!
Thank you so much for helping to get me free! The stench of those monsters up there was awful.
I don't have much to give you in return, apart from my knowledge of how to use different kinds of armors. It's not much, but it's the least I can do.
I can teach you how to better handle most types of armors, so that you can get even more proficient while wearing them.

replies.text: What armor types can you teach me?

conversationlist.message: I can teach you about using shields and parrying weapons to your advantage, or how to best use light or heavy armors. I can also teach you how to better handle blows when not wearing any armor at all - fighting unarmored, that is.
We only have time for one type of armor right now though, so think carefully on which one will suit you best.

replies.text: Tell me more about shields and parrying weapons.
Tell me more about light armor.
Tell me more about heavy armor.
Tell me more about fighting without armor.

conversationlist.message: Shields can be used in combination with your regular weapon, to block attacks from your opponent. Parrying weapons are mainly defensive, and can be use to block or divert your opponents strike. They will not block as well as a good shield, but if you know how to use them they can be very effective, and you may be able to do some damage with them.
I can teach you to better withstand attacks using a shield, or to divert blows using a parrying weapon, so that you don't take as much damage while using them.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me about shields and parrying weapons.
Let's go back to the other types of armors.

conversationlist.message: [Fayvara teaches you the shield skill]

Light armor comes in many varieties. From the simple leather armor to the light-weight steel ones. Compared to the heavy armors, you can generally be more flexible when using them, sometimes even increasing your movement speed.
I can teach you how to better block blows while wearing light armor, so that you don't get hit as often.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me about light armors.
Let's go back to the other types of armors.

conversationlist.message: [Fayvara teaches you the light armor skill]
Heavy armor, for when you really need protection. They generally provide the best protection around, making you withstand most attacks from your opponent without even getting a scratch.

The downside is of course that they weigh a lot, which can slow you down. I can teach you how you can use that to your advantage, so that you can withstand attacks better and not be as slowed down as you would otherwise.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me about heavy armors.
Let's go back to the other types of armors.

conversationlist.message: [Fayvara teaches you the heavy armor skill]
Ah yes, the pure of mind do not need physical protection. As you know, wearing armor may slow you down - and by learning how to fight without wearing any, you can become even faster.
I can teach you the way of fighting without armor and how you can use that to your advantage so you don't get hit as often.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me about unarmored combat.
Let's go back to the other types of armors.

conversationlist.message: [Fayvara teaches you the unarmored combat skill]
Well done. I hope that will be useful for you.
I can of course teach you the other types of armors as well, if you want. Seeing as how I already taught you once for free, I will require payment for teaching you further.
Hello again, my friend. I hope that the things I have taught you have proven to be useful.
We very rarely teach anyone outside our settlement, Falothen and I. I heard that Falothen taught someone a while ago and I heard that he was given five Oegyth crystals and 5000 gold in return.

So I'm thinking something similar would suffice. Since as you're my friend, I won't charge as much as Falothen did but our settlement really needs the coin. Two of those crystals and 6000 gold should be well enough.

replies.text: I don't have that on me right now. I'll be back.
I think I should hold on to those crystals some more.

conversationlist.message: Yes, those things sure are valuable.
It seems you do not have enough gold. 6000 gold it is.
Which type of armor are you interested in?

replies.text: Tell me more about light armor.
Tell me more about heavy armor.
Tell me more about fighting without armor.

conversationlist.message: I've already taught you that skill.

replies.text: Let's go back to the other types of armors.

conversationlist.message: Shields can be used in combination with your regular weapon, to block attacks from your opponent.
I can teach you to better withstand attacks using a shield, so that you don't take as much damage while using them.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me about shields. Here are two Oegyth crystals and 6000 gold as payment.
Let's go back to the other types of armors.

conversationlist.message: [Fayvara teaches you the shield skill]

Light armor comes in many varieties. From the simple leather armor to the light-weight steel ones. Compared to the heavy armors, you can generally be more flexible when using them, sometimes even increasing your movement speed.
I can teach you how to better block blows while wearing light armor, so that you don't get hit as often.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me about light armors. Here are two Oegyth crystals and 6000 gold as payment.
Let's go back to the other types of armors.

conversationlist.message: [Fayvara teaches you the light armor skill]
Heavy armor, for when you really need protection. They generally provide the best protection around, making you withstand most attacks from your opponent without even getting a scratch.

The downside is of course that they weigh a lot, which can slow you down. I can teach you how you can use that to your advantage, so that you can withstand attacks better and not be as slowed down as you would otherwise.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me about heavy armors. Here are two Oegyth crystals and 6000 gold as payment.
Let's go back to the other types of armors.

conversationlist.message: [Fayvara teaches you the heavy armor skill]
Ah yes, the pure of mind do not need physical protection. As you know, wearing armor may slow you down - and by learning how to fight without wearing any, you can become even faster.
I can teach you the way of fighting without armor and how you can use that to your advantage so you don't get hit as often.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me about unarmored combat. Here are two Oegyth crystals and 6000 gold as payment.
Let's go back to the other types of armors.

conversationlist.message: [Fayvara teaches you the unarmored combat skill]
Well done! You learn quickly.
Hello there. Can I help you?

replies.text: You seem to have a lot of equipment around here. Do you have anything to trade?
What do you do up here?
You must have a good view of the surroundings up here. Have you seen anything interesting lately?

conversationlist.message: I might, but you would have to clear it with Gandoren downstairs. We don't trade with just anyone.
You return. Was there something else you wanted?

replies.text: Can you tell me again about those men you saw?
Do you have anything to trade?
What do you do up here?

conversationlist.message: Mostly, I see the travellers on the Duleian road from and to Feygard here.
Recently however, there have been a lot of movements to and from Loneford. I guess it is because of the problems they have been having up there.
I did see something very interesting yesterday though.

replies.text: You mentioned the Duleian road, what's that?
You mentioned some problems in Loneford, what problems were you referring to?
Never mind that, I wanted to ask you what your duty is up here?

conversationlist.message: Some farm animals today as well.

replies.text: You mentioned the Duleian road, what's that?
You mentioned some problems in Loneford, what problems were you referring to?

conversationlist.message: I handle the equipment storage for us guards here in the Crossroads guardhouse, and I keep a lookout of the surrounding areas.

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?
Have you seen anything interesting lately?

conversationlist.message: See this wide road that goes outside this guardhouse? That's the Duleian road. It goes all the way from the glorious city of Feygard up in the northwest down to the wretched Nor City in the southeast.

replies.text: You mentioned some problems in Loneford, what problems are that?
I wanted to ask you what your duty is up here?

conversationlist.message: See this wide road that goes outside this guardhouse? That's the Duleian road. It goes all the way from the glorious city of Feygard up in the northwest down to the wretched Nor City in the southeast.

replies.text: You mentioned some problems in Loneford, what problems are that?

conversationlist.message: I saw a band of rough looking men travelling up the Duleian road. Usually, a band of rough looking men is not something that's worth getting all excited about.
But these men matched the description of some people that are wanted by the Feygard patrol.
If I saw correctly, these men were the band of rogues led by a man called Rogorn, that we are looking to apprehend for several ruthless cases of murder and theft.
Their leader, Rogorn, is a particularly savage man according to the reports from Feygard that I have read.

Now, usually, we would go out searching for them, to verify that the men I saw were indeed these men. However, now with the trouble up in Loneford, we cannot afford to spare any guards other than to guarding Loneford.
I am sure that those were the men. If we were to catch and kill them, the people of Feygard would be much safer.

replies.text: I could go look for them if you want.

conversationlist.message: Thank you. Good luck yourself. Now, if you will excuse me, I need to keep my eyes on the road.
Hey, that's a great idea. Are you sure you are up to it though? The people of Feygard would indeed be grateful if you were to find them.
Anyway, I saw them travelling the road west of here. You know that road that leads to Carn Tower? That's the last I saw of them. You might want to follow that road and see if you can spot them.
They have stolen three pieces of a very valuable painting from Feygard, from the report that I have read. For their crimes and the savageness of their way, they are wanted dead by the Feygard patrol.

replies.text: I will be back once they are dead. Anything else?

conversationlist.message: Yes, I should also tell you that they most likely will try to persuade you into believing their story.
In particular, their leader, Rogorn, is a well known villain by Feygard. Nothing he says should be trusted.
I urge you not to listen to their lies. Their crimes must be punished in order to uphold the law.

replies.text: I will return once the task is done.

conversationlist.message: You return. Did you find those men that we talked about?

replies.text: I am still looking for them.
Yes, I killed them and recovered the three pieces of the painting.
I travelled west and found a travelling group of men, but they did not match the men you described.

conversationlist.message: Good. Return to me as soon as you have anything to report. We would really like to recover those three pieces of the painting they stole.
That is excellent news indeed! I knew that we could trust you.
Your services to Feygard will be greatly appreciated.
Are you sure that they were not the ones? I have a keen eyesight, that's why I am up here. I was sure that they matched the description of the men.
I guess I will have to take your word for it.
Thank you for helping me investigate this matter.

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?
You must have a good view of the surroundings up here. Have you seen anything interesting lately?

conversationlist.message: Thank you for helping me investigate the men earlier.

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?
You must have a good view of the surroundings up here. Have you seen anything interesting lately?

conversationlist.message: Sure, take a look.
Thorin shouts at you: Hey, get away from there! That's my bed.
You see a pile of skeletal remains. This must be one of Thorin's former companions.

replies.text: Pick up one of the bones.

conversationlist.message: You see a pile of skeletal remains. This must be one of Thorin's former companions.

replies.text: Pick up one of the bones.

replies.text: Pick up one of the bones.

conversationlist.message: You pick up one of the bones. It seems to have been severely damaged by something corrosive.
You pick up one of the bones. It seems to have been severely damaged by something corrosive.
You pick up one of the bones. It seems to have been severely damaged by something corrosive.
