You see a pile of skeletal remains, from where you removed some pieces earlier.
You see a pile of skeletal remains.
Hello. I heard that you helped us find the key of Luthor. Good work, it will really come in handy.

replies.text: What can you tell me about the Thieves' Guild?

conversationlist.message: I'm Farrik, Umar's brother.

replies.text: What do you do around here?
What can you tell me about the Thieves' Guild?

conversationlist.message: I mostly manage our trading with other guilds and keep an eye on what the thieves need to be as effective as they can be.

replies.text: What can you tell me about the Thieves' Guild?

conversationlist.message: We try to keep to ourselves as much as possible, and help our fellow thieves as much as possible.
Well, there was one thing a few weeks ago. One of our guild members got arrested for trespassing.
The Fallhaven guard has started to get really annoyed with us lately. Probably because we have been very successful in our recent missions.
The guards have increased their security lately, leading to them arresting one of our members.
He is currently held in the jail here in Fallhaven, pending transfer to Feygard.
Oh, nothing serious. He was trying to get into the catacombs of Fallhaven church.
But now that you have helped us with that mission, I guess we don't need to go there anymore.
I guess I can trust you with this secret. We are planning a mission tonight to help him out of jail.

replies.text: After all, if he wasn't allowed down there, then the guards are right to arrest him.

conversationlist.message: Yeah, I guess so. But for the guild's sake, we would rather have our friend freed than imprisoned.

replies.text: Don't worry, your secret plan to free him is safe with me.
[Lie] Don't worry, your secret plan to free him is safe with me.
Maybe I should tell the guards that you are planning to get him out?

conversationlist.message: Oh yes, they are. The people also dislike them in general, it's not just us in the Thieves' Guild.

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to help you with those annoying guards?

conversationlist.message: Thank you. Now please leave me.
Whatever, they wouldn't believe you anyway.
Are you sure you want to annoy the guards? If they catch word of you being involved, you could get into a lot of trouble.

replies.text: No problem, I can handle myself!
There might be a reward for this later on. I'm in.
On second thought, maybe I should keep out of this.

conversationlist.message: Sure, it's up to you.

replies.text: Maybe I should tell the guards that you are planning to get him out?

conversationlist.message: Good.
OK, here is the plan. The guard captain has a bit of a drinking problem.
If we were able to supply him with some mead that we have prepared, we might just be able to sneak our friend out during the night, when the captain is sleeping off the drunkenness.
Our cook can prepare a special brew of mead for you that will knock him out.
He would probably need to be persuaded to drink on duty too. If that should fail, he could probably be bribed instead.
How does that sound to you? Do you think you are up to it?

replies.text: No, this is really starting to sound like a bad idea.
Sounds a bit dangerous, but I guess I'll try.

conversationlist.message: Good. Report back to me when you have gotten the guard captain to drink that special mead.
Hello again my friend. How goes your mission to get the guard captain drunk?

replies.text: I am not done yet, but I am working on it.
It is done. He should be no problem during the night.

conversationlist.message: That is good news! Now we should be able to get our friend out from jail tonight.
Thank you for your help my friend. Take these coins as a token of our appreciation.
Thank you for your help with the guard captain earlier.
That's very useful information. Well done. You have my thanks, friend.
So did you tell the Warden about our plan then?

replies.text: No, I haven't talked to him.
[Lie]. No. I went there, but I overheard the Warden saying there was no real threat, so they will lower security. So maybe you can carry out your mission without me being involved.

conversationlist.message: Hello. I'm Unzel.

replies.text: I am sent by Vacor to kill you.

conversationlist.message: Yes, this is my camp. Lovely place, isn't it?
Vacor sent you huh? I guess I should have figured he would send someone sooner or later.
Very well then. Kill me if you must, or allow me to tell you my side of the story.

replies.text: Hah, I will enjoy killing you!
I will listen to your story.

conversationlist.message: Very well, let's fight then.
Thank you for listening.
Vacor and I used to travel together, but he started to get obsessed with his spell making.
He even started to question the Shadow. I knew I had to do something to stop him!
I started questioning him about what he was up to, but he just wanted to keep on going.
After a while, he became obsessed with the thought of a rift spell. He said it would grant him unlimited powers against the Shadow.
So, there was only one thing I could do. I left him and needed to stop him from trying to create the rift spell.
I sent some friends to take the spell from him.
So, here we are.

replies.text: I killed the four bandits you sent after Vacor.

conversationlist.message: So, here we are.
What? You killed my four friends? Argh, I feel the rage coming.
However, I also realize that all this is the making of Vacor. I'll give you a choice now. Choose wisely.
Either you side with Vacor and his rift spell, or side with the Shadow, and help me get rid of him. Who will you help?

replies.text: I will side with you. The Shadow must not be disturbed.

conversationlist.message: Thank you my friend. We will keep the Shadow safe from Vacor.
You should go talk to him about the Shadow.
Welcome back. Did you talk to Vacor?

replies.text: Yes, I have dealt with him.

conversationlist.message: You killed him? You have my thanks friend. Now we are safe from Vacor's rift spell. Here, take these coins for your help.
Thank you for your help. Now we are safe from Vacor's rift spell.

replies.text: I have a message for you from Kaverin in Remgard.

conversationlist.message: Thank you for all your help earlier.
Please, you have to help me!
I was setting up camp here during the night, and was attacked by some bandits while asleep.
Ack, this wound doesn't seem to be healing itself.
At least I managed to keep them from getting my book. I'm sure they were after the book.

replies.text: Seems like a valuable book then. This sounds interesting, please go on.

conversationlist.message:
I managed to throw the book in among the trees over there during the attack.
[Points to the trees directly to the north]
I don't think they managed to get the book. It's probably still somewhere among those trees.
Oh, I can't say really.

replies.text: I could help you find that book if you want.
What would it be worth for you to get that book back?

conversationlist.message: You would? Oh thank you.
Please go look for it among those trees to the northeast.
Worth? Well, I was hoping you would help me anyway, but I guess 200 gold could do.

replies.text: 200 gold it is then. I'll go look for your book.
A lousy 200 gold, is that all you can do? Fine, I'll go look for your stupid book.
Keep your gold, I'll return your book for you anyway.
No, I am not getting involved in this. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: Make it quick.
Have you found that book yet?

replies.text: Not yet, I am still looking.

conversationlist.message: You found it! Oh thank you so much. I was so worried that I had lost it.
You found it! Oh thank you so much. In return, here is the gold I promised you.
Thank you for helping me find my book earlier.
I am still hurt by this wound that I got from the attack during the night.
Ack, it hurts so bad and it doesn't seem to be healing itself.
I am really in need of some stronger healing here. Maybe some potions would do.
I have heard that the potion makers these days have potions of major health, and not just the regular potions of health.
One of those would surely do. Otherwise, I think four regular potions of health would be enough.

replies.text: I'll go get those potions for you.
Here, take this bonemeal potion instead. It's very potent in healing deep wounds.
Here, take this potion of major health.
Here, take this potion of major health.
Here, take these four regular potions of health.

conversationlist.message: Thank you my friend. Please hurry back.
Bonemeal potion? But ... but ... we are not allowed to use them since they are prohibited by Lord Geomyr.

replies.text: I have tried them myself, it's perfectly safe to use them.

conversationlist.message:
Hmm, yes. I guess you have a point. Oh well, here goes.
[Drinks potion]

Thank you for bringing me one.
[Drinks potion]

Thank you for bringing them to me.
[Drinks all four potions]
Wow, I feel slightly better already. I guess this healing really works.
Thank you my friend for your help. My book is safe and my wound is healing. I hope our paths will cross again.
Hello young fellow. Would you be so kind as to help a wandering traveller?

replies.text: No. I don't have the time.
Why not. What do you need?

conversationlist.message: I'd like to surprise a friend back home, when I return from my travels. I would need 5 insect wings. Could you bring them to me?

replies.text: Sounds boring ... but I'll do it.
I have these with me. Take them.

conversationlist.message: Thank you. I'll wait for you here.
Great! Here, take this gold as a reward. Now I need some rat tails. Will you find them for me?

replies.text: I have other things to do right now.

conversationlist.message: Have you found the 5 insect wings I need?

replies.text: No, not yet. I'll be back.

conversationlist.message: Thank you. Bring me 5 of them. I'll wait for you here.

replies.text: I hope this is worth it...
I already possess 5 rat tails. You can take them.

conversationlist.message: Well. Would you agree to bring me some rat tails now?

replies.text: I have other things to do right now.

conversationlist.message: Thanks. Take this small compensation.
Hmm ... they're not as good as I hoped. Can you get me 5 more?

replies.text: Not good enough for you? I'm tired of dealing with you.
As you wish. See you soon.
Well, I do have these 5 other rat tails here.

conversationlist.message: So. About those rat tails...
OK. I'll go look somewhere else. Goodbye.
I'll wait for you here, as usual.
Really?
Please ... I really need 5 rat tails.

replies.text: OK ... but it's the last time!
No. No no no ... leave me alone.

conversationlist.message: Here we meet again. I'm surprised to see you this far from Crossglen!
Well, I'm still looking for 5 good rat tails. Would you help me now?

replies.text: Alright, I hope there are rats around here, and that they have tails good enough for you.
OK, but you'd better like them this time.
I don't feel like doing this now. Sorry.

conversationlist.message: Great. I'll wait for you here.
Have you found more rat tails?
Perfect! I can't believe you found such good rat tails. Take this.
Next on my list is some animal hair. It has to be soft hair though. I think 4 handfuls should do. Would you find them for me?

replies.text: I guess I have no choice...
I already have them right here. Take them.

conversationlist.message: Thanks a lot. I'll wait for you here.
Hello again. Would you agree to get me 4 handfuls of animal hair now?

replies.text: I guess I have no choice...
I already have them right here. Take them.

conversationlist.message: Have you found the animal hair I asked for?
Good. Take this gold and let me see them.
Hmm ... this one is nice! However, the other three won't do.
Could you get me 3 more?

replies.text: No way! I'm tired of your errands.
More work means more money! I'll be back.
I have these with me. Take them.

conversationlist.message: Here you are again.
Thanks. I'll be right here when you return.
Really?
Thanks, but it's still not what I am looking for. Anyway, work must be rewarded. Take this gold.
Hello again. Have you found some soft animal hair?

replies.text: I think so. Here's what I found.

conversationlist.message: Are you sure? Won't you help me find the softest animal hair?
Too bad. Thanks for helping me this far anyway.
Hey! Long time no see. I'm happy to see a familiar face.
Travelling this far has exhausted me, and I'm running short of supplies. I'm glad I managed to reach this seemingly safe spot, but I don't think I can go further.
I could really use some healing. Do you happen to have a potion to spare?

replies.text: Here, take this minor potion of health.
Here, take this minor vial of health.
Here, take this regular potion of health.
Here, take this major potion of health.
Here, take this major flask of health.
Here, take this Lodar's bonemeal potion.
Here, take this Lodar's potion of health.

conversationlist.message: That's too bad. I will rest here until someone can heal me. If I can wait that long...
Thank you. I'm feeling a little better now. With some rest, I'll be able to continue my travels soon.
Thank you. I'm feeling way better already.
Wow. That was some serious healing potion.
I'm feeling ... strange ... I'm feeling ... great! That was incredible. I never had such a potion. Take this hat I found on my way here.
Back to business. I found awesome items on my way here, but I'm still looking for 3 handfuls of soft animal hair. Would you help me?

replies.text: I don't feel like doing it right now.
I happen to have some here. Take them.

conversationlist.message: Thank you. I'll wait here.
Have you found really soft animal hair?

replies.text: I think I do. Look at these.

conversationlist.message: Beautiful! They're even better than what I expected. I love the shade too. You really deserve a reward, plus a bonus for healing me. Take it. No need to thank me.
I'm getting closer to the end of my list. I now have to find some bones. They must be long ones though. Would you look for them as well? I need only two.

replies.text: Sure! It's not like I have more important things to do.
I guess I can remember to look for bones if I have some spare time.
I do have these here. Take them.

conversationlist.message: Did you change your mind? Care to help me find a pair of bones? Remember that they must be long ones though.

replies.text: Sure! It's not like I have more important things to do.
I guess I can remember to look for bones if I have some spare time.
Let me check ... I do have two bones here with me. Take them.

conversationlist.message: Thanks. I will be here when you return.
Did you find some bones? I'm only interested in long ones though.
Nope. That won't work. Could you find some longer ones?

replies.text: No. I don't think I can.

conversationlist.message: Thank you. You'll find me here when you return.
Really? You're giving up?

replies.text: Yeah ... bones are too heavy to carry.

conversationlist.message: OK. Never mind. I'll try to find long bones elsewhere.

replies.text: I have a feeling that we'll meet there, wherever that is.

conversationlist.message: The world is such a small place. We keep meeting in the most unusual places.
I found a bone that's long enough by myself since we last met. I just need another one. Could you try to find it for me?

replies.text: Only one long bone? I'm on it!

conversationlist.message: So, would you bring me a bone now? A long one though!

replies.text: Only one long bone? I'm on it!

conversationlist.message: Thank you. I'll wait for you here.
Have you found a long bone?
Awesome! Exactly what I was looking for.
Now, I just need one last thing. I heard about some nasty snakes, called the venomscale.
I'm really interested in their scales. Could you get me 10 of them?

replies.text: I hope this really is the last thing you need.

conversationlist.message: Thank you. I'll wait here until you return.
Have you found the venomscale scales?
I can't believe it! You really found them! Take this gold. It's all I have left.
I have finally gathered all the items I need! Kayla will be so thrilled.
Yes. She's a dear friend of mine. She lives in Stoutford.
She makes clothes and boots, and asked me to get her some of the finest items in the world for her work.
You should definitely pay her a visit when you are in Stoutford. I have to go now. Thank you for your help.

replies.text: Glad to help. See you later.

conversationlist.message: Hello again. Have you spoken to Guthbered in the Prim main hall yet?

replies.text: No, not yet. Where can I find him?
Yes, he told me the story about Prim.
No, and I do not intend to speak to him either. I am on an urgent mission to help the Blackwater mountain settlement.

conversationlist.message: You there! Please you have to help us!

replies.text: Is this the Blackwater mountain settlement?
Sorry, I cannot be bothered right now. I was told to go east quickly.

conversationlist.message: Blackwater? No no, certainly not. Just over there is the village of Prim.
Blackwater mountain, those vicious bastards.
East? But that leads up to Blackwater mountain.
You really do not want to go up there.
We desperately need help from someone from the outside in our village of Prim.
You should speak to Guthbered, in the Prim main hall, just north of here.

replies.text: OK, I will go see him.
I was told to go directly east.

conversationlist.message: Good, thanks. We really need your help!
The village of Prim is just north of here. You can probably see it through the trees over there.

replies.text: OK, I will go there right away.

conversationlist.message: Do not listen to their lies!
Stay away. This is my hiding spot.
Claws, beasts, gornauds. They cannot reach me here.

replies.text: 'Gornauds', is that what those monsters outside the village are called?
Yeah sure. Stay here and hide you pathetic creature.

conversationlist.message: Me? I am Moyra.
You are mean! I don't want to talk to you any more.
Please, not so loud! They could hear you.
I have seen them on the path up the mountain. Sharpening their claws.
I hide here now, so they cannot get to me.
Hello there. Welcome to Prim. Are you here to help us?

replies.text: Yes, I am here to help your village.
[Lie] Yes, I am here to help your village.

conversationlist.message: Thank you. We really need your help.
You should speak to Guthbered if you haven't done so already.
He is in the main hall right over there. The large stone house.
Hi, you seem to be new around here. How can I help you?

replies.text: Is there some place I can rest around here?
Where can I find a trader around here?

conversationlist.message: You should be able to find some place to rest in the inn right over there to the southeast.

replies.text: Where can I find a trader around here?

conversationlist.message: Our armorer is in the house in the southwest corner. I should warn you that the supply is not what it used to be though.

replies.text: Is there some place I can rest around here?

conversationlist.message: Hello. Welcome to Prim.
Hello. Who are you? Are you here to help us?

replies.text: I am looking for my brother. Would you by any chance have happened to see him around here?
Yes, I have come to help your village.
[Lie] Yes, I have come to help your village.

conversationlist.message: Your brother? Son, you should know that we do not get many visitors around here.
So, no. I cannot help you.
Oh thank you. We could really use some help around here.
You notice a slight draft blowing across your ankles as you stand admiring the quality of this woven coil of rope.
Despite your efforts to collect the rope, you find that it runs into what appears to be a crack in the stone wall before you. Unfortunately, this seems to be an adventure for another day.
You notice some torn papers on the floor. From the looks of it, these pages seem to have been torn from a larger journal.
Brakas, day 4. Why, oh why did I venture up here?
These things are too strong for me. The first few of them went down pretty easily, but these ... things ... up here are just too strong for me.
I am now almost out of potions as well.
As I am writing this journal, I can hear them growling outside the cabin. I need to rest some more before I can have a try at killing some of them again.
[The paper is full of dirt, but you still manage to read most of it]
Brakas, day 7. By the Shadow, I cannot even get down the mountain now! These things are in the way, and I am too weak to get past them now.
My potions are now all used up. How will I ever get out of here?!
Getting weaker. Must rest.
Brakas, day 9. Success! I managed to kill some of the monsters that were closest to the cabin, and some of them were carrying vials of minor healing that I could pick up!
I don't recall ever being so happy about seeing some of these potions!
With these, I might be able to get down the mountain again!
Ha ha, those bastards down in Prim didn't get rid of me that easily.
Maybe if I gather enough of these potions from the monsters around the cabin, I might have enough to safely make it down again.
Brakas, day 10. I have now managed to gather enough healing potions to feel confident that I will make it down alive.
I just hope that those disgusting snakes will stay away from me this time, with their nasty venom.
If luck is on my side, I might even be home safe by nightfall.
[The journal has no more pages]
I don't have time for you, kid. Get lost.

replies.text: I found a note with your name on it while looking for the book 'Calomyran Secrets'.

conversationlist.message: Now now, what have we here? Are you implying that I have been down in Arcir's basement?
So, maybe I was. The book is mine anyway.
Look, let's solve this peacefully. You walk away and forget about that book, and you might still live.

replies.text: No, you will give me that book.

conversationlist.message: Good boy. Now run away.
OK, now you're starting to annoy me, kid. Get lost while you still can.

replies.text: No, that book is not yours!

conversationlist.message: You are still here? OK then, if you want the book that bad, you will have to take it from me!

replies.text: At last, a fight. I have been waiting for this!
I had hoped it wouldn't come to this.

conversationlist.message: We keep the order around here. I wonder what the people of Loneford would do without us guards from Feygard. Poor things.
*cough* Please help us, soon there won't be many left of us!
I can't feel my face anymore, please help us!
Don't disturb me, I need to finish chopping this wood. Go bother someone else.
I fear for our survival. It seems we are getting worse every day that passes. It's a good thing Feygard helps us at least.
Don't I know you from somewhere? You look familiar somehow.
Wha? You!? No, get away from me!

replies.text: I heard that you saw something that you won't talk about.

conversationlist.message: [Landa gives you a terrified look]
You were there! I ssssaw you!

Or was it you? No, it looked like you, and I have a good memory!
[Bites lip]
Get away from me, whatever you did over there, it's your business and I don't want any trouble!

replies.text: You must have me confused with someone else.

conversationlist.message: Please don't hurt me!

replies.text: Landa, you must have me confused with someone else! What was it you saw?

conversationlist.message: No, you are smaller than him.

replies.text: Are you going to tell me what it was you saw?

conversationlist.message: The boy. He was doing something. I tried to sneak up closer to see what it was he was doing, I did. But he ran away before I could see.
He did something by the well here in Loneford.
It was in the middle of the night, on the day before everything started. The day after, I was sleeping it off during the day, so I didn't notice all the turmoil about when they brought Hesor back.
Almost the whole village wanted to see what had happened to Hesor. I kept to myself and didn't dare talk to anyone.
The same day, others started to get pale as well. I could see it in their faces.
The following night, I was getting ready to go to the well myself to look for any traces of what the boy had done.

I peeked out the window to see if there was anyone that might see me. Instead, I saw someone skulking around the well, filling up several vials with both dirt around the well, and water from the well itself.
I am sure it was Buceth, from the chapel. I have a good eye for people, and a good memory. Yes, I am sure it was Buceth.
Also, isn't it strange how Buceth has not gotten ill, while all the others in the village has gotten ill?
He must be up to something. He and that boy that looked like you. Are you sure it wasn't you?
Never mind. Please don't tell anyone that I told you all this.

Now, get out of here kid, before anyone sees you talking to me.
[Looks around anxiously]

replies.text: Thank you Landa. Your secret is safe with me.
Thank you Landa. I'll consider it.
Are you done? Phew, I thought you were never going to stop talking.

conversationlist.message: You again? I already told you. Get out of here before anyone sees you talking to me.
Welcome, traveller. You must be the one I heard about, that travelled up the mountain.
Would you be willing to help me with a task?

replies.text: Why would I want to help you?

conversationlist.message: Ah, a negotiator. I like that. If you help me, I will offer to trade the fruits of my labour with you. It should be most valuable to you.

replies.text: Fine. What task are we talking about here?
No, how can I agree to something when I don't know what it is? I'm out.

conversationlist.message: It is simple really. I am studying these wyrm creatures that lurk outside our settlement. I am trying to find what their strengths are, so that I can use it for myself.
But my expertise is in the studies of them, and not in actually going head to head with those things.
That's where you come in.
I need you to gather some samples from them for me. I hear that some of the white wyrm beasts have sharper claws that can be extracted at the time of death.
If you were to bring me some samples of those claws from the white wyrms, that would really speed up my research further.
Let's say, five of those claws should be enough.

replies.text: OK, sounds easy enough. I'll get you your 5 white wyrm claws.
Sure. Those things are no match for me.
No way I am going near those beasts again.

conversationlist.message: Good. Thank you. Please hurry back so I can continue my research on these beasts.
I assure you that my research is important. But it's your decision, and your loss.
Welcome back. How is the search going?

replies.text: What was I supposed to do again?
I haven't found everything yet. But I am working on it.
I have found what you asked for.

conversationlist.message: Very well done my friend! These will be very valuable in my research.
Come back in just a minute and I will have something ready for you.
Welcome back my friend! Good news. I have successfully distilled the fragments of the claws you brought earlier.
Now I am able to create effective potions that contain some essence of the white wyrms. These potions will be very useful in future dealings with these monsters.
Would you like to trade for some potions?

replies.text: Sure. Let's see what you have.

conversationlist.message: Hold up. What have we here? A lone traveller on the Duleian road.
Haven't you heard, travelling this road can be dangerous.
There have been reports of people being robbed of all their possessions whilst travelling down this road.
Tell you what, if you give me ... shall we say ... 500 gold, I can almost guarantee that you won't be robbed on this road.

replies.text: Hey, that sounds like robbery to me!
How about I just kill you instead?

conversationlist.message: Thank you. Have a pleasant day. Watch out for those robbers!
Oh, I see. You are trying to rob ME instead? Well then, I will not be so easily defeated. Prepare yourself.
Oh no no, are you accusing me of robbing you? That's not the case at all. I'm just asking for 500 gold so that you won't be robbed of all your possessions while travelling down this road.

replies.text: How about I just kill you instead?

conversationlist.message: Hey, did you try to open that treasure chest?

That chest is something of a local legend. Been there for generations. They say it is sealed with magic and can only be opened with a special key, which hangs on the neck of one of the undead that roam in a cemetery directly south of here.

replies.text: Killing the undead is my specialty.
Undead? I would love to hear the rest of your story but I am on a mission to find my brother.

conversationlist.message: You don't think someone has already tried? It's a treasure chest ... left outside ... in plain view ... unguarded.

Listen kid. A hundred 'adventurers' before you have tried and failed to open that chest. The problem isn't killing some undead. It's getting into the cemetery, because it's protected by a magical barrier that prevents anyone from entering.

replies.text: Interesting. Is there anything else you can tell me about the chest or cemetery?

conversationlist.message: That is all I know ... Come to think of it ... Hagale from the Wood Settlement was out here a few weeks ago asking about the chest. Something about him struck me as odd. It was as if he was in a trance.
Oh yeah? What's it to you kid? ... BURP ... If you want to know, it will cost you two bottles of Lowyna's special brew.

I heard rumors about an unguarded treasure chest. I heard that the key that opened it, hung around the neck of an undead roaming the cemetery south of the chest. I also heard that the entrance to the cemetery was sealed by magic.

I thought nothing more of it. I was a simple trader in Loneford with a beautiful wife and daughter.
[Hagale takes another long swig from the bottle of Lowyna's special brew]

[Hagale takes another swig from the bottle of Lowyna's special brew]
I realized that she wouldn't make it.
I watched as she suffered in agonizing pain. I knew without treatment she would die in a matter of weeks.

Still, I did not give up. I thought that if I opened the chest and gave its treasure as a gift to Lord Geomyr, I could plead with him to lift the bonemeal ban in time to save my daughter. It sounds stupid but I was desperate.
A few days later, I tracked the bandits down. I begged and pleaded but they would not volunteer any information. They were obviously after the chest themselves, and they attacked me.
[This man smells of alcohol and some plant-like substance; he is clearly intoxicated]

replies.text: I defeated the undead monster and opened the chest. I found a powerful sword inside.
I heard you were interested in that unattended treasure chest by the Waterway house.
Don't breathe on me! I'm leaving!

conversationlist.message: You actually opened the chest? That sword must be worth a lot of money ... could buy a lot of Lowyna's special brew ... Sorry kid, but I need that sword!

replies.text: I went through hell to get this sword. I won't give it to you without a fight.
I went through a lot to get this sword ... but you suffered more than me. I won't fight you. If you want it that badly, the sword is yours.
Yes, I have the sword, see here!
I did find the sword, but I don't have it anymore.

conversationlist.message: I should not have doubted you. Well done.
In plain sight, you find a large extravagantly adorned treasure chest. Glancing around, it appears the chest is unattended. You think to yourself...

replies.text: I have the key right here.
I should take a peek inside.

conversationlist.message: The chest is locked.
You think to yourself...
Multiple strikes from your weapon do not damage the chest. The chest is protected by some form of magic.

The text begins to radiate light. The ground begins to shake as darkness fills the sky. A loud cracking sound is followed by a rush of cold air that sends chills down your back. You watch as corpses begin to claw their way to the surface. The stench of rotting flesh fills your nostrils, making you gag.
As you approach the cemetery's entrance, your steps become heavier and heavier.
[You notice this undead is wearing a key around its neck]
Let's go.

replies.text: I'm sorry it has come to this.

conversationlist.message: Alright hand it over. Be quick about it.
You no brain.
You open the chest and discover a powerful sword infused with unholy magic.
Thanks for letting me have the sword kid. I decided that with the money I can get for this I can rebuild my life. I'm going to sober up and start trading again. I'll be leaving here soon.
Greetings, young traveler.

replies.text: I opened that chest and got a powerful sword.

conversationlist.message: The text described a cemetery sealed by magic to contain a powerful undead monster roaming within it. My source was correct, it was a reference to the cemetery south of that chest.

The ground began to tremble and darkness filled the sky. This was followed by a cracking sound, the loudest sound my ears ever heard, making a gust of cold air rush past me. Then, corpses began to claw their way to the surface. The odor ... it was putrid.
Suddenly, a horde of undead attacked me. I fought them off as best I could but there were just too many. I barely escaped with my life and I never went back.

[Hagale finishes the second bottle of Lowyna's special brew]
Sure do. I hope you know what you're doing kid.
That is probably why the chest was left outside in plain sight, unattended.
Good luck.

My daughter passed away shortly after I returned. I failed my wife and my daughter. I lost everything. I buried my family in Loneford, gave up my trade, and came here. Now, I drink Lowyna's special brew all day ... it helps me forget.

replies.text: I'm sorry for your losses. You have suffered a lot. I want to finish what you started. Do you still have that text?

conversationlist.message: Here lies Damurrela of Loneford, wife of Hagale and mother of Aradilles. Killed by Plaguestriders.
Here lies Aradilles of Loneford, daughter of Hagale and Damurrela. Died from blistering skin.
You must not be from around here. If you were, you would know that it is impolite to barge into homes without invitation.

replies.text: Sorry. I didn't mean to be rude. I'm $playername. I come from a small village where people tend to leave their doors open.

conversationlist.message: The surrounding forest is usually quiet, but for some time now it has been under a monster invasion. I am surprised you managed to reach my home.
I heard something similar was occurring in Charwood until a young adventurer killed a vile beast in the mine beneath the city.

replies.text:
I was in Charwood recently and what you heard was true.
[You describe your experiences in Charwood and the battle with Thukuzun]
That is interesting, but I am supposed to be looking for my brother. I should leave.

conversationlist.message: I do not know if it began happening here before the events in Charwood or after. However, from what you tell me, maybe there is a connection between the two.

There is a cave system that runs underneath the forest. If something sinister is afoot, it could be emanating from the ground below. Please, you must help me investigate the source of the monster invasion in this forest.

replies.text: Sorry, I cannot help you right now.
How much "investigating" will you be doing in this proposed partnership?

conversationlist.message: Thank you. You will have to pass through the forest to reach an opening to the cave where you can enter. The opening is roughly east of my home.
The Guardian stares at you. You feel an overwhelming sense of dread, and dare not even approach it.
You have found the entrance to the cave Cithurn was talking about.
You notice that the air has become much damper as you make your way towards the end of the cave system.
Ah, another puny mortal that has come to die and serve Tesrekan.
Hmm ... I'll work on the parts that aren't dangerous. A brave and expert fighter like yourself is better suited to the dangerous parts.

replies.text: Danger is my middle name! I'll help you.
Sorry. Flattery will not persuade me to risk my life for some piece of forest with one old man living in it.

conversationlist.message: Well I'm the only one here. Perhaps you should leave. Come back when you have learned some manners.
Meow ... Meow.

replies.text: [You scratch the cat behind the ear]

conversationlist.message: Baah!
You find a partly visible gem sticking out of the exposed rock.
You find a partly visible gem sticking out of the exposed rock.
The ancient text crumbles and turns to dust. The defeat of the undead master seems to have lifted the spell animating the remaining corpses and they return to their graves.
It is good to see you again $playername.

replies.text: I explored the cave. You were correct. I found a monster called Tesrekan, which was similar to the one I found in the Charwood mine.
I think I need more help to be able to complete my mission.
I haven't found out what is happening yet, but I wanted to let you know I'm still working on it.

conversationlist.message: Hey kid! Why don't you be a good little boy and fetch me some Lowyna's special brew?

Alright kid!
[Hagale immediately opens one of the bottles and takes a big swig, which he loudly swallows before wiping his mouth on the sleeve of his tattered shirt]
Yeah, I know something about that chest ... *burp* ... I almost opened it.
That was until I had to travel to Remgard to purchase some new inventory. I normally make the trip alone. This time however, my wife and daughter decided to accompany me to Remgard.
Well done! A thousand thanks young adventurer. I am in your debt. However, I would still like my talisman back. I need it to keep me safe.

replies.text: You are right about that debt. I think I'll keep the talisman as payment.

conversationlist.message: Was?

replies.text: I killed the monster. I brought one of its bones as proof.

conversationlist.message:
We were only halfway there when we were attacked by Plaguestriders. My daughter and I managed to escape...
[Hagale takes another long swig from the bottle of Lowyna's special brew]
...but my wife did not survive.

My daughter was afflicted by a nasty form of blistering skin. I rushed her back to Loneford. I thought with rest, good food, and water she could pull through ... but although the blisters were gradually healing, my daughter's health continued to decline.

I had to do something. I went to Fallhaven and begged Thoronir to make me a bonemeal potion. Although it would have cured my daughter completely, he refused because Lord Geomyr banned all use of bonemeal as a healing substance!
[Hagale takes another long swig from the bottle of Lowyna's special brew and finishes it. He proceeds to open the second the bottle.]
I searched the land for information about the chest and graveyard. I spent my entire fortune in the process. My last few coins resulted in a tip that directed me to a group of bandits.

I may be a trader, but traders have to learn how to protect themselves. The first few went down easily, but the leader was an experienced fighter. We fought for over an hour, but eventually I managed to kill him. I searched the body and found an ancient text.
The magical barrier at the cemetery could only be penetrated by someone carrying the text, which contained several magical inscriptions.

I took the best weapons and armor from the bandits, and made my way to the cemetery. Carrying the ancient text in my front pouch, I approached the entrance to the cemetery. I was only a few feet away when the text began to glow.
Maybe he knows more. You should give him a visit.
Well $playername, you are young, and you apologized, so perhaps I will be a little forgiving. Just remember that not everywhere is like your small village. My name is Cithurn.
You have small brain but small brain better than no brain. ARGH!!!
An unearthly force prevents you from entering the cemetery.
What's a kid like you doing around here? It's a dangerous place to be.

replies.text: I'm looking for my Brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me.

conversationlist.message: Sorry. I haven't seen anyone like that.

replies.text: Thanks. Maybe I can help you with whatever is dangerous around here?
Thanks. I need to get going.
Thanks. Maybe I can help you with whatever is dangerous around here?

conversationlist.message: I don't think so. It would need an experienced fighter to help with this problem.

replies.text: Fine. If I'm back around here sometime in the future maybe I'll offer my help again. Or maybe I won't.

conversationlist.message: I will clarify. A more experienced fighter than you.

replies.text: OK. I can take a hint.

conversationlist.message: Here. Take this talisman. It does much to dispel evil forces. I acquired it long ago, and it has kept me safe over the years. Since you have agreed to help me I think your need is now greater than mine. My only request is that if you are successful, you return it to me.
Good luck young adventurer. I await your return.
Thank you. I see you are not just a great fighter, but also an adventurer that keeps his word.
I see. You are apparently a great fighter, but not a very honorable one.
Have you come to return my talisman?

replies.text: Yes. I changed my mind about keeping it.
No. I already told you that I am keeping it as payment for my work.

conversationlist.message: Thank you. It seems you do have more honor than I thought.
Then I have nothing to say to you.
You have found a hatchway that appears to give access to something underground, but it is locked, and you can't open it.
You found some gold amongst the bones!
There is nothing more to be found here.
Don't you know that it's rude to walk into someone's house without knocking?

replies.text: Your neighbor was right. He said you were not always a nice person.
Sorry. I'm looking for my brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me. Have you seen him?

conversationlist.message: No. And little boys like you should not be wandering around on your own. I'm sure your father would not approve.

replies.text: My father sent me to look for my brother.

conversationlist.message: Then he must be a very bad father. He should look for your brother himself. Tell me, are your father and brother as rude as you?

replies.text: Thank you for talking to me. I will leave now.
They are certainly not as rude as you. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: Hello kid. What can I do for you?

replies.text: I'm looking for my brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me. Have you seen him?
Can you tell me anything about the local area?

conversationlist.message: Sorry. I don't recall seeing anyone like that.

replies.text: Can you tell me anything about the local area?

conversationlist.message: There's not much to tell. Loneford is mostly a quiet place, although I have heard rumors that there is some criminal organization based here. Personally, I don't believe it.
The nastiest person in town is probably my neighbor. *laughs*. Be careful about walking in on her!

replies.text: I appreciate the warning, but unfortunately it's too late. I already met her.
You are right. I told her you warned me that she was not always nice to strangers, but I think that just annoyed her.

conversationlist.message: Is there anything else I can help you with?

replies.text: I'm looking for my brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me. Have you seen him?

conversationlist.message: Did he now! Well, I'll have a word or two to say to him later! What do you want?

replies.text: I'm looking for my brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me. Have you seen him?

conversationlist.message: Thanks kid. *sigh*. I expect she will be around here later to complain about that. You should be more careful what you say to people.
Is there something I can help you with?

replies.text: I'm looking for my brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me. Have you seen him?

conversationlist.message: No. Is there anything else?
Like many folk in Loneford, I'm a farmer.

replies.text: OK. Thanks. I need to get going.
Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: I'm a farmer, not a shopkeeper. So yes, if you want to buy a cartload, no otherwise.

replies.text: OK. Thanks. I need to get going.

conversationlist.message: [You have stumbled upon the remains of an adventurer that came before you. Looking at what is left of their equipment, they were ill-prepared for a place such as this. Now they have no use for their equipment or gold. You debate whether to loot the corpse. In the past you have done worse, but...]

replies.text: You decide to leave the corpse undisturbed.

conversationlist.message: You again? What do you want this time?

replies.text: I wish to apologize. I'm $playername. I come from a small village where people tend to leave their doors open. I didn't mean to be rude.

conversationlist.message: Purr ... Purr.
Purr ... Purr.
You have discovered a hidden room!
I will kill you, and then you will join my army of undead servants and soldiers.

replies.text: I just destroyed a lot of your army.
If you are so powerful why do you need an army?
I have destroyed others like you, and I will destroy you!

conversationlist.message: All the more reason for me to kill you and replenish what you have destroyed!

replies.text: An army with no leader is not an army, so I will destroy you!

conversationlist.message: Insolent human! I will make you my undead slave!

replies.text: You don't have what it takes!

conversationlist.message: OK. Thanks for keeping me updated. Please come back when you have more information.
You dare approach me? You will die!
The Guardian stares at you. You feel a sense of dread, but you resist the urge to turn back.
Thanks for your help, but I don't think we have anything else to discuss.
You found some crates that look as though they have been here for a very long time. One of the crates has some old, tattered clothing in it.
The clothes smell musty and are falling apart.
You found some crates that look as though they have been here for a very long time. The crates are empty now.
You found some crates that look as though they have been here for a very long time.
The cemetery is quiet now.
There is nothing left to take from the corpse.
South of the Duleian road, close to Fallhaven.
Hey kid! Stop waving that thing at me! If you want to talk to me, put it away first!
So where is it?
Not too bright, are you kid? Perhaps you should go and pick it up again.
I gave you the text you needed to get that sword. I think some of that gold should be mine. If you don't give me some then I'll take it from you.

replies.text: OK, OK. I guess it's fair that you should get a share. Here's 1000 gold.
No way! I fought to get the sword, and the profit is mine!

conversationlist.message: Thanks kid. It's good to see you have some honor.
Thanks for the gold kid. I decided that with the money I can rebuild my life. I'm going to sober up and start trading again. I'll be leaving here soon.
We'll see about that.
Hello again. You should go talk to Nocmar.
Hi there.

replies.text: There was a drunk outside the tavern that told me a story about you two.

conversationlist.message: That old drunk over at the tavern told you his story did he?
Same old story. We used to travel together a few years back.
Real adventuring you know, swords and spells.
Then, after a while, we stopped. I can't really say why, I guess we got tired of life on the road. We settled down here in Fallhaven.
Nice little town here. A lot of thieves around, but they don't bother me.
So what's your story, kid? How did you end up here in Fallhaven?

Yeah yeah, I get it. Your brother has probably run off to some dungeon, trying to go adventuring.
[Rolls eyes]
Or maybe he has gone to one of the bigger cities to the north.
Can't say I blame him for wanting to see the world.
Hey, by the way, are you looking to be an adventurer?
Nice. I'll give you a hint, kid. *snickering* Go see Nocmar over by the west side of town. Tell him I sent you.
Smart move. Adventuring leads to a lot of scars. If you know what I mean.
His house is just southwest of the tavern.
What's that in your hands?! ... I recognize that seal!

replies.text: You should recognize it, I found this on one of Unzel's associates in Remgard.

conversationlist.message: Surely, he didn't just give it to you!

replies.text: He was asking too many questions. He needed to be silenced.

conversationlist.message: So, you killed him? Right?!

replies.text: Kaverin is dead. His blood is still on my boots.

conversationlist.message: How did you get your hands on that document?!

replies.text: A man in Remgard, by the name of Kaverin, was asking about Unzel...

conversationlist.message: What happened boy?!

replies.text: Kaverin is dead. His blood is still on my boots.

conversationlist.message: Good, maybe now I can work on my Rift Spell in peace...
I must have that document!
I must know what they are planning!
I have a cache of potions hidden, far to the southwest.

replies.text: Excellent, I could always use more supplies.

conversationlist.message: Good. Now give me the message.
Here, take this map as compensation for your troubles.
It will lead you far to the southwest, to one of my secret retreats ... where a cache of potions is hidden.
[The map shows a location to the northwest of the former prison of Flagstone]
Now, let's see here.
[Vacor opens the sealed message and starts reading]
Yes ... hmm ... really?! *mumbles* ...yes, indeed...
Thanks kid, you have helped me more than you can possibly understand.
HA HA HA!!! THE POWER WILL SOON BE MINE!

replies.text: Excellent! The Shadow must be stopped!
I just wanted a reward... Weirdo.

conversationlist.message: Thanks for giving me that message, but now please leave me. I have more important things to do than to talk to you.
Bow before the might of the Thukuzun!

replies.text: Bow down to your own death!

conversationlist.message: You there, thank the Shadow you're here! Quickly, untie these ropes!

replies.text: I think I'll leave you right there.

conversationlist.message: I'm free, thank you! I'll make my way down the hill to the Charwood cabin. Meet me back there.
You see the bloody remains of what looks like a human.
Among the remains, you find a ring with the insignia 'Morenavia'. This must be what's left of the former leader of the Charwood hills.
Please help me! I'm being held captive here.

replies.text: I think I'll leave you right there.

conversationlist.message: Thank you, thank you! I'll make my way down the hill to the Charwood cabin. Meet me back there.
You see a pile of bloody body parts.
Among the remains, you find a ring with the insignia 'Ayell'. This must be what's left of the former healer of the Charwood hills.
Oh, someone from the outside! Please, sir! You have to help us!
We urgently need help from someone outside!
Very funny. I was sent by my settlement to get help from the outside.
The people of my settlement, the Blackwater mountain, are slowly being reduced in numbers by the monsters and the savage bandits.
The monsters are closing in on us, and we desperately need help by some able fighter.

replies.text: I guess I could help, I have killed a few monsters here and there.
Will there be a reward for this?
Hmm, no. I had better not get involved in this.

conversationlist.message: Reward? Hmm, I was hoping you would help us for other reasons than a reward. But I guess my master will reward you sufficiently if you survive.
Excellent. The Blackwater mountain settlement is some distance away. Frankly, I am amazed that I made it this far alive.
I must warn you though, that there are some nasty monsters on the way.
But I guess you seem strong enough.
Good. First though, we must cross this mine to the other side.
The mine shaft over there [points] has collapsed, so I guess you won't make it through there.
You will have to go through the abandoned mine below. Beware that the mine is pitch-black, so you will have to navigate in there without any light.

replies.text: OK, I'll go through the pitch-black mine.

conversationlist.message: I'll try to crawl back through the mine shaft here. That's how I got here in the first place.
Let's meet at the other side of this mine shaft.

replies.text: OK. You crawl through the shaft, and I'll go below. See you on the other side!

conversationlist.message:
Hello kid. You're Mikhail's son aren't you? With that brother of yours.

I'm Leonid, steward of Crossglen village.

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?
What can you tell me about Crossglen?

conversationlist.message: Your brother? No, I haven't seen him here today. I think I saw him in here yesterday talking to Gruil. Maybe he knows more?

replies.text: Thanks, I'll go talk to Gruil. There was something more I wanted to talk about.
Thanks, I'll go talk to Gruil.

conversationlist.message: Anything else I can help you with?

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?
What can you tell me about Crossglen?

conversationlist.message: As you know, this is Crossglen village. Mostly a farming community.
We have Audir with his smithy to the southwest, Leta and her husband's cabin to the west, this town hall here and your father's cabin to the northwest.
That's pretty much it. We try to live a peaceful life.

replies.text: Has there been any recent activity in the village?
Let's go back to the other things we talked about.

conversationlist.message: There were some recent disturbances some weeks ago that you may have noticed. Some villagers got into a fight over the new decree from Lord Geomyr.
Lord Geomyr issued a statement regarding the unlawful use of bonemeal as healing substance. Some villagers argued that we should oppose Lord Geomyr's word and still use it.
Tharal, our priest, was particularly upset and suggested we do something about Lord Geomyr.

Other villagers argued that we should follow Lord Geomyr's decree.

Personally, I haven't decided what my thoughts are.

On one hand, Lord Geomyr supports Crossglen with a lot of protection.
[Points to the soldiers in the hall]
But on the other hand, the tax and the recent changes of what's allowed are really taking a toll on Crossglen.
Someone should go to Castle Geomyr and talk to the steward about our situation here in Crossglen.
In the meantime, we've banned all use of bonemeal as a healing substance.

replies.text: Thank you for the information. There was something more I wanted to ask you.
Thank you for the information. Bye.

conversationlist.message: Shadow be with you.
Hello there. Can I help you?

replies.text: Mind if I use one of the beds over there?

conversationlist.message: Hello again. I hope the bed is comfortable enough. Use it as much as you like.
No, sorry. These beds are for guards and allies of Feygard only.
Say, aren't you that kid that helped the guards down in Fallhaven? With the thieves that were planning an escape?

replies.text: Yes, I helped the guards in the prison find out about some plans that the thieves had.

conversationlist.message: I knew I had heard about you somewhere. You are always welcome by us guards. You can use that second bed over there to the left if you need to rest.
Uh, hello.
Back there? Oh, nothing.

replies.text: But there's a hole in the wall there. Where does it lead?

conversationlist.message: Lead? Oh nowhere. Nothing back there at all.

replies.text: There's something you are not telling me.

conversationlist.message: Oh no, no. Nothing interesting here. Move along now.

replies.text: How about I pay you 100 gold to move out of the way?

conversationlist.message: You would do that? Hmm, let me think.
No.
No.
Look, you are not getting back there, and there is nothing to see back there.

replies.text: OK, final offer, 800 gold? That's a fortune.

conversationlist.message: Hmm, 800 gold you say? Well, why didn't you say so from the start? Sure, that could work.
I should tell you however, that there is something in there that we won't dare go near. I just guard here to make sure it doesn't get out, and that no one goes in.
Some other guards went in there earlier, and came back screaming. Enter at your own risk, but don't say I didn't warn you.

replies.text: Never mind, I was just kidding.
Here is the gold, now get out of the way.

conversationlist.message:
*Hssss*
[You hear squishing sounds as the creature starts moving towards you]

replies.text: You will not survive this, you pathetic creature.
A fight! I have been looking forward to this!

conversationlist.message: The zortak will defeat you!
You will not pass me.
I heard that you helped us get rid of that witch Algangror. Thank you.
Welcome to my tavern. I hope you will find your stay a pleasant one.
How may I be of service?

replies.text: What is there to do around here?
Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: Oh sure. Here, have a look.
Most people here in Remgard tend to their crops. Other than that, I hear that Arnal the armorer over on the western shore has some good business trading.
Also, we usually get a lot of visitors here in the tavern. Lately, it has been a lot fewer people in here though, with the closing of the bridge because of those missing people and all.
On your way in, maybe you noticed that we even have a visit from the Knights of Elythom here in the tavern? It seems that more and more people are becoming aware of the hospitality of Remgard.

replies.text: Thank you. I had some other questions.

conversationlist.message: You have already rented my last room. We don't have any more rooms other than that one.
Why, yes, as a matter of fact, there is. I have one very fine room available upstairs.
The previous tenant left in a hurry some days ago.
You may rent the room for as long as you like for only 600 gold.

replies.text: 600 gold, are you mad!? That's a fortune.
Is there anything you can do to lower the price?
I'll take it. Here is the gold.
I don't have that much gold.

conversationlist.message: The price is fixed. I cannot go around handing out discounts to just anyone. Also, keep in mind that you may rent it for as long as you wish.

replies.text: I'll take it. Here is the gold.
I don't have that much gold.

conversationlist.message: Since you helped us here in Remgard with that witch Algangror, I am prepared to offer you a discount. How about we say 400 gold for it instead?

replies.text: I'll take it. Here is the gold.
I don't have that much gold.

conversationlist.message: You are welcome to return once you have the gold, if you are still interested.
Thank you. The room is upstairs. You may rent it for as long as you wish.
[You feel a tingling sensation in your body as the frightening figure begins to speak]
Sssshadow take you.
G ... argoyle Shadow.
A ... llow the Sssshadow in you.

replies.text: The Shadow, what do you mean?
I will not be affected by your nonsense!

conversationlist.message: [The figure lifts his hand and points at you]
Sssshadow be with you.
Welcome to the Crossroads guardhouse. I am Gallain, the proprietor of this place.
How may I help you?

replies.text: Do you have anything to eat around here?
Is there any place I can rest here?

conversationlist.message: As I said, this is the Crossroads guardhouse. The guards from Feygard are using this place as a place to rest and gear up.
Because of this, it is also a safe haven for merchants travelling through here. We get a lot of those.
Here, have a look.
The guards have set up some beds downstairs. Go check with them.
And who might you be? Come to sell me one of those trinkets that you people sell, eh?
No, let me guess - you want to know if I have any items to trade?
Let me tell you something. I do not want to buy anything from you, nor do I want to sell you anything. I just want to be left alone here, now that I have made it all the way to this safe haven.

I have travelled all the way from my home town of Sullengard, and on my way to Brimhaven, I have stopped at this place to get a break from all the commoners that always bother me with their trinkets and whatnots.
So, if you will excuse me, I really need my well deserved rest here. Without you bothering me.

replies.text: Wow, you're the friendly type aren't you?
I should put my sword through you for talking like that.

conversationlist.message: Are you still around? Did you not listen to what I said?
Did you hear about what happened up in Loneford? The guards seem like a bunch of angry bees about it.
You are not allowed to enter here.
Hello. I am Laecca, mountain guide.

replies.text: What do you do around here?

conversationlist.message: I keep an eye on the mountain pass, to make sure no more of those beasts make their way down here.

replies.text: Then what are you doing indoors here? Shouldn't you be outside guarding then?
What beasts are you talking about?

conversationlist.message: Yeah, sure. It may sound that way. In reality, it's a lot of hard work.
Very funny. I have to rest too you know. Keeping the monsters away is hard work.
There used to be more of us mountain guides, but not many have survived the attack of the beasts.

replies.text: Sounds like you aren't really cut out to do your job properly.
What beasts are you talking about?

conversationlist.message: Perhaps.
Anyway. I have some things to tend to. Nice talking to you.
Thank you for your concern.

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to help?

conversationlist.message: Pfft, 'What beasts?'. The gornaud beasts of course.
Scratching their claws against the bare rock at night. *shrug*
At first, I thought they were acting on pure instinct. But recently, I have started to believe they are smarter than regular beasts.
Their attacks are getting more and more clever.

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to help?

conversationlist.message: You should talk to Guthbered. He is usually in the main hall. Look for a stone house in the center of the village.
Can I help you?

replies.text: What food do you have available for trade?
Is the back room available for rent?

conversationlist.message: Food? No, sorry. I don't have anything to trade.
Rent? Hmm. No, not at the moment.
Now that you mention it, he hasn't been around here for quite some time. Maybe you could go talk to him and see if he still wants to rent it?

replies.text: OK, I will go talk to him.
Sure. Any idea where he might be?

conversationlist.message: It is still rented out to Arghest. He would not be very happy if I rented it out to someone else when he expects to use it.
I don't know where he is now, but I do know that he used to be part of the mining effort in our mine to the southwest.

replies.text: Thanks. I will go look for him.
I will go look for him right away.

conversationlist.message: Thanks.
Thank you for your help earlier. I hope the back room is comfortable enough.
Did you talk to Arghest?

replies.text: [Lie] Yes, he told me that I could rest in the back room if I want to.
Yes, he gave me permission to use the back room whenever I wish.

conversationlist.message: Return to me once you know if he is still interested in renting the back room or not.

replies.text: Any idea where he might be?

conversationlist.message: Did he really say that? Somehow I doubt that. It doesn't sound like him.
You will have to do something more to convince me.
Really, he did? Well then, go ahead. I'm just glad the back room is being used.
You are welcome to rest in the back room any time you want. Please let me know if there is anything I can do to help.
Lovely place this, isn't it?
Hello there. Can I help you?

replies.text: I was sent by Jhaeld to ask about your missing wife.
Do you have anything to trade?
What do you do around here?

conversationlist.message: Me? No, I don't have anything to sell you. Does this look like a shop to you?

replies.text: I was sent by Jhaeld to ask about your missing wife.
What do you do around here?

conversationlist.message: Well, usually I tend to the crops that we grow here. Now, I can't find the strength to do that though.
My wife, Bethir. She is gone, and no one seems to know where she is.
I even went so far as to ask the guards to look for her, but she is nowhere to be found.

replies.text: Are you sure she isn't just out of town running some errands?
Where do you think she has gone?
I was sent by Jhaeld to ask you about her.

conversationlist.message: If that were the case, I would have hoped she would have told me first. No, I can feel it - I am sure something bad has happened to her.

replies.text: Where do you think she has gone?
I was sent by Jhaeld to ask you about her.

conversationlist.message: To be quite honest, I have no idea.

replies.text: Are you sure she isn't just out of town running some errands?
I was sent by Jhaeld to ask you about her.

conversationlist.message: What do you want me to say? She is missing.

replies.text: Is there anything else you have found out that you didn't tell the guards earlier?

conversationlist.message: No. I told those guards the whole story. If I were to find out more, I would immediately tell them of course.
We did have a minor argument just the night before she went missing. But it was just a minor thing, nothing serious.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have things to tend to.
Kazaul...
[The guardian looks completely unaware of your presence]
[The guardian looks down upon you with its burning eyes]

replies.text: Kazaul, defiler of the Elytharan Temple.

conversationlist.message: [You see the burning eyes of the guardian instantly turn into a dark red haze]

replies.text: A fight, I have been waiting for this!

conversationlist.message: You see the shrine of Kazaul that you poured the vial of purifying spirit on.
The previously glowing hot rock is now cold as any regular piece of rock.
Before you stands a large cut out piece of rock, in what looks like a shrine.
You can feel an intense heat coming from the rock, almost like a burning fire.

replies.text: Apply the vial of purifying spirit on the formation.

conversationlist.message: You gently pour the contents of the vial onto the formation.
You hear a loud crackling noise from deep below the shrine. At first, the formation seems unaffected, but after a while you see the glowing of the rock decrease slightly.
The process continues more rapidly, while reducing the heat generated from the formation.
This must be the purification process of the Kazaul shrine.
You can see no way to descend the cliffs from here.
Standing on the top of the mountain, you have a great view in all directions.
You see a town across the lake, but you can see no way to cross the water to get there.
You see the southern shore of a large lake. It looks like it might be possible to walk around the lake in that direction, but there are a number of large, dangerous looking creatures moving around.
The mountain drops away below you. There is not much to see in this direction.
You see more cliffs, but the view beyond that is hidden in mist.
The mist briefly clears, and you can make out a town in the distance.
You see a bird, perhaps a hawk, high in the sky.
Suddenly, the bird folds its wings and dives. You realize that it is not a hawk, but a falcon.
The falcon hurtles towards the mountain. It is going so fast it seems that surely it must crash into the rocks.
At what seems like the last possible moment, the falcon flares its wings and lands hard on whatever unfortunate creature it spied from high above.
The falcon soars back into the sky. It has something in its talons, but you can't make out what it is. What an amazing thing to witness!
You see a few houses, and what appears to be an inn, or tavern.
You see a large lake. It is difficult to make out any details on the distant shore, but there are trees and cliffs.
The view is blocked by mountains. You can see some creatures moving on the slopes.
You see the river, far below. You can't believe you climbed all the way up from there!
You see a town across the lake, but you can see no way to cross the water to get there. You can see a few people in the town.
You see two women that appear to be arguing.
The two women eventually separate and walk away from each other. You wonder what the argument was about.
The two women eventually separate and walk away from each other. You can't make out their faces from here, but you know who they probably are.
You see the montain top you are standing on.
You see something glinting by your feet.
You have found a gem!
There is nothing more to be found here.
You look to the north.
You look to the northeast.
You look to the east.
You look to the southeast.
Suddenly, something in the sky catches your eye.
You look to the south.
You look to the southwest.
You look to the west.
You look to the northwest.
The sign is old and worn, but you can make out the words "Lake Laeroth watchtower".
You toss and turn, but sleep won't come.
Now you have got a headache. You really should give up trying to sleep.
Baah!

replies.text: [Place Tinlyn's bell around the neck of the sheep]

conversationlist.message: Baah!

replies.text: [Place Tinlyn's bell around the neck of the sheep]

conversationlist.message: Baah!

replies.text: [Place Tinlyn's bell around the neck of the sheep]

conversationlist.message: Baah!

replies.text: [Place Tinlyn's bell around the neck of the sheep]

conversationlist.message: Baah!
[You place one of the bells around the neck of the sheep]
Baah!
Hello. I'm Arcir.

replies.text: I noticed your statue of Elythara downstairs.
You really seem to like your books.

conversationlist.message: Anything else you wanted to ask?

replies.text: I noticed your statue of Elythara downstairs.
You really seem to like your books.

conversationlist.message:
Oh, you found my statue in the basement?

Yes, Elythara is my protector.
I find great pleasure in my books. They contain the accumulated knowledge of past generations.

replies.text: Do you have a book called 'Calomyran Secrets'?

conversationlist.message: 'Calomyran Secrets'? Hmm, yes I think I have one of those in my basement.
Old man Benradas came by last week, wanting to sell me that book. Since it's not really my kind of book, I declined.
He seemed upset that I didn't like his book, and threw it at me while storming out of the house.
Poor old man Benradas, he probably forgot that he left it here. He tends to forget things.
You looked downstairs but didn't find it? And a note you say? I guess there must have been someone in my house.
I heard you found it and gave it back to old man Benradas. Thank you. He tends to forget things.

What did the note say?

Larcal ... I know of him. Always causing trouble. He is usually in the barn to the east of here.
Ha! You look funny. You small.

replies.text: What is that thing you are keeping around?

conversationlist.message: Me, Sienn. I strong!

replies.text: What is that thing you are keeping around?

conversationlist.message:
Pet, cute!
[Sienn makes cuddly sounds while scratching the pet under its chin]

replies.text: Did you know that Taevinn thinks you caused the illness here in Loneford?

conversationlist.message: Sienn not ill! Sienn strong!

Aaargh!
[The creature looks up at you, showing all its teeth, while making a high-pitched piercing sound]
Hello there. Have you come to browse my selection of items?

replies.text: What's the deal with Sienn over there with his pet?

conversationlist.message: I don't know where he got it from. Anyway, they don't harm anyone, so I'm fine with them being in here. I figured someone should help them have some place to stay, and no one else wanted to help them, so I let them stay here.
Sienn may be a bit thick, but he sure can be funny when you get to know him and he trusts you. He can do a lot of those hilarious facial expressions.
Beat it, kid. You shouldn't be out here.
Hey, I'm trying to admire the view here. Get out of my way.
[The lich looks at you with its burning eyes, and glances at the remains of the guardian you defeated]
Kazaul'te vaarmun iktel urul. Klatam ku turum Kazaul'te?
[The lich raises its hands towards the ceiling, chanting something you cannot understand]
[While chanting, it slowly lowers its hands forward, until pointing directly at you]
Klatam ku turum Kazaul'te.
[As if having swallowed a thousand needles, you are suddenly stricken with a cascading series of spikes of pain throughout your stomach]
[You start to feel nauseous, and your stomach turns and twists - as if it has a life of its own]
[The pain increases slightly, and you start to realize that something is moving inside of you]
[The lich must have infected you with something]
[The lich seems to enjoy seeing you in pain]

replies.text: You will pay for what you did to me!

conversationlist.message: [On the shrine that was behind the lich 'Toszylae' that you defeated, you find a strange looking helmet]
[You see an empty shrine where you found the strange looking helmet]
Oh good, you are awake.
I can't seem to find your brother Andor anywhere. He hasn't been back since he left yesterday.
Never mind, he will probably be back soon.
Anything else I can help you with?

replies.text: Do you have any more tasks for me?
Do you have any more tasks for me?
Do you have any more tasks for me?
Do you have any tasks for me?
Is there anything else you can tell me about Andor?
I have a present for you.
I have a present for you.

conversationlist.message: Oh yes, there were some things I need help with, bread and rats. Which one would you like to talk about?

replies.text: Never mind, let's talk about the other things.

conversationlist.message: Thanks for getting me the bread. There are still the rats.

replies.text: Never mind, let's talk about the other things.

conversationlist.message: Thanks for taking care of the rats. I'd still love some bread.

replies.text: Never mind, let's talk about the other things.

conversationlist.message: Not for now. Thanks for taking care of the bread and rats.

replies.text: Never mind, let's talk about the other things.

conversationlist.message: As I said, Andor went out and hasn't been back since. I worry about him. Please go look for your brother. He said he would only be out for a short while.
Maybe he went into that supply cave again and got stuck. Or maybe he's in Leta's basement training with that wooden sword again. Please go look for him in town.
Oh, I almost forgot. If you have time, please go see Mara at the town hall and buy me some more bread.
Did you get my bread from Mara at the town hall yet?
Thanks a lot, now I can make my breakfast. Here, take these coins for your help.
Thanks for the bread earlier.
I saw some rats out back in our garden earlier. Could you please go kill any rats that you see out there.

replies.text: I have already dealt with the rats.
OK, I'll go check out in our garden.

conversationlist.message: If you get hurt by the rats, come back here and rest in your bed. That way you can regain your strength.
Also, don't forget to check your inventory. You probably still have that old ring I gave you. Make sure you wear it.

replies.text: OK, I understand. I can rest here if I get hurt, and I should check my inventory for useful items.

conversationlist.message: Did you kill those two rats in our garden?

replies.text: Yes, I have dealt with the rats now.

conversationlist.message:
Oh you did? Wow, thanks a lot for your help!

If you are hurt, use your bed over there to rest and regain your strength.

Thanks for your help with the rats earlier.

If you are hurt, use your bed over there to rest and regain your strength.
Hello there.

replies.text: Did you rent the back room at the inn in Prim?

conversationlist.message: This is the old Elm mine of Prim.
We used to mine a lot here. But that was before the attacks started.
The attacks on Prim by the beasts and the bandits really reduced our numbers. Now we cannot keep up the mining activity any longer.
I am Arghest. I guard the entrance here to make sure no one enters the old mine.
No. The mine is closed.
I said no. Visitors are not allowed in there.
Welcome back. Thanks for your help earlier. I hope the room at the inn can be of use to you.
Welcome back. Did you bring me the 5 bottles of milk that I requested?

replies.text: No, not yet. I'm working on it.
Yes, but this nearly cost me a fortune!

conversationlist.message: OK then. Return to me once you have them.
Thank you my friend! Now I can restock my supply.
These bottles look excellent. Now I can last a while longer in here.
Oh, and about the room in the inn - you are welcome to use it in any way you see fit. Quite a cozy place to rest if you ask me.

replies.text: Finally, I thought I would never be able to rest here!

conversationlist.message: 'Inn in Prim' - you sound funny.
Yes, I rent it. I stay there to rest when my shift ends.
However, now that we guards aren't as plentiful as we used to be, it has been a while since I could rest in there.

replies.text: Mind if I use the room at the inn to rest in?
Are you still going to use it?

conversationlist.message: Well, I would like to still keep the option of using it. But I guess someone else could rest there now that I'm not actively using it.
Tell you what, if you bring me some more supplies to keep me occupied here, I guess you could have my permission to use it even though I have rented it.
I have plenty of meat here, but I ran out of milk some weeks ago. Do you think you could help me restock my milk supply?

replies.text: Sure, no problem. I'll get you your bottles of milk. How much do you need?
Sure, if it leads to me being able to rest here. I'm in.

conversationlist.message: Bring me 5 bottles of milk. That should be enough.
You notice that these rocks seem out of place compared to the surroundings. Maybe they are meant to symbolize something?
The formation of rocks seems to have sunken somewhat into the ground.
You notice some writing on one of the rocks, but it is very faint and in some form of writing that you do not understand.

While examining them, you recall the old man Ogam in Vilegard spoke of some 'Rocky Formations'. Could this be what he was referring to? If that is the case, you wonder if this path might lead to Lodar's hideaway.
