Someone has scribbled a crude addition to the sign: Unless they bring the good stuff.
Here lies an unnamed visitor. May her items that we took serve us well.
Here lies Khulrik. He always told us that he'd take one too many. Finally, he did.
The text on the cross says: Here lies another Nor City savage bandit that roamed the Duleian road, easily slain by the glorious Feygard patrol.
Welcome to beautiful Charwood heights!
Some mysterious power prevents you from opening the door.
Oh, a newcomer. Great. I hope you are here to help us with our problems.
Stay out of trouble and trouble will stay away from you.
Great place this, isn't it?
Teehee. Mazeg's potions make you feel all tingly and funny.
Get out of my kitchen! Take a seat and I will get to you in time.
Banging. Wheezing.
Have to get away!
The monsters, they come at night.

[Looks nervous]
Have to hide.
Regardless, I cannot help you. My services are only for residents of Blackwater mountain, and I don't trust you enough yet.
Welcome friend. What can I do for you?

replies.text: What weapons do you have for sale?

conversationlist.message: Welcome traveller. I see you are looking at my fine selection of weapons.
I have no time for you, kid. Have to practice my skills.
...but while the forces were withdrawing, the larger part of...
Oh. A young one. Hello. Please do not disturb my students while they are studying.
Sorry, I can't talk right now.
Hello again.

replies.text: How do I get to Remgard?
What can you tell me about Remgard?
Do you have anything to trade?
I'm looking for my brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me.

conversationlist.message: Hello. My name is Teksin. I'm a trader. Who are you?

replies.text: I am $playername. I am looking for my brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me.

conversationlist.message: Sorry. I haven't seen anyone that looks like you.
I have been out in the wild for a while, and have seen nobody since I left the main road weeks ago.
I decided that I should find a better route to Remgard. The road through the mountains to the east is plagued by terrible monsters. My quest for a better route was a mistake though.

This is as close as I can get coming this way. I am an experienced traveler, and I know that Remgard is close. It's north across this lake, but there is no way to cross, or to go further east around the lake.

replies.text: It sounds like you are not quite the experienced traveler you claim to be.
I guess it was worth a try. What can you tell me about Remgard?
How do I get to Remgard?
Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: Remgard is a town that is well protected by the lake that we are next to. It is peaceful, and far from any enemies, which makes it somewhat surprising that they make excellent armor there. The high quality of the goods available in Remgard is the reason it is on my trading route, even though it is so hard to get to.

replies.text: How do I get to Remgard?
Thanks for the information, but I have to leave now.

conversationlist.message: You have to go back down to the river, then south until you find some caves. Go through the caves, up through the mountains, and then around the lake we are now standing next to. It's a long way, and as I said, there are some very bad monsters. A kid like you should probably not attempt it.

replies.text: I can handle it. I'm on my way.
It sounds dangerous. I think I'll go somewhere else.
Thanks for the information. Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message:
Yes. I think you will see that I sell quality items from many places.
Under the circumstances I can only sell you limited provisions though.

I do also have one special item. It is a potion that increases your attack speed.
It is very rare, and therefore expensive, but I am willing to part with it if the price is right.

replies.text: No thanks. Show me what else you have.
OK. Show me what you have.

conversationlist.message: For you, I will offer the special price of 4999 gold.

replies.text: I don't have that much gold. Please show me what else you have.
That's too expensive. Please show me what else you have.
I think I'll just be on my way.

conversationlist.message:
Use it wisely. Such a potion is very hard to obtain. 
It is unlikely I will have any more to sell in the future.

replies.text: Thanks for the advice. Please show me what else you have to trade.
Thanks for the advice. I need to go now.

conversationlist.message: This is a haystack.
The guard bars your way.
You do not really want to try the beds of these torturers.
The room is private. Please respect this.
The room is private. Please respect this.
The room is private. Please respect this.
The tower is no playground. Keep away from there, kid.
Don't run away!
To the stairs!
Up now! To the wall!
Oh, this is high. I would not want to fall off this wall!
Now jump!
Hey! The dungeon is no playground! Go away, kid!
Hey! The dungeon is no playground! Go away, kid!
The door is locked.
Hey! You can't go there!
Hey! You can't go there!

replies.text: I am on a mission for Lord Guynmart.
I am on a mission for Steward Unkorh.

conversationlist.message: OK, then hurry.
Here lies Guynmart, the righteous.
Here lies Guynmart, the treacherous.
The door is locked.
You can not open the door with a raging torturer at your heels.
The door is wide open now.
You have a feeling that you will need the flute down there.
My hellebori! Can't you be careful?
No! Get away from my cerastii!
Watch it! Don't step on my precious buphtalmum!
My arenaria! Don't step on my arenaria!
Watch it! Don't step on my strelitzia reginae!
There is no door to the gate house on this side.
A hollow voice cries: Who daaares to distuuurb my rest?
Uuuuaaahahahaaaa!
Completely wrong! Are you lost?
Coocoo, here I am!
Where am I? You will never find me!
[Whispering from below] Oh, how I long to take my place here...
Sweet Hannah will be my bride...
And Guynmart shall rot deep down in his own dungeon...

replies.text: I should leave the gallery - quietly.

conversationlist.message: Yoo-Hoo! You again - fine! I'm coming...

replies.text: Olav? Oh no - not the special guest exit again!

conversationlist.message:
REST
Do you want to rest here?

You close your eyes and almost immediately see people starving, with rats everywhere, chewing on the faces of the dead, and demons throwing their shackled human slaves into giant cauldrons of a boiling, foul smelling brew...
We have come to get you! We are hungry!

replies.text: I have no fear of dirty sheets.
Nooo! I want to wake up!

conversationlist.message: You should have! We will teach you!
You awake sweating. A nightmare - no wonder in such place.
This looks like a mechanism to open and close the main gate.
This ... is ... hard ... work...
I should have asked a guard to do it.
Done, the gate is open.
Done, the gate is open, and Guynmart's personal guard can enter. I should leave quickly now, maybe to the farmhouse south of here.
Closing is easier than opening.
Done, the gate is closed again.
Done, the gate is closed again. But it was a stupid idea, so I had better open the gate again.
Shadow be with you.

replies.text: Do you know anything about the illness here in Loneford?
Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: The people of Loneford are very keen on following the will of Feygard, whatever it may be.
Normally, this would not be a problem. But Lord Geomyr seems to have something against the Shadow. He will do almost anything to oppose all actions that in some way extend the reach of the Shadow.
Because of this, the people of Loneford are now actively abolishing the thought of the Shadow guiding them through their lives.
People around here would rather follow the law of Feygard than follow the old ways.
My feeling is that this illness is caused by the Shadow, as punishment to all of us here in Loneford.
For Feygard!
Halt! Do not come any closer. The contents of these crates is property of Feygard.

replies.text: I mean you no harm. Who are you?
Sure. I'll just stay right here. Who are you?

conversationlist.message: I am Aulowenn of Feygard.
I'm guarding these crates. That's what I do. At least until my company gets back from their scouting party.
Oh I hope they do get back. Come to think of it, they have been away for quite some time now.
I sure hope they are well. Unlike the others...
In my squad, we were a band of six guards that, together with other squads, were sent out here to find a dangerous madman that takes his refuge somewhere in the nearby hills around here.
But something started to happen once we got here. Some of my fellow guards started acting ... odd.
I don't know if it was just me imagining things or if something truly happened to them. Anyway, one by one, we started to get fewer and fewer.
Some of my men were killed by the creatures that live in these woods, some ran away by themselves and some have never come back from their scouting trips.

replies.text: What do you think has happened to them?

conversationlist.message: I have two theories. My first thought is that some of the local creatures that we've been having problems with here might have captured them, or even killed them. I know for a fact that some were killed by the creatures, since we even buried some of my men to the east of here, but I am not certain of the others.
The creatures in these woods are intelligible, but fierce. Luckily, we've been able to kill them off before they've been able to spew their foul lies. There are still a few of them around though.
My second theory is that the madman that we are looking for must have done something to them. Maybe the madman has smeared some of his madness onto them.
Regardless, there isn't much that I am able to do here. I need to guard these crates.
Also, I do hope that those creatures that seem to live here don't return. They've been a real pest.

replies.text: Anything I can do to help?

conversationlist.message: Oh yes, would you? There is one thing you could do.
As I mentioned, some of my men were killed by the local creatures here. We buried them to the east of here.
I haven't been there for a few days now, but last I visited the graves, there was one of those foul creatures standing over the graves.
I've seen that particular creature there before, it seems to be haunting the graves of my fellow men.
Of course, it must be up to no good. I would like your help in either removing or defeating that thing.

replies.text: So, you want me to go visit the graves to the east and defeat whatever creature is there?

conversationlist.message: Yes, that's it. I should also warn you that those creatures are intelligible, so I would urge you to act quickly when encountering it, before it can spew its foul lies.

replies.text: Sounds easy enough. I'll do it.
Great, more blood for my sword. I'll do it.
Anything to help a fellow Feygard friend.
I don't think I should get involved in this.
I'll go visit the graves, but I can't promise that I'll kill anyone.

conversationlist.message: Good. Return here once you are done.
Glory to Feygard. Return here once you are done.
You do as you wish. I'll be here regardless.
Hello again. Were you successful in defeating that beast?

replies.text: What was I supposed to do again?
Not yet. I'll do it soon enough though.
I don't think I should get involved in this.
I'll go visit the graves, but I can't promise that I'll kill anyone.
I met Tiqui by those graves. He had an interesting tale to tell.

conversationlist.message: Excellent. Maybe now my brethren can rest peacefully. Thank you so much for helping me.
In return, you are very welcome to use my bed to rest whenever you wish.
Welcome back my friend. Thank you for helping me defeat that foul creature that was haunting the grave of my fellow guards.
You actually listened to it? Please, indulge me, what lies did it have you believe?

replies.text: He told me that you have been killing off his kin.

conversationlist.message: Of course we have! They've been attacking us, and we've taken precautions by hunting them so they can't kill more of us.
To think that they believe they have a chance against the forces of Feygard. Hah! We will cut them down like sheep once the reinforcements get here.

replies.text: I should leave before there is more bloodshed.
I don't like your tone. They haven't done anything to you.
I was also asked to take care of you, and I intend to do just that.

conversationlist.message: Hah! Take care of me? That will be the day.

replies.text: You will be no match for me.
I should leave before there is more bloodshed.

conversationlist.message: Hah! See, there are those lies that I told you about. They. Attacked. Us. Get it?

replies.text: You will be no match for me.
I should leave before there is more bloodshed.

conversationlist.message: You are not allowed to enter this room until you have rented it.

West: Loneford
