Welcome to Lake Laeroth and the city of Remgard!
The thicket is too dense for you to get through.
You squeeze through the narrow opening of the cave.
You squeeze through the narrow opening of the cave. The stale air that hangs heavy within the damp cave, with its hints of mold and old parchment, fills your nose.
This must be the cave that the map leads to. This must be Vacor's old hideout.
Hello.
What are you, some kind of adventurer? Hmm. Maybe you can be of use to me.
Are you willing to help me?

replies.text: Sure, what do you need help with?
No, why should I help you?

conversationlist.message: Bah, lowly creature. I knew I shouldn't have asked you. Now leave me.
A while ago, I was working on a rift spell that I had read about.
The spell is supposed to, shall we say, open up new possibilities.
Erm, yes, the rift spell will open things up alright. Ahem.
So there I was working hard on getting the last pieces together for it.
Then, all of a sudden, a gang of thugs came around and started bullying me.
They said they were Messengers of the Shadow, and insisted that I should cease my spell making.
Preposterous, isn't it? I was so close to having the power!
Oh, the power I could have had. My dear rift spell.
Anyway, I was just about to finish the last piece of my rift spell when the bandits came and robbed me.
The bandits took my notes for the spell and took off before I could call the guards.
After years of work, I can't seem to remember the last parts of the spell.
Do you think you could help me locate it? Then I could have the power at last!
You will of course be suitably rewarded for your part in me getting this power.

replies.text: Very well. I will help you.
No thanks, this seems like something that I would rather not get involved with.

conversationlist.message: I knew I couldn't trust... Wait, what? You actually said yes? Hah, well then.
OK, find the four pieces of my rift spell that the bandits took, and bring the pieces to me.
There were four bandits, and they all headed south of Fallhaven after I was attacked.
You should search the southern parts of Fallhaven for the four bandits.
Please hurry! I am so eager to open up the rift ... erm, I mean finish the spell. Nothing odd with that right?
Hello again. How is the search for my missing pieces of the rift spell going?

replies.text: I have found all the pieces.
What was I supposed to do again?
Could you tell me the whole story again?

conversationlist.message: Oh, you found all four pieces? Hurry, give them to me.
Yes, these are the pieces that the bandits took.
Now I should be able to finish the rift spell and open up the Shadow rift ... erm I mean open up new possibilities. Yes, that's what I meant.
The only obstacle between me and continuing my rift spell research is that stupid Unzel fellow.
Unzel was my apprentice a while ago. But he started to annoy me with his questions and talk about morality.
He said that my spell making was disrupting the will of the Shadow.
Bah, the Shadow. What has it ever done for ME?!
I shall one day cast my rift spell and we will be rid of the Shadow.
Anyway. I have a feeling that Unzel sent those bandits after me, and if I don't stop him he will probably send more.
I need you to find Unzel and kill him for me. He can probably be found somewhere southwest of Fallhaven.
Bring me his signet ring as proof when you have killed him.
Now hurry, I cannot wait much longer. The power shall be MINE!
Hello again. Any progress yet?

replies.text: Could you tell me the story again?

conversationlist.message: Have you killed Unzel for me yet? Bring me his signet ring when you have killed him.

replies.text: I have dealt with him. Here is his ring.
I listened to Unzel's story and have decided to side with him. The Shadow must be preserved.

conversationlist.message: Ha ha, Unzel is dead! That pathetic creature is gone!
I can see the blood on your boots. I even got you to kill his minions beforehand.
This is a great day indeed. I will soon have the power!
Here, have these coins for your help.
Now leave me, I have work to do before I can cast the rift spell.
Hello again, my assassin friend. I will soon have my rift spell ready.
What? He told you his story? You actually believed it?
I will give you one more chance. Either kill Unzel for me, and I will reward you handsomely, or you will have to fight me.

replies.text: OK, I'll think about it once more.

conversationlist.message: Bah, lowly creature. I knew I shouldn't have trusted you. Now you will die along with your precious Shadow.
If you are looking for Duaina, she is out in the backyard.
Sorry, we are closed. If you want to practice your reading skills, please come back another day. If there is a specific book you are looking for, I might be able to help you.
He he. They will never know what hit them.
Oh, hello! Never mind me, I am just strolling along here. Nothing strange about that. See?
*cough* Please leave me be. I haven't *cough* done anything!
Hey, what are you doing in here? Don't try any funny business.
We don't get many visitors here these days. I hope you like what you see here in Remgard.
This is no place for children. You had better leave.
See this? The harvested crops have begun to rot. Argh, I knew we should have fixed that door when we had the chance.
Ah, isn't this place nice? What else could anyone wish for? This place has all that a man needs - good food, a warm bed and people to exchange stories with.
You again. Thank you for the gold earlier.
Welcome back my friend. Walk with the Shadow.
Shadow be with you.

replies.text: I know of your business at the well the night after the illness broke out.
Can you tell me more about the Shadow?

conversationlist.message: Oh, I am sure you do. But what proof do you have, eh? Anything the guards would believe?
Let me ask you something first, and we might talk after that.

replies.text: How about some gold, would that make you talk?

conversationlist.message: Let me start by telling you a story.

replies.text: Let me guess, this story is going to take forever to listen to. How about I give you some gold, and instead we can discuss what you were doing at the well.

conversationlist.message: Hmm, that might be an interesting proposal. How much gold are you suggesting?
Hrmpf. Thanks for the gold, but I am not interested in talking to you. Now, please leave.
You seem to realize the true value of the Shadow. Yes, this will do fine, thank you.
Let's assume you live in a village that, for the most part, keeps to itself. Your village is self-sustainable and the crops have been good for some years.
With the few exceptions of some fights here and there between villagers because of misunderstandings, on the whole, your village is a friendly, peaceful village.
You work in the same profession as your parents, which in turn worked in the same professions as their parents.
Let's also assume that the way you conduct your business is the same way that the people in the village have been conducting their business for generations past.
Everyone respects one another in the village, and your appointed leader does a good job at keeping everyone's interests satisfied, while at the same time being reasonably fair.
Then, one day, a group of men come walking into the village. Shining armor, white teeth, combed hair, trimmed beards.
The men claim that their lord owns this land, including your village.
They claim that they keep the land safe of wrongdoers and evil creatures.
For their help in protecting your village, they ask that the village compensate them with a share of the harvest.
Now, tell me. Would you support those men by agreeing to their terms?
I am sorry to hear that. You should make up your mind and return to me once you have done so. Then we might be able to talk more.

replies.text: How about I give you some gold instead?

conversationlist.message: How interesting.
Let me continue the story of our hypothetical case.
A while later, the men return. They explain that some of the ways things are done in the village have now been prohibited across the whole land.
Without going into specifics, let's say that these are ways that have been used for past generations in your village.
Changing the way things are done will require quite an effort for people to adjust. A lot of people in the village are upset because of this news from the men.
Now, tell me. Would you in secret continue using the old ways your past generations have used, or would you instead convert to the ways that the men are advocating?

replies.text: I would continue using the old ways in secret.
I would continue using the old ways, and fight the ruling that prohibited them in the first place.
I would only use the ways that are allowed.
I can't decide without knowing the specifics.

conversationlist.message: How interesting.
I am glad to hear that there are people still around that are willing to stand up for what is right.
How interesting. You have a different view of the world than what I and the priests of Nor City have.
You are of course entitled to your opinion, but you should know that your opinion might conflict with the Shadow.
You wanted to know about some business that you accuse me of. Since you have no proof, I will claim innocence. I know that my conscience is clean.

replies.text: Fine. How about I give you some gold instead, would that make you talk?

conversationlist.message: Your views match those that I and the other priests from Nor City believe in. Tell me, would you be interested in following the glow of the Shadow?

replies.text: I am ready to follow the Shadow.
How can I agree to something without knowing what it entails?
No, I will go my own way.
No, I will go my own way. Your stupid Shadow is nothing but talk and fancy words.

conversationlist.message: If the answers you gave previously were indeed your views, then I can assure you that the path that is guided by the Shadow is the right one.

replies.text: I am ready to follow the Shadow.
No, I will go my own way.
No, I will go my own way. Your stupid Shadow is nothing but talk and fancy words.

conversationlist.message: I am sorry to hear that. I guess we do not share views after all.
I am glad to hear that, but then again, I had a feeling all along that you would say that.
You wanted to ask me something?

replies.text: What were you doing at the well during the night?

conversationlist.message: Let me first tell you my background.

I am appointed by the priests of Nor City to help guide the people of Loneford towards the Shadow. Our mission is to see that the Shadow casts its glow over Loneford as well as other settlements around here.

Most folk in these northern parts seem too occupied with obeying the will of Feygard and Lord Geomyr. We want to help people see the light of the wrongdoings that Feygard advocates, and to point out the errors in their ways.
That's my mission here. To see that the Shadow casts its glow over Loneford.

replies.text: How does this relate to what you were doing at the well?

conversationlist.message: Nor City sent word to me that something was about to happen here in Loneford. Something that would help our cause.
They were sending a boy to do some business here, and I was assigned to make sure that the mission was successful.
I was tasked with gathering samples from the water in the well and from the ground around the well. Also, I was given some vials whose contents should be poured into the well.
Apparently, the boy they sent was successful in his mission. The task that I did was also successful, if I may say so myself.
So, currently, that's where we stand now. The deed is done, and the Shadow will look favorably upon us.

replies.text: So, the well was poisoned, that's horrible. How could you?

conversationlist.message: Horrible!? What is horrible? What those people from Feygard are doing - that's what's horrible!
Now, I ask you to keep this story just between us two. You understand that, right?

replies.text: I promise not to tell anyone.
No, I will report you to the guard.

conversationlist.message: I urge you to rethink your reasoning. The way of the Shadow is the righteous way.

replies.text: Very well. I promise not to tell anyone.
No. Your crimes will be punished!

conversationlist.message: Infidel, you will not defeat me! For the Shadow!
Thank you, my friend.
If you want to learn more about the Shadow, please visit the chapel custodian in Nor City. Tell them I sent you, and they will surely extend their gratitude towards you.
Welcome back my friend. May you bask in the glow of the Shadow.
Can I help you?
Well, it's our cabin. What are you doing here, anyway?

replies.text: I'm looking for my brother, Andor.
Not much, maybe there is some loot in here that I can grab.

conversationlist.message: Hrmpf. I think you had better leave.
OK. Good luck with that.
Does it matter? I don't know you, and you don't know me.

replies.text: Wow, you're not very friendly, are you?

conversationlist.message: He he. Interesting. Let's just say our line of work is ... interesting.
But never mind that. I heard there were some troubles up by the Charwood mining town recently.
It's just northeast of here. Look for the Charwood cabin north of here.
Please, you must help us!

replies.text: Do you know anything about the illness?

conversationlist.message: I'll tell you what I know. We try to follow the law around here. Without rules and laws, how would we be any different from the savages that roam the southern lands?
But even if we here in Loneford keep as peaceful as possible, there's always someone that has a desire to cause mischief.

Have you seen him? That fool Sienn. Him and his 'pet' are always trying to cause some trouble. We can't have that around here in our friendly village. Especially not in times like these when we are trying to show our good side to those magnificent guards from Feygard that are here.
Did you know I tried to talk to him on several occasions about his so called 'pet'? I couldn't really make out what he was trying to tell me, but that thing of his nearly tried to kill me, it did!

I tell you, there's mischief all around him and that thing he keeps around. I am sure they are up to something. They probably caused this illness somehow. Maybe we caught something contagious from that thing of his that he keeps around?
Hello there. Please do not bother me, I have a lot of work to do.
Hello. Could you please move out of the way? I am trying to work here.
Welcome to our wonderful Inn. How can we help you?
My name is Cadoren. I'm the best cook in town.
Unlike most, lesser, cooks in local towns, I'm a specialist.

replies.text: Enough of the bragging. Show me what you have to trade.

conversationlist.message: Food that lasts a long time. *cough*. Or in some cases food that has already lasted a long time.

replies.text: That sounds interesting. Show me what you have.
Why do you need food that lasts a long time?

conversationlist.message: The path to Blackwater mountain has been cut off. There are also increasing attacks by monsters. These things have driven down trade, making supplies hard to get.

replies.text: So all the food you sell is old?
Thanks for the information. I have to leave now.

conversationlist.message: Hello, welcome to my shop.

replies.text: Please show me what you have to trade.
What can you tell me about the town and local area?
I'm looking for my brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me.

conversationlist.message: Stoutford is not a big town, but it used to be important.
Sorry, I don't recall seeing anyone like that recently. Most visitors go to the inn though, so you might have more luck asking there.
Oh. No one asked before you. I didn't even think about it.
Are you willing to hear my story?

replies.text: Oh no. Not a long story.
If it can be of any comfort ... go ahead.

conversationlist.message:
Thank you. My name is Aryfora.
I met my husband here in Stoutford, during the fair.
He offered me a beautiful flower, one that I had never seen before.

He was smart and handsome and we quickly fell in love.
He was from a town called Remgard.
His name was Noraed.
He told me that it is very far from here, to the northeast, beyond the river and the mountains.
I've never been there, as he always said how dangerous that road was, but every year, for our anniversary, he went back to bring me a damerilia, the same flower he offered me on the day we met.

During one of the recent attacks on Stoutford, my husband sacrificed his life to save mine.
Now, I can't do anything but mourn next to his grave.

replies.text: He must have loved you very much.

conversationlist.message: I'd really love to place damerilias on his grave, as a symbol of our love.

replies.text: Uh oh, I suspect I am going to be asked for something...

conversationlist.message: But it would be reckless of me to ask such a young kid as you to go so far to the northeast.

replies.text: Don't worry about me. I can handle myself.
I'm an adventurer. I'm afraid of nothing.

conversationlist.message: Really? If you manage to do it, I'll make sure to reward you with something only I can do, and that I haven't done in a long time.

replies.text: I guess I have work to do now.

conversationlist.message: That's a secret. I can't tell you, but you'll know when you'll see it.
Thank you for listening to me anyway. I wish you the best.
You're back! Have you found some damerilias yet?

replies.text: Yes. Here they are, three of the most beautiful damerilias.
Yes. Here they are, two of the most beautiful damerilias.
Yes. Here it is, the most beautiful one.

conversationlist.message: Oh. Come back to me if you find some, will you?
Oh. But that is not enough - what would that look like! There must be at least 3 damerilias for the grave. Please...
So much work to do. I sure hope we will have some rain soon.
So much work to do. I sure hope we will have some rain soon.

replies.text: Do you know where I can find some damerilias?

conversationlist.message: Oh, it is you again.
What a strange request!
Yes I happen to have some. Why are you asking?

replies.text: There is this woman in Stoutford, she wants some for the grave of her husband, Noraed.

conversationlist.message: Noraed is dead? Oh no ... my poor little brother. What happened?

replies.text: He was killed saving the life of his wife, during a monster attack on Stoutford.

conversationlist.message: Yes, that would be him. He loved Aryfora so much. I never had the chance to meet her.
Every year he came to pick the most beautiful damerilia to give it to her as a present.

replies.text: Yes, Aryfora told me. She asked me to bring her some damerilias for Noraed's grave.

conversationlist.message: I still have some. Here, take these to her, and send her my condolences.

replies.text: Thanks. I'll make sure she gets them.
All this trouble for a bunch of smelly flowers...

conversationlist.message: These damerilias are not really good any more. You should get fresh ones from my family's glade north of Remgard.

replies.text: How would I get to your glade?

conversationlist.message: To find the glade you have to pass through a cave. There are trolls, but my father had put up a statue that the trolls don't like to pass. So I was able to pass through the cave fairly safely.
The glade itself is barred by a solid door to keep the trolls out. I had a key for it of course.
Yes. Unfortunately I did not pay enough attention to where I was going when I was there last time, and took a wrong turn.
Suddenly there were trolls everywhere. I barely escaped, but I must have lost the key to our glade there. If only I could have my key back!

replies.text: Your damerilias do look a bit wilted. I will go to your glade.
Eh, OK. This isn't worth the trouble. Fresh damerilias wouldn't look different after my travel back. Thank you, I will return to Stoutford directly.

conversationlist.message: Farewell then. Give my greetings to my sister-in-law.
And you will bring back my key to the glade? Then I would be the happiest person!
Oh, it is you again. Did you find my key?
You! You have no business here! Get out of my cave!

replies.text: Of course, sorry, please excuse the disturbance.
May I ask a question before I leave?

conversationlist.message: That was already a question! Hahaha! You are lucky that I am in good mood - and not hungry at the moment.
What do you want?

replies.text: I am looking for my brother Andor. Have you seen him?
I am looking for some flowers called damerilias.
Someone lost a key here. Once I have found the key, you can have your wet, dark hole to yourself again.

conversationlist.message: No. If your brother looks like you then I have never seen him, and if I had then I would have eaten him! Now go!

Everyone is after my damerilias! For what? Such ugly, stinking things!
No, I won't give you a single one. And you really should leave now, before I get hungry!

replies.text: What do you need damerilias for, if you don't like them?

conversationlist.message: The damerilias attract food for me; tasty, delicate, little people. Catching them is kind of a sport for me. It makes eating more fun.
But talking about food with a troll is not the smartest idea...
What do you know about the key? I keep the key safe. Are you associated with that thief who comes once a year and steals my damerilias?

replies.text: Do you mean Noraed? He is dead.

conversationlist.message: Dead? No - what a pity! I am really sorry. What a loss.
I was so looking forward to eating him.

replies.text: I would like to take some damerilias for his grave.

conversationlist.message: Forget it. Especially because you know those people who built that terrible statue near the entrance.

replies.text: What is terrible about that statue?

conversationlist.message: It is a bane for all trolls. We avoid going past, or even near, her.
I might let you go if you remove that ghastly statue. Maybe I'll even give you two of those ugly plants for that. Agreed?

replies.text: No. That statue is a blessing for the people here. Even if I could, I would not tear it down.

conversationlist.message: You lie. You think I am just a stupid troll.
Outrageous! I will put you in my pantry now.
Get away from there!
You may be a great warrior, but you are not a tall one. Maybe a jump with a runup?
That was close - just half an inch short. Try again!
You got hold of the shelves and tore them down!
Hey, this looks like Caeda's lost key.
Oh, it is you. Nice to meet you again.
Oh, it is you again. Did you find my key?

replies.text: Yes. Eh, no. I seem to have lost it. Wait, I'll go and find it.

conversationlist.message: You really found my key! Thank you - I can't believe it!

replies.text: A troll had taken the key, but he won't need it any more.

conversationlist.message: Oh, it is you again. Thank you again for bringing back my key.
With all these trolls around I don't feel safe to go through the cave and take care of the flowers in the glade.
The scorpions are bad enough, but the trolls are really dangerous. I know that they hate the statue, but I am scared they can reach past it.
Would it be too much to ask if you could get rid of the trolls?

replies.text: I can teach them to stay further away from the statue. No problem.

conversationlist.message: Is the passage to the glade safe again?

replies.text: No, not yet. I guess there are at least 30 trolls to kill. I will go after them again.

conversationlist.message: Please do, and come to me when you are done with them.
Is the passage to the glade safe again?

replies.text: Yes, I have dealt with most of the trolls. They won't dare to bother you for a long time.

conversationlist.message: Thank you so much! I wish you safe travels back to Stoutford. If you want to go to the glade next time you are in Remgard, just ask me for the key.

replies.text: Thank you. I will leave now.

conversationlist.message: Oh, it is you again. Thank you for all you have done.

replies.text: Could you give me the key for the glade again?
It was all for the Shadow.

conversationlist.message: Yes, of course. I will give you my father's key. Keep it. Then you can always pick damerilias for Noraed's grave.

replies.text: That would be great, thank you.

conversationlist.message: Here is the key. I will move to the glade and retire there. It is the most beautiful place in the world.

replies.text: So I will meet you there. Bye.

conversationlist.message: Damerilias. I haven't seen one in a long time. Try with Caeda, she used to give us a damerilia sometimes.
I don't know where she might be at the moment. And I have work to do now, so excuse me.
No. Excuse me, I have work to do.
Thank you very much for the flowers. Is there anything I can do for you?

replies.text: Your potion was great! Can I have some more?
That potion you made smells really interesting. Can I buy another?

conversationlist.message: No, sorry.

Oh. They're beautiful!
Thank you! Here, take this potion as your reward.
How did you find these flowers?

replies.text: Caeda, Noraed's sister, gave them to me. She sends you her condolences.
I found them in the wild around Remgard.

conversationlist.message:
Is that so?
Remgard must be a beautiful place to have such nice flowers growing in the wild.

replies.text: Beautiful, but deadly to get there!

conversationlist.message: Anyway. Thank you very much.
Noraed had a sister? He never talked about his family. He said he had a happy childhood, but that's it. I think he didn't want me to ask to go there with him. I'd love to meet her someday.

replies.text: I'm sure she feels the same.

conversationlist.message: I gave you my last one, and I can't brew potions anymore.
It is something I gave up long ago.
It's a long story.

replies.text: Never mind. Now I understand why Noraed traveled so far every year.

conversationlist.message: My father was the alchemist of this town. He was very talented, and inspired. He experimented with all sorts of ingredients from all over Dhayavar. Whatever he could get from the travellers stopping at Stoutford.
He created unique potions, and no other alchemist that I have heard of managed to reproduce his recipes.
When he deemed me old and responsible enough, he started teaching me his art.
He passed away a few years later. They said he poisoned himself during a new experiment, but I never believed it.

replies.text: Sorry, I have to go now.

conversationlist.message: Our priest, Tahalendor, was convinced by my uncle, Blornvale, my father's own brother.
My uncle also convinced the whole village that I was too young to be their alchemist, and that they needed him to take over the shop.

They all agreed, even though my uncle is a lousy alchemist.
I was sent to work on a farm, while my uncle took my father's house and opened the shop again.
Everyone suffered from the nasty side effects of my uncle's ... I can't say potions ... poisonous imitations of my father's recipes.
People complained at first, but nobody ever looked for a real solution.
Seeing how things turned out, I came to suspect that my uncle is responsible for my father's death.

replies.text: And would you brew more potions if you had your father's shop back?

conversationlist.message: No. Every time I talk to him, he denies everything, and calls me crazy. I can tell he's lying though.

replies.text: And would you brew more potions if you had your father's shop back?

conversationlist.message: Maybe. If the villagers asked me to, and if they recognize the guilt of my uncle.

replies.text: Can I help you with this?

conversationlist.message: You have already done so much for me. I cannot accept that.
Really? Then I think I have a plan.
My uncle is very cautious with me, but with an unknown kid, there's a chance we can make him confess.
He's a dangerous man though. Are you sure you wish to confront him?

replies.text: Eh, I'd better leave now. It's none of my business.

conversationlist.message: Then it's settled.

To begin, you'll have to buy some potions of the brave from him. I need these as the base for a potion I want to create.
Don't forget: three potions of the brave.

replies.text: What will you do with them?

conversationlist.message: The potion of the brave can be enhanced to the much more useful potion of truth. These additions are easy, but for the potion of the brave I would need a laboratory.
That is why you must get the potions of the brave from Blornvale. Oh how I hate that name! Be quick.

replies.text: By chance, I have three potions of the brave with me. Here, take them.

conversationlist.message: Did you get the three potions of the brave from Blornvale?

replies.text: Yes, I have them. But I won't give them to you.

conversationlist.message: Great! This will finally break him.

replies.text: I hope so. He is a most unfriendly guy.

conversationlist.message: What? Do you betray me? We must get rid of Blornvale!

replies.text: I don't quit think so. He is an honest person.
I'm just kidding. Here, take the three potions.

conversationlist.message: I would not have expected that from you!
Aryfora just glares at you. Her eyes are icy cold.

Now I take three potions of the brave *chanting* ... add my prepared ingredients *chanting* ... shake it *chanting* ... shake it - ready.
Here, be careful with it. Potions of truth are rare.

replies.text: Thank you. What do you have in mind now?

conversationlist.message: Isn't it obvious?
With the potion of truth you will make Blornvale confess that he poisoned his brother.

replies.text: But who would believe me, a stranger?

conversationlist.message: You are right. We need a credible witness...
Best would be Tahalendor himself. Yes, you must persuade the priest to be present when Blornvale tells the whole story.

replies.text: Tahalendor? How can I do that?

conversationlist.message: I have full confidence in you. You will come up with something.
Did Blornvale drink the potion of truth?
Did Blornvale drink the potion of truth?

replies.text: Yes. I just have to make him confess to the murder.

conversationlist.message: Any news about the murderer?

replies.text: Yes, he confessed to poisoning your father.

conversationlist.message: Any news about the murderer?

replies.text: Yes, but it's not good news. He guessed that I tried to entrap him, and is cautious now.

conversationlist.message: Oh no! Now I will never get justice!
You look like you are in a good mood. What did you accomplish?

replies.text: Blornvale is gone! Tahalendor came to hear him give a detailed confession to the murder. Then he took him away.

conversationlist.message: At last! How can I thank you?

replies.text: Oh, that was just a trifle.
No problem. I can handle myself.

conversationlist.message: Now I can move back into my father's house and create potions again. I will leave at once. Please come and visit me at any time.
Welcome! I already created some good potions - better than Blornvale's stuff. Want to have a look?

replies.text: Of course! Please show me what you have.
Can I get your masterpiece, the potion of deftness?
It's good to see you happy again.

conversationlist.message: Well, no. Somehow I have the feeling that you did not always tell the truth about the damerilias. I don't think that you are old enough to get such a potent potion.

replies.text: Then let me see your other potions, please.
I have to leave now - bye.

conversationlist.message:
I won't sell this potion for money. You can pay me in flowers - damerilias of course.
I will give you one potion of deftness for three damerilias.

replies.text: OK, I have some damerilias with me.

conversationlist.message: Here, I have one potion for you.

replies.text: Thank you, that is enough for today.

conversationlist.message: Welcome! I already created some good potions - better than Blornvale's stuff. Want to have a look?

replies.text: Of course! Show me, what you have, please.
Could you give me of your masterpiece, the potion of deftness?
Nice to see you happy again.

conversationlist.message: Did you kill this brute behind my house?
You lie. You shouldn't try that on a potion maker.
You have indeed killed this brute behind my house!

Welcome to my shop kid.
My potions are not for the faint of heart. Do you want to take a look?
Wait! You look rather disappointed. Are you displeased with my selection?
What did you expect? You are a kid after all. I can't give you strong potions!

replies.text: You are right. Have a nice day.
I can handle myself - shall I prove it?

It is not for me of course. My father and his men are fighting in Flagstone right now. They urgently need some useful potions, not soap! I think three potions of the brave would do it, if you happen to have them. And possibly more, if it is good stuff.

conversationlist.message: Ah. Oh. That changes everything. Wait a second.
Hmm, yes. How could you prove it? Let me think...
I know - sometimes there is a great dark wolf behind the house. Kill him!

replies.text: Oops - I must go now. See you.
No problem! I'll be right back.

conversationlist.message: Come, I will show you my special selection.

replies.text: OK, let's see if it's more interesting than soap.

conversationlist.message: Ah, my best customer! Do you want to buy more potions?

replies.text: Your potions are unhealthy. Two of our men drank them, and now they are complaining of bad stomachache.
Your potions are unhealthy. A friend of mine drank it, and now he is complaining of bad stomachache.

conversationlist.message: That cannot be! My potions are not bad, and never have any side effects!

replies.text: Well, who believes that? Prove it!

conversationlist.message: Is there any left over from the potions?

replies.text: Yes, here. I still have one bottle of your potion of the brave.
No, I poured all the rest away.

conversationlist.message: Then you can never prove it. That's good. Out now, leave my shop, you scum!
Do you see me drinking? Yes? Anything wrong? No - this potion is just perfect!

replies.text: Yes. I'm just curious if you will still think so in a minute.

conversationlist.message: What ... what is this? I feel strange...

replies.text: [Loud voice] Tahalendor! Come in, we can start!
Well, it looks like the potion is already working. Blornvale - that is your name. Right?

conversationlist.message: Yes.

replies.text: How did you kill Aryfora's father, your own brother?

conversationlist.message: He was naive enough to take a potion from me. I poisoned him with the potion of Quick Death.

replies.text: I thought so. Didn't you worry that someone would suspect you?

conversationlist.message: Only an alchemist could have found out, so I had only Aryfora herself to fear. But no one believed her accusations.

replies.text: That's enough evidence, thank you. I am going to bring Tahalendor here.

conversationlist.message: Well, it looks like the potion is already working. Blornvale, how did you kill Aryfora's father, your own brother?
He was naive enough to take a potion from me. I poisoned him with the potion of Quick Death.
I thought so. Didn't you worry that someone would suspect you?
Only an alchemist could have found out, so I had only Aryfora herself to fear. But no one believed her accusations, not even you, Tahalendor.
I have heard enough. Thank you, kid. I will ensure that Blornvale never makes trouble again.
You dare to come here again?
As you wish.
Talk to Yolgen. He handles such things for me.
We are on the road to Blackwater mountain, so many traders used to pass through Stoutford and stay at the inn.
That's all changed though. The path to Blackwater mountain has been blocked by a rockfall. There is also the prison that's just east of here.
Flagstone prison. We never liked it being so close. Who would? But recently something happened, and it was overrun by monsters.
There's a guard that protects the path, but without a good reason to come this way most people choose not to risk it. And then of course, there are the monsters coming from the south.

replies.text: I'm tired of hearing about your problems.

conversationlist.message: We think they come from Mount Galmore, and they keep attacking our town.

replies.text: I'm sorry to hear about all the trouble, but there's something else I wanted to talk about.

conversationlist.message: We think they came from Mount Galmore, and they recently started attacking the town. We can fight them off, but they deter travelers from coming here.

replies.text: OK. Could you repeat what you said about that other mountain.

conversationlist.message: Follow the path to the west. There are two settlements there, Prim and Blackwater mountain Settlement. There has been a rockfall though, making it very difficult to get to them.

replies.text: Thanks for the information. What was it you said about the monsters?

conversationlist.message: Of course not. We have some fields where we grow crops. And we have a number of goats.
Goats are very versatile. They eat almost anything, provide both milk and meat, and their hides make excellent clothing.
With supplies from other towns being so limited, getting the goats was an excellent idea. My idea, of course.

replies.text: *Sigh*. The whole town would obviously starve if it were not for you. Thanks for the information though.
How about you quit with the bragging, and show me what you have to trade.
Whatever. Why don't we go back to what you said about the monsters and that mountain.

conversationlist.message: Welcome to my shop. Are you looking for anything in particular?

replies.text: Please show me everything you have available.
I am looking for my brother, Andor. Have you seen anyone recently that looks a bit like me?
Can you tell me anything about Stoutford?

conversationlist.message: I did see someone that might have been your brother. He was with a rather dubious looking person. They didn't stay around here very long though. Sorry, but that's all I can tell you. You should ask around town. Other townsfolk may know more.

replies.text: Thanks. I'll go and do that now.
Please show me what you have to trade.
OK. Can you tell me anything about Stoutford?

conversationlist.message: Stoutford is a small town, and life used to be easy here. A lot of traders stayed in Stoutford on their way to and from Blackwater mountain, and spent money that boosted the economy of the whole town. Those days are gone though.
The path to Blackwater mountain was cut off by a rock fall. That stopped most of the traders from coming here. The attacks by the monsters stopped the rest.

replies.text: How do I get to Blackwater mountain?

conversationlist.message: Just follow the path west, but you will have to find a way past the rockfall.

replies.text: Thanks for the directions. I'm headed there right now.
Thanks for the information. Please show me what you have to trade.

conversationlist.message: They started attacking the town recently. Nobody is sure why. Their attacks have been unsuccessful, so we are all hoping that they will give up soon and go back to wherever they came from.

replies.text: Thanks for the information, but I have to leave.
Thanks for the information. Do you have anything to trade?
Thanks. I'm looking for my brother, Andor. Has anyone new been through here recently?
How do I get to Blackwater mountain?

conversationlist.message: Yes, indeed. My daughter has not come home for some days. I don't know what's happened to her.

replies.text: And you have no idea where she might be?

conversationlist.message: I've been looking for her all over Stoutford. She does not leave the city. So she can only be in the castle, or kidnapped, or worse.

replies.text: Did you already look for her in the castle?

conversationlist.message: You cannot go to the castle anymore, do not you know that? At least not if you want to continue living.

replies.text: I see. She will certainly reappear soon. In the meantime you could show me everything you have for sale.
I am also looking for someone: my brother, Andor. Have you seen anyone recently that looks a bit like me?
OK. Can you tell me anything about Stoutford?
I'm not afraid. I could have a look in the castle.

conversationlist.message: You would do that for me? I can hardly accept your offer.

replies.text: No problem, but first I have something else I wish to discuss.

conversationlist.message: Gyra is back and has told me everything. Many thanks again for your help.

replies.text: I was happy to do it.

conversationlist.message: Please give the helmet to its owner Lord Bourbon - eh, Lord Berbane I mean. He will be in the tavern.

replies.text: I did that already. But he didn't seem to be happy about it.
I did that already. Although he won't need it, because the castle is already clear of the undead.

conversationlist.message: Buzzzzz
Here lies Zorin, the first to tend this glade. Its beauty would be diminished without him.
You see large shapes moving in the shadows to the east. It looks dangerous that way!
They don't seem to want to come in your direction though. Maybe it has something to do with the statue?
Baaaaaa!
Many of the trolls are dead now. The rest will no longer dare to approach the statue.
Pick the flower?
You picked the flower.
Pick the flower?
You picked the flower.
Pick the flower?
You picked the flower.
Pick the flower?
You picked the flower.
Pick the flower?
You picked the flower.

Oh, that is a long story my friend. This town has existed for ages and it used to be a prosperous and well visited outpost on the border of the Aewhata Kingdom. We used to trade with Fallhaven and Prim.
Stoutford used to be the seat of Lord Erwyn of house Gorland. But during the Noble Wars 17 years ago, everything changed.
Well, the Noble Wars were one of the darkest periods of our history. They lasted only 3 years but brought great misery to most of the area.

When our great King Luthor died and left the throne with no heir the three mighty lords of the land soon enough began fighting over the title as successor. They were Lord Erwyn of Stoutford, Lord Geomyr of Feygard, who used to be the advisor to King Luthor, and Lord Emeric of Nor City. The former capital of Fallhaven at first remained neutral.
While Erwyn and Emeric fought to capture the central area, Lord Geomyr waited for the right moment and crushed his enemies with his great army. He has ruled the Kingdom ever since with an iron hand.

replies.text: Why do you say iron hand?

conversationlist.message: Well, he has installed garrisons in pretty much every village, introduced a tax system and now he even wants to prohibit the worship of the mighty Shadow! This is outrageous!

replies.text: I will clear the castle of undead for you.

conversationlist.message: Yes, incredible! Although kids like you should not play with such things.

replies.text: I will clear the castle of undead for you.

conversationlist.message: Well, to the east, there's Flagstone prison. To the south, there's Mt. Galmore. That's definitely a place that you don't want to go to. To the northwest, we have our railway terminal, and going west beyond that, you come to our border post at the Blackwater river. Nothing but bogs and marshes westwards of that. And finally, to the north, we had a tunnel leading to Prim and the Elm mine, in the heart of Blackwater mountain.

replies.text: Can you tell me more about Flagstone?
Can you tell me more about Mt. Galmore?
Can you tell me more about the railway terminal northwest of here?
Can you tell me more about Blackwater mountain?
There is something else I wanted to know.

conversationlist.message: Flagstone Prison was built four hundred years ago by house Gorland of Stoutford, and was used until the Noble Wars, when the house was vanquished by its enemies. They mostly used it to detain people that were worshipping the "old gods".
That dreadful place has been left abandoned ever since. Recently, however, undead have started pouring out of the prison, and we had to send guards to keep them away from the road.

replies.text: Can I help you with Flagstone?
Is there anything I could help you with?
There was something else I wanted to ask you about.

conversationlist.message: Mt. Galmore? It has been our bane for a long time. Garthan I, the founder of Aewhata Kingdom, ordered the excavation of the mountain for gold and gems 430 years ago.

Local lore says that fortifications were built to protect against monster attacks, and an enormous network of mine tunnels was dug under the mountain. They found rich ore veins and the mine flourished.
But their success didn't last long. It is said that after a few years unspeakable horrors overwhelmed the knights and miners of the King, and the mine has been abandoned ever since.

However, recently more and more of the most foul monsters are coming from the mountain and we have to fend them off. With the rise of undead knights in the castle and Lord Erwyn's demise we struggle more and more.

replies.text: That sounds dreadful. Can I help you with the castle?
Is there anything I could do to help?
There was something else I wanted to ask you about.

conversationlist.message: Well, you already were of great help. Thank you again!
Well, you look a bit young. But I guess we could still make use of you in these dark times. Let me think about some tasks I can offer you.

replies.text: What about the undead in the castle?

conversationlist.message: Could you help with Flagstone?

replies.text: OK. I will go to the prison.
I cleared Flagstone of an evil demon.

conversationlist.message: Can you clear the castle?

replies.text: Sure. All the undead will soon be dead!

conversationlist.message: I hate this place. It rains all the time and I can't stand the eerie screams of the undead!
This is both good and bad news. I am truly grateful that you rid us of the warden and his thralls. Talk to Yolgen for a reward. We will make sure that we recover this prisoner.

replies.text: Thank you. Shadow be with you.

conversationlist.message: If you could help with Flagstone, it would take a big burden off us.

replies.text: I have been inside Flagstone, but I will go back and find out more.
OK, I will take a look.

conversationlist.message: Oh that is good news! I am very pleased that the citizens of Stoutford have one thing less to worry about. It is a pity that we didn't send guards to investigate the prison earlier. Then all of this wouldn't have happened. Here, take this gold.

replies.text: Thank you kindly. I am happy to help.
Thank you kindly. Shadow be with you.

conversationlist.message: Yes, thanks to you my friend, we don't need to worry about the undead anymore.

replies.text: There was something else I wanted to ask you about.
Where do you think they came from?

conversationlist.message: Bah, why did you ask then anyway?
We do have a problem. Our soldiers usually guard the castle gate to Mt. Galmore to keep the monsters away from the Kingdom.

However, five days ago, the undead knights of Lord Erwyn started to rise from their grave. I have no idea why this happened. We haven't been able to recapture the castle yet. I would ask you to rid us of this plague.

replies.text: It sounds more like a task for the guards. I'll go and talk to the captain of the guard.
No problem. They are already as good as dead.
Hmm, I wonder where they came from.
No thanks. I think that's way over my head.

conversationlist.message: Before you leave, go to Tahalendor. He might give you something that helps against undead.

replies.text: There was something else I wanted to ask you about.

conversationlist.message: As I said, we've got our railway terminal to the west.
We used to trade food and tools with Prim and the miners from Elm mine and get loads of iron ingots in return. We shipped them on to Nor City and Feygard and prospered from the trade.

Further to the west, there's the border outpost next to Blackwater River. Anyway, from what I have heard there's nothing but bogs, marshes and grasslands west of the river, along with a few native tribes.

replies.text: Is there anything I could do to help?
There was something else I wanted to ask you about.

conversationlist.message: Ah another mortal! You shall be another servant in Lord Erwyn's army! Ha Ha!

replies.text: No thank you. Maybe another time.

conversationlist.message: What do I seee? A mortal? Your bonesss shall be clattering on the ground soon enoughhh!

replies.text: How about you show me what that would look like?

conversationlist.message: Ah, your ssskull will be my favorite cup!

replies.text: Yes, but I also like it very much. So I'd rather keep it.

conversationlist.message: Bonesss! Niccce little bonesss!!
I shall crush you little mortal!

replies.text: For that you have to get me first, lazybones!

conversationlist.message: You see a heavily armed and cloaked skeleton moving towards you. This must be Lord Erwyn himself.
Did you come to serve me? On your knees!

replies.text: What would I gain from that?
You are very rude and poorly educated. Maybe I should introduce myself? $playername is my name.
I will serve you - my weapon. Attack!

conversationlist.message: Did you come to serve me? On your knees!

replies.text: What would I gain from that?
You are very rude and poorly educated. Maybe I should introduce myself? $playername is my name.
I will serve you - my weapon. Attack!

conversationlist.message: Gain? I am the one who gains!

replies.text: No, that's not acceptable. Do you have anything better to offer?

conversationlist.message: Your name does not matter. Are you going to kneel now?

replies.text: No. The floor is not clean here.

conversationlist.message: You shall die now mortal!

replies.text: No, you are going to die once and for all!

conversationlist.message: I followed Tahalendor's advice, and placed one coin in each eye socket. Not long after, Lord Erwyn's remains crumbled to dust. He is gone for good.
I'm not dead, so you can't kill me. Haha. You don't know much about the undead, do you kid? You can't destroy me!

replies.text: There must be a way to put an end to this.

conversationlist.message: Let me see... You already killed some of Erwyn's undead knights and soldiers - if killed is the correct word for undead. But there are some still around.

replies.text: OK, I will go and look for the rest.

conversationlist.message: Let me see... No, the castle is still crowded with undead soldiers.
I just know. Don't try to fool me.
Let me see... OK, you killed all of the undead knights and soldiers who had worn Lord Erwyn's tattered banner.
And you slew Lord Erwyn's commander.
But their commander is still around.

replies.text: OK, I will go and look for him.

conversationlist.message: And you slew Lord Erwyn himself.
But Lord Erwyn is still around.

replies.text: OK, I will go and look for him.

conversationlist.message: That is unbelievable!

replies.text: Well, it was a tough fight, but I managed to slay Lord Erwyn himself.
The undead are no match for me.

conversationlist.message: Did you search him?

replies.text: Sure. I found this ring among his remains.
[Lie] He had nothing of any worth on him.

conversationlist.message: I am very pleased to hear this. A ring you say? Let me take a look.

Hmm. This looks most interesting. I suspected something like this. It is certainly some magical item and seems to have the powers to reanimate the dead. I am indeed very grateful that you brought this ring to me. We should destroy it once and for all to avoid further trouble.

replies.text: Sounds fine to me. Anything for the safety of the people of Stoutford.

conversationlist.message: Yolgen puts the ring on his altar and chants a spell. Suddenly the altar seems to be getting darker and darker and then the ring cracks.

That is it. The ring is destroyed. I wonder where it came from. Maybe from the depths of Mt. Galmore, or some mischievous traveller put it on Lord Erwyn's remains? Anyway, my friend, I and the people of Stoutford are most grateful.

replies.text: Thank you. Shadow be with you.

conversationlist.message: He was there without any of his ... special items? Did you look thoroughly?

replies.text: [Lie] Yes, but I found nothing worth having.
I found a strange glowing ring. But I prefer to keep it. You have enough such toys, I am sure.
Yes, indeed, look at this ring.

conversationlist.message: If you say so. I suspect Lord Erwyn had a ring, and if you find it you must bring it to me. It is dangerous.

replies.text: Thank you for the warning. I wonder who had owned the ring before Erwyn.

conversationlist.message: You're insane! Lord Erwyn's ring is dangerous. It must be destroyed!

replies.text: No, I don't think so. I wonder who had owned the ring before Erwyn?
You are probably right. Here is the ring.

conversationlist.message: Do not play with ancient forces that are beyond your power.

replies.text: Now I'm even more curious who the ring belonged to. Farewell, Yolgen.

conversationlist.message: Ah. Blackwater mountain. I will try to keep a long story short. We used to trade food and tools with Prim and the miners from Elm mine, and get loads of iron ingots in return. We shipped them on to Nor City and Feygard and prospered from the trade.
A few months ago, everything changed. A sudden violent earthquake shook the mountain and our railway tunnel to Prim collapsed.
At almost the same time, those Gornaud beasts attacked us, and with all the trouble we're having we haven't been able to restore the tunnel yet.
There hasn't been any contact with Prim since then, so we no longer have any trade with them. That means there are also fewer travellers coming from Fallhaven and Nor City. It's a shame.

replies.text: Is there anything I can help with?
There was something else I wanted to ask you about.

conversationlist.message:
Stoutford Castle

[Scribbled below] Death awaits you
These are hard days. It is nice to see kids like you still strolling around.
It is a lovely day for a drink. Come and join me.

replies.text: Thank you, maybe some other time.

conversationlist.message: Hey, kid, get out of here immediately!
Hey, kid, what are you doing here?
Get out! Immediately, naughty child!
My name is Borlag. I am chief of the local guards here.

replies.text: Aha. And why are you sitting here in your tower instead of driving the undead out of the castle?
What are you doing here at the moment?

conversationlist.message: Oh, I'm working on a strategy to win back the castle. I have already made 17 plans. Now I have to compare and rate them.
So young and already hanging around in taverns?

replies.text: No, I am looking for my brother Andor. Maybe you have seen him?
At least I am not drinking whole bottles on my own, like that guy at the next table.

conversationlist.message: Yes, I have seen a boy that looks a bit like you. Not too long ago. But he is gone and I can not say where he was bound to.

replies.text: What a pity. At least someone has seen him. Better than nothing.

conversationlist.message: Well said. I hope for your sake that you will choose other amusements.

replies.text: He looks rather well off. Who is he?

conversationlist.message: That is Lord Bourbon ... - I mean Lord Berbane of Stoutford. His name invites a nasty pun, but honestly, he does not do much to show a different character.
Lord Bourbon sits there every evening, drinking or telling fairy tales. Or he plays his lute and sings to it. I must admit he has a reasonable voice.

replies.text: He is the heir to Stoutford Castle?

conversationlist.message: Correct, although there is not much in the way of heirlooms left. And the castle is almost in ruins now, after the raid.
And now you should run home and go to bed. Your parents should take better care of you and your brothers.
The richly dressed man does not react.

replies.text: Yolgen asked me to help clear the castle of undead. Shall we do it together?
Gyra found your helmet and asked me to give it to you, so that you could start to clear the castle.
The castle is clean of undead now.

conversationlist.message: Gyra? My dearest and most eager listener?
Many of my songs are about this magical helmet. But it's all just songs.

replies.text: Will you make the songs a reality now?
I cleared the castle of undead already.

conversationlist.message: He sighs and slowly takes the helmet.
Lord Berbane looks sadly at his bottle, but still shows no sign of getting up.

replies.text: The castle is clean of undead now.

conversationlist.message: Lord Berbane jumps up and cries with a loud voice: SILENCE!
[Loud voice] Pay attention and listen everybody! The castle is free! The trembling is over!
[Loud voice] My trainee and I, we were in the castle. I demonstrated how to fight properly. Lord Erwyn himself was an especially good demonstration object.
[Loud voice] But we will come to the details later - after the next round.
[Loud voice] Yes, he has carried my magical helmet for me. I will take it back now.
[Loud voice] Yes, he has learned much from me. But no need to thank me now.

[Low voice] Well-behaved.
[Loud voice] And now: Mead for everyone! Let's be merry! Forget all sorrows!
Lord Berbane is singing merrily about his heroic deeds.

replies.text: Psst. I have something for you.

conversationlist.message: Why are you disturbing my song?

replies.text: Gyra found your helmet and asked me to give it to you.

conversationlist.message: Ah yes, one of my helmets. Thank you.
Anything else?

replies.text: Here you go. You're welcome. No, I don't need a reward. I always like to help without appreciation. Everything is OK. Bye.

conversationlist.message: Oh, when does the shift end? I want to have some cold mead right now.
Stoutford shall prevail in these hard times, traveler.
Hi kid. It is nice and warm here next to the fire. Come and make yourself comfortable.

replies.text: Ah, no thank you. I have more interesting things to do.

conversationlist.message: What are you doing out here all alone?

replies.text: I am looking for my brother Andor. Have you seen him by any chance?

conversationlist.message: No. We're on a military exercise right now.
We saw another horde of undead approach the castle just as we left. We hurried here, so that we can complete our exercise and be back in time to be able to help.

replies.text: You mean, you ran away just in time, before you got involved in the fight?

conversationlist.message: Ow, the way you put it, that doesn't sound nice.

replies.text: Cowardice. I'll report that to your commander.
I had better leave now. You do not need to hurry with your exercise. All your comrades have already been killed by the undead.

conversationlist.message: No, you won't.
Hi kid, should we play hide and seek?

replies.text: Oh yes, I love hide and seek!
Leave me alone, I am too old for silly games.

conversationlist.message: Great! Count to ten, then I will hide.

replies.text: OK, I'll close my eyes now. 1, 2, 3...

conversationlist.message: I am ready!
You found me too quickly! Once more, please. Count to ten again!
Hey, you found me again! Once more?
You didn't count to 10! Don't cheat. Another time!
Are you sure you didn't cheat this time?

replies.text: Of course not. So go and hide again, quick! 1, 2, 3...

conversationlist.message: You found me again! Once...
How did you know I'm here?

replies.text: I won't reveal my secrets so easily. Now disappear, I'm already counting. 1, 2, 3...

conversationlist.message: No! Wait!
That time it took you a bit longer to find me!
Ha ha - no! I have to go home for lunch now. What a pity. I had fun with you! See you!
You wouldn't rest here.
Beam me up - enabled.
Help! You must help me! Please!

replies.text: What is your problem, my little one?

conversationlist.message: I am Gyra, Odirath's daughter. My father is the armorer of Stoutford, a very important man.
I was looking for Lord Bourbon's helmet, when I was surprised by these monsters.
So I hid here in the storeroom and didn't dare to leave the hiding place.

replies.text: Eh, I will be back soon. Maybe. But ... probably not, no. I hate kids.
Of course I will help you. Just follow me.

conversationlist.message: Great! It is so important that Lord Bourbon gets his helmet. Then he will drive out these monsters!
I started to look in the main house, but maybe we have to search the whole castle.
Please go ahead. I will follow you, probably.

replies.text: OK, just stay close to me.
Let me carry you for a while.

conversationlist.message: I will follow you wherever you go. Only if I'm too scared, then I will stay where I am. For example, I will never go to Flagstone.
You may have to carry me from time to time. I'll jump off your back again when I'm rested.
NO! Please not through the gate! I won't go there!
No! Please not to Flagstone! I won't go there!
Now I know the way. I run to my dad and tell him the whole story.
No, I won't go home without the helmet! We must go back and find it. You promised to help me with this.
You don't need to carry me anymore, I can walk by myself again.
I think that Lord Bourbon's helmet must be somewhere in a castle building.
To find the helmet, we should really search all the rooms within the castle and its walls.
I have a feeling that we are very close.
Look there, behind the cupboard!
And now back home quickly!

replies.text: I would never have found the helmet without you.

conversationlist.message: Look there, under the bed!
Look there, behind the crack in the wall!
Greetings, $playername! Come, sit down and chat with me a little bit over a cup of tea.
Would you like a cup of good southern blend?
Here you are.

replies.text: Who are you and how do you know my name?

conversationlist.message: *chuckles* Very clever. You should not trust strangers nowadays.

replies.text: Who are you and how do you know my name?
Right. That's why I'm leaving now.

conversationlist.message: You have not finished all the fights. So what are you doing here?
Oh, I know many things. A good leader has to keep his eyes and ears open.

replies.text: You command the undead soldiers down there?
You didn't answer my question. Who are you?

conversationlist.message: No, do not worry. I have nothing to do with the undead here in the castle. I just find them interesting.

replies.text: Do you have any idea what the undead are doing here?

conversationlist.message: No. I expected Lord Berbane's men to be here. But these undead are a nice change.
I am Colonel Lutarc, maybe you have already heard of me? No? Whatever.

replies.text: May I ask what you are doing here?

conversationlist.message: Isn't that obvious? I am enjoying my tea here. It is a splendid place. I really like it here.

replies.text: You do have a nice view from here.
You drink tea while fighting is going on down there?

conversationlist.message: Indeed. I come often to watch my warriors down there as they fight.
It was nice to see how easily you killed the undead knight.

replies.text: Oh that - a small thing for me...

conversationlist.message: It was nice to see how easily you killed the undead soldier.

replies.text: Oh that - a small thing for me...

conversationlist.message: I'm always impressed when I see a good fighter at work.

replies.text: Just tell me what you want from me.

conversationlist.message: Now I am curious about how well you could handle a number of my better warriors. Would you like to try?

replies.text: Sure. After I have finished my tea of course.
Why not? A little challenge is always good.
Maybe some other time. I have to leave now.

conversationlist.message: Take your time.
This is really an excellent tea, right?
I had not noticed that the cups are so big.
You are really a connoisseur.
We have all the time in the world. Do not hurry.
The Colonel looks at you silently now.
Good. Please go to the foot of this hill, right down there, by the gate.
There I will have five of my more interesting fighters compete against you.
One after the other of course...
Go now. Show me what you can do.
Get ready now for your first fight.
Have a lizard as warm up.
Not bad for the first one. Let's have the next.
Lost the first fight already. Well, let's have the next.

replies.text: This time I will make more effort.

conversationlist.message: Ready for your second fight?
Just some bones - should be easy.
Nicely done. Let's have the next.
Lost the second fight. Well, I have three more for you.

replies.text: Let me catch my breath for a moment.

conversationlist.message: Well, get ready now.
$playername! What do you think you are doing?!
We need you back home. Andor is back since a long time ago, and we have our hands full trying to control the rat plague.
Come with me now. And give me back my ring.

replies.text: Sure, here is your ring. It was very useful in the beginning, but I don't need it anymore.
I don't have it anymore, sorry.
[Lie] I don't have it anymore, sorry.
[Lie] I don't have it anymore, sorry. This ring on my finger just looks similar.

conversationlist.message:
[Ring taken]
Thank you, stupid kid.
You think you are clever? Useless kid!
Double surprise!
Surprise!
I am impressed. You won the fight with my poser.
A poser can imitate someone you have had in mind recently. Also, if you give him some object, then he can turn it into a second duplicate.

replies.text: Yes, but two Mikhails were a little bit too conspicuous.

conversationlist.message: A poser can imitate a person you have had in mind recently, if you don't give him anything.

replies.text: So Mikhail wasn't really here and I didn't kill him. I'm relieved.

conversationlist.message: I knew you would lose this one.
Now to your next opponent.
This one looks like a little dragon.
Nicely done.
Lost against a little worm. Well, well, well.
Your last opponent will be something big. Don't underestimate him.

replies.text: I hope it will last a bit longer than the others.

conversationlist.message: Come, Bully.
That was it. Relax a bit.
Lost the last fight, of course. I thought so.

replies.text: This one was far too strong indeed.

conversationlist.message: Come up to me now.
You lost every fight. I really did not expect such a poor performance from you.

replies.text: They were far too strong, and they all fought in an unfair way.

conversationlist.message: You won every fight! Very good! I have not enjoyed myself so much for a long time.
I did not expect you to win against all of my fighters, but it's good to know that for sure. Thanks for trying it out.

replies.text: If you have more for me, just call.

conversationlist.message: Take this medallion as a token of my thanks.

replies.text: Very kind of you. Oh, how nice! There is a tiny little lizard on it. It looks completely real, just like the lizard I fought against.

conversationlist.message: Go now. I have to think.
Greetings, $playername.
Stop! You do not have permission to withdraw now. Go back to the fight.
You hear some mechanism rattle.
Neigh!
Neigh!!!

replies.text: One might think that you want something from me.
Haha, I think I'm going crazy. Horses can't talk.

conversationlist.message: Neigh! Neigh!!! neigh.

replies.text: Oh I see now. They left you here without anything to drink. Wait, Here is a bucket of water.
You are becoming gradually more annoying. I'm leaving now.

conversationlist.message: [After drinking greedily] Neiiieieiiigh!!

replies.text: There, now you feel better! I have to leave now.

conversationlist.message: Neigh.
Please don't kill me! I am too young to die.

replies.text: Eh, you do know that you are already dead?

conversationlist.message: Oh.
Do you know the password?
OK, then you may pass.
No? Without the password, I cannot let you pass.

replies.text: I will find the password and come back.
Haha, just kidding. Of course I know it.

conversationlist.message: Ah, I knew you did. You may pass.
Any news about the murderer?

replies.text: Yes, but it's not good news. Tahalendor won't believe me.

conversationlist.message: That was - a potion of truth! How dare you! Did you think I wouldn't recognize it?
You gave me a potion of truth! How dare you! Did you think I wouldn't recognize it?

replies.text: That will not help you. You are forced to tell the truth.

conversationlist.message: I don't think so. After all, I'm a potion maker and I have an antidote for it.
Ah, I see, Tahalendor is here too, fine. Tahalendor, here is a stupid little kid with too much imagination. Please take it with you.
Sorry Blornvale, first I have to ask you if you killed Aryfora's father, your own brother?
Of course not. Nobody is sadder about the loss than me.
Here, Tahalendor, I'll give you a bottle of your favorite potion. And please take this child with you when you go.
I will, sorry for disturbing you.
And you child, go away now and tell no more fairy tales.
No more talk. Go now!
Please don't disturb. We have to practice.
Kaverin, my old friend! It's good to hear that he is still alive. What is the message?

Hmm, yes... Let's see...
[Unzel opens the sealed message and reads it]
Yes, this makes sense with what I have seen.
Thank you for bringing it to me.
Your help could prove more valuable than you might realize.
Say hello to my old friend Kaverin the next time you see him, will you?
Hello again. Thank you for your help with defeating Vacor and bringing me the message from Kaverin.
Shadow, embrace me.
Bask in the Shadow, my child.

replies.text: What can you tell me about the Shadow?
Can you tell me more about the church?
Are the Bonemeal potions ready yet?

conversationlist.message: The Shadow protects us from the dangers of the night. It keeps us safe and comforts us when we sleep.

replies.text: Tharal sent me and told me to tell you the password 'Glow of the Shadow'.

conversationlist.message: This is our chapel of worship in Fallhaven. Our community turns to us for support.
This church has withstood hundreds of years, and has been kept safe from grave robbers.
Glow of the Shadow indeed my child. So my old friend Tharal in Crossglen village sent you?

replies.text: What can you tell me about bonemeal?

conversationlist.message: The catacombs beneath the church house the remains of our passed leaders. Our great King Luthor is rumored to be buried there.

replies.text: There was something else I wanted to talk about.

conversationlist.message: No one is allowed down in the catacombs, except for Athamyr, my apprentice. He is the only one that has been down there for years.

replies.text: OK, I might go see him.

conversationlist.message: Shhh, we shouldn't talk so loud about using bonemeal. As you know, Lord Geomyr issued a ban on all use of bonemeal.
When the ban came, I did not dare keep any, so I threw my whole supply away. It was quite foolish now that I look back on it.
Do you think you could find me 5 skeletal bones that I can use for mixing a bonemeal potion? The bonemeal is very potent in healing old wounds.

replies.text: Sure, I might be able to do that.
I have those bones for you.

conversationlist.message: Thank you, please come back soon. I heard there were some undead near an old abandoned house just north of Fallhaven. Maybe you can check for bones there?
Thank you, these bones will do fine. Now I can start creating some bonemeal healing potions for you.
Give me some time to mix the bonemeal potion. It is a very potent healing potion. Come back in a little while.
Yes, the bonemeal potions are ready. Please use them with care, and don't let the guards see you. We are not actually allowed to use them anymore.

replies.text: Let me see what potions you have made so far.
There was something else I wanted to talk about.

conversationlist.message: Turn back while you still can, mortal. This is no place for you. Only death awaits you here.

replies.text: Very well. I will turn back.
Move aside, I need to get deeper into the catacombs.
By the Shadow, you will not stop me.

conversationlist.message: Nooo, you shall not pass!
*hissss* What mortal disturbs my sleep?

replies.text: By the Shadow, what are you?
At last, a worthy fight! I have been waiting for this.
Whatever, let's get this over with.

conversationlist.message: When the other students see how you killed Golin, a panic breaks out. Screaming, they all run out of the building.
When the little students see how you killed their teacher, a panic breaks out. Screaming, they all run out of the building. Just Golin remains.
A panic breaks out. Screaming, all the little students run out of the building. Just Golin remains.
No. That is not acceptable. You can't be late to school and then sit in the last bench.
Who do we have here? A new kid? You are late for class. Sit down now, and be punctual next time.
No walking around in my lessons! Please sit down.
No talking, please.
In the glorious days of year 2177, the enslavement of men ended.
The world was formed new.
Our redeemers fought a bloody war to make the world worthy for us again. In exchange and out of deepest respect, men helped to build up vast cities and many underground places.
Little has been preserved from this period. Nor City is the only large city that has survived from this period. Their bright and magnificent flags were visible from afar in the surrounding area.
Just imagine all those mighty churches and splendid palaces! It was a merry time, down under Mt. Galmor, the highest mountain in whole Dhayavar.
What...? Don't interrupt me. Now I don't know where I was. I have to start from the beginning.
People were living happily and all was well. There was plenty of food and music everywhere.
I hope you will live to see it one day.
But one dark day, this treacherous liar, Elythara, appeared. Many men were betrayed by her blinding light.
They believed in her false promises and were misled.
Then Elytharan cultists arrived on the shore of the northern sea, which is also known as the Sea of Tears.
The cultists worshipped the blinding and cleansing light of Elythara. Clever and sneaky as they were, they have gained people's trust.
Partly with gold, partly with cunning and violence, they attracted more and more people to their side. Those who still wanted to walk the old ways often found their house burning.
A general distrust began, and it didn't take long until weapons were drawn. Brothers fought each other - the horrible War of Dawn began!
Psst...
Be quiet, please. How can I concentrate if you are talking all the time? Where was I? I had better start anew.

However Elythara and her cultists failed to completely annihilate the old ways. Many true men managed to hide in remote places in the total darkness, unknown to the Elytharans. Also Elythara's power is diminished underground.
Each city was ruled by one or two houses who closely collaborated with the Elytharan priests. People were mainly influenced by the Elytharan priests.
The Elytharans built several towns and cities, dedicated to their goddess. Several aristocratic houses were formed by that time.
First the Elytharans erected the city of Feygard on the shore of the Sea of Tears. It became a center of trade for the realm due to its access to the sea.
The town of Loneford was founded and it soon became famous for its fertile fields and healthy vegetable which fed the northern parts of the Forgotten Kingdom.
Blackwater Mountain was explored, and on its summit a large sanctuary for the Elytharan priests was erected.
The mining colony of Prim was also founded after pioneers found rich sources of iron and coal under the mountain.
The city of Fallhaven became a prospering center of trade due to its excellent location as a junction between the sanctuary of Blackwater Mountain, Stoutford, Nor City and Feygard.
Big storehouses were built to safely store shipments.
However, bands of thieves ...
Yes thieves. Dishonorable men who cut cheeky children's neck for a few pennies. But ... where was I?
You don't know what I just said? Then I had better start anew.

... were soon attracted by the growing wealth and united under one big organization, the Thieves' Guild, whose guild halls were secretly placed in Fallhaven, Feygard, and Nor City, those being the richest cities at that time.

However, bands of thieves were soon attracted by the growing wealth and united under one big organization, the Thieves' Guild, whose guild halls were secretly placed in Fallhaven, Feygard, and Nor City, those being the richest cities at that time.

Brimhaven has become an emerging, thriving city. Our importance will increase - you have it in your hands!

conversationlist.message: In front of the shrine, you find a book laying in the sand. 'Reflections on Kazaul rituals'.
You quickly look through the book, and find several chants and rituals of Kazaul.
There is one in particular that you spot, that talks of imbuing ancient artifacts with the power of Kazaul.
The ritual itself would require the heart of a lich, and from the text surrounding the ritual in the book, it could surely restore the helmet to its former glory.
You place yourself in front of the shrine, kneeling like the drawings in the book show.

conversationlist.message: You place the helmet on the ground in front of you, leaning it slightly against the shrine.

replies.text: Speak the words of the ritual from the book

conversationlist.message: You start reciting the words of the Kazaul tongue from the book, taking great care of saying the words exactly as the book states them.
As you speak the words, you notice a faint glow coming from the shrine, and you get the eerie feeling that the sand on the ground almost moves by itself.
The movements start to get more visible, almost as if there's something crawling under the sand.
As you get closer to the end of the ritual, the helmet falls forward, face down in the sand.
Once you speak the final words of the ritual, the ground sinks slightly in front of the shrine, taking part of the helmet down under the sand.
As you pull it out and dust off the sand, you notice a change in texture on the part that was submerged in the sand.
You take the helmet, and examine it more closely.
Along the side, you notice some ornaments that were not there before. The helmet also gives a slight tingling feeling in the hands as you hold it.
Completing the ritual must have restored the helmet to its former glory.
You see the shrine of Kazaul, where you performed the Kazaul ritual.
