Luckily, now Feygard has sent patrols up there to help guard the village at least. The people are still suffering though.
Me, I am certain that this is the work of those savages from Nor City somehow. They probably sabotaged something up there.
What do they call it, the 'Shadow'? They are willing to do almost anything to upset the law and order around here.
I tell you. Savages - that's what they are. No respect for the laws or authority.
Walk in the glow of the Shadow, my child.

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?
What can you tell me about bonemeal?
Do you have anything to help against food-poisoning?

conversationlist.message: Bonemeal? We shouldn't talk about that. Lord Geomyr issued a decree. It's not allowed anymore.
No, we really shouldn't talk about that.
Well if you really are that persistent. Bring me 5 insect wings that I can use for making potions and maybe we can talk more.

replies.text: Here, I have the insect wings.

conversationlist.message: Thanks kid. I knew I could count on you.
Oh yes, bonemeal. Mixed with the right components it can be one of the most effective healing agents around.
We used to use it extensively before. But now that bastard Lord Geomyr has banned all use of it.
How am I supposed to heal people now? Using regular healing potions? Bah, they're so ineffective.
I know someone that still has a supply of bonemeal if you are interested. Go talk to Thoronir, a fellow priest in Fallhaven. Tell him my password 'Glow of the Shadow'.
No, sorry. I hear that the potion-maker in Fallhaven can create something to help against that though.
You should go see him and ask if he has anything to help against that. He can probably help you.
Hello there. Nice weather ain't it?

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?

conversationlist.message: Hello. Anything you want from me?

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?

conversationlist.message: Hi. Can I help you?

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?

conversationlist.message: You're that kid from Crossglen village right?

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?

conversationlist.message: Out of the way, peasant.
Good day to you.

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?

conversationlist.message: No, sorry. I haven't seen anyone by that description.
Some other kid you say? Hmm, let me think.
Hmm, I might have seen someone matching that description a few days ago. Can't remember where though.
Oh yes, there was another kid from Crossglen village here a few days ago. Not sure he matched your description though.
There were some shady looking people following him around. Didn't see any more than that.
Nope. Haven't seen him.
Keep out of trouble.
Shadow be with you.

replies.text: Can you tell me more about the Shadow?

conversationlist.message: The Shadow protects us. It keeps us safe and comforts us when we sleep.
It follows us wherever we go. Go with the Shadow my child.
Well hello there! Aren't you a cute little fellow.

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?

conversationlist.message: Your brother, you say? His name is Andor? No. I don't recall meeting anyone like that.
I heard you helped my old man find his book, thank you. He had been talking about that book for weeks. Poor thing, he tends to forget things.

replies.text: You should keep an eye on him, or bad things might happen to him.
Whatever, I just did it for the gold.

conversationlist.message: Welcome to my shop. Please browse my selection of fine clothing and jewelry.
Hello. You made it here, good.

replies.text: I talked to some people in the village Prim. They had some interesting things to say about Blackwater mountain.
I went east, as you said.

conversationlist.message: Good. Now let's get up this mountain. I will meet you halfway up there.
This path leads up to the Blackwater mountain settlement. Follow this path and we will talk later.
Beware of the nasty monsters, they can really cause some harm!

replies.text: OK, I will follow this path up the mountain.
Great, more monsters. Just what I needed.

conversationlist.message: Do not listen to their lies. They poison your thoughts and would not hesitate to stab you in the back once they get the chance.

replies.text: Yes, they do seem a bit shady.

conversationlist.message: I will not talk of them now. Follow me up to the Blackwater mountain settlement and we will talk more there.

replies.text: I'm keeping my eye on you. But I'll agree to your terms for now.

conversationlist.message: Indeed they do.
You should talk to Mikhail first.
On the ground, you find a piece of paper with a lot of strange symbols. You can barely make out the words 'meet me at Lodar's hideaway', but you are not sure what it means.
Audir shouts: Hey you, get away! You are not allowed back there.
The sign on the wall is cracked in several places. You cannot make out anything comprehensible from the writing.

West: Crossglen
South: Fallhaven
North: Feygard
This map is not yet done. Please come back in a later version of the game.

West: Crossglen
East: Fallhaven
North: Feygard
Gandir lies here, slain by the hand of his former friend Irogotu.
Welcome to Fallhaven. Watch out for pickpockets!
You are not allowed to enter the catacombs of Fallhaven Church without permission.
You see a torn page from a book titled 'Calomyran Secrets'. Blood stains its edges, and someone has scribbled the words 'Larcal' with the blood.
Elythara, mother of the light. Protect us from the curse of the Shadow.
You are not allowed into the room unless you have rented it.
Bucus shouts: Hey you, get away from there!

North: Crossglen
East: Fallhaven
South: Stoutford

West: Stoutford
North: Fallhaven

North: Fallhaven
West: Stoutford
The demon radiates a force that pushes you back, making it impossible for you to approach it.
You notice that this tunnel seems to be dug out from below Flagstone. Probably the work of one of the former prisoners from Flagstone.

North: Fallhaven
East: Vilegard
East: Nor City
Hello. I'm Nocmar.

replies.text: This place looks like a smithy. Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: I don't have any items for sale. I used to have a lot of things for sale, but nowadays I'm not allowed to sell anything.
I was once one of the greatest smiths in Fallhaven. Then that bastard Lord Geomyr banned my use of heartsteel.
By decree of Lord Geomyr, no one in Fallhaven is allowed to even use heartsteel weapons. Much less sell any.
So now I have to hide the few weapons I have left. I won't dare sell any of them anymore.
I haven't seen the heartsteel glow in several years now that Lord Geomyr has banned them.
So, unfortunately I can't sell you any of my weapons.
Unnmir sent you huh? I guess it must be important then.
OK, these old weapons have lost their inner glow now that they haven't been used in a while.
To make the heartsteel glow again, we will need a heartstone.
Years ago, we used to fight the liches of Undertell. I have no idea if they still haunt the place.
Undertell; the pits of the lost souls. Travel south and enter the caverns of the Dwarves. Follow the horrid smell from there.
Beware the liches of Undertell, if they are still around. Those things can kill you by their gaze alone.
Have you found a heartstone yet?

replies.text: Yes, at last I found it.
Could you tell me the story again?

conversationlist.message: Please keep looking. Unnmir must have something important planned for you.
By the Shadow. You actually found a heartstone. I thought I wouldn't live to see the day.
Can you see the glow? It's literally pulsating.
Quick. Let's get these old heartsteel weapons glowing again.
[Nocmar places the heartstone among the heartsteel weapons]
Can you feel it? The heartsteel is glowing again.

replies.text: Let me see what items you have available.

conversationlist.message: For the Shadow!
Good to hear that there are at least a few people left out there willing to take a stand against Feygard.
Should you really be out here all by yourself?
Look fellas, a kid! Out strolling here in the wilderness!
Should you really be out here kid? These areas are dangerous.

replies.text: You are right, I better leave.

conversationlist.message: I bet you can.
Well, west of here is not much. No towns for quite a while, only the harsh and dangerous wilderness.
Of course, there is Carn Tower if you travel really far west, but you really do not want to head there.
So, what brings you to these parts of the land?

replies.text: I am looking for a group of men led by someone by the name of Rogorn. Are you him?
Just looking for any treasure that might reveal itself here.

conversationlist.message: Well, keep on looking then.
That depends, why do you want to know?

replies.text: You are wanted by the Feygard patrol for the crimes you have committed.
I am seeking to deal justice wherever I can, and I heard that you are in need of being shown some justice.
I am sent by some guards over at the Crossroads guardhouse to look for you.
The guards from Feygard are looking for you, and I came to warn you.

conversationlist.message: Hah! We? Crimes?
Justice? What would you know of justice, kid?
If there is someone that deserves punishment, it surely isn't us. By the Shadow, it's those snobs from Feygard that should be taught a lesson.

replies.text: I will not listen to your lies! For Feygard!
Talk all you want, I happen to know that you have stolen from Feygard, which is not acceptable.
What's your side of the story then?

conversationlist.message: I tell you, we did not steal anything from those snobs.

replies.text: You are still wanted dead by the Feygard patrol. For Feygard!
Why are they looking for you then?

conversationlist.message: I had hoped it would not come to this. For the Shadow!
Talked to those guards from Feygard eh? Tell me, what is your opinion of Feygard?

replies.text: They seem to have honorable ideals of law and order, and I respect that.
Their ideals seem to be a bit oppressive of the people, which I do not like.
I have no opinion, I try not to get involved in their business.

conversationlist.message: Interesting. But now that you are part of their business by coming here to look for me on their behalf, how does that fit into your unwillingness to take sides?

replies.text: I will not listen to your lies! For Feygard!
I was told that you have stolen from Feygard, which is not acceptable.
I want to hear your side of the story.
I am just looking to see if there is some treasure to be gained from this.

conversationlist.message: You should make up your mind about what your priorities are. Tell your Feygard friends that we will not be oppressed by them. Shadow be with you, child.
You have got that right. They are always trying to make life hard for us little people. Let me tell you my side of the story.
Law and order? What use do we have of that if we are always persecuted by them and do not even have the freedom to live our lives the way we want?
They are always looking for us, trying to oppress us in some way. Always trying to make our lives a little bit harder.
Good to hear that there still are some people willing to make a stand against Feygard. Let me tell you my side of the story.
Me and my boys here travelled from our home in Nor City to these northern lands a few days ago.
We had never been here ourselves. We had only heard stories about how tough the guards from Feygard were, and how they held their precious law above all.
Anyway, we got wind of a certain business opportunity here up north. One where we would be on the receiving end of a very profitable deal.

So we went here to conduct our business. Shortly thereafter, I guess the guards from Feygard must have been tipped off about us, since we noticed that we were being followed by the guards after a while.

Not willing to risk anything, considering the rumors we had heard about the guards from there, we did the only reasonable thing we could do - we abandoned the plan right away and left, before we could conduct the business we had planned.
However, something must have upset the guards there anyway. Now we hear that we are accused of murder and theft in Feygard, without even being there ourselves.

replies.text: I will not listen to your lies! For Feygard!
Your story does not add up.
I believe your story. How can I help you?

conversationlist.message: I can't really say. We do our business on behalf of Nor City, and our business is our own.

replies.text: I will not listen to your lies! For Feygard!
Your story does not add up.
I believe your story. How can I help you?

conversationlist.message: What are you, a spy for Feygard? I told you, the accusations against us are false.
Thank you for listening to our side of the story.

replies.text: What now? I was sent here to find you by some guards in the Crossroads guardhouse.

conversationlist.message: You tell those guards that you searched for us, but did not find anyone.
You are back.

replies.text: Can you tell me your side of the story again?
I will not listen to your lies! You must be held accountable for your crimes against Feygard!
I believe your story. How can I help you?

conversationlist.message: Thank you for listening to our side of the story.
The formation of rocks seems to have sunken somewhat into the ground.
On the ledge, you notice another formation of rocks that seem out of place compared to the surroundings.
On the ledge, you notice another formation of rocks that seem out of place compared to the surroundings. The rocks almost seem to have a faint pulsating glow coming from within them.
The rocks in this formation no longer seem to give off that pulsating glow that they did before.
The rocks in this formation give off a distinct pulsating glow.
You begin to wonder if the glow is stronger because they're closer to whatever is causing them to glow, or because of the dim conditions in this damp cave.
This formation looks somewhat similar to the other rocky formations that you've encountered before.
However, you also notice several piles of chewed bones around these rocks.
The rocks in this formation do not seem to give off any pulsating glow any more.
As you try to step further into the cave, you feel your steps becoming more and more heavy.
The smell of the damp cave air fills your nostrils as you push forward.
From the stone that Lodar gave you, you start hearing cracking noises.
Something must be affecting you, making you unable to proceed further into the cave.
The cracks get more frequent, until the stone finally crumbles to a fine powder in your hand, like a dried leaf.
You feel the weight that was weighing down your steps previously becoming slightly lighter, allowing you to proceed further into the cave.
A massive stone lid with strange runes seals the grave. Between some cracks in the stone, you can feel a cold breeze coming out of it.
Teehee. You funny looking.
He he, but funny not enough to let you pass.
Master says only ones with password can pass. You have password?

replies.text: No, I don't have the password.
[Lie] Your master has allowed me to get through without the password.
'By the moon and stars, the path is laid clear to me.'

conversationlist.message: You not know password! Teehee.
[The guardian pushes you away and shakes its head]
You know! You know!
[The creature moves out of the way, and gestures with its hands almost like it is welcoming you further into the forest]
You again?
You again? Leave this place and go to your friends up in the Blackwater mountain settlement instead. We want no business with you.

replies.text: I am here to give you a message from the Blackwater mountain settlement.

conversationlist.message: What message?

replies.text: Harlenn in the Blackwater mountain settlement wants you to stop your attacks on their settlement.

conversationlist.message: That's completely insane. We!? Stop OUR attacks?! You tell him that we have nothing to do with what happens up there. They have brought their own misfortune upon themselves.
Welcome back, traveller. Did you talk to Harlenn up in the Blackwater mountain settlement?

replies.text: Can you tell me the story about the monsters again?
What was I supposed to do again?
Can you tell me the story about Prim again?
Yes, but Harlenn denies that they have anything to do with the attacks.
Actually, I am here to give you a message from the Blackwater mountain settlement.

conversationlist.message: Welcome to Prim, traveller.

replies.text: What can you tell me about Prim?
I was told to see you about helping against the monster attacks.
Actually, I am here to give you a message from the Blackwater mountain settlement.

conversationlist.message: Prim began as a simple camp for the miners that worked in the mines around here. Later it grew to a settlement, and a few years back we even got a tavern and an inn here.
This place used to be full of life when the miners worked here.
The miners also attracted a lot of traders that used to come through here.
Just until recently, we could at least get some contact with the outside villages. Nowadays, that hope is lost.
You see, the mine tunnel to the south is collapsed, and no one can get in or out of Prim.

replies.text: I know, I just came from there.

conversationlist.message: You did? Oh. Well, yes of course you must have since you are not from Prim. So there's a way through it after all huh?

replies.text: Yes, but I had to go through the old pitch-black mine.
Yes, the passage in the mine below is safe.
No, just kidding. I scaled over the mountain ridge to get here.

conversationlist.message: OK. We will have to investigate that later.
Anyway, as I was saying...
The collapsed mine tunnel makes it hard for any traders to reach Prim. Our resources are really starting to dwindle.
We are not sure. But we have our suspicions.
On top of that, there are the attacks from the monsters that we have to deal with.

replies.text: Yes, I noticed some monsters outside the village.

conversationlist.message: I am Guthbered, protector of this village.

replies.text: What can you tell me about Prim?
I was told to see you about helping against the monster attacks.

conversationlist.message: A while ago, we started seeing the first of the monsters. At first, they were no problem for us to handle. Our guards could cut them down easily.
But after a while, some of our guards got hurt, and the monsters started increasing in numbers.
Also, the monsters almost seemed like they were getting smarter. Their attacks were getting more and more coordinated.
Now, we can hardly hold them back. They mostly come at night.
According to lore, the monsters are called the 'gornauds'.

replies.text: Any ideas where they might be coming from?

conversationlist.message: Oh yes, we are almost certain.
Those evil bastards up in the Blackwater mountain settlement probably summoned them to attack us. They would rather see us perish.
Oh good. Did you talk to Tonis? Yes, I'm sure you met him on your way into town.
Good. Let me tell you the back-story about Prim first.

replies.text: I'd rather skip to the end directly.

conversationlist.message: We used to trade with them up there, but that all changed once they got greedy.

replies.text: I met a man outside the collapsed mine saying he was from the Blackwater mountain settlement.
Do you need any help in dealing with those monsters?
I would be glad to help you with the monsters.

conversationlist.message: Oh boy, do we? Yes please, you are welcome to help.

replies.text: I would be glad to help you with the monsters.

conversationlist.message: Do you really think you have what it takes to help us?

replies.text: I have left a bloody trail of monsters behind me.
If the monsters are anything like those around where I entered the mine, it will be a tough fight. But I can manage it.

conversationlist.message: Great. I think we should go straight to the source with the problem.
A man, from the Blackwater mountain settlement, you say?
Did he say anything about us here in Prim?

replies.text: No. But he insisted that I go straight east when exiting the mine, thus not reaching Prim.

conversationlist.message: That figures. They send out their spies even now.

replies.text: Do you need any help in dealing with those monsters?

conversationlist.message: As I said, we believe those bastards up at the Blackwater mountain settlement are behind the monster attacks somehow.
I want you to go up there to their settlement and ask their battle master, Harlenn, why they are doing this to us.

replies.text: OK, I will go ask Harlenn in the Blackwater mountain settlement why they are attacking your village.

conversationlist.message: Thank you friend.
What did I expect? Of course he would say that. He probably even denies it to himself. Meanwhile, we here in Prim suffer from their savage raids.
I am sure they are behind these attacks. However, I do not have sufficient evidence to back up my statements in order to do anything about it.
But I am sure they are! As false as they are, they must be. Always lying and deceiving. Causing destruction and turmoil.
Just listen to the name they have chosen for themselves: 'Blackwater'. The tone of it sounds like trouble.
Anyway. I would like to get some further evidence on what they are up to. Maybe something you can help us with.
But I need to be sure that I can trust you. If you are working for them, you had better tell me now before things get ... messy.

replies.text: Sure, you can trust me. I will help the people of Prim.
Hmm, maybe I should help the people up in Blackwater mountain instead.

conversationlist.message: Yet somehow I do not trust you.

replies.text: I was working for them, but I have decided to help you instead.
Why would I ever want to work for your filthy village? The people in the Blackwater mountain settlement deserve my help more than you.

conversationlist.message: Good. I'm glad you want to help us.
Fine. You should leave now while you still can, traitor.
I want you to go up there into their settlement and find any clues as to what they are planning.
We believe they are training their fighters to launch a larger raid on us soon.
Go look for any plans that you might find. But make sure that they do not see you while you're looking around.
You should probably start your search around where their battle master, Harlenn, stays.

replies.text: OK. I will look for clues in their settlement.

conversationlist.message: Thank you, friend. Report back to me with your findings.
Hello again. Did you find anything up in the Blackwater mountain settlement?

replies.text: What was I supposed to do again?
Yes, I found some papers with a plan to attack Prim.

conversationlist.message: Then it is as we suspected. This is terrible news indeed.
Now you know what I was talking about. They are always looking to cause trouble.
Thank you for finding this information for us.
Very well. We will have to deal with this.
I had hoped it would not come to this. But we are left with no choice. We must remove their main driving force behind the raids. We must remove their battle master, Harlenn.
This would be an excellent task for you my friend. Since you have access to their facilities, you can sneak in and kill that bastard Harlenn.
By killing him, we can be sure that their attacks will ... shall we say ... lose their teeth. He he.

replies.text: No problem, he is as good as dead.
Are you sure more violence will really solve this conflict?

conversationlist.message: Excellent. Return to me once you are done.
No, not really. But for now, it looks like the only option we have.

replies.text: I will remove him, but I will try to find a peaceful solution to this.
Very well. He is as good as dead.

conversationlist.message: My sources from inside the Blackwater mountain settlement tell me you are working for them.
It is, of course, your choice. But if you are working for them, you are not welcome here in Prim. You should leave quickly, while you still can.
Hello again my friend. Thank you for your help in dealing with the bandits up in Blackwater mountain.
I am sure everyone here in Prim will want to talk to you now.
Thank you again for your help.
The glow in your eyes frightens me.

replies.text: I am sent by the Blackwater mountain settlement to stop you.
I am sent by the Blackwater mountain settlement to stop you. However, I have decided not to kill you.

conversationlist.message: I had hoped it would not come to this. I'm afraid that you will not survive this encounter. Yet another life on my hands.

replies.text: Brave words, let's see if you can back them up with anything.
Great, I have been longing to kill you.

conversationlist.message: How interesting... Please continue.

replies.text: It's obvious that this conflict will only end in more bloodshed. That should stop here.

conversationlist.message: What are you proposing?

replies.text: My proposal is that you leave this village and find a new home somewhere else.

conversationlist.message: Now why would I want to do that?

replies.text: These two towns will always fight each other. By you leaving, they will think they have won, and stop their attacks.

conversationlist.message: Hmm, you might have a point there.
OK, you have convinced me. I will leave Prim for another town. The survival of my people here is more important than me.
Thank you friend, for talking some sense into me.
Hello again. Did you manage to remove that bastard battle master Harlenn from the Blackwater mountain settlement?

replies.text: Can you tell me again what I was supposed to do?
Not yet. I am still working on it.

conversationlist.message: While I am grateful for this news in knowing that he is dead, I am also saddened that it had to come to this.
Really? This is great news indeed.
This will hopefully mean that their attacks on our village will cease.
I do not know how to thank you enough my friend.
Here, please accept these few items as some form of compensation for your help. Also, take this piece of paper that we have acquired.
This is a permit that we have ... produced, which according to our sources, will allow you to enter their inner chamber in the Blackwater mountain settlement.
Now, the permit is not ... shall we say ... completely genuine. But we are certain that the guards won't notice any difference.
Anyway, you have my greatest thanks for the assistance that you have provided for us.
What have we done to deserve this?
Didn't you hear about the illness?
It all started a few days ago. Selgan found Hesor passed out on his old crop field, completely white faced and shivering.
A few days later, Selgan started showing the same symptoms as Hesor, with stomach aches. I also started feeling the pains and got the shivers.
Then, all people showed the symptoms in one way or another.
Poor old Selgan and Hesor apparently got the worst of it, and both died the day before yesterday.
Cursed illness, why did it have to be Selgan and Hesor? I wonder who is next.
We all started to investigate what could be the cause. We still aren't certain what the cause is, but we have our suspicions.
Luckily, now Feygard has sent patrols up here to help guard the village at least. We are still suffering though, and we fear who will be taken by the illness next.
Please report any suspicious behavior you might see to Kuldan.
What have we done to deserve this? Please, will you help us?

replies.text: What do you think is the cause of the illness?

conversationlist.message: My guess is that this must be something done by those arrogant people from Feygard.
They are always looking for ways to make our lives a little bit harder.
We try to farm our lands to feed ourselves, but they demand that they get a share of whatever we bring in.
Lately, the crops haven't been as good as they used to be, and the guards apparently think we are withholding some part of their share.
I am sure that they did something to us as punishment for not following their *rules*. They are always talking about how the laws and rules are so precious to them.
That's what I think anyway.
There's something else also. I talked to that drunk, Landa, in the tavern earlier today. He said he saw something but didn't dare tell me what it was.

replies.text: Thank you, I will go talk to him.
Great, another drunk that I have to talk to.

conversationlist.message: Hello. Do you want something from the kitchen?

replies.text: Sure, let me see what food you have to sell.
That smells horrible. What are you cooking?
That smells wonderful. What are you cooking?

conversationlist.message: Oh this? This is supposed to be a stew of anklebiter. Needs more seasoning I guess.

replies.text: I look forward to trying it when it is done. Good luck cooking.
Yuck, that sounds awful. Can you really eat those things? I'm grossed out, goodbye.

conversationlist.message: No sorry, I don't have any food to sell. Go talk to Torilo over there if you want some drink or ready-made food.
Welcome to the Foaming Flask tavern. We welcome all travelers in here.

replies.text: Thank you. Are you the innkeeper here?
Have you seen a boy called Rincel around here recently?

conversationlist.message: I am Torilo, the proprietor of this establishment. Please have a seat anywhere you like.

replies.text: Can I see what you have available for food and drink?
Do you have somewhere I can rest?
Are those guards always shouting and yelling that much?

conversationlist.message: Was there anything else you wanted?

replies.text: Can I see what you have available for food and drink?
Are those guards always shouting and yelling that much?
Have you seen a boy called Rincel around here recently?

conversationlist.message: Absolutely. We have a wide selection of food and beverages.
Yes, you already rented the back room.
Please feel free to use it in any way you like. I hope you can get some sleep even with these guards yelling their songs.
Oh yes. We have a very comfortable back room here in the Foaming Flask tavern.
Available for only 250 gold. Then you can use it as much as you like.

replies.text: 250 gold? Sure, that's nothing to me. Here you go.
250 gold is a lot, but I guess it is worth it. Here you go.
That sounds a bit too much for me.

conversationlist.message: Oh well, it's your loss.
Thank you. The room is now rented to you.
Rincel? No, not that I can recall. Actually, we don't get many children in here. *chuckle*
*Sigh* Yes. Those guards have been here for quite some time now.
They seem to be looking for something or someone, but I am not sure who or what.
I hope the Shadow watches over us so that nothing bad happens to the Foaming Flask tavern because of them.
Hello again. You made it through alive, well done!

replies.text: You never told me it would be pitch-black down there. I almost got killed!

conversationlist.message: The gornauds? I have no idea where they come from, one day they just showed up here around the mountain.
Nasty beasts, they are.
Anyway, let's get going now. We are now one step closer to the Blackwater mountain settlement.
We should hurry now.
Once we exit this mine, it is very important that you go directly east from there. Do not travel to other places other than going east now!

replies.text: OK, I'll go east once I have exited the mine. Got it.
Why east? What else is there here?

conversationlist.message:
I'll wait for you by the steps up to the mountain pass. See you there!

Remember, go east once you exit the mine.
Oh, nothing. There are dangerous places here. You should definitely not head any other direction than east.

replies.text: Dangerous? Sounds like my kind of place!
Is there something you are not telling me?

conversationlist.message: It would be your loss. Don't say I didn't warn you. Safest route would be to head east.

replies.text: Is there something you are not telling me?

conversationlist.message: No no, just head east and I'll explain everything to you once we get to the Blackwater mountain settlement.

replies.text: OK, I promise to head east once we exit the mine.
[Lie] OK, I promise to head east once we exit the mine.

conversationlist.message: Actually, I did tell you that it would be pitch-black down there. Good work navigating through there!
Hello again. Thank you for saving me from captivity up in the Charwood heights!
I won't dare to think about what those monsters would have done to me, had you not freed me!
In return, I am willing to teach you the things I know. I used to be a weapons trainer for the Charwood heights, before all of this started.
I can teach you how to better handle most types of weapons, so that you can get even more proficient in them.

replies.text: What weapon types can you teach me?

conversationlist.message: I can teach you about swords, either one-handed or two-handed ones. I know a bit about daggers, axes and blunt weapons. I also know a fair deal about fighting with your bare fists.
I only have time to teach you about one type of weapon, so make sure you pick the one that suits you best.

replies.text: Tell me more about fighting with your bare fists.
Tell me more about two-handed swords.
Tell me more about one-handed swords.
Tell me more about blunt weapons.

conversationlist.message: Two handed swords are usually much heavier than their one-handed counterparts, which means that they are much harder to swing correctly.
In return, they provide much deeper cuts that hurt your opponent more. I can teach you how to better handle swinging your two-handed swords.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me two-handed sword fighting.
Let's go back to the other types of weapons.

conversationlist.message: [Falothen teaches you the two-handed sword skill]
Unarmed, now that's my kind of style! When not being hampered by either a weapon or shield, you can be a lot more flexible in your moves.
Fighting unarmed can make you land more successful punches, and will also make you quicker when dodging blows.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me how to be better at unarmed fighting.
Let's go back to the other types of weapons.

conversationlist.message: [Falothen teaches you the unarmed fighting skill]
One handed swords, now that's an art form. They have a wide range of uses, from slashing to piercing types.
I can teach you how to handle them better, so that you land your attacks more often.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me how to fight with one-handed swords.
Let's go back to the other types of weapons.

conversationlist.message: [Falothen teaches you the one-handed sword skill]
Daggers, the choice of the fast fighter. Their light weight usually makes you much faster when attacking. Some of them also have nasty side effects. Nasty for your opponent, that is.
I can teach you how to handle them better, so that you land your attacks more often.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me how to fight with daggers.
Let's go back to the other types of weapons.

conversationlist.message: [Falothen teaches you the dagger skill]
Oh yes. The mighty axes. You can do a lot of damage with them, if you know how to handle them correctly.

I can teach you how to get better at fighting with all types of axes, from the small hatchet up to the larger two-handed greataxes. Even a scythe, although not designed for combat, can do a lot of damage if you know how to use it. That way, you can be very versatile in your choice of weapons.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me how to fight with axes.
Let's go back to the other types of weapons.

conversationlist.message: [Falothen teaches you the axe skill]

Now, blunt weapons is my way of categorizing everything from the simple club, to maces up to quarterstaves, and even whips. The technique for using them well is mostly the same, although whips are obviously somewhat different.
I can teach you how to better land your blows with all blunt weapons.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me how to fight with blunt weapons.
Let's go back to the other types of weapons.

conversationlist.message: [Falothen teaches you the blunt weapons skill]
There. That wasn't so hard once you get the hang of it, now was it?
I can help you get better in the other types of weapons as well, of course, if you want. But for that, I will have to require some form of payment.
Hello again, my friend. I hope you've been using what I taught you.
We usually don't teach anyone outside our settlement. Last time I did, I was given five Oegyth crystals and 5000 gold in return for my services.
Seeing as you saved me, I think it's reasonable to only require two of those crystals from you. I still have expenses to pay, mind you, so I will require that gold.

replies.text: I don't have that on me right now. I'll be back.
I think I should hold on to those crystals some more.

conversationlist.message: Yes, those things sure are valuable.
It seems you do not have the gold required for it.
Which weapon type would you be interested in?

replies.text: Tell me more about fighting with your bare fists.
Tell me more about two-handed swords.
Tell me more about one-handed swords.
Tell me more about blunt weapons.

conversationlist.message: I've already taught you that skill.

replies.text: Let's go back to the other types of weapons.

conversationlist.message: Two handed swords are usually much heavier than their one-handed counterparts, which means that they are much harder to swing correctly.
In return, they provide much deeper cuts that hurt your opponent more. I can teach you how to better handle swinging your two-handed swords.

conversationlist.message: [Falothen teaches you the two-handed sword skill]

I can teach you how to handle them better, so that you land your attacks more often.

conversationlist.message: [Falothen teaches you the dagger skill]
Oh yes. The mighty axes. You can do a lot of damage with them, if you know how to handle them correctly.
I can teach you how to get better at fighting with all types of axes, from the small hatchet up to the larger two-handed greataxes. That way, you can be very versatile in your choice of weapons.

Let's go back to the other types of weapons.

conversationlist.message: [Falothen teaches you the axe skill]
Now, blunt weapons is my way of categorizing everything from the simple club, to maces up to quarterstaves. The technique for using them well is mostly the same.
I can teach you how to better land your blows with all blunt weapons.

replies.text: Sounds good. Teach me how to fight with blunt weapons. Here are two Oegyth crystals and 5000 gold as payment.
Let's go back to the other types of weapons.

conversationlist.message: [Falothen teaches you the blunt weapons skill]
Well done! You learn quickly.
Good. We need all the help we can get.
I'll let you enter the hills. Keep heading east, and then turn north once you see the mountain side.

replies.text: I sure hope there's some reward for all of this later.

conversationlist.message: You better talk to Maevalia.

replies.text: I've already talked to her, and I have agreed to help find your missing people.
OK, I'll go talk to her.

conversationlist.message: Yes, you do that.
Behind me is the path up to the Charwood mining town. You really should go talk to Maevalia though. She's inside the cabin.

replies.text: OK, I'll go talk to her.
I've already talked to her, and I have agreed to help find your missing people.

conversationlist.message: Thank you for helping us!
Please, you have to help us!
Thank you so much for finding our missing people!

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?
Please sell me some of your famous Cheddar cheese.

conversationlist.message: It's not much, but I have some food if you'd like.

replies.text: Sure, let me see what you have.

conversationlist.message: What ever will we do? Poor Ayell and Fayvara, I sure hope they're alright.

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: You should talk to Maevalia over there.
I'm sorry, I'm too distracted to help you right now.
Khorailla shouts to you: Hey! Get away from there!
Ah, you really know what's good.

replies.text: I hope so. It was a long way to come.

conversationlist.message: Hello kid.

replies.text: Hello. Do you know where I can find Umar?

conversationlist.message: This is our guild hall. We are safe from the guards of Fallhaven in here.
We can do pretty much as we like here. As long as Umar allows it, that is.

replies.text: Do you know where I can find Umar?

conversationlist.message: He is probably in his room over there [points].
Umar is our guild leader. He decides our rules and guides us in moral decisions.
Hello, did you want something?

replies.text: You look like the cook around here.
Can I see what food you have for sale?
Farrik said you can prepare me a round of special mead.

conversationlist.message: That's right. Someone has to keep these ruffians fed.
Thanks. This stew is coming along nicely.

replies.text: I'm interested in buying some of that.

conversationlist.message: Yeah, I know. With ingredients this bad, what can you do? Anyway, it keeps us fed.

replies.text: Can I see what food you have for sale?

conversationlist.message: Oh sure. Planning to get someone a bit sleepy eh?
Don't worry, I won't tell anyone. Making sleepy food is one of my specialties.
Give me a minute to mix it up for you.
There. This should do it. Here you go.
Yes, I gave you the special brew earlier.
Be careful not to get any of that stuff on your fingers, it is really potent.
Hello there.
My real name is unimportant. People mostly call me Quickfingers.
Well, I have a tendency to ... how shall I put this ... acquire certain things easily.
Things previously in the possession of other people.
No no. I wouldn't call it stealing. It's more of a transfer of ownership. To me, that is.

replies.text: That sounds a lot like stealing to me.
That sounds like a good justification.

conversationlist.message: After all, we are the Thieves' Guild. What did you expect?
Hello. Don't I recognize you from somewhere?

replies.text: No, I'm sure we have never met.
What do you do around here?
Can I take a look at what supplies you have available?
Umar sent me to talk about my first job here.

conversationlist.message: I keep an eye on our supplies for the guild.

replies.text: Can I take a look at what you have available?

conversationlist.message: No, I really recognize you.

replies.text: You must have me confused with someone else.
Maybe you have me confused with my brother Andor.

conversationlist.message: Yes, might be.

replies.text: Have you seen my brother around here? He looks somewhat like me.

conversationlist.message: Oh yes, now that you mention it. There was that kid running around here, asking a lot of questions.

replies.text: Do you know what he was looking for, or what he was doing?

conversationlist.message: No. I don't know. I just manage the supplies.
Oh my, what has happened to you? You don't look too well.

replies.text: I was infected with something by a lich of Kazaul.
A man called Ulirfendor told me he thought I might be infected with Kazaul rotworms.
I was told to find you, and that you might be able to help me.

conversationlist.message: Ah, my old friend Ulirfendor. It's good to hear that he is still alive. Wait! What was that? Rotworms you say, eh?
Nasty things, they are. I have seen people going mad from the stomach pains, and I have seen people being eaten alive from the inside.

replies.text: Are you able to help me?
It's not that bad. I have had worse.

conversationlist.message: It's good that you came to see me. I might be able to help you.
A lich of Kazaul eh? Then I am sure that whatever ails you are those cursed rotworms.
Just to be sure, you did kill whatever creature that infected you with this, right?

replies.text: No, I have not killed it yet.

conversationlist.message: Good. Then I am able to help you.
Then you better go take care of that first!

replies.text: OK, I will be back once the lich is defeated.

conversationlist.message: However, there is a slight problem. You see, normally my supply of potions and ingredients would be fully stocked. However with this trouble that we have here in Loneford, my supplies are lower than they have ever been before.
I am not even able to go out and gather new supplies, what with the illness and all.

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to help?
Bah! Then you are useless to me. Guess you should have prepared better before then.

conversationlist.message: Yes, I guess I should have.
You know what, maybe you can go out and gather some items for me. With your condition, it is important that we hurry as much as we can.

replies.text: What would you like me to do?
Argh! The pains are getting worse! Isn't there anything you can do?

conversationlist.message: No, unfortunately not. Not with this few supplies I'm sorry.

replies.text: Fine. What would you like me to do?
Bah! Then you are useless to me. Guess you should have prepared better before then.

conversationlist.message: For this particular cure to work, I would need help with gathering four items.
Or ... well ... actually, nine items in total, but four different types. Eh ... well, you get the idea.

Anyway, what you need to bring me is, first and foremost, some more fresh bones. Five bones will do I think. Make sure they are fresh. Any old skeleton will do, but I'd rather take some fresh bones of some nasty animal.
Secondly, I will need some animal fur to go with that. Two pieces of animal hair will surely do. I'm sure any old animal fur from the wilderness outside town will do.
Third, I will need a gland of poison from a creature called the irdegh.
Now, I have not seen an irdegh myself, but I hear they are particularly nasty creatures. Venomous like nothing I've heard of.

replies.text: OK, one irdegh poison gland. Where can I find one?

conversationlist.message: Some people have talked about seeing some of them far to the east, across the bridges.
Lastly, I would need a clean empty vial to make the potion in. I hear that the potion-maker in Fallhaven has the best vials available.
Bring me these things and I will be able to help you with your ... condition.

replies.text: Very well, I will be back shortly.

conversationlist.message: You return. Have you gathered those things that I asked for?

replies.text: What was I supposed to collect again?
I brought five bones for you.
I brought two pieces of animal hair for you.
I brought an irdegh poison gland for you.
I brought an empty vial for you.
Do you know anything about the illness here in Loneford?
Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: There are still some more of those items that I need.

replies.text: What was I supposed to collect again?
I brought five bones for you.
I brought two pieces of animal hair for you.
I brought an irdegh poison gland for you.
I brought an empty vial for you.

conversationlist.message: No need, you already brought me that before. But thank you anyway.
Oh, good. Please, give them to me.

replies.text: On second thought, I'll be right back.

conversationlist.message: Thank you.
Oh, good. Please, give them to me.

replies.text: On second thought, I'll be right back.

conversationlist.message: Thank you.
Oh, good. Please, give it to me.

replies.text: On second thought, I'll be right back.

conversationlist.message: Thank you.
Oh, good. Please, give it to me.

replies.text: Here you go, one small empty vial.
Here you go, one empty vial.
On second thought, I'll be right back.

conversationlist.message: Thank you.
That's all I need to cure you. Good work.
Now, let's get this cure started. I just need to grind this ... and mix those ... and...
Give me a minute.
[Talion mixes the ground up ingredients together in the vial you brought, with some leaves and berries that he kept with him]
[He gives the potion a thorough shake for quite a while]
There. Drink this. This should do it.

[The potion smells rancid, but you manage to drink it all down. The pain from the stomach decreases, and you feel one of the rotworms crawling up into your mouth. You quickly spit the worm out into the now empty vial.]
Ah, that seems to have worked. Frankly, I was a little worried that it might not have worked, but seeing you spit out that worm really confirms it. Ha ha.

replies.text: Yuck! Those things were inside of me?

conversationlist.message: Yes. Nasty, aren't they? *chuckle*
That one worm you spit out, you should make sure you hold on to that. It might be valuable in the future.

replies.text: OK, I will hold on to it.
I think I had better put it under my boot.

conversationlist.message: Well, you never know. Some people really like ... exotic things.
It's your choice of course.
Now, I know you must have gone through a lot to get infected with these things. You seem like the experienced type.
Tell you what, I don't normally offer this to anyone, but you seem like you could use the help.
Seeing as you managed to pull through all of this, I would be willing to offer you the help of giving you blessings of the Shadow if you want.
Yes. Well ... for a fee of course.
I am able to bless you with either the Shadow's strength, regeneration, accuracy, or even the blessing of the Shadow guardian.

replies.text: I'm interested in the blessing of Shadow strength.
I'm interested in the blessing of Shadow regeneration.
I'm interested in the blessing of Shadow accuracy.
I'm interested in the Shadow guardian blessing.

conversationlist.message: The blessing of Shadow strength grants you more strength while attacking, thus increasing the amount of damage you do on each hit. I can give you the blessing for 300 gold.

replies.text: OK, I'll take it for 300 gold.
Never mind, let's go back to those other blessings.

conversationlist.message: The blessing of Shadow regeneration will slowly heal you back if you get hurt. I can give you the blessing for 250 gold.

replies.text: OK, I'll take it for 250 gold.
Never mind, let's go back to those other blessings.

conversationlist.message: The blessing of Shadow accuracy grants you a keen sense of where best to strike your opponent, thus increasing the chance of a successful hit while fighting. I can give you the blessing for 250 gold.

replies.text: OK, I'll take it for 250 gold.
Never mind, let's go back to those other blessings.

conversationlist.message: Ah yes, the blessing of the Shadow guardian. The Shadow protects you in dark places, and keeps you safe where others might not see. I can give you the blessing for 400 gold.

replies.text: OK, I'll take it for 400 gold.
Never mind, let's go back to those other blessings.

conversationlist.message: Very well. *starts chanting*
Very well. *starts chanting*
Very well. *starts chanting*
Very well. *starts chanting*
There. I hope you will find it useful on your travels.

replies.text: How about some of those other blessings?

conversationlist.message: You are welcome to rest here if you want. Pick any bed you wish.
I should warn you though that the one in the corner over there has a rotten stench to it. Someone must have spilled something onto it.
Welcome traveller. These beds are only for residents of Blackwater mountain.
Welcome friend. What can I do for you?

replies.text: What items do you have for sale?

conversationlist.message: Welcome traveller. I see you are looking at my fine selection of wares.

...Kazaul, destroyer of spilled hope...
No that's not it.

Spilled ... torment?
No that's not it either.
Argh, I can't seem to remember it.
Oh, hello. Never mind. Nothing. Just trying to remember something. Don't concern yourself with that.
Halt! You should not step any further.
There is something over there. Do you see it?
A mist? A Shadow? I'm sure I saw something moving.
Screw this guard duty stuff. I am staying back here.
Good thing we blocked that entrance from that old cabin.
[The guard gives you a patronizing look, but says nothing]
Hey, I'm staying out of your fight with the boss. Don't involve me in your schemes.
Only residents of Blackwater mountain or faction members are allowed in here.

replies.text: Here, I have a written permit to enter.

conversationlist.message: I will let you through. Please go right ahead.

replies.text: Yes, get out of my way.

conversationlist.message: A permit you say? Let me see that.
Well, it has the signature and all. I guess it checks out all right.
Oh, it is you.
Fresh flesh!

replies.text: By the Shadow, I will slay you.
Yuck, what are you? And what is that smell?

conversationlist.message: Nooo, I will not be imprisoned again!
Aaaa! Who's there? I will not be enslaved again!
Ah, another mortal. Prepare to become part of my undead army!
Die mortal!
What, a mortal in here that is not marked by my touch?
You seem delicious and soft, will you be part of the feast?
Yes, I think you will. My undead army will spread far outside of Flagstone once I am done with you.

replies.text: By the Shadow, you must be stopped!
No! This land must be protected from the undead!

conversationlist.message: Halt! Who's there? No one is allowed to approach Flagstone.
You should turn back while you still can.
Flagstone has been overrun by undead, and we are standing guard here to make sure no undead escape.

replies.text: Can you tell me the story about Flagstone?

conversationlist.message: Flagstone Prison was built a few hundred years ago by house Gorland of Stoutford and used until the Noble Wars, when the house was vanquished. This dreadful place has been abandoned ever since.
For years, no one took notice of Flagstone, although there were occasional reports from travelers of terrible screams coming from the camp.
But recently, undead started pouring out of Flagstone and started to threaten Stoutford and the trade routes nearby.
So, here we are. I have to guard the road from undead, so that they do not spread farther than Flagstone.
So, I would advise you to leave unless you want to be overrun by undead.

replies.text: Can I investigate the Flagstone ruins?

conversationlist.message: Are you really sure you want to head in there? Well, OK, fine by me.
I won't stop you, and I won't mourn you if you never return.
Go ahead. Let me know if there's anything I can tell you that would help.
Return here if you need my advice.

replies.text: OK. I will return to you if there is anything I need help with.

conversationlist.message: Hello again. Did you enter Flagstone? I am surprised you actually returned.

replies.text: Can you tell me the story again?
There is a guardian in the lower levels of Flagstone that cannot be approached and the former prisoners are undead now.

conversationlist.message: A guardian and undead prisoners you say? This is troubling news, since it means there is some larger force behind all this.
You should look for the former warden. Maybe he has something to do with all of this. If you find him you should return here with any important news.

replies.text: OK, I will go and look for the former warden.

conversationlist.message: Oh this looks most interesting. Let's take a look. Hmm. It has got some weird inscriptions on it that say 'Daylight Shadow'. Maybe you could try these words on the demon? So perhaps the warden did have something to do with the demon after all?
Hello again. Have you found the former warden in Flagstone yet?

replies.text: I slew the former warden and found a peculiar necklace among his remains.
Can you tell me the story again?
Not yet. I have to keep looking.

conversationlist.message: You found the necklace? Good. Here, give it to me.
Now, let's see here. Ah yes, it is as I thought. The necklace contains a password.
'Daylight Shadow'. That must be it. You should try to approach the guardian with this password.
Hello again. How is the investigation of the undead in Flagstone going?
Well, keep looking. Return to me if you need my advice.
Hello again. It seems something happened inside Flagstone that made the undead weaker. I'm sure we have you to thank for it.

replies.text: In the depths of Flagstone, I had to fight a winged demon and found a prisoner called Narael. He told me that he has been there for a very long time, and is too weak to leave.

conversationlist.message: Thank you, thank you for freeing me from that monster.
I have been a captive here for what seems to be an eternity.
Oh, the things they did to me. Thank you so much for freeing me.
I was once a citizen in Nor City, and worked on the excavation of Mount Galmore.
After a while, the day came when I wanted to quit the assignment and return to my wife.
The officer in charge would not let me, and I was sent to Flagstone as a prisoner for disobeying orders.
If only I could see my wife once more. I have hardly any life left in me, and I don't even have enough strength to leave this place.
I guess my fate is to perish here, but now as a free man at least.
Now leave me to my fate. I do not have the strength to leave this place.
If you find my wife Taurum in Nor City, please tell her I'm alive and that I haven't forgotten about her.

replies.text: I will. Shadow be with you.

conversationlist.message: Ha ha, you tell him Garl! *burp*
Sing, drink, fight! All who oppose Feygard will fall!
We will stand tall. Feygard, city of peace!

replies.text: Have you seen a boy called Rincel around here recently?

conversationlist.message: What, you haven't heard of Feygard, kid? Just follow the road northwest and you will see the great city of Feygard rise above the treetops.
A boy?! Apart from you, there have been no children in here that I have seen.
Check with the captain over there. He has been around here for longer than us.

replies.text: Thank you. Shadow be with you.

conversationlist.message: Don't bring that cursed Shadow in here son. We want none of that. Now leave.
Are you lost, son? This is no place for a kid like you.

replies.text: I have a shipment of iron swords from Gandoren for you.
I have a shipment of iron swords from Gandoren for you.
Have you seen a boy called Rincel around here recently?
Hi! I have been sent by Herg ... Hertzsen Laumwill, patriarch of the Laumwill family, to bring back his daughter!

conversationlist.message: I am the guard captain of this patrol. We hail from the great city of Feygard.

replies.text: What do you do around here?

conversationlist.message: We are travelling the main road to make sure the merchants and travelers are safe. We keep the peace around here.

replies.text: You mentioned Feygard. Where is that?

conversationlist.message: The great city of Feygard is the greatest sight you will ever see. Follow the road northwest.

replies.text: Thank you. Shadow be with you.

conversationlist.message: There was a kid running around in here a while ago.
I never talked to him though, so I don't know if he is the one you are looking for.

replies.text: OK, that might be something worth checking anyway.

conversationlist.message: I noticed he left to the west heading out of the Foaming Flask tavern.

replies.text: West. Got it. Thanks for the information.

conversationlist.message: Always happy to help. Anything for the glory of Feygard.
The Shadow? Don't tell me you believe in that stuff. In my experience, only troublemakers talk of the Shadow.
I seem to have lost track of where I am. I was looking for something.
I'll find it.
Soon, it will all be mine.
I'll find what lurks beneath.
[The guard turns towards you, almost as if he didn't notice you before]
What, who are you?
Are you one of ... them?

replies.text: [Lie] Yes, I an one of them. Bow down to me.

conversationlist.message: Oh yes, you are one of them. What lurks beneath demands that I purge this land from all of you.
You will be the first of my glorious victories.

replies.text: All right, a fight! I've been wanting to slay more of you Feygard scum.

conversationlist.message: Get lost kid. I don't have time for you.

replies.text: I'm looking for a piece of the Rift spell.

conversationlist.message: No! Vacor will not gain the power of the rift spell!
What have we here? A lost wanderer?
How much is your life worth to you? Give me 100 gold and I'll let you go.

replies.text: OK OK. Here is the gold. Please don't hurt me!
How about we fight over it?
How much is your life worth?

conversationlist.message: About damn time. You are free to go.
OK then, your life it is. Let's fight. I have been looking forward to a good fight!
State your business.

replies.text: I heard that you are fond of mead.
The thieves are planning an escape for their friend.
I recently talked to the watchman who blocks the old pathway to the Duleian Road. Why don't you just pay the woodcutter?

conversationlist.message: That thief? He was caught in the act. Trespassing he was. Trying to get down into the catacombs of Fallhaven church.
Luckily, we caught him before he could get down there. Now he'll serve as an example to all other thieves.
Damn thieves. There must be a nest of them around here somewhere. If only I could find where they hide.
Mead? Oh ... no, I don't do that anymore. Who told you that?
I've stopped doing that years ago.

replies.text: Sounds like a good approach. Good luck with keeping away from it.
Not just even a little bit?

conversationlist.message: Um. *clears throat* I really shouldn't.

replies.text: I brought some with me if you would like to have a sip.

conversationlist.message: Oh sweet drinks of joy. I really shouldn't have this while on duty though.
I could get fined for drinking on duty. I don't think I would dare try it right now.
Thank you for the drink though, I will enjoy it when I get home later tomorrow.

replies.text: What if someone would pay you the amount of the fine?

conversationlist.message: Oh, that sounds a bit shady. I doubt anyone could afford the 450 gold around here. Anyway, I would need a bit more than that just to risk it.

replies.text: I have 500 gold right here that you could have.
You know you want the mead right?
Yes, I agree. This is starting to sound too shady. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: Oh sure. Now that you mention it. It sure would be good.

replies.text: So what if I pay you, say, 400 gold. Would that cover enough of your anxiety to enjoy the drink now?
This is starting to sound too shady for me. I'll leave you to your duty, goodbye.
I'll go get that gold for you. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: Wow, that much gold? I'm sure I could even get away with this without being fined. Then I could have the gold AND a nice drink of mead at the same time.
Thank you kid, you really are nice. Now leave me to enjoy my drink.
Hello again, kid. Thanks for the drink earlier. I had it all in one go. It sure tasted a bit different than before, but I guess that is just because I'm not used to it anymore.

replies.text: I recently talked to the watchman who blocks the old pathway to the Duleian Road. Why don't you just pay the woodcutter?

conversationlist.message: Hello again, kid. Thanks for the drink earlier. I still haven't had it.
Really, they would dare go up against the guard in Fallhaven? Do you have any details on their plan?

replies.text: I heard they are planning his escape tonight.
No, I was just kidding with you. Never mind.
On second thought, I better not upset the Thieves' Guild. Never mind I said anything.

conversationlist.message: Tonight? Thank you for this information. We will make sure to increase the security tonight then, but in such a way that they won't notice.
When they do decide to break him free, we will be prepared. Maybe we can arrest more of those filthy thieves.
Thank you again for the information. I'm not sure how you may know this, but I really appreciate you telling me.
I want you to go one step further and tell them that we will have less security for tonight. But instead we will increase the security. That way we can really be ready for them.
Good. Report back to me when you have told them.
Hello again, my friend. Did you tell those thieves that we will lower our security tonight?

replies.text: Yes, they won't expect a thing.
No, not yet. I'm working on it.

conversationlist.message: Great. Thank you for your help. Here, take these coins as a token of our appreciation.
Hello again, my friend. Thank you for your help in dealing with the thieves earlier.
I will make sure to tell other guards how you helped us here in Fallhaven.

replies.text: I recently talked to the watchman who blocks the old pathway to the Duleian Road. Why don't you just pay the woodcutter?

conversationlist.message: Hah! Jakrar? I should pay Jakrar before he has done his work? No way! Either he does his woodcutting job before I pay him or the passage stays blocked! That's how I always do it. It's the only way to get the job done well.
No way! Get lost or I'll throw you in jail! Talk to that filthy woodcutter if you want to reopen the path, but nothing will change my mind!

replies.text: So where can I find him?

conversationlist.message: He lives in his hut, immediately south of my prison. Don't you bother me again!

replies.text: I wanted to leave your shabby prison anyway.

conversationlist.message: Oh, it's you. You with that brother of yours. Always causing trouble.
Hmm, maybe you could be of use to me. Do you think you could help me with a small task?

replies.text: Tell me more about this task.
Sure, if there is anything I can gain from it.

conversationlist.message: I recently went in to that cave over there [points west], to check on our supplies. But apparently, the cave has been infested with rats.
In particular, I saw one rat that was larger than the other rats. Do you think you have what it takes to help eliminate them?

replies.text: Sure, I'll help you so that Crossglen can use the supply cave again.
Sure, I'll help you. But only because there might be some gain for me in this.

conversationlist.message: I need you to get into that cave and kill the large rat, that way maybe we can stop the rat infestation in the cave and start using it as our old supply cave again.

replies.text: On second thought, I don't think I will help you after all.

conversationlist.message: I didn't think so either. You and that brother of yours always were cowards.
Did you kill that large rat in the cave west of here?

replies.text: Yes, I have killed the large rat.
What was I supposed to do again?

conversationlist.message: Thanks a lot for your help kid! Maybe you and that brother of yours aren't as cowardly as I thought. Here, take these coins for your help.
Thanks a lot for your help earlier. Now we might start using that cave as our old supply cave again.

Welcome to my shop!

Please browse my selection of fine wares.

Oh my, will I ever get any sleep with those drunkards singing like that?

Someone should do something about them.

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message:
Sure kid, you may rest here.

Pick any bed you want.

Drink drink drink, drink some more.
Drink drink drink 'til you're on the floor.

Hey kid, wanna join us in our drinking game?

Never mind those drunken fellas, they're always causing trouble.

Want something to eat?

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: I heard you helped Odair clean out that old supply cave. Thanks a lot, we'll start using it soon.
Please do not disturb me, I have work to do.

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?

conversationlist.message: What?! Can't you see I'm busy? Go bother someone else.

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?

conversationlist.message: Andor? No, I haven't seen him around lately.

Well well, what have we here? A visitor, how nice. I'm impressed you got this far through all my minions.

Now prepare to die, puny creature.

replies.text: Great, I have been waiting for a fight!

conversationlist.message: Oh mortal, free me from this cursed world!

replies.text: Oh, I'll free you from it alright.

conversationlist.message: Hello there. Welcome to my cabin.

replies.text: What do you do around here?
What can you tell me about the surroundings here?

conversationlist.message: Mostly, I trade with travelers on the main road on the way to Nor City.

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?
What can you tell me about the surroundings here?

conversationlist.message: Oh, there is not much around here. Vilegard to the west and Brightport to the east.
Up north is just forest. But there are some strange things happening there.
I have heard terrible screams coming from the forest to the northwest.
I really wonder what is up there.
Welcome to my tavern. How can I help you?

replies.text: Do you know something about the back room?
What do you offer for trade?
I am looking for my brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me.

conversationlist.message: Keep your fingers out of things that are none of your business.
Please go away. I don't want you here in my tavern anymore.
You again
What do you want from me?

replies.text: I just want to talk a little bit.
I want to join you for a beer.
Do you know something about the back room?

conversationlist.message: I am very thirsty...

replies.text: Why don't you buy something for yourself?
Let's drink a beer together. I will pay. [Pay 2 gold]

conversationlist.message: I lost all my money gambling and can't afford a beer.

replies.text: I will buy you a beer. [Pay 2 gold]

conversationlist.message: Can I have one more beer?

replies.text: Here is one more beer. [Pay 2 gold]
Do you know something about the back room?
Where did you lose your money?
I want to find out what's happening in the back room, but they want a password.
I want to find out what's happening in the back room.
I want to talk to you about the gamblers.

conversationlist.message: Thank you for the beer.
I lost all my money gambling in the backroom. I think they are cheating.

replies.text: I will go and play with them to find out if they are cheating.
I want to find out what's happening in the back room, but they want a password.

conversationlist.message:
Thanks for trying to find out more. But you will need a password for entering the back room. [He whispers the password in your ear.]

You have to win and lose a few times until they trust you and play for higher amounts. Then they start cheating.

Thanks for trying to find out more. The password for entering the back room is... [he whispers the password in your ear.]

You have to win and lose a few times until they trust you and play for higher amounts. Then they start cheating.

Did you already find out if they are cheating?

You have to win and lose a few times until they trust you and play for higher amounts. Then they start cheating.

replies.text: I did not find anything out yet
I gambled with them and it seems they are cheating.
I gambled with them and it seems they are cheating. I even had a fight with them.
I gambled with them and I think they are playing fair.

conversationlist.message: I still believe they are cheating. Thanks anyway.
Thats what I thought. Thank you for your help.
That's what I thought. Thank you for your help and the fight. Someone had to do it.
Thank you for your help with the gamblers.
Hello again, friend. Thank you for your assistance with my family grave earlier.
Hello again. Have you investigated if anything has happened to my family grave?

replies.text: [Lie] I went to check on the grave. Everything seems to be normal. You must be imagining things.
What was I supposed to do again?
Yes. I killed the intruder and restored the dagger to its original place.

conversationlist.message: Hello there. You wouldn't happen to know anything about a grave to the southwest of Prim would you?

replies.text: I have been there. I met someone on one of the lower levels.

conversationlist.message: You have been there?
My family grave is located in the tomb to the southwest of Prim right outside the Elm mine. I fear that something has disturbed the peace there.
You see, my grandfather was very fond of a particular valuable dagger that our family used to possess. He wore it with him always.
The dagger would of course attract treasure hunters, but up until now we seem to have been spared of this.
Now I fear something has happened to the grave. I have not been sleeping well the last couple of nights, and I am sure this must be the cause.
You wouldn't happen to want to go check on the grave and see what is happening over there?

replies.text: Sure. I will go check on your parents grave.
A treasure you say? I'm interested.
I have actually already been there and restored the dagger to its original place.

conversationlist.message: Thank you. Please see if anything has happened to the grave, and what could be the cause of my nightly anxiety.
Nothing you say? But I was sure something must have happened over there. Anyway. Thank you for checking it for me.
Please hurry, and return here to tell me of your progress once you find out something.
An intruder? Oh thank you for dealing with this matter.
You say you restored the dagger to it's original place? Thank you. Now I might be able to rest during the nights ahead.
Thank you again. I'm afraid I can't give you anything except my gratitude. You should go see my relatives in Feygard if you get the chance to travel up there.
Hello again. Well done getting through those monsters.
We are almost there now. Just a little bit more.
We should hurry this last bit, my settlement is close now.
I hope you can manage the cold out here.
Also, stay away from the wyrms. They have a really nasty bite.
Now hurry. We are almost there. Follow the snowy path to the north, and you should reach the settlement in no time.

replies.text: OK, I will follow the path to the north, further up the mountain.

conversationlist.message: Hello there outsider. In general, we dislike outsiders here in Vilegard, but there is something about you that I find familiar.
What do you want to talk about?

replies.text: Why is everyone in Vilegard so suspicious of outsiders?
What can you tell me about Vilegard?

conversationlist.message: Most of us that live here in Vilegard have a history of trusting people too much. People that have hurt us in the end.
Now we start by being suspicious, and ask that outsiders coming here gain our trust by helping us first.
Also, other people generally look down upon us here in Vilegard for some reason. Especially those snobs from Feygard and the northern cities.

replies.text: What else can you tell me about Vilegard?

conversationlist.message: We have almost everything we need here in Vilegard. Our center of the village is the chapel.
The chapel serves as our place of worship for the Shadow, and also as our place to gather when discussing larger issues in our village.
Apart from the chapel, we have a tavern, a smith and an armorer.

replies.text: Thanks for the information. There was something else I wanted to talk about.
Wow, nothing more? I wonder what I am doing in a puny village such as this one.

conversationlist.message: I see a weird stone formation in front of me. As I try approaching the rocks, I'm stopped by a powerful magical force.
After defeating the Hira'zinn, the rock formation has fallen apart and somehow it made some hidden stones rise up so I can walk over them now.
In front of me, I see a torch burning with a purple glow. I can feel the force coming from this item. I shouldn't get closer until I tell Lodar about it.
There is no way to go further. Maybe this has something to do with the stones?
When pouring the vial's liquid over the torch, it suddenly burns a lot brighter and changes its color to green. I should approach this torch carefully...
Rocks have emerged here. I can walk further down this path.
Welcome back. Have you found out anything about my son, Rincel?

replies.text: Can you tell me the story about what happened again?
No, I have not found anything yet.
Yes, I have found out the story about what happened to him.

conversationlist.message: Welcome back. Thank you for your help in finding out what happened to my son.
Shadow help me.
My son! My son is gone.

replies.text: Jolnor said I should see you about your son.

conversationlist.message: I don't want to talk about it. Not with an outsider like you.

replies.text: Jolnor said I should see you about your son.

conversationlist.message:
Please leave me.

Oh Shadow, watch over me.
My son is dead, I know it! And it's those damn guards fault. Those guards with their snobby Feygard attitude.
At first they come with promises of protection and power. But then you really start to see them for what they are.
I can feel it in me. The Shadow speaks to me. He is dead.

replies.text: Can you tell me what happened?

conversationlist.message: Thank you. Shadow watch over me.
It all started with those Feygard royal guards coming here.
They tried to pressure everyone in Vilegard into recruiting more soldiers.
The guards would say they needed more support to help squelch the supposed uprising and sabotage.

replies.text: How did this relate to your son?
Are you going to get to the point soon?

conversationlist.message: My son, Rincel, did not seem to care much for the stories they told.
I also told Rincel of how bad an idea I thought it was to recruit more people to the Royal Guard.
The guards stayed a couple of days to talk to everyone here in Vilegard. Then they left. They went to the next town I guess.
A few days passed, and then suddenly my boy Rincel was gone one day. I am sure those guards managed to somehow persuade him to join them.
Oh how I despise those evil and snobby Feygard bastards.
This was several weeks ago. Now I feel an emptiness inside. I know in me that something has happened to my son Rincel.
I fear he has died or got hurt somehow. Those bastards probably drove him into his own death.
*sob* Shadow help me.

replies.text: What can I do to help?
That sounds awful. I am sure you are just imagining things.
Do you have proof that the people from Feygard are involved?

conversationlist.message: No, but I know it in me that they are. The Shadow speaks to me.

replies.text: OK. Is there anything I can do to help?
You sound a bit too occupied with the Shadow. I want no part of this.
I probably shouldn't get involved in this if it means that I could upset the royal guard.

conversationlist.message: If you want to help me, please find out what happened to my son, Rincel.

replies.text: Any idea where I should look?
OK. I will go look for your son. I sure hope there will be some reward for this.
By the Shadow, your son will be avenged.

conversationlist.message: Please return here as soon as you have found out anything.
Walk with the Shadow.
I guess you could ask in the tavern here in Vilegard, or the Foaming Flask tavern just north of here.

replies.text: By the Shadow, your son will be avenged.
OK. I will go look for your son. I sure hope there will be some reward for this.
OK. I will go look for your son so that you may know what happened to him.

conversationlist.message: Please tell me what happened to him!

replies.text: He left Vilegard by his own will because he wanted to see the great city of Feygard.

conversationlist.message: I don't believe it.

replies.text: He had secretly longed to go to Feygard, but didn't dare tell you.

conversationlist.message: Really?

replies.text: But he never got far. He was attacked while camping one night.

conversationlist.message: Attacked?

replies.text: Yes, he could not stand up to the monsters, and was critically wounded.

conversationlist.message: My dear boy.

replies.text: I talked to a man that found him bleeding to death.

conversationlist.message: He was still alive?

replies.text: Yes, but not for long. He did not survive the wounds. He is now buried to the northwest of Vilegard.

conversationlist.message: Oh my poor boy. What have I done?
I always thought he shared my view of those Feygard snobs.
And now he is not with us anymore.
Thank you, friend, for finding out what happened to him and telling me the truth.
Oh my poor boy.
Hello. I am Oluag.

replies.text: What are you doing here around these crates?
