conversationlist.message: Oh these. They are nothing. Never mind them. That grave over there is nothing to worry about either.
No no, nothing suspicious at all. It's not like they contain any contraband or anything like that, hah!

replies.text: What was that about a grave?
OK then. I guess I didn't see anything.

conversationlist.message: Right. Goodbye.
Look, I already told you the story.
Yeah, OK. So there is a grave right over there. I promise I had nothing to do with it.

replies.text: OK then. I guess you didn't have anything to do with it.

conversationlist.message: Well, when I say 'nothing', I really mean nothing. Or maybe just a little bit.
OK, so maybe I just had a little bit to do with it.

replies.text: Do I have to beat it out of you?

conversationlist.message: Relax, relax. I don't want any more fights.
There was this kid I found. He had almost bled to death.
I managed to get a few sentences out of him before he died.
So I buried him over there by that grave.

replies.text: What were the last sentences you heard him say?

conversationlist.message: Something about Vilegard and Ryndel maybe? I didn't really pay attention, I was more interested in what loot he had on him.

replies.text: I should go check that grave. Goodbye.
Rincel, was that it? From Vilegard? Wrye's missing son.

conversationlist.message: Yeah, that might be it. Anyway, so he said something about fulfilling a dream to see the great city of Feygard.
And he told me something about that he didn't dare tell anyone.

replies.text: Maybe he didn't dare tell Wrye?

conversationlist.message: Yeah sure, probably. He had set down here to camp, but got attacked by some monsters.
Apparently he was not as strong a fighter as, for example, someone like me. So the monsters wounded him too much for him to last the night.
Sadly, they also must have taken any loot with them, since I could not find any on him.
I heard the fighting and only managed to get to him after the monsters had fled.
So, anyway. Now he is buried over there. Rest in peace.
Lousy kid. He could at least have had a few coins on him.

replies.text: Thank you for the story. Goodbye.
Thank you for the story. Shadow be with you.

conversationlist.message: Hello again. I hope you will find what you are looking for.
Swift is my blade. Poisoned is my tongue. Or was it the other way around?

replies.text: There seems to be a lot of thieves here in Fallhaven.

conversationlist.message: Yes, we thieves have a strong presence here.
I heard that you helped Gruil, a fellow thief in Crossglen village.
Word has also reached me that you are looking for someone. I might be able to help you.
You should go talk to Bucus in the derelict house a bit southwest of here. Tell him you want to know more about the Thieves' Guild.

replies.text: Thanks, I'll go talk to him.

conversationlist.message: Consider it a favor done in return for helping Gruil.
Welcome friend! Would you like to see what equipment I have available?

replies.text: Sure. Show me what you have.

conversationlist.message: Welcome traveller. Have you come to ask for help from me and the equipment I sell?
I must tell you that my supply is not what it used to be, now that the southern mine entrance has collapsed. Far fewer traders come here to Prim now.

replies.text: OK, let me see your wares.

conversationlist.message: Regardless, I cannot help you. My services are only for residents of Prim, and I don't trust you enough yet. You might be a spy from the Blackwater mountain settlement.
Welcome traveller, what can I do for you?

replies.text: Let me see what you have available to sell.

conversationlist.message: Sell? I'm sorry, my supply is all out. Now that the traders do not come here anymore, I don't get my regular shipments. So at the moment, I have nothing to trade with you unfortunately.
Talk to the boss instead.
Please don't hurt me! I'm only doing my job.
What are you looking at? These weapons in the crates over here are only for us guards.
[The guard looks down on you with a condescending look]
Oh, I am so tired. When will we ever get to rest?
Can't talk now. I'm on guard duty. If you need help, talk to someone else over there instead.
See these bars? They will hold against almost anything.
When my training is complete, I will be one of the greatest healers around!
Can't you see I'm trying to read over here? Talk to me in a while and I might be interested.
Can't talk now, I have work to do.
Are you the one I heard about? No, you can't be. I imagined someone taller.
Welcome friend! Would you like to browse my selection of fine potions and ointments?

replies.text: Sure. Show me what you have.

conversationlist.message: Welcome traveller. Have you come to ask for help from me and my potions?
You look like a smart fellow. Need any supplies?

replies.text: Sure, let me see what you have available.
What can you tell me about yourself?

conversationlist.message: Me? I am no one. You didn't even see me. You certainly did not talk to me.

replies.text: Troublemaker sent me to get your report.

conversationlist.message: Hello there. I heard you helped Jolnor in the chapel. You have my thanks, friend.
Have a seat anywhere. What can I get you?

replies.text: Show me what food you have available.

conversationlist.message: Oh look, a lost kid. Here, have some mead kid.
You! I have seen you.

replies.text: Jhaeld sent me to ask you about the people that have gone missing.
I don't think so, I've never been here before.
Yes, I was just here, remember?

conversationlist.message:
The dreams and the visions. It is you! The child that challenges the beast.
[Duaina gives you a terrified look]

replies.text: So you have seen me in your visions?

conversationlist.message: The sleeping beast. No, no. The blinding light. Oh, why have you come here? Have you come for me?
Nooo, please spare me!

replies.text: I'm not here to get you, if that's what you are afraid of.

conversationlist.message: I can see it in you. You have the gift. The gift that will destroy the beast. My visions were true.

replies.text: Maybe you are confusing me with my brother Andor?

conversationlist.message: A brother? Yes, that must be what I saw in my visions. It is all becoming clearer.
The black hand sweeps over the land. The beast that hunts. Nooo! Leave this place!

replies.text: I'm not here to hurt you!

conversationlist.message: The child and the brother. The unsuspecting people. The beast casts its shadow.
I have seen you in my visions.
Slaying the beast beneath the prison of Flagstone.
Cooperating with the thieves in Fallhaven.
Working against the thieves in Fallhaven.
Something about a dagger returned to an ancestor in a tomb.
Something about stealing a dagger in a dark tomb.
Killing innocent sheep.
[Duaina stares at you in silence while holding her hand over her mouth]

replies.text: What else have you seen in your visions?

conversationlist.message: [Duaina stares at you in silence]
Kazaul ... Shadow ... what was it again?
Oh, a visitor. Hello there. I have not seen you around here before. Did they let you in here?
Of course they did. What am I rambling on about. Harlenn and his gang always keep their worldly duties under control.
So, who might you be then, eh? Probably here to bother me with some worldly complaint about the settlement needing more resources or someone complaining about the cold drag from the outside again?
What do you want?

replies.text: What was that you talked about when I arrived, Kazaul?
Are you aware that there is a bitter rivalry going on between this settlement and Prim?

conversationlist.message: And there you go with your mundane problems. I tell you, your worldly troubles do not interest me the least bit.
This is the mages' chamber in Blackwater mountain. We devote our time to the studies of the Shadow and its descendants.

replies.text: Let's go back to my other questions.

conversationlist.message: I am Throdna. One of the most learned persons around, if you ask me.
Kazaul, the Shadow spawn of red marrow.
We have been trying to read all we can on Kazaul, and the ritual. It seems we might be too late.
The ritual. We believe that Kazaul will manifest in our presence soon.
We must learn more about the Kazaul ritual, to gain its power and learn to use it for our purposes.

replies.text: Can I help in some way?
What were you planning to do?

conversationlist.message: As I said, we want to learn more about the ritual itself.
A while ago, we were on the verge of getting our hands on the whole ritual itself, but the messenger was killed under most interesting circumstances while traveling up here.
We knew he had the parts of the complete ritual on him, but since he was killed and we could not get to him because of the monsters - his notes were lost to us.

According to our sources, there should be five parts of the ritual scattered across the mountain. Three of them describing the ritual itself, and two describing the Kazaul chant used to summon the guardian.
Hmm, maybe you could be of use here...

replies.text: I would be glad to help.
Sounds dangerous, but I'll do it.
Keep your ritual of the Shadow to yourself. I am not getting involved in this.

conversationlist.message: Fine, we will just have to find someone else then.
Yes, you might be able to help. Not that you really have any choice though.
OK. Find me the pieces of the ritual that the former messenger carried on him. They should be found somewhere on the path up to Blackwater mountain.

replies.text: I will return with your parts of the ritual.

conversationlist.message: Yes, you will.
Hello again. I hope you come here to tell me you have the five parts of the ritual.

replies.text: I am still looking for them.
How many parts was I supposed to find?
What was I supposed to do again?
Yes, I think I have found them all.

conversationlist.message: Then hurry and go find them! What are you standing around here for then?
You actually found all five pieces? I suppose I should thank you. Well then. Thank you.
It seems you have not found all five pieces yet.
We have more pressing matters to focus on. As I briefly mentioned before, we believe that Kazaul will manifest in our presence soon.
If that were to happen, we could not complete our research about the ritual or Kazaul itself, all our efforts would be lost.
Therefore, we intend to delay the process as much as we can, until we have learned of its powers.
You might be useful to us here again.

replies.text: What do you need of me?
I sure hope it involves more killing and looting.

conversationlist.message: We need you to do two things. First, you must find the shrine of Kazaul. Our scouts tell us that the shrine should be located somewhere near the base of Blackwater mountain.
However, all passageways to the shrine are 'clouded in Shadow' according to our scouts. I'm not sure what that means.
Second, we need you to take a vial of purifying spirit and apply it to the shrine.
This vial is a vial of purifying spirit. It should delay the process well enough for us to be able to continue our research.

replies.text: Sounds dangerous, but I will do it.
This sounds like a trap. I won't agree to do your dirty work.

conversationlist.message: Good, here is the vial. Now hurry.
Return to me as soon as you have completed your task.
Hello again. I hope you are here to tell me you have purified the shrine of Kazaul?

replies.text: What was I supposed to do again?

conversationlist.message: Then hurry and go take the vial to the shrine! What are you standing around here for?
Good. We must hurry to continue our research on Kazaul.
You should get out of here to allow us to concentrate on our work.
...Kazaul, destroyer of bright dreams...
...Kazaul ... Shadow...
[Throdna continues to mumble on about Kazaul, but you cannot make out any other words]
Keep your voice down while in the inner chamber.
Are you also looking to become one with the Shadow?
Please report any suspicious behavior you might see.

replies.text: I know what the cause of the illness is. Have a look at this vial that Buceth had on him.

conversationlist.message: I am Kuldan, captain of this here detachment of guards in Loneford. Now, if you will excuse me, I have work to do.
Feygard is grateful for your assistance in solving the mystery of the illness here in Loneford.
We are trying to help the last few people that are still ill here now. Loneford might require our assistance from Feygard for quite some time.
What is this? This smells like Narwood poison. You say you retrieved this from Buceth?

replies.text: Buceth was part of a mission by the Nor City priests to poison the water well here in Loneford.

conversationlist.message: But this means ... it is the water that the people are getting ill from? This explains a lot of things.
You my friend have done Loneford a great service by finding this, and by extension, Feygard as well. We should go catch Buceth for what he has done.
Dead you say? Hmm, not quite the way we do things in Feygard, but I guess this is an exceptional case.
I always suspected that those savages from Nor City were behind this all along.
It's good to know that we now at least have some evidence to back up our claims.
As for Loneford, I guess we will have to start bringing in water from Feygard to help the people here. Good thing they have us around, what would they do otherwise?

And you, my friend - you should of course be sufficiently rewarded for your assistance in this matter. You should travel to the glorious city of Feygard to the northwest and report to the castle steward there for further instructions.
I happen to know the castle steward personally, and I will send word to him about your help here.
For the glory of Feygard, the people of Loneford may live on thanks to your help.
What? Talk to the boss.
Welcome to Fallhaven Tavern. Have a seat anywhere.

replies.text: Let me see what food and drinks you have available.

conversationlist.message: A room will cost you only 10 gold.

replies.text: I really need to rest but I don't have 10 gold. I will wash the dishes. [Wash the dishes]

conversationlist.message: Thanks. Take the last room down at the end of the hall.

replies.text: Thank you. There was something else I wanted to talk about.

conversationlist.message: I hope the room suits your needs. It's the last room down at the end of the hall.

replies.text: Thank you. There was something else I wanted to talk about.

conversationlist.message: You seem familiar somehow.

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?
Do you know anything about the Thieves' Guild?

conversationlist.message: Thieves' Guild? How would I know? Do I look like a thief to you?! Hrmpf.
Hey you! You shouldn't be here. This dagger is mine. Get out!

replies.text: Hey, that's a nice looking dagger you have there.

conversationlist.message: You see the remains of rusted equipment and rotten leather.

You see the remains of rusted equipment and rotten leather. Something seems to have been recently removed from here since one place completely lacks dust.

The lack of dust looks distinctly dagger-shaped. There must have been a dagger here earlier that someone removed.

replies.text: Place the dagger back into its original place.

conversationlist.message: You place the dagger back among the equipment, where it looks like it used to be.
Hello again, friend. Thank you for your assistance in obtaining that dagger earlier.
Hello again. Have you been able to retrieve that dagger from Bjorgur's family grave yet?

replies.text: I decided to help Bjorgur instead.
What was I supposed to do again?

conversationlist.message: What?! Sigh. Stupid kid. That dagger is worth a fortune. We could have been rich! Rich I tell you!
Hello there. You seem like just the type of person I am looking for.
Oh wow, you actually managed to get the dagger? Thank you kid. This is worth a lot. Here, take these coins as compensation for your efforts!
Thank you again. Now, let's see ... how much should we sell this dagger for?
Would you be interested in hearing about a business proposal I have?

replies.text: If it leads to something for me to gain, then sure.
I couldn't possibly think you would have anything worthwhile to offer me, but let's hear it anyways.

conversationlist.message: For some time, I have known about a certain valuable dagger that a certain family used to possess here in Prim.
Now hurry up. I really need that dagger soon.
This dagger is extremely valuable to me, for personal reasons.

replies.text: I don't like where this is going. I better not get involved in your shady business.
I like where this is going, please continue.
I have already helped Bjorgur return the dagger to its original place.

conversationlist.message: Fine. Suit yourself, you goody two-shoes.
The family in question is Bjorgur's family.
Now, I happen to know that this particular dagger can be found in their family tomb that has been opened by other ... people ... recently.
What I want is simple. You go get that dagger and bring it to me, and I will reward you handsomely.

replies.text: Sounds easy enough. I'll do it.
No, I had better not get involved in your shady business.
I have already helped Bjorgur return the dagger to its original place.

conversationlist.message: Good. Return to me once you have it. Maybe you can talk to Bjorgur about directions to the tomb. His house is just outside here in Prim. Just don't mention anything about our plan to him!
Welcome adventurer!

replies.text: Trade items very very long text

conversationlist.message:
Debug quest start
Test.
Yes, you have already completed this quest.
Thank you for the items.
Quest is now completed.
More info. Quest progress should now be updated to 20.
This should be a signpost.
This tile requires a quest progress.
This tile costs 10 gold !
OK. But only because it's you M. Coder.

replies.text: When I come to debugmap, I always feel like a star.

conversationlist.message: Sorry. You already spent 100 gold...
Hmm... beer...
Do you want beer?
Bees & beer !
No beer for you !
OK.
OK.
OK.
OK.
OK.
OK.
OK.
OK.
OK.
OK.
What do you want?
Applied.
Cleared.
5 rounds immune!
Immune forever !
Punished forever !
You are unable to enter the Charwood mine.
The air around here is much hotter around the hole in the ground here than in the rest of this room. This must be where the miners found the strange markings on the ground.
Ah, another mortal that has come to bow before the might of Thukuzun.
You will be a fine specimen in my army of bones.

replies.text: Your bones will be a fine specimen in my collection.

conversationlist.message: Hello again. We sure showed that bastard Tinlyn. That should teach him not to mess with me again.
I have nothing more to say to you. Leave me.
Psst, hey. Over here.
You look like an aspiring adventurer. Are you willing to do some ... [Benbyr pauses] ... adventuring? He he.

replies.text: What are we talking about here?
Depends on what I get in return.
I try to help people wherever they might need help.

conversationlist.message: Straight to the point eh? I like that.
Ah, the adventurer seeks compensation. Tell me, is the thrill of an adventure not reward enough?
Then I will surely disappoint you. Return to me once you are ready for my task.
The noble adventurer. He he, I like that. Yes, you will do fine.
A while ago, I did some business with a certain man called Tinlyn, over here at this Crossroads guardhouse.
As to the nature of our business, I can't really tell you. Let's just say that our business was of the kind that was mutually beneficial and the guards did not know about it.
We were ready to finish the big deal, me and Tinlyn. That's when he decided to turn on me.
He reported me to the guards, and made me take the whole blame for our business.
I was sent to Feygard prison, while he himself was set free for reporting me.
Argh, that fool Tinlyn. I hope the Shadow never shows him any mercy.

replies.text: What do you need me to do?

conversationlist.message: I want to get revenge on that fool Tinlyn of course. Now, my plan is the following:
I have heard that he is herding sheep these days. This is an excellent opportunity for ... shall we say ... an accident to happen to his sheep. He he.
You, my friend, would be the perfect walking accident. I want you to find all of Tinlyn's sheep and make sure they are forever united with the Shadow.
Do this, and I will have avenged that fool Tinlyn.

replies.text: Sounds like just my type of thing. I'll do it!
This sounds a bit shady, but I'll do it anyway.
No way, killing innocent sheep is beneath me. I will never do your task.

conversationlist.message: Very well, but remember that I have my eyes on you ... adventurer.
Splendid!
I happen to know that there are eight of his sheep in total, and they should all be to the northwest of here.
Return to me with proof that you have slain all eight of them.
Ah, my walking accident returns. He he.

replies.text: Can you tell me your story again?
I am still looking for those sheep.
I have slain all eight of Tinlyn's sheep for you.

conversationlist.message: Ha ha! That fool Tinlyn must be in tears. The Shadow surely walks with you my friend.
This is a glorious day indeed! Tinlyn should have known not to mess with me!
As for you my friend, seek out my friends in Brightport. I am sure they would extend their hospitality to you.
What will happen to us?
Thank you for finding our missing people!

replies.text: What do you think caused the monsters to appear?

conversationlist.message: I told them we shouldn't be digging deeper!
But they did anyway. Now, look what it got us.
It all started with a few of the miners coming back from their shift. They reported having found some sort of markings on the ground.
Strange markings. Unnatural. Nothing like we've seen before.
We don't know. No one could make any sense of them, not even Morenavia. I told them all that we should just leave it be.
But they didn't listen.
Then some people started hearing strange noises coming from below the ground around those markings. Almost like there was something below - a cavern or something.
Strange noises filled the whole mine, loud rumbles and shrieking noises from within the rock.
They wanted to find out what was below those markings.
So they started breaking through further down.
I wasn't there myself, but I heard from some of the miners. As they broke through, there was a rush of air and a clattering noise, almost like claws, coming from the dark hole beneath.
Below the ground with the markings, there was a cavern, just as they had suspected.
A foul sulfurous smell crept into the mine, most likely coming from that cavern.
They started hearing chattering in strange voices from inside the opening.
Then they saw it. As I've heard it, it all started as a small flame from within the dark cavern.
The flame grew stronger, and more lights appeared.
Out of the dark, they came. Out from the depths of the mine.
Those foul smelling things.
I told everyone that we shouldn't have breached that deep. We should have stopped when we first saw those markings on the ground.
Those markings must have been some sort of warning.

replies.text: Is that how this all started?

conversationlist.message: Yes. Whatever was in that cavern, we should not have let it out. Maybe that way, Morenavia and Ayell would still be alive.

replies.text: Is there anything I can do?

conversationlist.message: You've helped us this far. Talk to Maevalia again, she might have something else for you.

replies.text: OK, I'll go talk to Maevalia again.

conversationlist.message: Hey, this is my house, get out of here!
Beat it kid, get out of my house!

Do you know anything about my husband? He should be here helping me with the farm today, but he seems to be missing as usual.
Sigh.

replies.text: Yes, I found him. He is hiding among some trees to the east.

conversationlist.message:
If you see him, tell him to hurry back here and help me with the housework.
Now get out of here!

Hiding is he? That's not surprising. I'll go let him know who's the boss around here.
Thanks for letting me know though.
Thanks for telling me about Oromir earlier. I will go get him in just a minute.

Oh you startled me.
Hello.
I'm hiding here from my wife Leta. She is always getting angry at me for not helping out on the farm. Please don't tell her that I'm here.
Go away, I don't want to talk to you!

replies.text: Wow, you're the friendly type, aren't you?

conversationlist.message: [Elwel mutters to herself] Stupid kids...
I saw you talking to that cursed sister of mine. Don't listen to her, she always tries her best to portray me in the worst way possible.
Now look what you did!
Who are you? Did we invite you here? No, I didn't think so. Now get out!
Bah. Leave, before I call the guards over here!
Yes. Argh. It's not like I am proud of being a sister to ... her.
She is the black sheep of the family. She never agrees to anything, and always complains. Just look at her.
She even has the stomach to call ME the black sheep of the family, when it is clearly SHE that is causing all the trouble around here.
She's always nagging me about how I should move out of what she considers to be HER house, when it in fact is MY house and SHE is the one that should move out so that things can settle down.
Ahem. As I've told you several times, Elwyl, since it's YOU that is causing all the trouble, I think it would be best for both our sake if YOU moved out.
Argh. I am so upset at her!

replies.text: Good luck with that. I'll leave you to your fighting.
Is there anything I can do to help?
Some people have been complaining that your squabbling has kept them awake at night.

conversationlist.message: Yes, you can leave! I never invited you here. Leave, before I call the guards!

That's what I always tell her, to keep it down. She is insistent on shouting at me when we argue. I guess all of her shouting must have made her more or less deaf, since I also have to shout to her to make her understand.
She doesn't stop either. I can't remember for how long this has been going on, it almost feels like forever.

Oh, my sister is just so stubborn! You know, last night, I was talking to her about those potions that Hjaldar used to make. The smell from his brewing used to reach into our house here ... or, I mean ... my house here.
So, I was talking to her about those potions of accuracy focus and how I always thought their blue liquid seemed so odd, since there were no blue things that he used while making them.
Then all of a sudden, she started arguing with me about how I have things completely wrong. She insists that the potions were green.
I can't understand why she would make such a big deal out of it, when the potion was clearly blue. I remember it distinctly. Argh, how stubborn she is! She wouldn't even admit that she is wrong!

replies.text: Are you sure it was blue?
Why make such a big thing out of what color some potion was?
Is there anything I can do to help you two?

conversationlist.message: Why ... yes ... of course. I am not wrong! They were clearly blue.

replies.text: Why make such a big thing out of what color some potion was?
Is there anything I can do to help you two?

conversationlist.message: Exactly. She is clearly wrong, so why won't she just admit it, and we can move along?

replies.text: Are you sure it was blue?
Is there anything I can do to help you two?

conversationlist.message: Maybe you could go visit Hjaldar and get one of those potions of accuracy focus, and we can both show her that she is clearly wrong.

His house is up on the northeast shore of town.
[Elwyl points outside]
I'm not sure why he doesn't make those potions anymore though. Maybe he still has some old ones still in supply that you may have?

replies.text: I'll return with one of those potions.
I am not getting involved in this. You'll have to solve your own conflict.

conversationlist.message: Good. Maybe when you bring that potion, she will agree to being wrong for once!
Bah, you kids are never good for anything.
Oh, it's you again. What do you want?

replies.text: I have one of those potions of accuracy focus for you.
I have a strong potion of accuracy focus for you.
You talked about some potion before. Could you repeat that?
Some people have been complaining that your squabbling has kept them awake at night.

conversationlist.message: Oh good. Give me that.
Huh, what's this? It's yellow ... I was sure that it used to be blue. Let me smell it to make sure that it's the right kind of potion.
Hmm, yes, it smells exactly as I remember it. It must be the right potion.
This means ... that Elwel was wrong anyway!
Elwel, look at this, you were wrong! The potion wasn't green as you said, it's yellow! Why didn't you just listen to me?!
Elwel, you are always trying your best to prove me wrong. Well look at this, now you are wrong for once!

replies.text: Whatever, you two don't seem to get along very well. I'll leave you to your squabbling.
I hope that you two will get along some day.

conversationlist.message: Hey Elwel, you were wrong all along! Why won't you ever admit it when you are clearly wrong?
Oh, it's you again. Thanks for bringing me that potion earlier.
Maybe under here? No.
Maybe over there... Yikes! Who are you!?
Oh, it's you again. Now, who were you again?
Well, it doesn't matter who you are anyway. I am Lodar, maker of potions.

replies.text: I was sent to find you, I'm looking for my brother, Andor - have you seen him?

conversationlist.message: Don't know. What difference does it make? I must get all this done before the Hira'zinn moves.
Yes yes, the Hira'zinn. As I said, I must find the correct mixture before it moves again.
Now, where were they? Over here perhaps?
No, maybe I should add some of the...

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to help?
What's going on here, why are you in such a hurry?

conversationlist.message: Oh yes. Can you please move a bit, you are in the way. Can't you see I'm busy with finding a way to stop the spread of the Hira'zinn here?

replies.text: You are still not making any sense to me. What is this Hira'zinn that you keep mentioning?
Very well, I'll leave you to it. Good luck.

conversationlist.message: Didn't I tell you? I must find the correct mixture before the Hira'zinn spreads further.

replies.text: You are still not making any sense to me. What is this Hira'zinn that you keep mentioning?
OK then. I'll leave you to it. Good luck.

conversationlist.message: Everything was fine up until a few days ago. That's when everything started to happen.
It never used to be like this, or did it? I can't remember.
Doesn't matter. I must make it stop anyway.
Maybe it was in here...
No ... hmm, wait. You! Maybe you can be of use here, if you are willing to help?

replies.text: I'm up for it! What do you need help with?
I'm not so sure about this. What do you need done?
No way. You solve your own problems, old man.

conversationlist.message:
[Lodar hands you an odd looking stone that seems to be glowing from within]
Good. Take this stone, it will allow you to enter the tomb. Go below. Return once you're done.

replies.text: You're not very good at giving directions, old man. I'll try to do what you ask.
Below? Below what? Which tomb? What are you even talking about?

conversationlist.message: Good. Now, hurry, before the Hira'zinn moves again!
I thought I make it very clear before. With the stone in your possession, you will be able to enter the tomb. Go below. Return once you're done.

replies.text: Fine. I still don't understand, but I'll try to do as you ask.
Oh, that makes it much clearer! I'll be right back.
OK. I'll be back once I'm done with your task.

conversationlist.message: Oh, it's you again. Were you successful in what I asked of you?

replies.text: What was I supposed to do again?
I have defeated the Hira'zinn in the tomb below. Here is its heart.

conversationlist.message: Give me that. Oh, yes ... yes!
Did you really defeat the Hira'zinn? It is a formidable foe. I guess you must have, since you gave me its heart.
What was I doing? I was searching for something. I seem to recall you being here before, is that right?

replies.text: Yes, we spoke before, but you seemed to be obsessed with the Hira'zinn and did not make much sense.
Yes, but you were acting all crazy. I nearly put my sword through your throat.

conversationlist.message: Well, I feel much better now.
Thank you my friend for saving not only me but all of us.
The Hira'zinn would have slowly but surely found a way to creep up on us all.
So, thank you. I am in your debt. Now, how could I repay you?
Maybe you would be interested in purchasing some of my brews, mixtures or herbal salts? I am afraid that is the only thing of any worth that I possess. I will of course offer you a discount.

replies.text: That will do nicely. Thank you.
I killed that foul thing and saved us all, and all I get in return is a few lousy potions?

conversationlist.message: Good.
Do not forget that you also saved yourself from the Hira'zinn by defeating it. Had you not done that, it would have crept up on you as well, sooner or later.
I can assure you that my mixtures are ... well ... shall we say ... not for the faint of heart. They can have quite a profound effect on you.
Hello again.
Again, thank you for your help.

replies.text: I'd like to talk about your potions.
What are you doing all by yourself out here in the forest?
On the body of the Hira'zinn, I found this peculiar sword. Do you know anything about it?
I have come to find you. I am looking for my brother Andor.
The way to come here is a real maze and the path is tricky to find. I think I've lost my way a hundred times. Do you know of an easier way?
I found the cave you mentioned but unfortunately the path doesn't go anywhere. I noticed a weird torch burning with a purple glow though. Do you know anything about this?
I found a cave beneath the Hira'zinn tomb but unfortunately the path doesn't go anywhere. I noticed a weird torch burning with a purple glow though. Do you know anything about this?
It worked and I didn't get injured at all! There's now a path from the Duleian road to here that lets me avoid the maze.

conversationlist.message: I try to keep to myself. Not many people find their way to my cabin here.
I like that. That way, I am not bothered, like I used to be.
Oh yes, I too grew up in the city. But that life is behind me.
Right now, this suits me well. I hope there won't be any more ... disturbances, like the one you helped with.
No! Get that thing away from me, I want nothing to do with it. I can almost hear the cries of the many lives that that thing has taken.
I tell you - that thing should be destroyed.

replies.text: I think I'll hold on to it a bit longer.

conversationlist.message: You should go see the smith in Vile ... haven? Vile ... fall? Argh, I'm not very good at names.
Vilegard - yes, that's the place. You should go see the smith there. He might be able to guide you further.
Anyway, It's good that you defeated the Hira'zinn. I can't imagine what could have happened if the Hira'zinn would have given that thing into the wrong hands.
Oh yes. These are the ones I have available right now. If you want, I can also create some other special potions for you.

replies.text: Let me see the ones you have.

conversationlist.message: Yes, yes. I have some even more interesting recipes that I might be able to mix for you. However, I am all out of some of the most important ingredients for them.
If you want me to mix them for you, you'll have to help me get those ingredients.
Yes, were you able to get some of that Spotted Hornbeam fungus from the potion-maker in Fallhaven?

replies.text: No, not yet. I'd like to see what potions you have available right now.

conversationlist.message: Oh yes, this will do nicely. Good, good. Thank you, my friend.
The Spotted Hornbeam fungus is an excellent reagent for creating potent mixtures.
With your help, I can now create additional potions from the remains of certain animals if you would like.
Actually, the most important ingredient is the one that I am out of. Most of the potent mixtures that I know of require the spores from the Spotted Hornbeam fungus.
And that, my friend, is not easy to come by here in the forest. Believe me, I have scoured the nearby forest in search for it, and I have even tried to cultivate some of it myself, to no avail.
However, I can imagine that the merchants in the larger settlements might have some.

replies.text: Do you want me to find you some of that fungus?

conversationlist.message: Yes please. Maybe the potion-maker in that Fall-something town has some? Fall ... brim? Fall ... port?

replies.text: Fallhaven? The potion maker in Fallhaven?

conversationlist.message: Yes, that's what I was looking for. Fallhaven. Go visit him and ask him if he has some. I am sure he has some, if you know enough to ask.

With the Spotted Hornbeam fungus that you brought, I can either do a mixture that makes you think you're stronger than you actually are, or a mixture that makes you resist attacks more. There's also the skin-hardening potion, of course.

replies.text: I'd like to see what regular potions you have available.
Never mind that, let's go back to the other things we were discussing.

conversationlist.message: Have you ever noticed how insects are able to lift things that are much larger than themselves? As it turns out, I have discovered that if you mix some ground up insect wings together with the dried body of a spider, you can experience that same sensation yourself.

replies.text: I'll go find some of that. Let's talk about the other potions.
I have those things on me, here.
I have enough of those things on me for five potions, here.
I have enough of those things on me for ten potions, here.

conversationlist.message: Excellent. These will do nicely. Now, we only need to mix these with some of this ... and some of...
There. One mixture for you.

replies.text: Thank you. About those other potions...

conversationlist.message: Excellent. These will do nicely. Now, we only need to mix these with some of this ... and some of...
There. Five mixtures for you.

replies.text: Thank you. About those other potions...

conversationlist.message: Excellent. These will do nicely. Now, we only need to mix these with some of this ... and some of...
There. Ten mixtures for you.

replies.text: Thank you. About those other potions...

conversationlist.message: I have discovered that if you mix some ground up claws from a beast called the white wyrm, together with a slight sprinkle of the center of a ruby gem, it can have a most interesting effect on you. Two of those claws and one gem would do.

replies.text: I'll go find some of that. Let's talk about the other potions.
I have those things on me, here.
I have enough of those things on me for five potions, here.
I have enough of those things on me for ten potions, here.

conversationlist.message: Excellent. These will do nicely. Now, we only need to mix these with some of this ... and some of...
There. One mixture for you.

replies.text: Thank you. About those other potions...

conversationlist.message: Excellent. These will do nicely. Now, we only need to mix these with some of this ... and some of...
There. Five mixtures for you.

replies.text: Thank you. About those other potions...

conversationlist.message: Excellent. These will do nicely. Now, we only need to mix these with some of this ... and some of...
There. Ten mixtures for you.

replies.text: Thank you. About those other potions...

conversationlist.message: Up in the north, I have heard tales of beast called the arulir. Their skin is thick as bark due to the interesting oily substance that they produce. I have learned that if you extract some of that thick oily substance, and mix it with an infectious claw from some monster, you can make a potion that makes your skin almost as tough as theirs. I will require two of those skins for it to be effective, and I believe you can find the type of claws that I require on monsters that dwell underground and in caves somewhere outside Fallhaven.

replies.text: I'll go find some of that. Let's talk about the other potions.
I have those things on me, here.
I have enough of those things on me for five potions, here.
I have enough of those things on me for ten potions, here.

conversationlist.message: Excellent. These will do nicely. Now, we only need to mix these with some of this ... and some of...
There. One mixture for you.

replies.text: Thank you. About those other potions...

conversationlist.message: Excellent. These will do nicely. Now, we only need to mix these with some of this ... and some of...
There. Five mixtures for you.

replies.text: Thank you. About those other potions...

conversationlist.message: Excellent. These will do nicely. Now, we only need to mix these with some of this ... and some of...
There. Ten mixtures for you.

replies.text: Thank you. About those other potions...

conversationlist.message: Ah yes, the Hira'zinn. It nearly had me fully in its grasp as well.

replies.text: You seem a bit crazy to me.

conversationlist.message: That's the effect of the Hira'zinn. Its desire is to consume the minds of all it finds.
I have only heard of it through tales in books. It has been many generations ago since it last showed itself.
Last time it crept up on the world, it got its grip on whole villages, I've read. People were fighting their own brethren, after having been consumed by the Hira'zinn.
Imagine, sisters and brothers fighting, husbands and wives going at each others throats, all because the Hira'zinn had twisted their minds.

replies.text: Let's go back to the other questions.
What caused it to appear the last time?
Hah, those people seem like weaklings. That thing was no match for me, I could have defeated it while blindfolded even.

conversationlist.message: Now, don't be so quick to underestimate the Hira'zinn. It has many tricks up its sleeve.

replies.text: Let's go back to the other questions.
What caused it to appear the last time?

conversationlist.message: I do not know. The tales I have read do not tell how or why it all started - only that there was some kind of conflict going on at that time.
The wise men during those days also spoke of having seen some sort of signs before things got worse.
I don't know. Something about some rocks turning to life. Sounds like crazy-talk to me.

replies.text: Yes, maybe they too were affected by the Hira'zinn?
I saw some odd looking rock formations on my way here through the forest. Some of them even seemed to have some inner glow in them.

conversationlist.message: Yes, they might have been.
Anyway, it's good that you defeated that thing.
Formations of rocks you say? Hmm. I don't recall seeing any of that the last time I ventured out.
Could that be how the Hira'zinn extends its reach?
Yes, that would explain a great deal. The tales speak of it slowly creeping up on the world.
It could be that those formations are the way it gets closer to the people and things that it wants to consume.
It could be that the Hira'zinn has some way of affecting the life of the forest itself, causing these formations to appear.
That's what I think, at least.

replies.text: You still sound a bit crazy to me.

conversationlist.message: Oh, you must be referring to that other boy that was here recently.

replies.text: You've seen him? Andor has been here?

conversationlist.message: He did not tell me his name, but he had some similarities to how you look. Yes, then he probably was the person you are looking for.
You say his name is Andor? That's an odd name, don't you think?
Anyway, enough of that. What would you like to know?
Well, even from the first time I saw him, I knew something odd was going on.
He seemed overly friendly to me, almost like he seemed to know me already.
You should know that most people that stumble into my cabin here have either been lost in the maze some time, or are just happy to see another living being.
He showed no such signs. Almost like he knew who I was and that he expected me to be here.
He very kindly asked for some Narwood extract.

replies.text: I recognize that name 'Narwood extract' from somewhere.

conversationlist.message: It can be used to make quite a nasty poison.

replies.text: Oh right. I've visited a village whose town well had been poisoned with that.

conversationlist.message: Those poor poor people. They have my sympathies. I hope it's not my things that brought this misery upon them.

replies.text: Please continue your story about Andor.

conversationlist.message: So, he asked for a sample of Narwood extract. Normally, I wouldn't give that out to just anyone.
However, as I said, there was something odd about this whole meeting. I actually felt a bit threatened, even though he was so polite and friendly.
Fearing something would happen to me if I rejected his request, I reluctantly gave him a small sample of the Narwood extract.
He gladly accepted the sample, and left shortly after. That's when it started to get even more odd.
As he left, I happened to glance out the window. There, in the forest I saw the bright flash of the light from the sun hitting a blade.
If I hadn't seen that light coming off the blade, I would not have spotted the person there at all. He seemed to be hiding in the forest.

replies.text: Someone was hiding in the forest?

conversationlist.message: Yes, so it would seem. It was quite obvious that he did not want me to spot him. After your brother left, I saw them both speak some words to each other, before they both left together.

replies.text: So, Andor was here, wanted some Narwood extract, and he was travelling with someone that did not want you to spot him?

conversationlist.message: Yes, that's basically it. But that's not all.
Shortly after they left, strange things started happening in the forest.
I saw a pack of wolves that were fighting each other. Tearing up each others sides, and eating the remains.
I saw birds flying over my cabin, totally covered in red blood. Blood covered birds - now that's something that I have not even heard about.
I tell you, something affected the forest. Myself, I felt my stomach turning even more often than it usually does.
I had this strong urge to eat more than usual. I even found myself having lapses of time where I could not remember what I had done for the past couple of hours.

replies.text: What could have been causing that?

conversationlist.message: In hindsight, I think it's pretty clear what started to happen. The Hira'zinn awoke. To make matters worse, at least for me, it awoke in the tomb beneath my cabin here.
What I find disturbing is that this all started to happen right after your brother and that other person were here.
Maybe they visited that tomb. Now, I'm not pointing any fingers here, but it certainly seems like they had something to do with this, considering that the tomb has been quiet for ages.

replies.text: Are you implying that Andor awoke the Hira'zinn?
I don't think I like where you're going with this. Andor is my brother, and he would never do such a thing.

conversationlist.message: I don't know the details of course, and I have no proof. I only know that asking for Narwood extract is an odd request, and that the Hira'zinn started to creep up on me shortly after that.
Now, I am no expert in these things. I have only read bits and pieces from old books. I mostly focus my thoughts on herbs, mixtures and potions.
But I do know other people that might be able to provide you with further guidance.
Since you defeated the Hira'zinn, I think those people would be more than happy to speak to you. I would be happy to help you in any way I can too, of course.

replies.text: Who do you have in mind?

conversationlist.message: Seek out Lady Lydalon in the Valanyr temple of the Shadow in Nor City. She is one of the wisest people I know, and an excellent mentor.
Here, take this letter.
Present the letter to the guards at the temple, and they will grant you an audience with Lady Lydalon.
Also, while you're there, please give her my warmest regards. It has been too long since I last visited her.

replies.text: I will go to Nor City and visit Lady Lydalon in the Valanyr temple of the Shadow.
He he, a temple. That must mean a lot of riches in there.

conversationlist.message: Show some respect will you?
Just one more thing.
The person that was hiding among the trees here, that your brother was travelling with - I happened to get a quick view of his cloak.
I've seen cloaks like that before. The fabric is similar to a fabric commonly used in Nor City.
It could mean that whatever group of people he belongs to - there might be more of them in Nor City. Either you might want to stay away from them, or seek them out. You decide.

replies.text: Thank you for all the information. I will travel to Nor City.

conversationlist.message: You have done a great deed here. Goodbye. Take care, my friend.
Hmm, I remember seeing a cave under the former cave of the Hira'zinn. I don't know where it leads to but maybe you could give it a try and search for a shortcut through this cave?

replies.text: Thanks for your advice! I'll check it out!

conversationlist.message: Hmm, this is interesting. I have heard of such artifacts being teleporters but have never seen one myself. Here, take this vial and pour it over the torch. We will see what happens. I should tell you that this may be very dangerous. The artifact could respond differently than I think and could even kill you.

replies.text: Thanks, I'll try it. Danger is my specialty.
I hope it will be OK.

conversationlist.message: Well, that's great to hear. But don't tell this to anybody else because I don't want to have some Feygard soldiers in front of my house one day.

replies.text: Sure, this will be a secret between us.
[Lie] Sure, this will be a secret between us.

conversationlist.message: Sure feel free to use any bed in the main hall you like.
A child, here? I must be seeing things again.
[The guard stares back at you without saying anything]
[You notice him breathing heavily, and that his hands are shaking furiously]
[You also notice that the whites in his eyes have turned red from the many pulsating veins]
[The guard launches himself at you, raising his sword]
You not belong here. You leave now.

replies.text: I am sent here by Aulowenn to take care of you.

conversationlist.message: No, you die now! You one of them! Tiqui angry!

replies.text: Sorry, I wasn't listening since I was so distracted by your hideous appearance and your foul smell. Here, let me fix your face with my dagger.

conversationlist.message: You are not allowed to use Aulowenn's bed.
My helping friend! Thank you, thank you!
Tiqui not want fight. Tiqui angry that men who smell bad kill his friends.

replies.text: I won't listen to any of your lies. You'll die now!

conversationlist.message: They did. Men who smell bad do not belong here. Everything quiet before they came.

replies.text: I won't listen to any of your lies. You'll die now!

conversationlist.message: You can smell them from far away even. We sense something bad would happen when we first noticed them.
First we try stay away from them. They notice us, but we stay away. They trespass deeper.
One smelly man walked into snake trap. Snake trap not meant for smelly man.
Other smelly men angry at snake trap. Tiqui not understand. Smelly men should be angry at stupid man who walk into snake trap.
After, smelly men angry at us. Hunt us. Kill us.
Much fight. Much blood on ground. But blood good for trees.
Tiqui head of clan. Tiqui make decision of revenge.
Smelly men hunt us down. Kill many.

replies.text: The smelly men you speak of must be the guards from Feygard. They've been killing you off?
I won't listen to any more of your lies. You'll die now!

conversationlist.message: Yes. Smelly men kill us when they see us.

replies.text: I won't listen to any more of your lies. You'll die now!
What can I do to help?

conversationlist.message: You help Tiqui? Tiqui want revenge for dead friends.
Tiqui knows smelly person with crates [points in the direction to where Aulowenn is].
You go take care of last smelly person. Tiqui can be friend to you. Tiqui can have revenge.

replies.text: I won't listen to any more of your lies. You'll die now!
I will gladly kill more of those Feygard scum.
No, I think I'll find your village and take whatever riches you have instead.
It sounds like they have been wrongfully killing you. I will help you.

conversationlist.message: You friend of Tiqui.
Hello, friend of Tiqui. Can Tiqui have revenge for friends?

replies.text: I won't listen to any more of your lies. You'll die now!
Can you tell me your story again?
I've dealt with Aulowenn for you.

conversationlist.message: Yes! Yes! The smell is gone. You friend of Tiqui now! Tiqui help you when we meet again!
You also use bed of smelly men, and Tiqui keep you safe.

replies.text: Thank you. I'll feel much safer now that I know you'll watch over me when I rest in Aulowenn's old bed.

conversationlist.message: You good friend of Tiqui!
Ouch, my head. It hurts so much.
What? Who are you?
No no. You are too small. You can't be him.
Crazy old fool, that's what they said he'd be.
Ha ha. Crazy!
[The guard mumbles something that you can't understand]
Must get away! Soon we all will be able to see it.
[The guard continues with his mumbling]

replies.text: Are you even listening to me?

conversationlist.message: I see .... So you want to get involved in our Guild?

replies.text: Yes, you seem like reasonable people.
No, not really. I'm not interested in being a smug thief.

conversationlist.message: Well, you've shown us you are trustworthy by bringing that key. However, doing just one task does not prove to us that you are eligible to be a member of our guild.

replies.text: But I really want to join your guild!
Really? I didn't see any of your members bringing you "that" key.

conversationlist.message: I'm sorry to hear that. Good luck.
OK, OK. You will get a chance. But I warn you that from now on, you cannot go back on your choice.
So what is your decision?

replies.text: Haven't you understood? Just tell me what I have to do.
I need some time to think about it.

conversationlist.message: Very well. Let's see if you're good enough to join our guild. Talk with Troublemaker. He will tell you what you have to do.

replies.text: All right! I'll go see him.

conversationlist.message: Fine. I will keep an eye on you.
Not for now. Make sure nobody sees you doing suspicious things. Good luck.
I understand your doubts. Come back when you're prepared.
Argh, another annoying apprentice ... I mean, sorry. I know you were the one who brought us the key.
OK, now listen up!
As I expect you are aware, we're not welcome in many places. In fact, we're being pursued by Fallhaven patrols. That's why we are here. This place is safe.
But we need supplies to survive, and also to maintain the Guild's influence. We are not just common robbers.

We don't just steal gold or goods. We steal information. Secrets, shipment reports, strategic locations.
Do you know what I mean?
We have spies and scouts in certain key locations, gathering information. These locations are places frequented by people from Feygard and also from Nor City.
So you will be the intermediary this time, collecting our spies' journals and bringing them to me.

replies.text: That's not my favourite kind of job, but I will bring them.
No, I'm too strong to be just a mere broker.

conversationlist.message:
Good. We have three people on the job.
The first one is a spy in Crossglen, Leta. I believe you know her.
One of our veteran spies, Dunla, is disguised as a vendor in Vilegard Tavern.
And finally we have Fanamor, watching what is happening around Crossroads Guardhouse. Search for them in this order.
Hmpf. Go kill some beetles with your strength!

Ah! I almost forgot. You have to say the password if you want them to give you the journal.
The password is "You are no one. No one knows you. No one has seen you." Good luck.

replies.text: I will keep that in mind. Bye.

conversationlist.message: What? I don't know what you are talking about.

replies.text: You are no one. No one knows you. No one has seen you.
You are no one. No one knows you. No one has seen you.

conversationlist.message: So, you are one of us. Here, take my journal.

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: Sorry, I don't have any more information for you.

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?

conversationlist.message: Finally! I was getting tired of waiting here killing these beasts ...
Take this. All I've seen is written here ...
Halt! You have been caught!
In the blink of an eye, Fanamor starts attacking the scout.

Argh ... damned trash, take this! 
(His sword swings quickly, and severely wounds Fanamor)

(Grabs the book)
What have we here? A lost kid trying to do business with this scum, hah? 
You are under arrest!

replies.text: How dare you! Prepare to die, useless soldier!

conversationlist.message:
Tsch ... I ... cannot ...
You kid, protect the book!
Umar you say? I don't know any Umar!

replies.text: (Whispering) You are no one. No one knows you. No one has seen you.

conversationlist.message: How do you ...? Whatever, you are one of us.

replies.text: Umar sent me to get your journal.

conversationlist.message: Here. Make sure you don't raise any suspicion on your future jobs. Bye kid.
I gave you all the information I have gathered. Now leave me alone.
Wow, you ... you really got rid of him ....

replies.text: Yes, even though he was strong, as we can expect of Feygard soldiers ...

conversationlist.message: Watch out! Behind you!
Argh ... The Feygard Scout hit me badly. I have not much time ... I am bleeding very heavily.
Yes, I am. I have no time for jokes!
I need a bandage quickly, or I will never return to the guild house.

replies.text: I will find a bandage for you, don't worry.

conversationlist.message: Have you brought me that bandage?
Hurry up! I do not have much time ...
(You look away when you see the corpse of Fanamor. Anklebiters probably had something to do with this horrible event.)
What's the matter, my child?

replies.text: Ehm ... My father has cut himself with an axe, and we don't have any bandages!
Fanamor, a member of Thieves' Guild, is severely wounded. Please give me a bandage for her!

conversationlist.message: Let me see ...
This is what I have, take it. I expect this will be useful.

replies.text: May the Shadow walk with you, my friend.
Thank you, I won't forget this!

conversationlist.message:
(You help Fanamor put the bandage on the wound)

... I think I will be able ... to move in a few minutes. See you at the Guild. Thank you kid.

replies.text: I'm glad to hear that. Bye.

conversationlist.message: How is the mission going?

replies.text: I have the journals, but one of your spies, Fanamor, was killed by a Feygard scout.
I gave you the journals, so where's my reward?
Well, but can I take a look at your supplies again?

conversationlist.message: Well done kid! You can now consider yourself skilled enough to be a part of this guild.

replies.text: Yes .... So where is my reward?

conversationlist.message: Well, that is the price of being one of us. There's always risk.
Return to me when you are done.

replies.text: Can you tell me again what I'm supposed to do?

conversationlist.message:
You have to retrieve information from our spies.
The first one is a spy in Crossglen, Leta. I believe you know her.
One of our veteran spies, Dunla, is disguised as a vendor in Vilegard Tavern.
And finally we have Fanamor, watching what is happening around Crossroads Guardhouse. Search for them in this order.
And don't forget the password: You are no one. No one knows you. No one has seen you.
You should talk with Umar. Maybe he has another task ... one that's more in your line of work, you know.

replies.text: Sure, I will talk to him.
At least I got some gold. Bye!

conversationlist.message: Hi again, kid. What do you want?

replies.text: OK ... It's done. She's alright, and probably eating some bread now.
I still have to take our guest to her quarters.
I have to ...(you look at Ambelie) find a better place for her.
Can I take a look at the Guild's current supplies?

conversationlist.message: Hello, friend! Thank you for all you've done for me.

replies.text: It's my job. Nice to see you survived those anklebiters ...

conversationlist.message: What have you decided?
Excellent, young friend. Consider yourself a member of our Guild.

replies.text: Meh, that was nothing special. Bye.
OK, nice to see you again.
Hah, what an honor! It has been so, so difficult ....

conversationlist.message: I detect a certain sarcasm in your words.

replies.text: No, no .... Never mind, see you later.
That's maybe because I am trying to be sarcastic ...

conversationlist.message: What do you mean?

replies.text: Just give me a high-risk job, please.
I mean my last job was a piece of cake. I need something more exciting!

conversationlist.message: If you want me to give you a more difficult task, then I am happy to do so.

replies.text: OK, in that case tell me what it is.

conversationlist.message: But first I have to clarify something. You need to be more careful not to give information to outsiders about the Thieves Guild.

replies.text: You're right. It will not happen again.

conversationlist.message: Yes, you mentioned Fanamor's membership to Thoronir.
Fortunately, Thoronir will keep quiet, as he certainly does not want to give up our donations.

replies.text: You're right. It will not happen again.

conversationlist.message: You still have many things to learn, young apprentice.
Well, before I can give you a very demanding job, I need you to do another ... retrieval task.

replies.text: Anything for the glory o... Oops, I mean OK

conversationlist.message: Excellent. I warn you that this is not an ordinary retrieval. It's more like a ... kidnapping.

replies.text: Can you get to the point please?
Sounds too shady for me. I think I prefer to not do that task for now.

conversationlist.message: Just tell me when you want to do the job. Bye

OK, listen carefully.
We have heard a noble woman has decided to travel outside Feygard.

Nothing unusual about that. But in this case we've discovered that the woman is the daughter of Hertzsen Laumwill, patriarch of the Laumwill family.

(You look around, trying to remember someone, but nothing comes to you)
To help you understand, they are one of the richest Feygard families, very close to Lord Geomyr.

replies.text: OK, so what I have to do?
I ... understand. So what's my task?

conversationlist.message: I want you to bring the noble woman here, so that we can ask for a substantial ransom from her generous father.

replies.text: Where can I find this woman?

conversationlist.message: Great ... Before you go, I should tell you where she is.
Scouts have seen the lady in the Foaming flask tavern. We do not want to be discovered, so act quietly. Guards are a problem though. It's up to you how you choose to solve the guards problem.

replies.text: Seems difficult, but whatever. I'll do it.

conversationlist.message: Good luck. Return to me when you're done.

replies.text: Wait, wait! How am I supposed to ...
I will bring her, even if I have to eliminate Feygard's entire army!

conversationlist.message: Use your tongue, young man. Sometimes it is more important than your sword skills.

replies.text: Hah! I don't think so. But anyway, thank you for the advice.
I'll do that, thanks for the advice.

conversationlist.message: Remember that if you are discovered, you are no one. No one knows you. And of course, no one has seen you. You are now a member of the guild, so don't fail.

replies.text: You still think I'm a novice, right? You're going to see that you're wrong!

conversationlist.message: No, I've told you all you need to know. Now leave me please, I've work to do.
Why? I don't know you, commoner. Why would I be willing to trust a savage looking kid?

replies.text: But I'm not a commoner! I'm a ... Feygard spy. These clothes are my disguise!
I'm stronger than those smug guards.

conversationlist.message: Anyway, I prefer to stay in this place for now. Get away from me!
What? I haven't been informed of that. Since you seem like an inexperienced kid, I don't believe you.

replies.text: Ergh ... Mr Laumwill is grateful for your protection. However ... Ah! He has given this reward of 1000 gold for your efforts.
Trust me, I'm the one that delivered those swords from Gandoren to you!
(I would like to bribe the captain, but I need at least 1000 Gold) I will come back later.

conversationlist.message: Oh! What a considerable reward! OK, OK. Only Feygard people are so generous!
I have to stay here to supervise my guards. They sometimes need educating about what to do. I assume you're able to escort her without problems?

replies.text: [Lie]For the glory of Feygard, I will!

conversationlist.message: Oh, I see. Maybe you're right.
You again?!

replies.text: [Lie] Sorry, but I have to take you back home!

conversationlist.message: No! I won't go anywhere with you, commoner! Guards, guards!
Haha! Sorry lady, but your father wants you back home. I also believe this dirty tavern is no place for a woman like you, haha!

replies.text: Yes, you have to come with me.

conversationlist.message: NO! I've said no! Don't bother me. Get away from me!

replies.text: [Whispering] You fool! Be quiet. Listen to me if you want to save your life.

conversationlist.message: (You tap her on the back of the head with the handle of your weapon, and she falls unconsicious)

Halt! The road to Fallhaven is closed due to recent information about a dangerous criminal who has been seen not far from here.
That criminal committed a murder only hours ago.

replies.text: But I really need to pass!

conversationlist.message:
Sorry, I'm not able to decide who passes. This barricade will be here until we catch or kill the criminal.

(You take a look into your map. There seems to be another way to reach Fallhaven, heading up to the North)

(You put Ambelie, who is still unconsicious, in a chair next to you)

Oh! How how did you get here so fast? I've heard reports of a barricade blocking the way from the Duleian road to Fallhaven.

replies.text: Barricades, guards ... no big thing for me.

conversationlist.message: OK, well done. Now we will have to find a better place for our guest. Keeping this lady here could be dangerous for us.

replies.text: I'm sure that's the case, but that's not my problem anymore. Right?

conversationlist.message: Yes it is.

replies.text: Well, I have no choice. What should I do?

conversationlist.message: Hmm, let me think about it ....
We are supposed to have one room for receiving "visitors". However, I don't know if It's finished.
Hmm, I believe Troublemaker knows the actual state of that place. Ask him, and if it's possible leave our guest there.

replies.text: OK, I will. (You lift Ambelie up and carry her on your shoulders)
Hmpf ... Bye (You lift Ambelie up and carry her on your shoulders)

conversationlist.message: So do you want to kill her quietly?

replies.text: No, just I want a suitable place to leave her until ...
What? No, I am just asking you for a place for this type of job. Umar told me you knew of somewhere.

conversationlist.message: Yeah, the ransom. I'm a veteran kid, don't forget that.
Hmpf, be more specific next time. I'm not a mind-reader!
Well, I understand. Yes I have a place, but there's a problem. That place is at the other end of the town, next to the graveyard.

replies.text: I don't think that will present a major problem for me.
I got here without any problem. Why I would have problems crossing through town?

conversationlist.message: Well, anyway, I'm building a way underground to reach it without being seen. It will be ready next time, I promise.

replies.text: Thank you. I will go there.

conversationlist.message: OK. Make sure you're not seen doing suspicious things!
Yes, there is something.
I almost forgot. Take this key. Make sure you put it in correctly to open the hatchway.

replies.text: Hmm, OK. I will keep that in mind.

conversationlist.message: I have better things to do than help an apprentice. Leave me. Hmpf.
Looking around the room, you see an unusual mechanism. A crowbar with a locked chain that prevents a lever from beng moved.
You hit the chain, but all you get is a mark on your weapon and frustration, as the chain is still intact.
This is probably the place Troublemaker mentioned. You see a crowbar with a locked chain that surrounds the whole mechanism, stopping it from moving. The key seems to fit into the lock.

replies.text: Put the key into the lock.

conversationlist.message:
You insert the key in the lock. You can hear strange noises and creaks as you turn the key. You make an extra effort, and finally the heavy chain falls on the floor, freeing the mechanism.

When you move the lever the floor starts trembling, and eventually a hatch appears that  leads downstairs.
This cell looks like the right place for a hostage.
You leave Ambelie in the cell and close the door.

Ah, yes ... that captive. Take this food and make sure she is comfortable enough. We don't want her starving right?
(Troublemaker gives you some bread)

replies.text: Argh. OK. What a tedious job!

conversationlist.message: (Ambelie seems to be resting, dead to the world. The entire room is quiet. You really don't like this cold place)
(You take a look at the cell. Ambelie has awakened. When she looks at you, her face turns pale)

replies.text: Hello! I have food for you.
Hey, you! Take this food quickly, I have no time to waste!

conversationlist.message: Wh..what do you want? What have you done to me? Where in the world am I? Answer me!

replies.text: That does not concern you. Take this food please.
Look, if you don't shut up I will silence you my own way, OK?

conversationlist.message: Don't hurt me please! I will be quiet.

replies.text: Now take this food ... Without complaining!

conversationlist.message: Food, you say?

replies.text: Are you deaf or something? Take this bread and stop bothering me!

conversationlist.message: Bread? That's not a worthy food for a noblewoman like me! Oh my, where am I?

replies.text: If you prefer going without food in this ugly cell for a long while then I don't care.
Do you prefer to eat the floor, bad mannered woman?

conversationlist.message: S..sorry, please ... Yes I'm hungry ... Will you give me that? *sniffs*
Th..thanks. Now, please tell me, where am I?

replies.text: Sorry, but I cannot reveal that to you right now. Bye.
That doesn't matter! If you behave well maybe you will be out of here sooner rather than later.

conversationlist.message: ... Fine *sniffs*.
(You look again through the bars. Ambelie is still there, alive, and gnawing on the bread you gave her earlier.)
Excellent. From now on me and my fellows will take care of her.

replies.text: Very well. I will go and talk to Umar again. Bye.

conversationlist.message: Do that.
Hey, what are you waiting for? Leave me and go talk with Umar or something!

replies.text: You don't need to be rude! I will leave.

conversationlist.message: Simple. Talk with Troublemaker about this job. He probably knows of some safe place to keep her. Then return to me.
Fine .... Although you look odd. What's the matter?

replies.text: It's OK ... it's just that is not my kind of work.
Urgh ... I just need better tasks! Do you still think I'm not yet ready?

conversationlist.message: Sometimes people must do things that they don't like. Maybe you're still too young to understand that?
No, nothing of the kind! I was .... Well, let's talk.
Well .... Anyway, I promise we won't give you those kind of jobs for a while.

replies.text: That is good news for me.

conversationlist.message: Great, so let's talk then.
First of all, take this gold for a job well done. We have already sent people to ask for the ransom.

(Umar looks a little worried)

This is really not your line of work huh?
I suggest you rest for a while before doing more. You look tired.

replies.text: Tired? I don't know what that means!

conversationlist.message: I prefer that you are completely rested before talking about work.
Don't be overconfident. Take my advice and rest. We'll talk tomorrow.

Come back to me when you're prepared. Bear in mind that your next task isn't going to be as easy as the ones you already did.
We'll talk about that tomorrow.

replies.text: I expected that. See you tomorrow then.
Easy? Argh, they've been so difficult! Good night.

conversationlist.message: (You should go to the bed now. You take off your bag and grab the blanket. This bed is more comfortable than you thought, but maybe that's because you are really exhausted. Finally, you blow out the candle in the room.)
Umar was clear. Sleep, then return. I should do what he said and go to bed.

(The night here is anything but quiet. You can hear wolves' howls, as they become more active during the night. Even people's conversations can be overheard. However, you couldn't care less about that right now. You finally fall asleep)
(The sun rises and you open your eyes. You feel fully rested and eager to talk with Umar. He's probably waiting for you.)
I should not leave the city now. Father told me once that monsters and beasts are more dangerous at night.
Why am I heading in this direction? The tavern isn't in this way!
It would be better to not bother people at this hour.
I see you are better than yesterday.
Fine. Listen to me carefully.

replies.text: Sure, tell me what you have to say.

conversationlist.message: Here in the guild, as you know, members range from apprentices to veterans. The veterans are usually specialized in specific jobs.
Troublemaker is my right hand man. He's in charge of planning jobs that have some level of complexity.
Pickpocket has developed his stealth skills to such an extreme that he's able to take your equipment, and you'll barely even feel it.
Each person has their own way to reach the top.
Believe me, I'm not lying.
Anyway, the fact is that one of our veterans has betrayed us.
Yes. He and his former comrades were sent to the Fallhaven catacombs.

replies.text: I thought the work there was done since I brought the key of Luthor to you.

conversationlist.message: The key is just the first part. We need to decipher the runes in the key in order to reach the crypt.

replies.text: What crypt? I've never heard of it.

conversationlist.message: The team leader and others loyal to him killed the rest of the team and escaped with the key, before entering the church. They have probably deciphered the code and they want to sell the information to the highest bidder. That happened three nights ago.
Let's just say that's not important to you at this moment. What they did is more important now.
Honestly, I don't know for certain.
Sure, I can do that.
Apparently they decided the Guild wasn't the best option, so they turned greedy and betrayed us. That's more common than I would like to admit.

replies.text: They have signed their own death sentence.

conversationlist.message: There's more. Two days ago the southern route from here to the Duleian road was closed, because there was a murder. Soldiers are trying to prevent the murderer from escaping to the west.

replies.text: And you think the traitors are involved in that?

conversationlist.message: I'm pretty sure about it. The team leader is the one we call "Crackshot", as he is a master of murder, torture and the subjugation arts. He's really a dangerous man.

replies.text: So, do you have a plan?
What am I supposed to do?

conversationlist.message: Hmm ... I think we have no choice. We'll have to deal with him and his henchmen ... forever.

replies.text: OK, leave this to me. That's finally the kind of work I was searching for.
I ... I prefer to not get involved into this. Sorry.

conversationlist.message: Are you completely sure? You will be alone against trained thieves and other criminals whose sole objective is to earn more and more gold.

replies.text: I can deal with them with my bare hands!

conversationlist.message: Maybe it's not the best time. We must bring him down. Think about it. There are probably many lives at risk ...
Whatever, I do believe you are capable. Regardless, be cautious with Crackshot. He's powerful, and his attacks can severely wound or kill you. Clear?

replies.text: Bah, words are worth nothing now. It's going to be a nice fight.

conversationlist.message: If you say so. Your self-confidence is a good aspect of your personality.
However, there's still a problem. We're not completely sure about the location of Crackshot's new hideout.

replies.text: What? How I will find him then?
He will show up sooner or later ...

conversationlist.message: Probably people near the Duleian road guard tower know more. See if you can ask them for tips.
Maybe, but it will be faster if you question people near the Duleian road guard tower. The Duleian road is the place where we think he was last seen.

replies.text: Argh, the Duleian road is big!

conversationlist.message: Sorry, I have no more information. If you need anything come back. Good luck.
That's why you have to ask.
Make sure you don't talk about the Guild and his relationship with us. Don't trust anyone.

replies.text: I won't even trust my shadow.

conversationlist.message: Fine.
Remember, this is an important mission! Don't forget it again!
First, you must find Crackshot's hideout.
Then you will have to deal with him and his henchmen, and finally bring back the Key of Luthor to us.
Understood?

replies.text: Can you explain it to me again?

conversationlist.message: Excellent. Good luck.

Are you serious?
Bah, I'll repeat it for you ...
Aren't you a bit young to be travelling around here all by yourself?

replies.text: Sorry, have you heard anything about a murder?

conversationlist.message: Yeah, Feygard authorities have sent more patrols to the south. Apparently there is a group of criminals hiding in the forest
Now go away kid, I'm working!
(This man seems to be immersed in his thoughts)

replies.text: Hi. Have you heard about the murder not far from here?

conversationlist.message:
What? A murder?
I don't know what you're talking about, sorry.

replies.text: Civilians! You never see anything. Bye.

conversationlist.message: Sorry, kid! I'm unable to let you pass. Orders from above!
Yes. He's not alone!
Yes! We have sent patrols to the north. There's a place infested by larval burrowers.
He and the other criminals are probably hiding there!

Yes! Those crimin ...
Wait, you don't have to know this information! Forget everything I've said!
Halt! The road to Fallhaven is closed due to a murder committed three days ago.

replies.text: Hey! I live in Crossglen. How do you expect me to get there?

conversationlist.message: (You look at the floor. The blood hasn't coagulated yet. It seems there has been a recent fight between two or more people.)
(The same blood stains. They are coagulating more and more. Soon they will be just another mark on the floor.)
(More blood. There's no doubt, there has been a fight here.)
(Looking again at the same blood marks won't achieve anything except wasted time.)

ARGH!! *sword clashing*

Sergeant! Sergeant!
... *laughter*

replies.text: That sounds like fighting nearby. I should check into that.

conversationlist.message: (You see, horrified, how this man is bleeding out rapidly. He has countless cuts and his face is mutilated. You can almost hear his gasps.)

replies.text: For the glory of Feygard, you will be avenged!

conversationlist.message: Sar...gent. *gasps*.
