Y..you kid ... Argh! *spits up blood*.
That guy is not ... Argh.

No ... he's not .... Agggh!
[He has stopped breathing. I cannot do anything for him. Better to move on.]
(The terrible smell of blood here is unbearable. However, I should check whether those men are alive.)
No way. There are countless cobwebs. I should go through the door.
I think I should check those strange blood marks before going on ....

Another idiot trying to pass through here, eh?
Your life ends here!

replies.text: The people you've killed will be avenged.

conversationlist.message:
(Gives you a surprised look). How ...?
Who are you kid?

Wait! That's not actually important.
Leave this dangerous place, right now!

replies.text: You are right. It would be better to leave.
Hah! No way, I won't give up.
I'm here because ... I'm here to help you!

conversationlist.message: My whole patrol is dead! Why do you think you have any chance of success?

replies.text: I managed to reach this place. Is that not enough for you?
I'm not here to discuss that with you.

conversationlist.message: It's your life, do whatever you want.

replies.text: Please tell me what do you know about the current situation.

conversationlist.message: Indeed, I don't know why are you here!
I don't know much. Only that me and my patrol were sent here to arrest a murderer. But what we found was unexpected.
We reached these passages via a forest cavern, and went through the beasts without any major problem. Suddenly, the suspect appeared with a group of men, probably his allies or subordinates ...
Those people were fast. Very fast and very dangerous. They killed them! My fellows, all of them defeated!
I managed to get rid of most of them, but I'm severely wounded and unable to continue ...

Don't you understand? You must leave this place before you can't.

He's playing with us!

replies.text: You are right. I will leave.
Take these supplies and leave. I'll avenge your mates.
Don't worry. You must report this before it is too late. I'll go there instead of you.

conversationlist.message: Agh, thank you. You are valiant, kid. I hope to see you when we are both out of here. I'll invite you for a drink!

replies.text: OK, thank you. Now I have to run.
Yeah, sounds good. For the glory of Feygard I'll avenge your mates!

conversationlist.message: (You see a hole leading to a cave. Maybe this is a good place to start searching.)
Kid, why are you still here? Leave me, I'm just resting a bit.

replies.text: Don't be rude! I'm here to help you. Please leave and go to a safer place.
Calm down. Take these supplies and call backup!

conversationlist.message: You couldn't be in a worse place to play hide and seek, kid. Die!

replies.text: Now your mates will play that with your corpse!

conversationlist.message: Oh ho! Welcome to my base, kid.

replies.text: Hmm .... This is not the place where I would choose to live.
You are under arrest for the crimes you've committed against Feygard!

conversationlist.message: Haven't you realized yet? Your life is not going to be much longer.

replies.text: Hah! Let's see if you're as strong as Umar has said.

conversationlist.message: *laugh* Are you serious?
Do you really believe such words are worth anything here?
Let's see if you can arrest me after I have finished with you!

replies.text: The Feygard soldiers will be avenged!
Your head will serve as proof!

conversationlist.message: The lock seems to match with the key of Luthor.

replies.text: Insert the key of Luthor into the lock.
Insert the blessed key of Luthor into the lock.

conversationlist.message: W..wait ....

(The dying Crackshot is in agony. He looks at you despairingly)
It is curs...sed.
The key is cursed .... She ... I am ... (Crackshot finally dies, emitting a soft bluish breath)

replies.text: Bah .... Too many questions. I need to come back.

conversationlist.message: Excellent. Did he have the key with him?

replies.text: Yes ... [give key]. Why is this key so important to us?
Sure, here, take it. And maybe it's time to give me some more information.
He had the key, but I don't have it with me.

conversationlist.message: Don't try to fool me. I am Umar. I know you have it.

replies.text: Oh. Yes, I remember now that I found the key. Here, take it.
Even if I have the key, I won't give it to you.

conversationlist.message: Why did it take so long? And do not look at me that way. I can not tell you anything about the key for now.
Come back when you are sane again.
Then what you are waiting for? Go and get it!
I'm sorry, but for now I can't say more.
Be patient, my friend. Everything will come in due time.

replies.text: I expect my patience will be rewarded.

conversationlist.message: Anyway, you've done your work. My spies reported to me that you saved someone's life.

replies.text: If your spies help me, tasks would be easier.
Yeah. He was a Feygard officer ... a sergeant I think.

conversationlist.message: Anyway, you've done your work. My spies reported to me you had saved someone's life.

replies.text: If your spies help me, tasks would be easier.
I tried to, unfortunately he didn't survive. But it was nobody important.
No, he died at last. He was a Feygard officer ... a sergeant I think.

conversationlist.message: Trust me, it will.
I've told you to have patience, my friend. Any thief is dead without patience.
I mean this is not the time to tell you what you want to know, sorry.
Each of you have your own specific task. Spies must hide their identities, even to their allies.
I see ....
Hmm! And now to business. Here's your reward for the good work.

Take 4000 gold coins, and some bottles of my favourite mead.
Now you deserve a good rest, my friend. You have earned the trust of the Thieves Guild.

replies.text: Count me in for the next job.

conversationlist.message: I will, no doubt about it.
And last but not least, I have some useful information for you. The way from here to the southeast has been finally been opened, once Crackshot's hideout was discovered.

replies.text: Good, I'm not going to have to take that detour.
Thank you for the information. Bye.

conversationlist.message: However, the Feygard presence is still significant. Be cautious with with what you do.

replies.text: I will, thank you for the advice.

conversationlist.message: No jobs today my young friend. Maybe some other day.

replies.text: That's a shame. Find more time for my skills then.

conversationlist.message: [Here, the story continues]
Wha... what are you referring to?

replies.text: Sorry. Time to sleep! (Knock her out)
I'm here to detain you, and then ask for a ransom.

conversationlist.message: No way! Guards!

replies.text: I'm not going to hurt you, I don't want to do this.

conversationlist.message: You! Don't go any further. Leave me!

replies.text: I'm not going to hurt you.

conversationlist.message: I couldn't care less about you! Just ask the guards.

replies.text: Those untrained men aren't able to defend themselves. Don't make me laugh.
Other people will get you, and they won't be as kind as me.

conversationlist.message: I am safe here!

replies.text: You aren't, and my presence here is the proof!

conversationlist.message: Then get out of my sight now!

replies.text: I can't.Things are not that easy! Other people will get you instead of me.
They will probably kill me if I go back without you.

conversationlist.message: Stop. Then tell me what I can do!

replies.text: Give me something of value, and you won't see me again.
[Lie]I have enough gold, so if you give me something valuable .... The ransom we were going to ask will be covered.

conversationlist.message: Take this and leave me, please.

replies.text: It has been a pleasure, my lady.

conversationlist.message: I see guilt in your eyes, my young friend.

replies.text: I couldn't accomplish the objective, I'm sorry.
I felt sorry for that woman, and I decided to extort her and get the gold directly.

conversationlist.message: You don't need to tell me things I can see with my own eyes, it is a waste of time.
I expect more of you. That was your first mission inside the guild and you failed it!

replies.text: I brought a valuable necklace from the noblewoman.

conversationlist.message: Being a good liar is a very valuable ability for the guild, but useless against me.
What we have here? (Umar's face gets a smile while he admires the necklace)
Well. I will take it as compensation for your mistakes.
You already took my necklace. Leave me alone.
You already triggered the lever that opened a hatch which leads downstairs.

You ... Argh ... 
[The sergeant takes one final breath and then dies. You should have come earlier. Now you will never get to know what he wanted to tell you.]
The door opens.
Something prevents the key from turning, so you cannot unlock the door.
I'm afraid all the beds at the guild are taken for the night. We have arrangements at the inn in town though. If you tell them Umar sent you then you will not have to pay for a bed.

[Takes a step back]
What ... is ... that? It can't be? No. Let me look at it.
It has all the markings. But it can't be? I don't understand.
This thing that you have stumbled upon, my friend. This is the Xul'viir. A most foul item indeed.
It has been said that King Luthor destroyed the sword so that it would not fall into the wrong hands.
It would seem that either he, or the stories have not been telling the truth.
If restored, anyone wielding it would make their enemies tremble from only the sight of it.
You must destroy it, of course. Here, put it into my smelting pit and we'll be rid of it.

replies.text: Here it is. We had better get rid of it.

conversationlist.message: Into the smelting pit with it. Good. See how it bubbles and flares? That's the lives of countless people thanking you for destroying it.
You can't be serious. It needs to be destroyed!

replies.text: Here it is. We had better get rid of it.
You mentioned restoring it before, what would that entail?

conversationlist.message: The original sword had ornaments of rare crystals, and a blade that was as sharp as nothing else.
I can't believe I'm telling you this. Give. It. Here. Now! It needs to be destroyed!

replies.text: Here it is. We had better get rid of it.
How about you get to work on restoring it, and I won't kill you.

conversationlist.message: I ... what? Are you threatening me?

replies.text: You won't believe what I had to go through to get it.

conversationlist.message: Sigh. You don't know what you are getting yourself into, kid.
Regardless, to restore the sword to its former shape, I'd need some of those crystals that it was adorned with, and those crystals are really hard to come by.
I think they are called Oegyth or something like that. The sword had three of them on its hilt.

replies.text: Never mind. Here is the sword. We had better destroy it.
I'll go find some of those crystals.
I have three of those crystals right here.

conversationlist.message: Pfft. Run along now, and don't threaten anyone else, you hear?
You continue to amaze me. Now, are you really sure that you want to do this? The lives of the people that it has slain will haunt you.

replies.text: I'm sure. Here is the sword and three of those crystals. Restore it to how it once was.
Never mind. Here is the sword. We had better destroy it.

conversationlist.message:
Sigh. OK, whatever you say. We just need to fit these into there, and sharpen up this bit here.
There. It should be almost like it once was.
You there! This is no place for children!
Thank you for all your help!
Hello again. Did you reach the lower parts of the Charwood mine?

replies.text: Yes. I encountered a dragon-like creature in the fiery depths of the mine.

conversationlist.message: It's good to see that Falothen and Fayvara are well. Anything else that I can help you with?

replies.text: Where do you think the monsters came from?
I talked to Kantya about what happened in the mine.

conversationlist.message: Hello again.
Hello again. Did you find our missing people?

replies.text: Can you tell me the story about what happened here, again?
What was I supposed to do again?
Who were the people that I was supposed to look for, again?

conversationlist.message: You again.

replies.text: Can you tell me the story about what happened here, again?

conversationlist.message: The Charwood area has become a dangerous place as of late. You should leave at once unless you want to get killed ... or worse.
For your sake, I urge you to leave. While we need all the help we can get, we can't take responsibility for the dangers that has befell our mining town of Charwood.
We were attacked. We didn't stand a chance, they were too many and we are no fighters.
They started pouring out of the mine and the surrounding hills.
The monsters. Disgusting, foul smelling monsters. Nothing like we've ever seen before.
They ransacked our whole mining camp. Even burnt down the wooden carving that Morenavia had created last year.
We did the only thing we can, seeing as none of us were equipped to fight. We ran.
We ran down the mountain, leaving behind our mining settlement of Charwood. Some of us made it here to our former cabin.
The few of us that's left have been able to hold them off from here, at least for now.
Our mining town up in the Charwood hills is completely overrun, however. All our belongings are back there.
There are also several of us that haven't made it down the hill. Many of our friends and relatives from the mining town have not been accounted for yet.

replies.text: What do you think has happened to them?

conversationlist.message: I don't want to think about that. Either they've been killed by the foul monsters, or worse.
You know, we saw one monster carrying around what looked like a net of some sort, instead of weapons like the other ones.
He shoved the other monsters around, and they all seemed to look up to him, like he was some sort of leader.
I don't know what that net was for though. I wonder if he was supposed to capture some of us.

replies.text: As I said, I'll try to find out what happened to them.

conversationlist.message: I sure hope that the people that we are missing are all alive at least.
In particular, I'm worried about what happened to Morenavia - our leader. None of us that made it back to this cabin saw what happened to her.
I sure hope she's still alive. We could use some of her wisdom and leadership right now to guide us.
I'm also worried about Falothen, our weapons trainer. As I ran down the hills myself, I thought I heard him call for help.
There's also Ayell, our healer, and Fayvara, our armorer. They always stayed together, those two. We don't know what happened to them or where they are.

replies.text: What are you going to do?
As I said, I'll try to find out what happened to them.

conversationlist.message: With your help, we might at least get somewhere.
I honestly don't know. We've sent out runners to try to find help. So far, none have returned with help.

replies.text: Tough luck. They're probably dead. You should move on with your lives.

conversationlist.message: Yes, I guess so. Thank you for listening to our story.
Well, I wouldn't want to be responsible for putting you into any trouble.

replies.text: I might be able to sneak by the monsters undetected.
A few puny monsters won't stop me!

conversationlist.message: OK. Frankly, I don't know what else we can do. We really need the help.
I would be very grateful for knowing what happened to the people we are missing.
Head up to our mining town of Charwood heights, and look for the missing people.
Please, try to be safe! If you spot any danger, or if those foul monsters are too much for you, don't hesitate to retreat back here.

replies.text: OK, I'll try to find your missing people.

conversationlist.message: Thank you. The path up to Charwood heights is just east of here.
Yes, what about them?

replies.text: I'm still trying to find out what happened to all four of them.

conversationlist.message: Thank you for helping us.
Yes, what about them? I saw that Falothen and Fayvara have returned.

replies.text: Yes, Falothen and Fayvara were alive. Morenavia and Ayell had been killed by the monsters.

conversationlist.message: While I am very happy to hear that Falothen and Fayvara are alive and well, it saddens me to hear that we've lost not only Ayell, but also Morenavia.
Morenavia was truly a great leader for us. Now, how will we ever be able to find the right paths?
Things will never be the same again for us.
It is at least some comfort to know that we still have Falothen and Fayvara with us.
I hear they are both anxious to talk to you now that they're safe. You should go meet them downstairs in the basement.

replies.text: OK, I'll go see them in the basement.

conversationlist.message: Good. We are truly grateful for the help that you have provided to us from the Charwood heights.
Absolutely. Pick any bed you want over there.
I have my guesses. Go talk to Kantya about it. I hear she has the full story, and some interesting theories.
Good. Did she tell you about that marking on the ground? I saw it myself. Nothing like I've ever seen before.
I wonder what is down there, in the deeper parts of the mine. I bet that whatever is controlling those monsters is still down there.

replies.text: I can go look down there if you want.
This all sounds too dangerous for me. I better not get involved.

conversationlist.message: Can't say I blame you. Thank you for the help you've provided so far.
You would do that for us? Thank you. I don't know what we would do without your help.
Please try to be safe, and be on the lookout for the dangerous monsters that inhabit the mine.
Whatever lurks down there, I'm sure it's not happy to get any visitors.

replies.text: I'll go down into the Charwood mine and investigate.

conversationlist.message: Thank you.
None of us ever dared to venture that deep.

replies.text: I haven't killed the creature yet though.
Whatever that thing was, it won't bother you any more now that I've killed it. Here is one of the bones from its corpse.

conversationlist.message: You actually killed it?
You are truly a hero to us.
Not only did you manage to find our missing people, but you also freed us from the creature that caused all this trouble.
We are forever in your debt. What can we do to ever repay you?

replies.text: How about some gold for all my troubles?
I think that one of your most precious items will suffice as payment.

conversationlist.message: You are truly our hero. Thank you yet again.
Certainly. Here is what we can spare. Thank you yet again.
After helping us, you still want to deprive us of more things that we cherish?
I guess we have no choice but to agree. Here, take these. They used to belong to my mother.
Hey there. I am master Krell of the Knights of Elythom. How may we be of service?

replies.text: I was sent by Jhaeld to ask about the missing people.
What do you do around here?

conversationlist.message: Me and my band of knights are just visiting Remgard in ... shall we say ... unfinished business.
As to the nature of our business here, that is something I would rather not disclose.
We serve the order of Elythom.

replies.text: Jhaeld sent me to ask about the missing people.

conversationlist.message: We are an order of knights that hail from Brimhaven.
You should visit our compound in Brimhaven, if you ever make your way there.
We serve all types of clients, from the wealthiest to even the poorest of poor.
Regardless, we always get the job done.

replies.text: What types of work do you do?

conversationlist.message: Mostly, we help people get back gold that other people owe them.
We also help people find ... erm ... people that have gone missing.

replies.text: About that, Jhaeld sent me to ask about the missing people.

conversationlist.message: Shh, not so loud!
Yes, we have heard the reports that people have gone missing here in Remgard. Most ... unfortunate.
We even had one of our knights disappear on us. Now, due to the nature of our order, I presume you can see how that puts us in a ... peculiar situation.
You see, usually it is us knights that find ... missing people. Now, we have had one of our own disappear. This has never happened before, and we are really unsure about what to do about it.
Granted, people in our order have succumbed in combat to greater foes, but to just ... disappear without a trace, that's unheard of.
We have a strong connection to each other, and to have someone leave the order would be unthinkable.
As you can see, this puts us in a difficult situation.

replies.text: What do you know about the knight that is missing?
Is there anything else you have found out that you didn't tell the guards earlier?

conversationlist.message: Well, we told the guards everything we know so far. They also seem to find this situation rather embarrassing, that they can't even keep a knight safe here in their town.
We have no clues apart from the fact that she is missing, unfortunately. Where our sister knight is, is still a mystery to us.
For the sake of our order's reputation, please keep this to yourself if possible. We wouldn't want people to get the perception that the Knights of Elythom can be weakened in any way.
Hello there. What can the Knights of Elythom do for you?

replies.text: That's a very nice suit of armor you have there.

conversationlist.message: Talk to master Krell over there, he can tell you all about us.
Thank you, it's our standard set of armor that we use in the order. It takes a lot of scrubbing and polishing to make it this clean though.
Hello. *cough*

replies.text: That's a very nice suit of armor you have there.

conversationlist.message: You attacked my sheep! Get away from me you filthy murderer!
Hello again. Thank you for helping me find my lost sheep.

replies.text: I talked to Benbyr and heard the story about you two.

conversationlist.message: Hello there. You wouldn't happen to want to help an old shepherd would you?
You see, I tend my flock of sheep here. These fields are excellent pastures for them.
The thing is, I have lost four of them. Now I won't dare leave the ones I still have in my sight to go look for the lost ones.
Would you be willing to help me find them?

replies.text: This doesn't sound like there will be any fighting involved. I only do things where there's fighting involved.
Absolutely, it would be my honor to assist you in locating your missing sheep.
What would I gain from this?

conversationlist.message: Oh well, it didn't hurt to ask.
Gain? Why, my thanks of course.

replies.text: This doesn't sound like there will be any fighting involved. I only do things where there's fighting involved.
Sure, I will help you find your sheep.
No thanks, I better not get involved in this.

conversationlist.message: Good, thank you. Please put these bells around their necks so I can hear them.
Return to me once you have placed bells around the neck of each of the four missing sheep.
Hello again. Did you find all four of my missing sheep?

replies.text: Yes, I found all of them.
Not yet. I am still looking.
What was I supposed to do?
I talked to Benbyr and heard the story about you two.

conversationlist.message: Yes, I can hear distant sounds of bells from the fields to the south. I am sure they will come back here now that they have the bells on them.

replies.text: That was some hard work. What about a reward?

conversationlist.message: I am sorry, but I am a simple shepherd. I have no wealth or magical trinkets to give you.
Thank you for helping me.
Is he still around? I thought the guards got the best of him.
Anyway, I do not want to talk about that. I have left that kind of life behind me. Herding sheep is what I do now.
You are not welcome here. Please leave now.

replies.text: Why is everyone in Vilegard so afraid of outsiders?
Jolnor asked me to talk to you.

conversationlist.message: I don't want to talk to you. Go talk to Jolnor in the chapel if you want to help us.
He did? I guess you are not as bad as I first thought.
I am still not convinced that you are not a spy from Feygard sent to cause mischief.

replies.text: What can you tell me about Vilegard?
I can assure you that I am not a spy.
Feygard, where or what is that?

conversationlist.message: Hmm. Maybe not. But then again, maybe you are. I am still not sure.

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to gain your trust?
[Bribe] How would 100 gold sound? Could that help you to trust me?

conversationlist.message: I still don't fully trust you enough to talk about that.

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to gain your trust?
[Bribe] How would 100 gold sound? Could that help you to trust me?

conversationlist.message: Are you trying to bribe me, kid? That won't work on me. What use would I have for gold if you actually were a spy?

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to gain your trust?

conversationlist.message: If you really want to prove to me that you are not a spy from Feygard, there actually is something that you can do for me.
Up until recently, we have been using special potions made of ground bones for healing. These were very potent healing potions, and were used for several purposes.
But now, they have been banned by Lord Geomyr, and most use of them has stopped.
I would really like to have a few more of those. If you can bring me 10 bonemeal potions, I might consider trusting you a bit more.

replies.text: OK. I will get some potions for you.
No. If they are banned, there is most likely a good reason behind it. You shouldn't use them.
I already have some of those potions with me that you can have.

conversationlist.message: Hello again. Have you found those 10 bonemeal potions I asked for?

replies.text: No, I am still looking for them.
No. If they are banned, there is most likely a good reason behind it. You shouldn't use them.

conversationlist.message: Well, hurry up. I really need them soon.
Fine. Now please leave me.
Good. Give them to me.
Yes, these will do fine. Thank you a lot kid. Maybe you are OK after all. May the Shadow watch over you.
Was there something you wanted to talk about?

replies.text: What can you tell me about Vilegard?
Why is everyone in Vilegard so afraid of outsiders?

conversationlist.message: You should go talk to Erttu if you want the background story about Vilegard. She has been around here far longer than me.
We have a history of people coming here and causing mischief. Over time, we have learned that keeping to ourselves works best.

replies.text: That sounds like a good idea.

conversationlist.message: Anyway, that's why we are so suspicious of outsiders.
Hello again, my friend.

replies.text: Do you have any tasks for me?
Are you going to tell me about the key?
What am I supposed to do again?
What are your plans for the traitors?
Can you continue with what you were telling me about the traitors?
We are supposed to talk about something.
We were supposed to talk about something, right?
We were supposed to talk about something, right?
What am I suppossed to do again?
What am I supposed to do with the noblewoman?
What am I supposed to do with the noblewoman?
I have to talk to you about the noblewoman.
Anything more about my new task?
Anything more about my new task?
Anything more about my new task?
Troublemaker sent me. I have finished the job.

conversationlist.message: Anything else I can help you with?

replies.text: Can you repeat what you said about Andor?
Yes, I want to know more about the Thieves' Guild.
I've been thinking about joining the guild.

conversationlist.message: Hello. How did your search go?
Last time we talked, you asked for the way to Lodar's Hideaway. Did you find it?

replies.text: You must have me confused with my brother Andor. We look very much alike.

conversationlist.message: Oh. I must have you confused with someone else.

replies.text: My brother Andor and I look very much alike.

conversationlist.message: Really? Never mind I said anything then.

replies.text: I guess that means that Andor was here. What was he doing?

conversationlist.message: He came here a while ago, asking a lot of questions about what relation the Thieves' Guild has to the Shadow and to the royal guard in Feygard.
We in the Thieves' Guild really don't care much for the Shadow. Nor do we care for the royal guard.
We try to be above their bickering and differences. They may fight as much as they want, but the Thieves' Guild will outlive them all.

replies.text: Tell me more about what Andor asked for.

conversationlist.message: Where have you been the last couple of years? Don't you know of the brewing conflict?
The royal guard, led by Lord Geomyr in Feygard, are trying to ward off the recent increase in illegal activities, and are therefore imposing more restrictions on what is or is not allowed.
The priests of the Shadow, mostly seated in Nor City, are opposed to the new restrictions, saying that they limit the ways that they can please the Shadow.
In turn, the rumor is that the priests of the Shadow are planning to overthrow Lord Geomyr and his forces.
Also, the rumor is that the priests of the Shadow are still doing their rituals, despite the fact that most of the rituals have been banned.
Lord Geomyr and his royal guard on the other hand, are still trying their best to rule in a way that they feel is fair.
We in the Thieves' Guild try not to get involved in the conflict. Our business is so far unaffected by all of this.
He asked me for my support, and asked about how to find Lodar.

Lodar? He is one of the famous potion makers from the old days. The Thieves' Guild has requested his services many times before. He can make all sorts of strong sleeping potions, healing potions and cures.
But his specialty is, of course, his poisons. His poison can harm even the largest of monsters.

replies.text: What would Andor want with him?

conversationlist.message: I don't know. Maybe he was looking for a potion.

replies.text: So, where can I find this Lodar?

conversationlist.message: I really shouldn't tell you. How to get to him is one of our closely guarded secrets in the guild. His hideaway is only reachable by our members.
However, I heard that you helped us find the key of Luthor. This is something we have been trying to get for a long time.
OK, I'll tell you how to get to Lodar's Hideaway. But you have to promise to keep it a secret. Do not tell anyone. Not even those that appear to be members of the Thieves' Guild.

replies.text: OK, I'll promise to keep it a secret.
I can't give any guarantees, but I will try.

conversationlist.message: Good. The thing is, you not only need to find the place itself, but you also need to utter the correct words to be allowed entry by the guardian.
The only one that understands the language of the guardian is the old man Ogam in Vilegard.
You should travel to the town of Vilegard and find Ogam. He can help you get the right words to enter Lodar's Hideaway.

replies.text: How do I get to Vilegard?
Thank you. There was something else I wanted to talk about.

conversationlist.message: You travel southeast from Fallhaven. When you reach the main road and the Foaming Flask tavern, head south. It's not very far to the southeast from here.
No problem. No sireee! Not causing any more trouble now. I sits here outside now.
Wait, who are you again? Are you that guard?
Oh, sir. I'm not causing any trouble anymore, see? I sits outside now as you says, OK?
Oh good. That guard threw me out of the tavern. If I see him again I'll show him one thing or another.
Drink drink drink, drink some more. Drink, drink ... Uh how did it go again?
Were you saying something? Where was I? Yes, so we were in this dungeon.
Or was it a house? I can't remember.
No no, it was outside! Now I remember.

That's where we...

Hey, where did my mead go? Did you take it from me?
Well then give it back! Or go buy me another mead.

replies.text: OK, I'll go buy some mead for you.
No. I don't think I should help you. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: I must have drunk it then. Could you get me a new mead do you think?

replies.text: OK, I'll go buy some mead for you.
No. I don't think I should help you. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message:
Oh sweet drinks of joy. May the sssshadow be with you kid.
[Makes big eyes]

[Takes a gulp of the mead]
That's good stuff!
Yeah, me and Unnmir had good times. Go ask him yourself, he is usually in the barn to the east of here. I wonder *burps* where that treasure went.

replies.text: Treasure? I'm in! I'll go look for Unnmir right away.
Thank you for the story. Goodbye.

conversationlist.message: I couldn't. When I tried, and failed, he laughed. He told me it was bound to that thing in the basement, which needed me to be its servant.

I didn't dare. The evening after Andor left his companion returned briefly. He warned me you might come here, and that if you found out what I had done you would kill me. He told me that my only hope was to make you the next victim.
Then he laughed some more, and told me that all I had to do was kill that thing, and I would be able to remove the necklace. I'm no fighter though. I was too scared to even go near it.

replies.text: I guess you are lucky I visited, although just asking me to kill it would have been easier. And nicer.

conversationlist.message: It was terrible! I could feel the necklace draining the life out of me, and the only thing that made me feel better was giving it another victim.

replies.text: Why didn't you just take it off?

conversationlist.message: Hello there. Please move along. These things are property of Feygard, and you have no business here.
Hey, you're that kid! That kid that we've been hearing about. It's great to finally get a face on the stories we've heard.
Please, anything I can help you with?
Sorry, can't help you there. You're the only kid I've seen running along here in a long time.
Sure thing. Here's what I've got.
Talk to Agthor.

replies.text: Where can I get some of that nice armor that you're wearing?

conversationlist.message:
Agthor. Talk to him.
[Points at Agthor]
Hey kid. Yeah, you!
He he. You might be of use. You'd help an old fella, wouldn't you?

replies.text: Yuck! What happened to your clothes, they're all dirty and torn up!
Hey, what happened to your teeth? Did you lose them all, or did that bad breath of yours make them corrode?
Did I just see something move inside that nasty beard of yours?

conversationlist.message: [Coughs heavily]
Har har. That's nothing! You should have seen Lentural that was here before. Come here and let me have a look at you.

replies.text: Stay away, or you'll not live to see the rest of the day!

conversationlist.message: OK, OK! No need to get all violent.
Stupid kids.
You'd help an old fella, right? Why don't you run over to Lowyna there and get me another one her bottles of rat poison.
Ah, that sweet rat poison.

replies.text: Rat poison? Are you sure that's safe?

conversationlist.message: She's in the other hut over there [points].

replies.text: I don't think it's such a good idea to help you. I could get in trouble.
I'll go get some rat poison for you.

conversationlist.message: He he. Yes. Yes you could. But that's the beauty of it all!
Good. Tell her two-teeth sent you.
Oh sure! It's perfectly safe. Har har.
[Coughs heavily]

replies.text: I don't think it's such a good idea to help you. I could get in trouble.

conversationlist.message: [Coughs heavily]
[Coughs heavily]
Hey, did you get that rat poison from Lowyna for me?

replies.text: Here, I got you some from Lowyna.

conversationlist.message: Hey, my little helper. Got any more of that rat poison for me?

replies.text: I don't think it's such a good idea to help you. I could get in trouble.

conversationlist.message: I'm fine right here. *chuckle*
Har har. Thank you. Give that here.
Ah, that sweet sweet rat poison.
What? No, we didn't agree on anything like that.

Hey you! Get away from there!

Walk with the Shadow.

replies.text: Have you been down in the catacombs?

conversationlist.message: Yes, I have been in the catacombs beneath Fallhaven Church.
But I'm the only one that both has the permission and the bravery to go down there.

replies.text: How can I get permission to go down there?

conversationlist.message: You want to go down in the catacombs? Hmm, maybe we can make a deal.
Bring me some of that delicious cooked meat from the tavern and I will give you my permission to enter the catacombs of Fallhaven Church.

replies.text: Here, I have cooked meat for you.

conversationlist.message: You have my permission to enter the catacombs of Fallhaven Church.
Thanks, this will do nicely.
Walk with the Shadow my child.

replies.text: I was told to talk to you about why everyone in Vilegard is suspicious of outsiders.

conversationlist.message: Walk with the Shadow my child.

replies.text: Can you tell me again what this place is?
Let's talk about those missions for gaining trust that you talked about earlier.
I require healing. Can I see what items you have available?

conversationlist.message: Walk with the Shadow my friend.

replies.text: Can you tell me again what this place is?
I require healing. Can I see what items you have available?

conversationlist.message: This is Vilegard's place of worship for the Shadow. We praise the Shadow in all its might and glory.

replies.text: Can you tell me more about the Shadow?
I require healing. Can I see what items you have available?
Whatever. Just show me your goods.

conversationlist.message: The Shadow protects us from the dangers of the night. It keeps us safe and comforts us when we sleep.
I don't trust you enough yet to feel comfortable trading with you.
Suspicious? No, I wouldn't call it suspicion. I would rather call it that we are careful nowadays.
In order to gain the trust of the village, an outsider must prove that they are not here to cause trouble.

replies.text: Sounds like a good idea. There are a lot of selfish people out there.
That sounds really unnecessary. Why not trust people in the first place?

conversationlist.message: Yes, right. You seem to understand us well, I like that.

replies.text: Is there anything I can do to gain your trust?

conversationlist.message: We have learned from history not to trust outsiders, and you are an outsider. Why should we trust you?

replies.text: What can I do to gain your trust?
You are right. You probably should not trust me.

conversationlist.message: With your help earlier, you have already gained our trust.
As I said before, you have to help some people here in Vilegard to gain our trust.
If you do us a favor, we might consider trusting you. There are three people I can think of that are influential here in Vilegard, that you should try to help.
First, there is Kaori. She lives up in the northern part of Vilegard. Ask her if she wants help with anything.

replies.text: OK. Talk to Kaori. Got it.

conversationlist.message: Then there is Wrye. Wrye also lives up in the northern part of Vilegard. Many people here in Vilegard seek her advice on various things.
She recently lost her son in a tragic way. If you can gain her trust, you will have a strong ally here.
And last but not least, I have a favor to ask of you as well.
North of Vilegard is a tavern called the Foaming Flask. In my opinion, this tavern is a guard station in guise for Feygard.
The tavern is almost always visited by the Feygard royal guard of Lord Geomyr.
They are probably here to spy on us, since we are followers of the Shadow. Lord Geomyr's forces always try to make life difficult for us and the Shadow.

replies.text: Yes, they seem like troublemakers all around.
I am sure they have their reasons for doing what they do.

conversationlist.message: Right. Troublemakers indeed.

replies.text: What do you want me to do?

conversationlist.message: Yes, their reason is to make life miserable for us, I am sure.

replies.text: What do you want me to do?

conversationlist.message: My reports say that there is a guard stationed outside the tavern, to keep an eye on potential dangers.
I want you to make sure the guard disappears somehow. How you do that is purely up to you.

replies.text: I am not sure I should upset the Feygard patrol guards. This could really get me into trouble.
For the Shadow, I will do as you ask.
OK, I hope this leads to some treasure in the end.

conversationlist.message: It's your choice. You can at least go check out the tavern and see if you find anything suspicious.
Good. Report back to me when you are done.
So, in order to gain our trust here in Vilegard, I would suggest you help Kaori, Wrye and me.

replies.text: Thank you for the information. I will be back when I have something to report.

conversationlist.message: I would suggest you help Kaori, Wrye and me to gain our trust.

replies.text: About that guard outside the Foaming Flask tavern...
Never mind, let's get back to those other topics.

conversationlist.message: Yes, what about them?

replies.text: What was I supposed to do again?
I have done all the tasks you asked me to do.
Never mind, let's get back to those other topics.

conversationlist.message: Yes, what about him. Have you removed him yet?

replies.text: Yes, he will leave his post as soon as this shift is over.
No, but I am working on it.

conversationlist.message: Yes, you dealt with him earlier. Thank you for your help.
Very good. Thank you for your help.

replies.text: No problem. Let's get back to those other tasks we talked about.

conversationlist.message: You still need to help Kaori with her task.
You still need to help Wrye with her task.
Good. You helped all three of us.
I suppose that shows some dedication, and that we are ready to trust you now.
You have our thanks, friend. You will always find shelter here in Vilegard. We welcome you into our village.
Hi, I'm Jakrar.
Yes, I'm Fallhaven's woodcutter. Need anything done in the finest of woods? I have probably got it.

replies.text: I'd like to talk with you about Fallhaven's passage to the Duleian Road.
Never mind. I don't need your services for now.
What have you got for sale?

conversationlist.message: Hello. I'm Alaun. How can I help you?

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor? He looks similar to me.

conversationlist.message: You are looking for your brother you say? Looks like you? Hmm.
No, I cannot recall seeing anyone by that description. Maybe you should try in Crossglen village west of here.
Hello there. Please do not bother me, I have a lot of work to do.
Hello. Could you please move out of the way? I am trying to work here.
Hey you, don't even think of touching any of the crates. I am watching you!
Oh no. Not again. I won't start cutting the trees unless I have received a payment beforehand. Go away!

replies.text: Is there anything that would change your mind?
Seems like nobody wants to open the road again. Great.

conversationlist.message: Hmm. Well if you would do me a great favor I would start to cut the trees away.

Let me tell you a story. Long ago, I was cutting in the woods to the north of Fallhaven. I used to cut the trees with great speed with my favorite axe. It was made of fine steel and probably worth more than my hut.
But then, I got attacked by a pack of wolves and I had to flee immediately. I barely saved my life, but during the escape I lost my precious axe.
I'm afraid of travelling to that place again because I'm not a trained fighter and the wolves, especially their leader, were really powerful.

replies.text: So I guess you want me to retrieve your axe?

conversationlist.message: Yes exactly. If you would do me that favor I will gladly cut away the trees and receive payment afterwards. Just head north to the Crossroads guardhouse and then head eastwards down the Duleian Road. That's where I lost my axe. And look out for that wolf pack!

replies.text: Sounds simple enough. On my way.
No way! That is far too dangerous!

conversationlist.message: Have you made any progress in finding my axe?
Let me see... Oh yes! This is my axe! I cannot thank you enough!

replies.text: So will you cut away those trees that block the old pathway?

conversationlist.message: Sure! Already on my way! The work will be finished soon.

replies.text: That sounds great! Remember to ask the stupid warden for a decent payment.

conversationlist.message: Sure. Will do that. He he.

You're welcome. But you're not the only one who is happy. There are more people resting for a night in Fallhaven, which helps our economy. Some even bought items at my store! By the way, I was surprised, but I even got paid well by the warden.

replies.text: Great. Now everything is much better than it was before!
I wanted to ask about something else.

conversationlist.message: Have you made any progress in finding my precious axe?

replies.text: Hello again! I've finally found your axe!
No I haven't. But I'm working on it.

conversationlist.message: Hello again my friend.

replies.text: I cannot thank you enough for cutting away those trees! Finally I've got a shortcut!
What have you got for sale?
Never mind. I don't need your services for now.

conversationlist.message: Thank you for bringing me back my axe!

replies.text: So will you cut away those trees that block the old pathway?

conversationlist.message: You look just like an adventurer. Tell me child, what brings you here?

replies.text: I'm looking for my brother Andor.

conversationlist.message: OK then. Good luck with that.
Ha ha, that sure sounds like an adventurer! Guts, that's what you need to be a successful adventurer, child. You don't seem to lack courage, if I may say so.
I am Reinkarr. I guess you could call me an adventurer of sorts.
No, not really. I never got the hang of the whole adventuring business. Me and some other fellows went looking for these ... crystals ... that we had heard about.
Doesn't really matter. We never found any of them anyway.

replies.text: What crystals were you looking for?

conversationlist.message: They were called 'Oegyth crystals'. Supposedly very powerful and worth a fortune.

replies.text: So what made you stop looking?

conversationlist.message: Actually, all I know is that they are some sort of crystal. As I said, they are supposedly very powerful. We were only looking for them so that we could sell them and become rich.
Just the boredom of it, I guess. We never were any good at the whole fighting thing, and as such we never found one of those things.
Anyway, it's been nice talking to you, kid. Take care.
What!? You actually have one of those things? Let me see. Yes, that sure matches the description I read.
You would do well to keep that to yourself, kid. Whatever you do, don't lose it, and don't go around showing it to everyone you might meet. You could get in serious trouble.

replies.text: What can I do with it?

conversationlist.message: I hear there are merchants that would do anything to get their hands on some of those crystals. You should seek out the merchants in one of the larger cities, and ask them.
Please be careful though!
Another way to regain your strength is to eat some food. You can buy some for yourself from Mara at the town hall. But watch out - I hear that raw meat can sometimes give you food poisoning.
If that happens, perhaps the town priest can do something to help you.  Otherwise, just rest until you feel better.
Me, I can't really afford the meat, so I just stick to my bread!
Get away! No! Turn back while you still can!
You don't know what they'll do to you!
What!? No, no, no. Must get out of here!
*wheeze*
[The figure points its finger towards you, in what looks to be an order for the nearby thralls to attack you]

South: Loneford
East: Brimhaven.
[You also see something written on an arrow pointing to the west, but you cannot understand the words]
The sign contains writing in a language you cannot understand.
What... Oh, a visitor!

replies.text: I have some izthiel claws to sell you.

conversationlist.message: This place used to be a safe house for travelers between Loneford and Brimhaven, before they had finished the path between them.
However, nowadays, hardly anyone comes here - because of those cursed creatures from the river.
Izthiel, they call them.
Ack, if it wasn't for those things out there, I am sure a lot of people would come by here more often.

replies.text: Would you like me to kill the creatures for you?

conversationlist.message: Oh sure. I have tried that. But they just keep coming back.
Tell you what though. Bring me those claws of theirs, and I'll buy them from you for a good price.

replies.text: OK, I will return with some of their claws.

conversationlist.message: Good. Please do. I like knowing that their numbers are reduced at least.
Great. How many would you like to sell?

replies.text: Never mind. I will be back with more izthiel claws to sell you.

conversationlist.message: Good, thank you. Here's some gold for your troubles.
Excellent, thank you! Here's some gold for your troubles.
Excellent, thank you! Here's some gold for your troubles.
Oh wow, you managed to get twenty of those claws? That's excellent, thank you! Here's some gold and some extra health potions for your troubles.
Hello again. Well done defeating the gornaud beasts.

replies.text: Their attacks really hurt. What are these things?
How come they do not attack you?
Yeah, no problem. Just another trail of dead bodies behind me.

conversationlist.message: Careful what you wish for, for it may come true.
Me? There must be something about me that scares them. I have no idea what it would be, some scent perhaps?
Anyway, we should get going. I'll run ahead of you up the mountain.
Meet me further up the mountain, and we will talk more.
I do not know where they come from. All I know is that they started to appear one day, blocking the path up the mountain.
And, their attacks are tough. Once one of them gets a hold of you, the other ones seem really eager to hit you too.

replies.text: How come they do not attack you?

conversationlist.message: Uh. Hello.
Whoa, you look small. I must be seeing things. That last batch I did must have gotten stronger than usual.

replies.text: What are you people doing here?
Can I look at your wares again?

conversationlist.message: He he, this and that.

replies.text: I see a lot of potion bottles around. Is that what you do?

conversationlist.message: I am Lowyna, of course. These people that you see in here and in the other huts, you could say that we're sort of in the same ... family.

replies.text: What are you people doing here?

conversationlist.message: What smell? I can't smell anything out of the ordinary. It must be you.

replies.text: What are you people doing here?

conversationlist.message: It's that obvious eh?
I really shouldn't be discussing this with you. You look way to inexperienced for this.

replies.text: Two-teeth sent me to get some rat poison.

conversationlist.message: Hah! How about no?
I'm amazed he's still around, good old two-teeth.
For his sake, I'll let you browse my wares.

itemlist.description:
* by Wormath Splathershed * 

Foundation of the Forgotten Kingdom (year 2300)
The first humans, led by Arntuk the Mighty, came from the south in ancient times and established the Forgotten Kingdom. These people, called the Lethgar, built settlements in places where now great towns and cities are located. Nor City and Sullengard were the first to be founded.
Then some time later, a few explorers climbed Mount Galmore, the highest mountain in Dhayavar. Due to the elevation and marvelous view, their priests and mages built a sanctuary near the summit where they studied the arts of magic and worshipped their gods. 

Rise of Kazaul (year 2177)
The insane and powerful wizard called Valugha was obsessed with the notion of creating a portal to another plane. Even though his fellow mages disapproved, he was able to create a portal by consuming the powerful life essence of his brothers and the stored energy in the sanctuary. The sanctuary erupted in an explosion and a large ravine split Mt. Galmore apart. At its bottom, the portal opened, which was soon merely called the 'Rift', and the devastated area around it 'Undertell'. The mountain also spilled out lava like blood coming from a wound and is now clouded in smoke all the time.
All kinds of demons and undead emerged into the world through the portal, led by their masters, the 'Kazaul'. The Kazaul themselves were guided by the Eternal Masters who were incredibly skilled in magic and warcraft. Soon the monsters and their masters spread over whole of Dhayavar. However, the portal became unstable after a while and finally collapsed after several decades, but the harm was already done, as thousands of beasts had crept through it into the realm. 
A short and brutal war was fought. With the loss of nearly all mages, the Lethgar were powerless against the monster invasion and were soon overthrown and enslaved by the Kazaul. The Kazaul imposed a reign of terror on the Forgotten Kingdom. It seemed no one was able to defeat or oppose the Kazaul due to their inhuman strength. 
Then the Lethgar had to build underground lairs for their oppressors. A large city was built around the deactivated portal and in the natural caves under Mt. Galmore. Also, Carn Tower and the Sanctuary on Blackwater Mountain were built, among countless other underground Kazaul settlements.
Even though most Lethgar despised their masters, some showed interest in the rituals and dark sorcery of the Kazaul. As a result, the Kha'zaan (Kazaul cultists), a group of human Kazaul followers, gathered around their masters and learned from them. They were often used to enforce the brutal rule of the Kazaul. Many of the current monsters are living forms that evolved from experiments made during this era, such as Izthiels, Gornauds, Wyrms, etc.
By that time, the Hira'zinn, the omen of war, started plaguing the smallfolk. 

The War of Dawn and the Rise of Elythara and the Elytharan Union (year 1537)
One day, the Elytharan cultists arrived on the shore of the northern sea (Sea of Tears). They worshipped the blinding and cleansing light of Elythara. 
The Elytharan mages and warriors were able to defeat the Kazaul and Kha'zaan with the help of the blinding light of Elythara which was forged

[... here some pages were torn out ...]

began erecting the city of Feygard on the shore of the Sea of Tears, which soon became a center of trade for the realm due to its access to the sea. 
The town of Loneford was founded and it soon became famous for its fertile fields and healthy vegetable which fed the northern parts of the Forgotten Kingdom. 
Blackwater Mountain was explored, and on its summit a large sanctuary for the Elytharan priests was erected to study dawn and dusk, the sun and stars, and to watch over the Forgotten Kingdom. Other sanctuaries were located in Feygard and Nor City, and shrines were found in each minor settlement. The mining colony of Prim was also founded after pioneers found rich sources of iron and coal under the mountain.
The city of Fallhaven became a prosperous center of trade due to its excellent location as a junction between the sanctuary of Blackwater Mountain, Stoutford, Nor City and Feygard. Big storehouses were built to safely store shipments. However, bands of thieves were soon attracted by the growing wealth, and united under one big organization, the Thieves' Guild, whose guild halls were secretly placed in Fallhaven, Feygard, and Nor City, those being the richest cities at that time. 
Many other towns, including Brimhaven and Brightport were also founded around this time, and the Charwood mines were opened.
Trade agreements were signed between the cities in order to make trade prosper further. 

Establishment of the Aewatha Kingdom (year 432)
The head of the most important Nor City family, Garthan I of house Houdart, declared himself King, marking the end of the Elytharan era and the beginning of the Shadow-supported kingdom. At this point, political power and religious power became closely united. As the kingdom prospered, so did the Shadow, and Elythara

[... again some pages were torn out ...]

as slaves for the digging. At that time the Flagstone Prison was also built, where runaway workers from Mt. Galmore were imprisoned and were left to rot. However the mines were closed after some years due to frequent monster attacks and other unspeakable horrors who dwelt in the dark.
Remgard was founded by Korhald of Remgard and built on a large island in Lake Laeroth. It became famous for its excellent smithing services. 
The village of Crossglen was founded, and farmers settled there.
King Luthor ascended to the throne as the direct heir of King Oromir III and moved the capital from Nor City to Fallhaven, while the center of worship remained in Nor City. As King Luthor got older he felt the need for an advisor, and so Lord Geomyr of Feygard was named Hand of the King. He fulfilled his duty with great obsession and effort. 

The Noble Wars (year 25 to 14)
When King Luthor died, he left the Kingdom with no heir to the throne. He was buried in the catacombs under Fallhaven church. What followed, the Noble Wars, was one of the darkest periods this country has witnessed. 
Four coalitions were formed which were each ruled by one powerful Lord. 
The Western one consisted of Stoutford and the settlements on Blackwater Mountain, and was ruled by Lord Erwyn. 
The Northern one consisted of Feygard, Thalgard, Luthaven and Remgard, and was ruled by Lord Geomyr. 
The Eastern one consisted of Nor City, Sullengard, Brightport and Brimhaven, and was ruled by Lord Emeric. 
The center capital area at first remained neutral and consisted of Fallhaven, Vilegard and Loneford (formerly administrated by King Luthor). 
The Noble Wars started with the Landlords arguing about who was to be the new, legitimate, King. 
The first stone was thrown by Stoutford. Lord Erwyn tried to use the time to attack the center area when the other Lords were busy debating. He wanted to occupy those to control the trade routes to Nor City, to gain the largest influence and to fracture other coalitions. Fallhaven was partially destroyed.
Erwyn's success was a short one, as he was attacked by the Eastern coalition. For several years, numerous battles and countless skirmishes were fought over control of the center area. When both Lords were weakened, Lord Geomyr attacked and forced both to surrender. The peace treaty of Fallhaven was signed and Lord Geomyr was proclaimed King.
The Hira'zinn haunted the lands once again during the war. 

The Rule of King Geomyr (year 14)
King Geomyr urged people to restore the destroyed cities and remove the traces of the long war. He reinstated a tax system, and garrisons of the Royal Guard of Feygard, in most of the villages. Geomyr promoted nepotism and corruption to further increase his power.
The cult of the Shadow became ever more important for the smallfolk. The commoners felt the need for salvation after the harsh period of the Noble Wars and accepted the Shadow as their guide into better times.
Lord Geomyr became fearful of the power of the religion, and tensions between Nor City and Feygard started to rise. He then proclaimed several prohibitions against the cult. They were no longer allowed to perform their rituals, and he tried to detain some of the priests. 
Then he even banned the trade and use of heartsteel weapons as he feared they would be used to overthrow him.  He destroyed many weapons and confiscated others. Bonemeal potions were prohibited as well much to the disapproval of the smallfolk and the priests.

[... here the story ends - you can't tell if there had been more pages ...]

itemlist.description:
* by Wormath Splathershed * 

Foundation of the Forgotten Kingdom (year 2300)
The first humans, led by Arntuk the Mighty, came from the south in ancient times and established the Forgotten Kingdom. These people, called the Lethgar, built settlements at places where now great towns and cities are located. Nor City and Sullengard were the first to be founded.
Then some time later, a few explorers climbed Mount Galmore, the highest mountain in Dhayavar. Due to the elevation and marvelous view, their priests and mages built a sanctuary near the summit where they studied the arts of magic and worshipped their gods. 

Rise of Kazaul (year 2177)
The insane and powerful wizard called Valugha was obsessed with the notion of creating a portal to another plane. Even though his fellow mages disapproved, he was able to create a portal by consuming the powerful life essence of his brothers and the stored energy in the sanctuary. The sanctuary erupted in an explosion and a large ravine split Mt. Galmore apart. At its bottom, the portal opened, which was soon merely called the 'Rift', and the devastated area around it 'Undertell'. The mountain also spilled out lava like blood coming from a wound and is now clouded in smoke all the time.
All kinds of demons and undead emerged into the world through the portal, led by their masters, the 'Kazaul'. The Kazaul themselves were guided by the Eternal Masters who were incredibly skilled in magic and warcraft. Soon the monsters and their masters spread over whole of Dhayavar. However, the portal became unstable after a while and finally collapsed after several decades but the harm was already done as thousands of beasts had crept through it into the realm. 
A short and brutal war was fought. With the loss of nearly all mages, the Lethgar were powerless against the monster invasion and were soon overthrown and enslaved by the Kazaul. The Kazaul imposed a reign of terror on the Forgotten Kingdom. It seemed no one was able to defeat or oppose the Kazaul due to their inhuman strength. 
Then the Lethgar had to build underground lairs for their oppressors. A large city was built around the deactivated portal and in the natural caves under Mt. Galmore. Also, Carn Tower and the Sanctuary on Blackwater Mountain were built, among countless other underground Kazaul settlements.
Even though most Lethgar despised their masters, some showed interest in the rituals and dark sorcery of the Kazaul. As a result, the Kha'zaan (Kazaul cultists), a group of human Kazaul followers, gathered around their masters and learned from them. They were often used to enforce the brutal rule of the Kazaul. Many of the current monsters are living forms that evolved from experiments made during this era, such as Izthiels, Gornauds, Wyrms, etc.
By that time, the Hira'zinn, the omen of war, started plaguing the smallfolk. 

The War of Dawn and the Rise of Elythara and the Elytharan Union (year 1537)
One day, the Elytharan cultists arrived on the shore of the northern sea (Sea of Tears). They worshipped the blinding and cleansing light of Elythara. 
The Elytharan mages and warriors were able to defeat the Kazaul and Kha'zaan with the help of the blinding light of Elythara which was forged into their weapons. The Kazaul were reduced to almost nothing because their Eternal Masters were slain. However Elythara and her cultists failed to completely annihilate them, as a few Kazaul and followers managed to hide in remote places in the total darkness, unknown to the Elytharans. This is because although the Kazaul's dark spells were powerless against the blinding light of Elythara, Elythara's power is diminished deep underground in the total darkness. Nevertheless, for hundreds of years the Kazaul hibernated in the darkness.  
The visual appearance of her powers, as well as her perceived benevolence towards the commoners lead to people to call her the Goddess of Light. People were overjoyed about the defeat of Kazaul.  The Elytharans helped the people organize life and built several towns and cities, dedicated to their goddess. Several aristocratic houses were formed by that time. Each city was ruled by one or two houses who closely collaborated with the Elytharan priests.
A long era of peace and prosperity followed and the Elytharan Union was founded, to spread the word of Elythara over the whole realm. Even though the aristocrats ruled the cities, people were mainly influenced by the Elytharan priests.
Obviously, the world under Elythara wasn't perfect, although that's what her priests wanted people to believe. Her 'light' was shown to those who refused to follow the 'right' way, generally leaving them blind or worse... 
The Elytharans soon began erecting the city of Feygard on the shore of the Sea of Tears, which soon became a center of trade for the realm due to its access to the sea. 
The town of Loneford was founded and it soon became famous for its fertile fields and healthy vegetable which fed the northern parts of the Forgotten Kingdom. 
Blackwater Mountain was explored, and on its summit a large sanctuary for the Elytharan priests was erected to study dawn and dusk, the sun and stars, and to watch over the Forgotten Kingdom. Other sanctuaries were located in Feygard and Nor City, and shrines were found in each minor settlement. The mining colony of Prim was also founded after pioneers found rich sources of iron and coal under the mountain.
The city of Fallhaven became a prospering center of trade due to its excellent location as a junction between the sanctuary of Blackwater Mountain, Stoutford, Nor City and Feygard. Big storehouses were built to safely store shipments. However, bands of thieves were soon attracted by the growing wealth and united under one big organization, the Thieves' Guild, whose guild halls were secretly placed in Fallhaven, Feygard, and Nor City, those being the richest cities at that time. 
Many other towns, including Brimhaven and Brightport were also founded around this time, and the Charwood mines were opened.
Trade agreements were signed between the cities in order to make trade prosper further. 

Establishment of the Aewatha Kingdom (year 432)
The head of the most important Nor City family, Garthan I of house Houdart, declared himself King, marking the end of the Elytharan era and the beginning of the Shadow-supported kingdom. At this point, political power and religious power became closely united. As the kingdom prospered, so did the Shadow, and Elythara was forgotten by almost everyone in only a handful of generations. A large temple complex with a magnificent cathedral was built in the center of Nor City where the former shrines of Elythara had been located. Smaller churches were built across the country. People now commonly believed in the Shadow.
Garthan I ordered the exploration of the dreaded Mt. Galmore and a large mine was opened for a few decades where gems and gold were found in abundance.  Any remaining Elytharan followers were used as slaves for the digging. At that time the Flagstone Prison was also built, where runaway workers from Mt. Galmore were imprisoned and were left to rot. However the mines were closed after some years due to frequent monster attacks and other unspeakable horrors who dwelt in the dark.
Remgard was founded by Korhald of Remgard and built on a large island in Lake Laeroth. It became famous for its excellent smithing services. 
The village of Crossglen was founded, and farmers settled there.
King Luthor ascended to the throne as the direct heir of King Oromir III and moved the capital from Nor City to Fallhaven, while the center of worship remained in Nor City. As King Luthor got older he felt the need for an advisor, and so Lord Geomyr of Feygard was named Hand of the King. He fulfilled his duty with great obsession and effort. 

The Noble Wars (year 25 to 14)
When King Luthor died, he left the Kingdom with no heir to the throne. He was buried in the catacombs under Fallhaven church. What followed, the Noble Wars, was one of the darkest periods this country has witnessed. 
Four coalitions were formed which were each ruled by one powerful Lord. 
The Western one consisted of Stoutford and the settlements on Blackwater Mountain, and was ruled by Lord Erwyn. 
The Northern one consisted of Feygard, Thalgard, Luthaven and Remgard, and was ruled by Lord Geomyr. 
The Eastern one consisted of Nor City, Sullengard, Brightport and Brimhaven, and was ruled by Lord Emeric. 
The center capital area at first remained neutral and consisted of Fallhaven, Vilegard and Loneford (formerly administrated by King Luthor). 
The Noble Wars started with the Landlords arguing about who was to be the new, legitimate, King. 
The first stone was thrown by Stoutford. Lord Erwyn tried to use the time to attack the center area when the other Lords were busy debating. He wanted to occupy those to control the trade routes to Nor City, to gain the largest influence and to fracture other coalitions. Fallhaven was partially destroyed.
Erwyn's success was a short one, as he was attacked by the Eastern coalition. For several years, numerous battles and countless skirmishes were fought over control of the center area. When both Lords were weakened, Lord Geomyr attacked and forced both to surrender. The peace treaty of Fallhaven was signed and Lord Geomyr was proclaimed King.
The Hira'zinn haunted the lands once again during the war. 

The Rule of King Geomyr (year 14)
King Geomyr urged people to restore the destroyed cities and remove the traces of the long war. He reinstated a tax system, and garrisons of the Royal Guard of Feygard, to most of the villages. Geomyr promoted nepotism and corruption to further increase his power.
The cult of the Shadow became ever more important for the smallfolk. The commoners felt the need for salvation after the harsh period of the Noble Wars and accepted the Shadow as their guide into better times.
Lord Geomyr became fearful of the power of the religion and tensions between Nor City and Feygard started to rise. He then proclaimed several prohibitions against the cult. They were no longer allowed to perform their rituals, and he tried to detain some of the priests. 
Then he even banned the trade and use of heartsteel weapons as he feared they would be used to overthrow him.  He destroyed many weapons and confiscated others. Bonemeal potions were prohibited as well much to the disapproval of the smallfolk and the priests.

stages.logText: You met Burhczyd afgz Dtaloumiye, a likable young man, in a tavern. He wanted to see the world and followed your advice to travel as a trader from city to city.
In another tavern you met Burhczyd again. He never got any customers, because he had named his company 'Burhczyd afgz Dtaloumiye - Transports'. You told him to find an easier name.
You saw Burhczyd in a tavern, but he still did not have any customers. You told him that 'B.A.D. Transports' was not a good idea either.
Another place, another tavern, Burhczyd again sitting there. He did get a shipment from Remgard of almost fresh fish, but nobody wanted to buy it. You bought the entire cargo and got it disposed of.
What a surprise - you met Burhczyd again in a tavern. He told you that he finally sold something successfully - his cart. The fool, how will he earn money now?
In a tavern a bard sang in a high, shrill voice. It's an old acquaintance - Burhczyd. His singing was incredibly bad. Maybe he should just play his instrument without singing?
You found Burhczyd collapsed at a table in the tavern, his lute lying in front of him. The landlord forbade him to play his lovely music, because then all the guests forgot to drink.
Again you met Burhczyd in a tavern. He told you that he had become a master thief.
When you met Burhczyd again, he gave you some of your things back.
You've talked with a Knight of Elythom who happened to be an old acquaintance - Burhczyd. He had to hide from the Elythom, because he had 'borrowed' something of value from their leader.
You've met Burhczyd
You've met Burhczyd 12
60=listened to merchant completely
61=talked to merchant Crossglen
62=talked to merchant Fallhaven
63=talked to merchant Loneford
64=talked to merchant Vilegard
65=talked to merchant Stoutford
