Just northeast of Crossglen village, I met Erinith that has set up camp. Apparently, he was attacked during the night and lost a book.
I have agreed to help Erinith find his book. He told me he threw it among some trees to the north of his camp.
I have agreed to help Erinith find his book in return for 200 gold. He told me he threw it among some trees to the north of his camp.
I have returned the book to Erinith.
He also needs help with his wound that doesn't seem to be healing. Either I should bring him one potion of major health, or four regular potions of health.
I gave Erinith a bonemeal potion to heal his wound. He was a bit scared to use it since they are prohibited by Lord Geomyr.
I gave Erinith a potion of a major health to heal his wound.
I gave Erinith four regular potions of health to heal his wound.
The wound healed completely and Erinith thanked me for all the help.

On the road to Carn Tower, west of the Crossroads guardhouse, I met a group of woodcutters led by Hadracor. Hadracor wants me to help him get revenge on some wasps that were attacking them while they were cutting down the forest. To help them get revenge, I should look for giant wasps near their encampment and bring him at least five giant wasp wings.
I have brought five giant wasp wings to Hadracor.
I have brought six giant wasp wings to Hadracor. For helping him, he gave me a pair of gloves.
Hadracor thanked me for helping him and the other woodcutters get revenge on the wasps. In return, he offered me to trade for some of his items.

On the road to Feygard, near the Feygard bridge, I met a shepherd named Tinlyn. Tinlyn told me that four of his sheep have wandered away and that he won't dare leave the remaining sheep to go look for them.
I have agreed to help Tinlyn find his four lost sheep.
I have found one of Tinlyn's lost sheep.
I have found one of Tinlyn's lost sheep.
I have found one of Tinlyn's lost sheep.
I have found one of Tinlyn's lost sheep.
I have found all four of Tinlyn's lost sheep.
Tinlyn thanked me for finding his lost sheep.
Tinlyn thanked me for finding his lost sheep, but he had no reward to give me.
I have attacked at least one of Tinlyn's lost sheep and is therefore unable to return them all to Tinlyn.
I have met Benbyr outside the Crossroads guardhouse. He wants to get revenge on an old 'business partner' of his - Tinlyn. Benbyr wants me to kill all Tinlyn's sheep.
I have agreed to help Benbyr find Tinlyn's sheep and kill all eight of them. I should go look for them in the fields northwest of the Crossroads guardhouse.
I have started attacking the sheep. I should return to Benbyr once I have killed all eight of them.
Benbyr was thrilled to hear that all of Tinlyn's sheep are dead.
I declined to help Benbyr kill the sheep.

questlist.name: The path is clear to me

stages.logText: Minarra up in the tower at the Crossroads guardhouse has seen a band of rogues heading west from the guardhouse, towards Carn Tower. Minarra was sure they matched the description of some men whose heads have a bounty on them from the Feygard patrol. If these are the men that Minarra thinks, they are supposedly led by particularly ruthless savage named Rogorn.

I am helping Minarra find the band of rogues. I should travel the road west from the Crossroads guardhouse towards Carn Tower and look for them. They have supposedly stolen three pieces of a valuable painting and are wanted dead for their crimes.
Minarra also tells me that I should not trust anything I hear from them. In particular, anything from Rogorn should be viewed with great suspicion.
I have found the band of rogues on the road west towards Carn Tower, led by Rogorn.
Rogorn tells me that they are wrongly accused of murder and theft in Feygard, while they themselves have never even been to Feygard.
I have decided to attack Rogorn and his band of rogues. I should return to Minarra with the three pieces of the painting once they are dead.
I have decided not to attack Rogorn and his band of rogues, but instead report back to Minarra that she must have mistaken the men she saw for someone else.
Minarra thanked me for dealing with the thieves, and told me that my services to Feygard will be appreciated.
After telling Minarra that she must have mistaken the men for someone else, she seemed a bit suspicious, but thanked me for helping her look into the matter.
I have helped Minarra with her task.

I met Gandoren, the guard captain at the Crossroads guardhouse. He told me about some trouble up in Loneford, that have forced the guards to be even more alert than usual. Because of this, they can't do their regular errands themselves but need help with some basic things.
Gandoren wants me to help him transport a shipment of 10 iron swords to another guard post to the south.
I have agreed to help Gandoren transport the shipment, as a service for Feygard.
I have grudgingly agreed to help Gandoren transport the shipment.
I should deliver the shipment to the Feygard patrol captain stationed in the Foaming Flask tavern.
Gandoren tells me that Ailshara has expressed some interest in the Feygard shipments, and urges me to stay away from her.
Ailshara is indeed interested in the shipment, and wants me to help Nor City with the supplies instead.
If I want to help Ailshara and Nor City, I should deliver the shipment to the smith in Vilegard instead.
I have delivered the shipment to the Feygard patrol captain in the Foaming Flask tavern. I should go tell Gandoren in the Crossroads guardhouse that the shipment is delivered.
I have delivered the shipment to the smith in Vilegard.
The Vilegard smith gave me a shipment of degraded items that I should deliver to the Feygard patrol captain in the Foaming Flask tavern instead of the normal ones.
I have delivered the shipment of degraded items to the Feygard patrol captain in the Foaming Flask tavern. I should go tell Gandoren in the Crossroads guardhouse that the shipment is delivered.
Gandoren thanked me for helping him deliver the shipment.
Gandoren thanked me for helping him deliver the shipment. He never suspected anything. I should also report back to Ailshara.
I have reported back to Ailshara.
I heard a story about Loneford. Apparently, a lot of people have become ill there recently, and some have even died. The cause is still unknown.
I should investigate what could have caused the people of Loneford to become ill. To gather clues, I should ask the citizens of Loneford and the surrounding areas about what they think is the cause.
The guards in the Crossroads guardhouse are certain that the illness in Loneford is caused by some sabotage done by the priests or people from Nor City.
Some villagers in Loneford believe that the illness is caused by the guards from Feygard, in some scheme to make the people suffer even more than they already have.
Talion, the chapel priest in Loneford, thinks that the illness is the work of the Shadow, as punishment for Loneford's lack of devotion to the Shadow.

Taevinn in Loneford is certain that Sienn in the southeast barn has something to do with the illness. Apparently, Sienn keeps a pet around that has approached Taevinn in a threatening manner several times.
I should go see Landa in the Loneford tavern. Rumor has it that he saw something that he doesn't dare tell anyone.

Landa confused me with someone else at first. He apparently saw a boy doing something around the town well during the night before the illness started. He was scared to talk to me at first since he thought I looked like the boy he had seen. Could it have been Andor that he saw?
Also, the night after he saw the boy at the well, he saw Buceth taking samples of the water in the well. Strangely enough, Buceth has not gotten ill like the others in the village.
I should go question Buceth at the Loneford chapel about what he was doing at the well, and about whether he knows anything about Andor.
I have bribed Buceth into talking to me.
I have told Buceth that I am ready to follow the Shadow.

Buceth tells me that he is assigned by the priests in Nor City to make sure the Shadow casts its glow over Loneford. Apparently, the priests had sent a boy to do some business in Loneford, and Buceth was tasked with gathering some samples from the water well.
I have attacked Buceth. I should bring any evidence that Buceth has on him to Kuldan, the guard captain in the longhouse in Loneford.
I have given the vial that Buceth had on him to Kuldan, the guard captain in Loneford.

Kuldan thanked me for solving the mystery of the illness in Loneford. They will start bringing in water with help from Feygard instead of drinking from the well from now on. Kuldan also told me to visit the castle steward in Feygard if I want to help further.

I have promised to keep Buceth's story a secret. If Andor was indeed here, he must have had a good reason for doing what he did. Buceth also told me to visit the chapel custodian in Nor City if I want to learn more about the Shadow.

After giving him the key of Luthor and talking with Umar about Andor, I needed to ask him about Thieves' Guild itself.
I want to join them to see what kind of jobs they do.
Umar told me to talk with Troublemaker regarding my first task for the Guild.

Troublemaker told me to bring him three journals from spies of the guild. First I have to talk with Leta in my village, then with Dunla in Vilegard's tavern, and finally with Fanamor somewhere around Crossroads guardhouse.
I have to remember to tell them the password "You are no one. No one knows you. No one has seen you."
Leta gave me her journal and advised me to not raise suspicion.
I got Dunla's journal without any problem. I have set out to get the last journal.
Fanamor gave me her journal.
Fanamor has been gravely wounded, and the Feygard Scout grabbed the journal.
After I had killed the Feygard scout I talked again with Fanamor. She's losing blood quickly, so I have to bring her a bandage. I need to find a trustworthy priest.
Thoronir gave me a bandage. I have to return to Fanamor as soon as possible.
Unfortunately, I was not able to save Fanamor's life. However, I did get her journal.
Fanamor is alive and will find her own way to return.
I returned to Troublemaker and gave him the journals. He told me to talk with Umar, maybe he has another task for me.
After completing my first task I'm considered a member of Thieves' Guild. Now I have to perform a very risky task. Umar sent me to kidnap a noble woman from Feygard, without being discovered.
She was recently seen in the Foaming Flask tavern.
Umar gave me some advice. My strength is not always the solution. I must "use my tongue" to avoid raising suspicion in the tavern.
Ambelie Laumwill doesn't want to come with me peacefully. I cannot make a scene, or the guards will alert other patrols. Maybe talking with them would solve the situation.
I have "used my tongue" with the main Feygard soldier in the Foaming Flask tavern. He gave me permission to "escort back" Ambelie.
I knocked out Ambelie. I will take her back to the Guild.
I have decided not to kidnap Ambelie. I must think of another solution.
Ambelie gave me a very valuable necklace. I must talk with Umar and persuade him to no longer pursue her.
I safely brought Ambelie to the basement. However, keeping her here could be dangerous.
Umar believes there is a secure room for these types of "visitors". I should talk to Troublemaker.
I have talked to Troublemaker about the place Umar believes it's okay to safely keep the hostage.
Troublemaker has given me the key to the Guild brig. I should take Ambelie there and leave her to wake up.
I've inserted the key and moved the lever. A hatchway has opened in the room.
I left Ambelie in that ugly, dark, and cold place. I should go back.
Troublemaker gave me some bread for Ambelie. The guild doesn't want her to starve to death. Indeed, they want her to be as comfortable as possible. I must go to the brig again.
I gave the bread to Ambelie. I should report Troublemaker that I completed the job.
The job finally seems to be finished. I just have to talk with Umar again. However, I do not feel good about this. Kidnappings are definitely not my kind of job.
I completed this task successfully. Umar told me they have sent couriers to Feygard, and the ransom is almost guaranteed. He paid me for my work.
Umar took the necklace as compensation for my errors. Everything is fine again.
Time to rest and prepare myself to start the next job. I should go to the tavern.
I really need to take a break ....
I am now fully rested, so I should go back to Umar.
Umar told me about a group of traitors led by a veteran of the Guild. It seems he stole the Key of Luthor.
Umar went on to say that this team leader  was known as "Crackshot". He is probably also the responsible for a murder on the Duleian road.
Crackshot and his henchmen are probably hiding somewhere near the Duleian road. I must ask people there whether they have seen them.
It seems that Benbyr, a suspicious man outside Crossroads Guardhouse, doesn't know what I'm talking about.
A Crossroads guard told me that Feygard has sent more soldiers to the south, to try and find the criminals' hideout.
The barricade guard has a big mouth, and told me all I needed to know. The hideout is near a place full of larval burrowers. I need to move faster than the patrols to reach the hideout before them.
I found a small hole which seems to lead to a cave. Crackshot and his henchmen are probably hiding there.
I reached the hideout and saw some recent blood stains. Maybe there was a fight there.
The blood trail goes further ....
I heard screams and sword clashes nearby. I should take a look.
There was a massacre. The Feygard patrol reached this place, but they seem to have all been killed. I must continue.
As I progressed down the corridor the air became thicker. The blood smell was stronger, and I found another dying soldier. He said something about his sergeant and some other guy.
As I progressed down the corridor the air became thicker. The blood smell was stronger, and I found a dying soldier. He said something about his sergeant and some other guy.
I found another dying soldier. There was a massacre. The Feygard patrol reached this place, but they seem to have all been killed. I must continue.
I've found the patrol sergeant. He advised me to leave this dangerous place.
The patrol sergeant told me about what happened before. He's tired and wounded, so I willl avenge his fellows.
The patrol sergeant has left to call for backup. Now I'm alone again. Time to defeat Crackshot.
I killed Crackshot and he had the key of Luthor with him. I have to go back and report to Umar.
I tried to open the door behind Crackshot, but for some reason I cannot get the key into the lock.
The dying Crackshot said something about the key. If he told the truth, it could be cursed.
I tried to open the door behind Crackshot, but for some reason I could not get the key turned in the lock.
I reported about the situation to Umar, and gave him the key. He did not seem to want to tell me more about the key - yet.
Finally, this job is done. Now I should take a rest and regain my strength.
Must be never fulfilled
Block road1
Spoke to dying Crackshot. Remove block road1
thieves3 - Found patrol 1
thieves3 - Found patrol 2
thieves3 - Open chest
thieves3 - Open door (can currently not be fulfilled, beause the blessed key of luthor can't be obtained in the game)
Talked about thieves to Thoronir
Sergeant died.
Gave journals
Got reward
The potion-maker Lodar seems to be obsessed with something called the Hira'zinn.
Apparently, it relates to something that has started to happen recently.

Lodar gave me a glowing stone, that he said would allow me to enter some sort of tomb. He did not say which tomb, where the tomb is located, or how to reach it - only that it's somewhere 'below'. Below what, I wonder?
In the cave leading to Lodar's Hideaway, I reached what looks like a tomb. Could this be the one Lodar was referring to?
The glowing stone that Lodar gave me, crumbled to dust as I got near the tomb. However, it seems that I am now able to enter.
I have encountered a foul creature inside the tomb. I assume this is the Hira'zinn that Lodar was referring to. I should kill it and then tell Lodar.
I have presented the heart of the Hira'zinn to Lodar.
As soon as I presented the heart of the Hira'zinn to Lodar, he seemed to snap out of his previous state of mind.
Lodar thanked me for defeating the Hira'zinn. In return, he promised to help me in any way he can. He has a large selection of potent potions available for me to purchase at a discount.

Lodar says that he can make potions from some animal remains, if I first bring him some Spotted Hornbeam fungus. Apparently, the potion-maker in Fallhaven has a stock of it, if you know enough to ask.
I have retrieved some Spotted Hornbeam fungus from the potion-maker in Fallhaven. I should return to Lodar with it as soon as possible.
I have given the Spotted Hornbeam fungus to Lodar.
Lodar thanked me for bringing him the fungus. In return, he can now create his special potions for me.
Lodar can create a defensive potion if I bring him two White wyrm claws and a Ruby gem.
Lodar can create a potion of strength if I bring him a dead spider and the wings of an insect.

Lodar can create a potent defensive potion if I bring him two arulir skins and a claw from some monster. The arulir beasts can be found somewhere up in the north, and the claws can apparently be found from creatures that dwell underground and in caves somewhere outside Fallhaven.
I was told that the broken sword that I found on the body of the Hira'zinn should be taken to the smith in Vilegard.
I have restored the Xul'viir. I had to threaten the smith in Vilegard to get it restored.
I have destroyed the Xul'viir.

In the maze of green vines east of the Duleian road, I met a guard named Aulowenn from Feygard, guarding some crates. She told me that she was part of a larger group of guards searching for a madman that supposedly hides somewhere in the nearby hills, but that the other guards are now dead or missing.

Aulowenn requested my help in defeating a monster that haunts the grave of her fellow guards to the east. She warned me that the foul beast will most likely try to trick me into listening to its story.
I have met the creature that Aulowenn spoke of.

I listened to the creature's story. Its name is Tiqui, and he is the head of his clan. Apparently, the guards have been ruthlessly killing off his kin. He asked me to kill the guard for him, as revenge for what they have done.
The creature tried to trick me into listening to its story.
I attacked the creature before it could spew out more of its foul lies.
I attacked Aulowenn.
Aulowenn thanked me for bringing peace to the grave of her fallen companions by killing the creature.
Tiqui was overjoyed that I helped him kill the guard for him. He promised that if we ever run into each other again, he'd help me somehow.
I am now able to use Aulowenn's bed whenever I wish to rest.
I will not be able to resolve the conflict between Aulowenn and her attacker.

In a cave to the east, I found a man called Thorin, that wants me to help him find the remains of his former travelling companions. I should find the remains of all six of them and return them to him.
I have found some skeletal remains in the same cave that I met Thorin in.
I have found some skeletal remains in the same cave that I met Thorin in.
I have found some skeletal remains in the same cave that I met Thorin in.
I have found some skeletal remains in the same cave that I met Thorin in.
I have found some skeletal remains in the same cave that I met Thorin in.
I have found some skeletal remains in the same cave that I met Thorin in.
Thorin thanked me for helping him. In return, he has allowed me to use his bed to rest, and is willing to sell me some of his potions.
In a lonely house on a peninsula at the northern shore of lake Laeroth up in the mountains to the north-east, I met a woman called Algangror.
She has a rodent problem and needs help dealing with some of them that she has trapped in her basement.
I have agreed to help Algangror deal with her rodent problem. I should return to her when I have killed all six rodents in her basement.
Algangror thanked me for helping her with her problem.

She also told me not to talk to anyone in Remgard about her whereabouts. Apparently, they are looking for her for some reason that she would not say. Under no circumstances should I tell anyone where she is.
I will not help Algangror with her task.
Algangror won't talk to me, and I will be unable to help her with her task.
Farrik in the Fallhaven Thieves' Guild told me of a plan to help a fellow thief escape from the Fallhaven jail.

Farrik in the Fallhaven Thieves' Guild told me the details of the plan, and I accepted the task of helping him. The guard captain apparently has a drinking problem. The plan is that I get a prepared mead from the cook in the Thieves' Guild that will knock out the guard captain in the jail. I might be required to bribe the guard captain.
I got the prepared mead from the cook in the Thieves' Guild.
I told Farrik that I don't fully agree with their plan. I might tell the guard captain about their shady plan.
I have given the prepared mead to the guard captain.
I have told the guard captain of the plan that the thieves have to release their friend.
The guard captain wants me to tell the thieves that the security will be lowered for tonight. We might be able to catch some of the thieves.
I managed to bribe the guard captain into drinking the prepared mead. He should be out during the night allowing the thieves to break their friend free.
Farrik rewarded me for helping the Thieves' Guild.
I have told Farrik that the security will be lowered tonight.
The guard captain thanked me for helping him plan to catch the thieves. He said he will also tell other guards that I helped him.
I should find a potion maker called Lodar. Umar in the Fallhaven Thieves' Guild told me that I will need to know the right words to pass a guardian in order to reach Lodar's hideaway.
Umar told me I should go see someone called Ogam in Vilegard. Ogam can supply me with the right words to reach Lodar's hideaway.

I have visited Ogam in southwest Vilegard. He was talking in what seemed like riddles. I could barely make out some details when I asked about Lodar's hideaway. 'Halfway between the Shadow and the light. Rocky formations.' and the words 'Glow of the Shadow.' were among the things he said. I am not sure what they mean.
I have found a formation of rocks on the Duleian Road. It does not look like they were naturally placed, but rather that they are meant to symbolize something.
Could this be the 'rocky formation' that the old man Ogam mentioned? If that is the case, then this might be a clue as to where Andor went.
In the woods close to the rocky formation, I encountered a creature blocking the way into the forest.
By speaking the words that Ogam had mentioned, the creature moved out of the way, and almost seemed to welcome me further into the forest.

I encountered a guard from Feygard in the woods. He told me a tale of a madman that the guards from Feygard are searching for. The madman is wanted for a number of reasons that he would not disclose. He warned me both about the twisty mazes ahead, and about the madman. Apparently, several guards have gone missing after venturing forth, either by getting lost in the maze, or by something that the madman has done to them.

Before leaving, the guard warned me both about the twisty mazes ahead, and about the madman. Apparently, several guards have gone missing after venturing forth, either by getting lost in the maze, or by something that the madman has done to them.
I found another rocky formation that looked out of place.
I encountered another guard from Feygard, disoriented and lost. The things he said did not make sense.
I encountered another guard from Feygard, that seemed to be affected by something. He attacked me without provocation.
I encountered another guard from Feygard, that rambled of something that 'lurks underneath'. He attacked me without provocation.
I found yet another rocky formation that looked out of place.
In a well-hidden cave, I encountered yet another rocky formation that looked similar to the other ones that I've already seen. I must be getting close to whatever these formations lead to.
In the cave, I reached what looks like a tomb. I was unable to venture further into the tomb because of something that held me back.
After navigating through the immense twisty green maze and the damp cave, I have reached a cabin in a clearing. The cabin is occupied by the potion-maker called Lodar.
The people of Vilegard are very suspicious of outsiders. I was told to go see Jolnor in the Vilegard chapel if I want to gain their trust.
I have talked to Jolnor in the Vilegard chapel. He suggests I help three influential people in order to gain the trust of the people in Vilegard. I should help Kaori, Wrye and Jolnor in Vilegard.
I have helped all three people in Vilegard that Jolnor suggested. Now the people of Vilegard should trust me more.
Jolnor in Vilegard chapel wants me to talk to Kaori in northern Vilegard, to see if she wants any help.
Kaori in northern Vilegard wants me to bring her 10 bonemeal potions.
I have brought 10 bonemeal potions to Kaori.
Jolnor in Vilegard chapel wants me to talk to Wrye in northern Vilegard. She has apparently lost her son recently.
Wrye in northern Vilegard tells me that her son Rincel has gone missing. She thinks that he has died or gotten critically hurt.
Wrye tells me that she thinks the royal guard from Feygard are involved in his disappearance, and that they have recruited him.
Wrye wants me to go search for clues as to what has happened to her son.
I should go look in the Vilegard tavern and the Foaming Flask tavern north of Vilegard.
I heard of a boy being in the Foaming Flask tavern a while ago. Apparently he left to the west of the tavern somewhere.

To the northwest of Vilegard I found a man that had found Rincel fighting some monsters. Rincel had apparently left Vilegard by his own will to go see the city of Feygard. I should go tell Wrye in northern Vilegard what happened to her son.
I have told Wrye the truth about her son's disappearance.

Jolnor in Vilegard chapel tells me of a guard outside of the Foaming Flask tavern, that he thinks is a spy for the Feygard royal guard. He wants me to make the guard disappear, in any way that I see fit. The tavern should be just north of Vilegard.
I have convinced the guard outside the Foaming Flask tavern to leave after his shift ends.
I have started a fight with the guard outside the Foaming Flask tavern. I should bring his Feygard royal guard ring to Jolnor once he is dead to show Jolnor that he has disappeared.
I have told Jolnor that the guard is now gone.

I heard a rumor that some mining town in the Charwood forest, northwest of the Foaming Flask tavern, has had some troubles recently. I should try to find the Charwood cabin and find out what has happened.
I heard someone mention that the mining town of Charwood heights has had some troubles recently. I should search for the Charwood cabin in the forest northwest of the Foaming Flask tavern.
I have found the Charwood cabin in the forest northwest of the Foaming Flask tavern.

Maevalia in the Charwood cabin told me a story about how their mining settlement was attacked by some monsters, forcing them to flee down the mountain. They are still missing several of their friends and relatives from the Charwood heights, either killed or captured by the monsters.
In particular, Maevalia mentions four people that are greatly missed; their former leader Morenavia, their weapons trainer Falothen, the healer Ayell and their armorer Fayvara.
I have agreed to help the people of Charwood find their missing people.
The guard outside the Charwood cabin allowed me to enter the hills ahead. I should keep to the east and then head north.
I encountered one of the monsters that Maevalia spoke of. The monster spoke of someone or something called 'The Thukuzun'.
I have found Falothen, the weapons trainer of the Charwood heights, and freed him from the restraints that held him. He will try to make his way back to the Charwood cabin himself.
I have found some skeletal remains, containing a ring with the insignia 'Morenavia'. This must be the former leader of the Charwood hills.
I have found the armorer Fayvara, and freed her from the restraints that held her. She will try to make her way back to the Charwood cabin herself.
I have found some skeletal remains, containing a ring with the insignia 'Ayell'. This must be the remains of the Charwood hills healer that Maevalia mentioned.

Maevalia thanked me for finding out what happened to the four people that she told me about, but was really sad to hear about the fate of Morenavia and Ayell. Both the weapons trainer Falothen and the armorer Fayvara made it back to the Charwood cabin safely.
She told me that both Falothen and Fayvara are anxious to see me, in the basement of the Charwood cabin. I should go see them at once.

Falothen was happy to see me again, and in return offered to train me in better handling of one weapon type. He can teach me better handling of one or two handed swords, daggers, blunt weapons, axes, or unarmed combat. I'll have to chose my preference and let him know.
Falothen has taught me how to better handle one handed swords.
Falothen has taught me how to better handle two handed swords.
Falothen has taught me how to better handle daggers.
Falothen has taught me how to better handle blunt weapons.
Falothen has taught me how to better handle axes.
Falothen has taught me how to be better at fighting unarmed, without weapons.
Falothen offered me the chance to learn about the other weapon types, but to teach me, he needs 5000 gold and two Oegyth crystals for each skill that I want to get better at.

Fayvara thanked me for rescuing her, and in return offered to train me in better handling of one type of armor. She can teach me better handling of shields, light armor, heavy armor or or unarmored combat. I'll have to chose my preference and let her know.
Fayvara has taught me how to better handle shields.
Fayvara has taught me how to better handle light armor.
Fayvara has taught me how to better handle heavy armor.
Fayvara has taught me how to better fighting unarmored, without wearing any armor.
Fayvara offered me the chance to learn about the other armor types, but to teach me, she needs 6000 gold and two Oegyth crystals for each skill that I want to get better at.
I have been taught one weapon type skill and one armor type skill from Falothen and Fayvara. I should go see Maevalia again.
Maevalia thanked me for helping the people of Charwood.

I've heard a story that the whole reason for the Charwood hills being invaded by the monsters in the first place was that something had been awoken deep in the Charwood mine. The people in the Charwood cabin say that the miners uncovered some sort of marking on the ground in a cave, with strange noises coming from below it. When they finally broke through the ground around the markings, all the troubles started. I should talk to Maevalia again.
I've promised Maevalia to investigate the deeper parts of the Charwood mine. I should be on the lookout for the dangerous monsters that inhabit the mine.
I've reached the part of the mine that was broken into. The air around here seems to get hotter as I get deeper into the mine.

Among the fires in the lower parts of the mine, I've encountered some type of dragon-like creature. I guess this is the source of all the chaos in the mine. I should attempt to kill it and then venture back to Maevalia to tell her about it once I'm victorious.
I have presented one of the bones from the corpse of the Thukuzun to Maevalia.
Maevalia was happy to hear that I killed the source of the monster invasion.
You entered a classroom in Brimhaven's school. The teacher told you to sit down.
You noticed an evil-looking statue in a corner. Who on earth puts such an ugly, hideous thing in a school?
You found a free place next to Golin.
The teacher was droning endlessly about Brimhaven history.
Then a practice lesson started.
Everyone should take a set of practice weapons from the chest and sit down again.
You should look for a dueling partner.
You started a fight with Golin.
You started a fight with Golin and killed him.
You started a fight with Golin, but you broke off the duel. Very good.
You tried to fight a pupil, but they all ran away screaming.
You started a fight with the teacher.
You started a fight with the teacher and killed her.
You started a fight with the teacher, but you broke off the duel. Very good.
You feel the evil stare of the statue.
The evil grinning statue suddenly grew to an incredible size and attacked you!
You killed the evil statue.
The teacher thanked you for saving him. School is over for you. You could go to the general store and get a cake for good performance.
You cheated during the duel. The teacher noticed it and banned you from the school.
The teacher was very satisfied with your performance in the duel. School is over for you. You could go to the general store and get a cake for good performance.
The teacher sent you away, because you killed Golin in the duel.
Golin was horrified by your murder of the teacher and attacked you to avenge her.
Facutloni asked you to help him check the storage. You should check if there is a pair of every item.
You have found a pair of crystal globes.
You have found a pair of plush pillows.
You have found a pair of lyras.
You have found a pair of boots.
You have found a pair of chandeliers.
You have found a pair of mysterious green somethings.
You have found a pair of old, worn capes.
You have found a pair of pretty porcelain figures.
You have found a pair of striped hammers.
You have found a pair of dusty old books.
I found all the 10 pairs. Facutloni is very happy.
You run around in classroom.
Talked to Golin.
Thieves?
Dueled Golin with school weapons.
Talked to the statue.
Reward: cake
Reward: cake got
Pupils ran out

On a farm I heard of Guynmart Castle nearby. The farmer Rhodita is worried about young Lady Hannah of Guynmart, who used to visit often but has not been seen for a week now. Rhodita asked me to check on her.
I got to the castle, but the main gate was shut.
I got to the castle, but the main gate was shut.
I found the way into the castle garden.
The guard at the back door is corrupt. He agreed to let me through for some gold.
He told me who is living at the castle: Guynmart himself, and his children Hannah and Robalyrius.
In the main hall I met Unkorh the steward. He expected Guynmart to return the following morning. He says I should go to the kitchen for some bread and then leave.
I met Lady Hannah's little brother, Rob.
The maid told me that Hannah is missing her betrothed. I should talk to Hannah; she is on the tower top. To get to her, I should offer the cook to take Hannah her lunch.
I overheard Unkorh the steward talking to himself. He plans for Guynmart to die in the castle dungeon, and after ursuping the throne he would marry Lady Hannah.
I suggested to Hofala the cook that I could take some lunch to Lady Hannah. He had no more of his special herb selection for the lunch and asked me to get some fresh herbs from Nuik in the garden.
Nuik gave some herbs to me.
I should take lunch to Lady Hannah on the tower top.
Hannah is filled with grief, she cannot think clearly without the smell of a rose. Before she can tell me her whole story, she needs a fresh, fragrant rose.
Unkorh saw me talking to Hannah. He was very jealous and asked guard Olav to show me the special guest exit.
I met Norgothla, the chief of Guynmart's personal guard. He was troubled about my news from the castle, and asked me to get evidence for it.
I got the rose from the guard at the garden door at last.
I gave the rose to Hannah. She told me that Lovis has vanished. In the deepenst depths of her darkest dreams she hears Lovis' voice calling out.
Hannah gave Lovis' flute to me, so that I might prove that I was sent by Hannah.
I met Rob in a room above the watch chamber. Rob promised to distract the guards so that I could pass by.
120 obsolete - The guards were distracted and would not see anybody climbing downstairs.
130 obsolete - I jumped into the dark dungeon below the tower.
I jumped into the dark dungeon below the tower where I found Lovis. He was overjoyed to get back his flute.
The dungeon door flew open. The torturer entered and demanded that we stop the noise.
After the torturer's death the door was open.
Lovis left and went into the woods to get Guynmart's personal guards.

Guynmart was laying half dead in a cell. He asked me to open the castle gate so that his personal guard may come in. After that I should run and hide, because there would be a dangerous battle. I should not return before the following morning.

Unkorh appeared and explained many things. Then Unkorh saw that Guynmart tried to kill me from behind, but stumbled and fell onto his own knife. I should still open the gate, and then go to the farm in the south until the morning.
Unkorh appeared and killed Guynmart. Then he fled like a coward.
The guards let me through to the wall.
I got the main gate open.
I went to Rhodita the farmer and stayed there for the night.
When I got to the castle on the next day, I saw Hannah and Lovis in the throne room. The castle was decorated for a wedding and there had been a merry feast.
When I got to the castle on the next day, I saw Unkorh the steward in the throne room. The castle was decorated for a wedding and there had been a merry feast.
Hannah gave me an everlasting fragrant rose as a present.
I was allowed to choose something from the treasury.
I took the money.
I took the scroll of wisdom.
I took the shield.
Lovis prepared a surprise for me west of the castle.
Then I took my leave of Unkorh.
Little Stuephant was crying because he lost his marbles. You told him you would find them for him.
I found a green marble.
I found a red marble.
I found a pink marble.
I found a golden marble.
I found a pearl white marble.
That was all of them. I should give them to Stuephant now.
Stuephant was happy again.
The old man on the hill top yearned for a meal of bread and cheese together with wine.
I brought him bread, cheese and wine. He is very happy.

He would be even happier if the cheese was cheddar from Charwood.
You can only get the cheddar there if you explicitly ask for it.
I got bread, cheddar and wine for him. He started feasting happily.

63=Hannah rant 3
I talked with Lodar about a possible shortcut to the outside world. He said I should check the cave under the former cave of the Hira'zinn.
I've found the cave but the way is blocked by rocks and water. Why can't I swim?
The rock formations are not the only thing that changed here. There is now a path through the water.
I notice a torch burning with a strange purple hue. It's definitely a magical item. I should ask Lodar about this torch.
Upon telling Lodar about the purple fire he gave me a green vial, and told me to pour it over the torch to see what happens.

I poured the vial over the purple fire and then it turned green. When approaching it I was teleported into another room of the cave with more purple torches. I was able to activate them as well. Finally, I have got my shortcut and can travel to Lodar a lot faster!
I told Lodar about the new shortcut. He asked me to keep it a secret.
I met a man seeking help for his settlement, the 'Blackwater mountain'. Supposedly, his settlement is being attacked by monsters and bandits, and they need help from the outside.
I have agreed to help the man and Blackwater mountain in dealing with the problem.
The man told me to meet him on the other side of the collapsed mine. He will crawl through the mine shaft and I will descend into the pitch-black abandoned mine.

I have navigated through the pitch-black abandoned mine, and met the man on the other side. He seemed very anxious about telling me to head straight to the east once I exit the mine. I should meet the man at the bottom of the mountain to the east.
I heard a story about Prim and the Blackwater mountain settlement fighting against each other.
I should follow the mountain path up the mountain to the Blackwater mountain settlement.
I met the man again on my way up to Blackwater mountain. I should proceed further up the mountain.
I have made it up to the snow-filled parts of the Blackwater mountain. The man told me to proceed further up the mountain. Apparently, the Blackwater mountain settlement is close by.
I have reached the Blackwater mountain settlement. I should find and talk to their battle master, Harlenn.

I have spoken to Harlenn in the Blackwater mountain settlement. Apparently, the settlement is under attack by a number of monsters, the aulaeth and white wyrms. On top of that, they are being attacked by the people of Prim.
Harlenn thinks the people of Prim are behind the monster attacks somehow.

Harlenn wants me to give a message to Guthbered of Prim. Either the people of Prim stop their attacks on the Blackwater mountain settlement, or they will have to be dealt with themselves. I should go talk to Guthbered in Prim.
Guthbered denies that the people of Prim have anything to do with the monster attacks on the Blackwater mountain settlement. I should go talk to Harlenn.
Harlenn is sure that the people of Prim are behind the attacks somehow.
Harlenn wants me to go to Prim and look for signs that they are preparing for an attack on the settlement. I should go look for clues around where Guthbered stays.
I have found some plans in Prim about recruiting mercenaries and attacking the Blackwater mountain settlement. I should go talk to Harlenn immediately.
Harlenn thanked me for investigating the attack plans.
To make the attacks on the Blackwater mountain settlement stop, Harlenn wants me to assassinate Guthbered in Prim.
I have started a fight with Guthbered.
I told Guthbered that I was sent to kill him, but I let him live. He thanked me deeply, and left Prim.
I have told Harlenn that Guthbered is gone.
Harlenn thanked me for the help I have provided. Hopefully, the attacks on the Blackwater mountain settlement should stop now.
I am now trusted in the Blackwater mountain settlement, and all services should be available for me to use.
I have decided to not help the people of the Blackwater mountain settlement.
Since I am helping Prim, Harlenn no longer wants to talk to me.

I talked to the cook in Prim, at the base of Blackwater mountain. There is a back room available for rent, but it is currently rented out to Arghest. I should go talk to Arghest to see whether he still wants to rent the room. The cook pointed me towards the southwest of Prim.

I talked to Arghest about the back room at the inn. He is still interested in having it as an option to rest at. But he told me he could probably be persuaded to let me use it if I compensate him sufficiently.
Arghest wants me to bring him 5 bottles of milk. I can probably find some milk in any of the larger villages.
I have brought the milk to Arghest. He agreed to let me use the back room at the Prim inn. I should be able to rest there now. I should go talk to the cook at the inn.
I have explained to the cook that I have permission by Arghest to use the back room.
Just outside the collapsed mine on the way to Blackwater mountain, I met a man from the village of Prim. He begged me to help them.
The village of Prim needs help from someone from the outside to deal with attacks from some monsters. I should speak to Guthbered in Prim if I want to help them.
Guthbered can be found in the main hall of Prim. I should look for a stone house in the center of town.
I talked to Guthbered about the story about Prim. Prim has recently been under constant attack from the Blackwater mountain settlement.
Guthbered wants me to go up to the settlement atop the Blackwater mountain and ask their battle master Harlenn why (or if) they have summoned the gornaud monsters against Prim.
I have talked to Harlenn about the attacks on Prim. He denies that the people of the Blackwater mountain settlement have anything to do with them. I should go talk to Guthbered in Prim again.
Guthbered still believes that the people in the Blackwater mountain settlement have something to do with the attacks.

Guthbered wants me to go look for any clues that the people of the Blackwater mountain settlement is preparing for a larger attack on Prim. I should go look for hints near Harlenn's private quarters, but make sure not to be seen.
I have found some papers around Harlenn's private quarters outlining a plan to attack Prim. I should go talk to Guthbered immediately.
Guthbered thanked me for helping him find evidence of the plans for an attack.
In order to make the attacks on Prim stop, Guthbered wants me to kill Harlenn up in the Blackwater mountain settlement.
I have started a fight with Harlenn.
I told Harlenn that I was sent to kill him, but I let him live. He thanked me deeply, and left the settlement.
I have told Guthbered that Harlenn is gone.

Guthbered thanked me for the help I have provided to Prim. Hopefully, the attacks on Prim should stop now. As thanks, Guthbered gave me some items and a forged permit so that I can enter the inner chamber up in the Blackwater mountain settlement.
I have shown the forged permit to the guard and was let through to the inner chamber.
I am now trusted in Prim, and all services should be available for me to use.
I have decided to not help the people of Prim.
Since I am helping the Blackwater mountain settlement, Guthbered no longer wants to talk to me.
I have made my way into the inner chamber in the Blackwater mountain settlement and found a group of mages led by a man named Throdna.
Throdna seems very interested in someone (or something) called Kazaul, and in particular a ritual performed in its name.

I have agreed to help Throdna find out more about the ritual itself, by looking for pieces of the ritual that apparently are scattered across the mountain. I should go look for the parts of the Kazaul ritual on the mountain path down from Blackwater mountain to Prim.
I need to find the two parts of the chant and the three pieces describing the ritual itself, and return to Throdna once I have found them all.
I have found the first half of the chant for the Kazaul ritual.
I have found the second half of the chant for the Kazaul ritual.
I have found the first piece of the Kazaul ritual.
I have found the second piece of the Kazaul ritual.
I have found the third piece of the Kazaul ritual.
Throdna thanked me for finding all the pieces of the ritual.
Throdna wants me to put an end to the Kazaul spawn uprising that has taken place near the Blackwater mountain. There is a shrine at the base of the mountain that i should investigate closer.
I have been given a vial of purifying spirit that Throdna wants me to apply to the shrine of Kazaul. I should return to Throdna when I have found and purified the shrine.
In the shrine at the base of Blackwater mountain, I met a guardian of Kazaul. By reciting the verses of the ritual chant, I was able to make the guardian attack me.
I have purified the shrine of Kazaul.

I had expected some form of appreciation from Throdna for helping him learn more about the ritual and for purifying the shrine. But he seemed more occupied with rambling on about Kazaul. I could not make out anything sane from his ramblings.

Herec on the second level of the Blackwater mountain settlement is researching the white wyrms outside the settlement. He wants me to bring him 5 white wyrm claws so that he can continue his research. Apparently, only some of the wyrms have these claws. I will have to kill some to find them.
I have given the 5 white wyrm claws to Herec.
Herec has finished making a potion of fatigue restoration that will be very useful when fighting against the wyrms in the future.
Bjorgur in Prim at the base of the Blackwater mountain thinks that something has disturbed the grave of his parents, to the southwest of Prim, just outside the Elm mine.
Bjorgur wants me to go check the grave, and make sure his family's dagger is still secure in the tomb.
Fulus in Prim is interested in obtaining Bjorgur's family dagger that Bjorgur's grandfather used to possess.
I met a man that wielded a strange looking dagger in the lower parts of a tomb to the southwest of Prim. He must have robbed this dagger from the grave.
I placed the dagger back into its place in the tomb. The restless undead seem much less restless now, strangely enough.
Bjorgur thanked me for my assistance. He told me I should also seek his relatives in Feygard.
I have told Fulus that I helped Bjorgur return his family dagger to its original place.
I have given Bjorgur's family dagger to Fulus. He thanked me for bringing it to him, and rewarded me handsomely.

questlist.name: A path to the Duleian Road

stages.logText: I talked to a guard in the east of Fallhaven. He watches over the old passage to the Duleian Road, which is now blocked by fallen trees. If I want to help opening the path I should talk to his superior, the warden in the Fallhaven prison.
I talked to the warden. I wasn't able to convince him, but he advised me to talk to the woodcutter Jakrar, who lives just south of Fallhaven's prison.

I talked to Jakrar the woodcutter. He will only clear the trees away if I do him a favor. I should search for his favorite axe east of the Crossroads Guardhouse, located to the north of Fallhaven. I should keep my eyes open for an evil wolf pack.
I have found a wolf pack and slain their leader. Beneath its remains I found Jakrar's axe. I should take it back to him.
I showed Jakrar the axe I found and he recognized it immediately.
Jakrar was very happy to see his good old axe again. He expressed his gratitude, and started to clear away the trees immediately.
Now the woodcutter has cleared away all the trees that blocked the path. Finally, the townsfolk have got back their shortcut to the Duleian Road!
My father Mikhail says that Andor has not been home since yesterday. I should go look for him in the village.
Leonid tells me that he saw Andor talking to Gruil. I should go ask Gruil if he knows more.
Gruil wants me to bring him a poison gland. Then he might talk more. He tells me that some poisonous snakes have such a gland.
Gruil tells me that Andor was looking for someone called Umar. I should go ask his friend Gaela in Fallhaven to the east.
I talked to Gaela in Fallhaven. He tells me to go see Bucus and ask about the Thieves' Guild.
Bucus has allowed me to enter the hatch in the derelict house in Fallhaven. I should go talk to Umar.
Umar in the Fallhaven Thieves' Guild recognized me, but must have me confused with Andor. Apparently, Andor has been to see him.
Umar told me that Andor went to see a potion maker called Lodar. I should search for his hideaway.

I heard a story in Loneford, where it seemed like Andor had been in Loneford, and that he might have had something to do with the illness that the people are suffering from there. I am not sure if it actually was Andor. If it was Andor, why would he have made the people of Loneford ill?

I have found the potion-maker Lodar, and heard his story about Andor. Andor went to visit Lodar in his hideaway to get a sample of something called Narwood extract. Lodar happened to notice that there was someone travelling together with Andor, that hid among the trees and did not seem to want Lodar to spot him.

Shortly after Andor and the person he was travelling with had left, strange things started to happen in the woods around Lodar's hideaway, and Lodar himself seemed to be affected by it somehow. Lodar believes that something disturbed the tomb below his cabin, and awoke the Hira'zinn.

Since I helped Lodar defeat the Hira'zinn, he promised to help me in return. He gave me a piece of paper that should allow me to enter the Valanyr temple of the Shadow in Nor City. He told me to seek out lady Lydalon in the temple for further assistance.
All clues so far as to where Andor went point to Nor City. I should travel to Nor City by following the Duleian road to the southeast and look for more clues there.
At Castle Guynmart I learned from Steward Unkorh that some time ago Andor was also there as a guest.
Unkorh gave me the bonemeal potion box that Andor had given him for safekeeping.
I have brought the bread to Mikhail.
Mikhail wants me to go buy a loaf of bread from Mara at the town hall.
I have killed the two rats in our garden.
Mikhail wants me to go check our garden for some rats. I should kill the rats in our garden and return to Mikhail. If I get hurt, I can come back to the bed and rest to regain my health.
Leta in Crossglen village wants me to look for her husband Oromir.
I have found Oromir in Crossglen village, hiding from his wife Leta.
I have told Leta that Oromir is hiding in Crossglen village.
Odair wants me to clear the supply cave in Crossglen village of rats. In particular, I should kill the large rat and return to Odair.
I have helped Odair clear out the rats in the supply cave in Crossglen village.

Leonid in Crossglen town hall tells me that there was a disturbance in the village some weeks ago. Apparently, Lord Geomyr has banned all use of bonemeal as a healing substance.

Tharal, the town priest should know more.
Tharal does not want to talk about bonemeal. I might be able to persuade him by bringing him 5 insect wings.

Tharal tells me that bonemeal is a very potent healing substance, and is quite upset that it is not allowed anymore. I should go see Thoronir in Fallhaven if I want to learn more. I should tell him the password 'Glow of the Shadow'.
I have talked to Thoronir in Fallhaven. He might be able to mix me a bonemeal potion if I bring him 5 skeletal bones. There should be some skeletons in an abandoned house north of Fallhaven.

I have brought the bones to Thoronir. He is now able to supply me with bonemeal potions.
I should be careful when using them though, since Lord Geomyr has banned their use.

Jan tells me his story, where he and his two friends Gandir and Irogotu, went down the hole to dig for a hidden treasure, but they started fighting and Irogotu killed Gandir in his rage.
I should bring back Gandir's ring from Irogotu, and see Jan when I have it.
Irogotu is dead. I have brought Jan the ring of Gandir, and avenged his friend.
Bucus in Fallhaven might know something about Andor. He wants me to bring him the key of Luthor from the catacombs beneath Fallhaven church.
The catacombs beneath Fallhaven church are closed off. Athamyr is the only one with both permission and the bravery to enter them. I should go see him in his house southwest of the church.
Athamyr wants me to bring him some cooked meat, then maybe he will want to talk more.
I brought some cooked meat to Athamyr.
Athamyr has given me permission to enter the catacombs beneath Fallhaven church.
I brought Bucus the key of Luthor.
A drunk outside Fallhaven tavern began telling me his story, but wants me to bring him some mead. I don't know if his story will lead anywhere though.
The drunk told me he used to travel with Unnmir. I should go talk to Unnmir.
An old man standing outside in Fallhaven has lost his book 'Calomyran Secrets'. I should go look for it. Maybe in Arcir's house to the south?
I found a torn page of a book called 'Calomyran Secrets' with the name 'Larcal' written on it.
I gave the book back to the old man.
Unnmir told me he used to be an adventurer, and gave me a hint to go see Nocmar. His house is just southwest of the tavern in Fallhaven.

Nocmar tells me he used to be a smith. But Lord Geomyr has banned the use of heartsteel, so he cannot forge his weapons anymore.
If I can find a heartstone and bring it to Nocmar, he should be able to forge the heartsteel again.
I have brought a heartstone to Nocmar. He should have heartsteel items available now.
Yolgen asked me to have a look at what is wrong with Flagstone prison.

I met a guard from Stoutford on sentry duty outside a fortress called Flagstone. He told me that Flagstone used to serve as a prison for house Gorland of Stoutford, but it is now abandoned. Recently, undead have started pouring out of Flagstone. I should investigate the source of the undead monsters. The guard tells me to return to him if I need help.
I found a dug out tunnel beneath Flagstone, that seems to lead to a larger cave. The cave is guarded by a demon that I am not even able to approach. Maybe the guard outside Flagstone knows more?
The guard suggested that the former warden may have something to do with this, and I should go and look for him. If I find him I should return to the guard with any important news.
I found the former warden of Flagstone on the upper level. Among his remains I found a necklace with some inscriptions. I should return to the guard now.
I have learned the words required to approach the demon beneath Flagstone. 'Daylight Shadow'. It seems like the warden has something to do with the monster invasion.
Deep beneath Flagstone, I found a powerful winged demon. It seems like the warden kept on running the prison and experimented with necromancy.

I found one prisoner, Narael, alive deep beneath Flagstone. Narael was once a citizen of Nor City. He is too weak to walk by himself, but if I can find his wife in Nor City, I would be handsomely rewarded.
I approached the sentry again and he was happy to hear the source of the undead is gone. I should talk to Yolgen, the priest of Stoutford, for a reward.
Yolgen rewarded me handsomely for my efforts and is happy that there is one thing less the citizens of Stoutford have to worry about.

A mage called Vacor in southwest Fallhaven has been trying to cast a rift spell.
There was something not right about him, he seemed very obsessed with his spell. Something about him gaining a power from it.
Vacor wants me to bring him the four pieces of the rift spell that he claims was stolen from him. The four bandits should be somewhere south of Fallhaven.
I have brought the four pieces of the rift spell to Vacor.

Vacor tells me about his former apprentice Unzel, who had started to question Vacor. Vacor now wants me to kill Unzel. I should be able to find him to the southwest outside of Fallhaven. I should bring his signet ring to Vacor once I have killed him.
Unzel gives me a choice to side with either Vacor or him.
I have chosen to side with Unzel. I should go to southwest Fallhaven to talk to Vacor about Unzel and the Shadow.
I started a fight with Unzel. I should bring his ring to Vacor once he is dead.
I started a fight with Vacor. I should bring his ring to Unzel once he is dead.
I have killed Unzel and told Vacor about the deed.
I have killed Vacor and told Unzel about the deed.
Halvor asked me to bring him 5 insect wings.
I gave Halvor the 5 insect wings he wanted.
Halvor asked me to bring him 5 rat tails.
I gave Halvor 5 rat tails.
My rat tails weren't good enough for him. He needs more. How many does he really want?
I refused to bring more rat tails to Halvor. He left Crossglen.
I met Halvor at the foot of a mountain.
Halvor told me he is still looking for 5 rat tails. I agreed to help again.
The 5 rat tails I gave him were good enough this time.
Halvor asked for 4 handfuls of animal hair.
I gave him 4 handfuls of animal hair.
Halvor liked only one of my handfuls of animal hair. He asked me to bring him 3 more.
I gave up on finding handfuls of animal hair that suit Halvor's taste. He has left.
I met Halvor again. He was standing by the lakeside, near an old house, in the north.
Halvor was in bad shape. He asked me to give him a healing potion.
I gave Halvor a small healing potion.
I gave Halvor a healing potion.
I gave Halvor a powerful healing potion.
I gave Halvor a potion made by Lodar.
He was healed by the potion I gave him.
Halvor told me he is still looking for 3 tufts of animal hair.
This time, the handfuls of animal hair I gave him were soft enough.
Halvor wants to find two bones. He wants long ones. I'll try to find some.
I gave Halvor two bones, but they weren't long enough. Should I really bring him more bones?
Halvor left the lakeside when I refused to get him more bones.
Exploring the ruins of Charwood, I stumbled upon Halvor.
Since I last met him, he found one bone that was long enough, but he's still looking for one.
I found a bone that was long enough, and gave it to Halvor.
Halvor asked me to find 10 scales from venomscale snakes.
I brought Halvor the 10 venomscale scales.
Halvor left, asking me to pay a visit to his friend Kayla if I ever go to Stoutford.
I met Kayla in Stoutford. She offered me a pair of the boots she made with Halvor's items.
I should visit the potion-maker in Fallhaven and ask for something to help against food poisoning.
The potion-maker in Fallhaven can create potions that help against food-poisoning.
I should bring him a poison gland, two pieces of animal hair and 50 gold pieces, and he'll create a potion for me.
I have brought the ingredients for the potion.
I received a potion of antidote, that should help me if I get food-poisoning.
I can bring him more ingredients if I want him to create more antidote potions in the future.
I stumbled across a treasure chest in a clearing south of the Waterway house but the chest is protected by some form of magic and cannot be opened.

I encountered a traveler a short distance from the treasure chest. He told me there is a legend that the key to the chest is held by one of the undead that roam the cemetery to the south of the chest. However, the entrance to the cemetery is sealed by a magical force.
The traveler told me that Hagale in the Wood settlement might know how to enter the cemetery.
I went to the Wood settlement and found Hagale. He was a drunk mess and would not speak to me unless I brought him two Lowyna's special brew.

Hagale said that the entrance to the cemetery was also sealed with magic to safeguard the key to the chest. The seal can only be broken by defeating the undead monster. However, Hagale found an ancient text that allows the holder to temporarily enter the cemetery. Hagale gave me the text.
I returned to the cemetery and was able to enter it using the ancient text just as Hagale had claimed.
I hacked through a horde of undead until I encountered one wearing a key.
I killed the undead and took the key.
I opened the chest, which contained a powerful sword. Next time I'm in the Wood settlement I should see if Hagale is still around.
Hagale tried to rob me and take the sword, but I killed him and took it back.
Hagale tried to rob me and take the sword. He lost his wife and daughter and wasn't thinking straight. I gave him the sword without a fight.
Hagale wanted some of the gold I got from selling the sword. It seemed fair to give him a share.
Hagale tried to rob me of the gold I got from selling the sword. I had no choice but to kill him.
In a lonely house east of Loneford, I met an old man named Cithurn.
Cithurn told me he needs an experienced fighter to help with his problem.
Cithurn told me that the surrounding forest has been under invasion by monsters for several weeks.
Cithurn heard something similar was occurring in Charwood until a young adventurer killed a vile beast in the mine beneath the city.
I told Cithurn about my role in Charwood and of my battle with Thukuzun.
Cithurn did not remember if the forest invasion began before the events in Charwood or after. However, based on my experiences in Charwood, Cithurn believes there is a connection between the two.
I promised Cithurn I would investigate the source of the monster invasion in the forest. I will have to pass through the forest to access an entrance to a cave northeast of Cithurn's home.
I found the entrance to the cave.
I reached the end of the cave system. The air became damper the deeper I went.
Among the cold and damp lower parts of the cave, I encountered another dragon-like creature. This must be the source of all the chaos in the forest above. I should attempt to kill it.
I killed the monster called Tesrekan and took one of its bones as proof. I should venture back to Cithurn to tell him about it.
I presented one of the bones from the corpse of Tesrekan to Cithurn. He was happy to hear that I killed the source of the monster invasion. As we agreed, I returned his talisman.
I presented one of the bones from the corpse of Tesrekan to Cithurn. He was happy to hear that I killed the source of the monster invasion. I decided to keep his talisman as payment for my hard work.

questlist.name: Placeholder for hidden quest stages 2 (not displayed)

stages.logText: Got Cithurn's talisman
Found gold on waytolake7b
Found gem 1 on waytolake6
Found gem 2 on waytolake6
Met Aemens
Was warned about Aemens
Told Aemens the neighbor warned you about her
Taret tells you to be more careful what you say
Looted corpse in waterway cave
Got repreimanded by Cithurn
Petted Cithurn's cat
Have discovered hidden room
Returned Cithurn's talisman after initially saying you would keep it.
Found old clothes
Met Teksin
Purchased potion of lightning attack
Mentioned Remgard - Teksin
Been to Remgard
Talked to Yolgen about the castle
Talked to Yolgen about Flagstone
Saw bird from lookout
Found opal at lookout
You will never get this quest stage (used for lookout)
bought Brimhaven bed

I have reached the bridge to enter the town of Remgard. According to the bridge guard, the town is closed for outsiders to enter, and no-one is currently allowed to leave. They are investigating some disappearances of some of the townspeople.
I have offered my assistance in helping the people of Remgard investigate what has happened to the townspeople that have disappeared.
The bridge guard has asked me to investigate an abandoned house to the east along the northern shore of the lake. I should be wary of any inhabitants that may be there.
I have reported back to the bridge guard that I met Algangror in the abandoned house.
I have reported back to the bridge guard that the abandoned house was empty.
I have been granted entrance into Remgard. I should go visit Jhaeld, the town elder, to talk about what the next step should be. Jhaeld can probably be found in the tavern to the southeast.
Jhaeld was rather arrogant, but told me that they have had a problem with people disappearing for a while now. They have no clue what could be causing it.
I should visit four people in Remgard, and ask them about any clues on what might have happened to the missing people.
First is Norath, whose wife Bethir has disappeared. Norath can be found in the south-westernmost farmhouse.
Second, I should go talk to the Knights of Elythom, here in the tavern.
Third, I should go talk to the old woman Duaina in her house to the south.
Lastly, I should talk to Rothses, the armorer. He lives on the west side of town.
I tried to tell Jhaeld about Algangror, but he dismissed me as he had not heard me.
I have talked to Norath. He and his wife had been fighting recently, but he has no idea on what may have happened to her.
The Knights of Elythom in the Remgard tavern have had one of their knights disappearing recently. No one noticed anything when she disappeared, however.

Duaina has seen me in her visions. I did not understand all that she spoke of, but the parts that were clear were that me and Andor were parts of a larger plot. I wonder what this means? She did not speak of any disappearing people however, not that I could understand anyway.
Rothses told me that Bethir visited him the night before she disappeared, to sell some equipment. He did not see where she went after that.

I have talked to all of the people that Jhaeld wanted me to talk to, but did not get any information from any of them about what may have happened to the missing people. I should go back to Jhaeld and ask what his plans are next.
Jhaeld was really upset that I did not find out anything from the people that I was sent to talk to.
If I still want to help Jhaeld and the people of Remgard, I should look for clues in other places.
Jhaeld does not want to talk to me. I will not help them find out what happened to the missing people of Remgard.
I have told Jhaeld, the village elder in Remgard, about the woman named Algangror that lives in the abandoned house to the east along the northern shore of the lake outside Remgard.

Jhaeld told me that he would rather not deal with her, since he believes she is very dangerous. For the sake of his guards, he will not risk going against her since he is afraid of what might happen to all of them.
If I want to help Jhaeld and the people of Remgard, I should find a way to make Algangror disappear. He also warns me to be extremely careful.
Algangror admitted to me that she had made some people disappear from Remgard. She would not tell me what happened to them though.
I have started attacking Algangror. I should return to Jhaeld with proof of defeating her when she is dead.
I have told Jhaeld that I defeated Algangror.
Jhaeld was very pleased to hear the good news. The people of Remgard should now be safe, and the town can be opened to outsiders again.
For helping the people of Remgard find the cause of the disappearing people, Jhaeld told me to talk to Rothses. He might be able to improve some of my equipment.
Ervelyn, the Remgard tailor, gave me a feathered hat as thanks for helping the people of Remgard find out what happened to the missing people.

Algangror wants me to help her with a task. She cannot describe the nature of the task, or the reasoning behind it. If I help her, she has promised to give me her enchanted necklace, that apparently is worth a lot.
I have agreed to help Algangror with her task.
Algangror wants me to place five idols near five different people in Remgard. The idols should be placed near the beds of these five people, and must be hidden so that they are not found easily.
The first person is Jhaeld, the village elder that can be found in the Remgard tavern.
Second, I should place an idol by the bed of Larni the farmer, that lives in one of the northern cabins in Remgard.
The third person is Arnal the weapon-smith, that lives in the northwest of Remgard.
Fourth is Emerei, that can be found to the southeast of Remgard.
The fifth person is Carthe. Carthe lives on the eastern shore of Remgard, near the tavern.
I must not tell anyone of my task, or of the placement of the idols.
I have placed an idol by Jhaeld's bed.
I have placed an idol by Larni the farmer's bed.
I have placed an idol by Arnal's bed.
I have placed an idol by Emerei's bed.
I have placed an idol by Carthe's bed.
All the idols have been placed by the beds of the people that Algangror told me to visit. I should return to Algangror.
Algangror thanked me for helping her.
She told me her story, with how she used to live in the city, but was persecuted for her beliefs. According to her, the persecution was totally unjustified since she does no harm to people.
To take revenge on the city of Remgard, she managed to lure some people into her cabin and turn them into rats.
For helping her with the tasks that she could not perform herself, Algangror gave me her enchanted necklace, 'Marrowtaint'.
I have decided not to help Algangror with her task.
I met Kaverin in Remgard, that apparently is an old acquaintance of Unzel, who lives outside of Fallhaven.
Kaverin wants me to deliver a message to Unzel.
I have declined to help Kaverin.
I have agreed to deliver the message.
Kaverin has given me the message that he wants me to deliver to Unzel.
I have delivered the message to Unzel. I should return to Kaverin in Remgard.
Kaverin thanked me for delivering the message to Unzel.
In return, Kaverin gave me an old map that he had acquired. Apparently, it leads to Vacor's old hideout.
Kaverin was furious over the fact that I killed Unzel, and that I helped Vacor. He started attacking me. I should return to Vacor once Kaverin is dead.
Kaverin was carrying a sealed message. Vacor immediately recognized the seal, and seemed very interested in it.
I have given Vacor the message that Kaverin was carrying. In return, Vacor gave me an old map, leading to his old hideout.
I should try to find Vacor's old hideout, on the road to the west of the former prison of Flagstone, southwest of Fallhaven.
I have found Vacor's old hideout.
Aryfora, a woman grieving in Stoutford's graveyard asked me to bring her some damerilias from Remgard for the grave of Noraed, her husband.
Noraed's sister, Caeda, gave me some damerilias. I should bring them back to Stoutford.
I have brought the damerilias back to Aryfora. She thanked me with a potion she made.
I told her the flowers were from Noraed's sister, Caeda.
I told her I found the flowers around Remgard, in the wild.

Caeda in Remgard told me I can find fresh damerilias in her family's glade, but the key was taken by monsters.
If I can find the key in the cave north of Remgard, I can access that glade, but I have to return the key to Caeda.
Finding the key was not worth the trouble. The wilted damerilias Caeda gave me will be just fine.
I killed some monsters and found the key to the glade.
I returned the key right away to Caeda.
I kept the key for a while, but finally returned it to Caeda.
Caeda asked for my help to clear out the monsters in the caves so that she can go back there and attend to the flowers.
Many monsters are dead now. The rest will no longer dare to approach the statue.
I told Caeda, so that she can attend to the glade.
Aryfora in Stoutford needs my help to prove her uncle, Blornvale, Stoutford's alchemist, killed her father.
She needs me to purchase three potions of the brave from Blornvale and return to her.
I have returned with the three potions, and gave them to her.
I decided not to help Aryfora any further.
She gave me a potion of truth.
She wants me to give that potion to Blornvale, and make him confess his crimes. I should have Tahalendor as a witness.
I agreed to make Blornvale drink that potion.
Tahalendor agreed to go with me to the alchemist's house to hear Blornvale's confession.
Blornvale drank the potion.
Tahalendor came to hear Blornvale's confession.
Blornvale confessed to killing Aryfora's father. Unfortunately there is no witness.
Blornvale now understands what I was trying to do. I will no longer be able to help Aryfora get back her shop.
Tahalendor wouldn't believe my story. I will no longer be able to help Aryfora get back her shop.
It's all my fault that Aryfora is crying now.
Blornvale confessed to killing Aryfora's father in the presence of Tahalendor.
Aryfora regained her father's shop.

I talked to Colonel Lutarc. He proposed a competition with five of his best fighters.
I accepted. The fight will be at the foot of the hill.
A lizard came towards me.
I won easily.
I lost the fight.
The second opponent was a skeleton warrior.
He was no match for me.
I lost against a pile of bones!
Mikhail came and asked me to come home.
But no, it wasn't Mikhail - it was a poser. Not a strong enough one though.
My own father attacked me? I lost this fight.
Then a little dragon came forth.
I won.
It won.
The fifth and last opponent came towards me: Bully.
I won.
I lost this last fight.
I have finished all the fights. I should climb back up to Colonel Lutarc.
He was pretty disappointed with my poor score.
My result confirmed his relatively low expectations.
He was pretty impressed with my excellent result.
Lutarc gave me a medallion as a present. There is a tiny little lizard on it, that looks completely real.

questlist.name: Lost girl looking for lost things

stages.logText: The little daughter of Odirath the armorer has been missing for several days now. You offered to help search for her.

Odirath's daughter Gyra was hidden in the storeroom of the main house of the castle. She was surprised by the raid on the castle and no longer dared to leave her hiding place.
She was looking for Lord Berbane's helmet, which he had forgotten somewhere in the castle.
You offered Gyra to lead her back home safely.
Gyra has the feeling that the helmet is very close.
You found the helmet.
Once back in Stoutford Gyra knew the way and ran to her father Odirath.
Odirath thanks you many thousand times.
Lord Berbane slowly took his helmet. Nevertheless, he remained sitting at the table. He probably needs a few more hours without drinks before he can get back to work. If ever.
Lord Berbane took his helmet. But somehow that does not really satisfy you.
Lord Berbane is singing merrily about his pretended heroic deeds. What a boaster.
Odirath thanks you many thousand times.
Lord Berbane is singing merrily about his pretended heroic deeds. What a boaster.
I tried to free this castle from the undead Lord Erwyn. But whenever I kill him, he reappears. I should seek help...

I talked to Yolgen, the Shadow priest of Stoutford, and he told me that the mighty Lord Erwyn used to reside here, but Lord Erwyn and his army were crushed during a war, the castle was sacked and the house extinguished. But recently Erwyn's knights have risen from the dead. Yolgen asked me to rid Stoutford of these undead once and for all.
I should ask Tahalendor for some special artifact that I can use to defeat powerful undead.
Tahalendor gave me a pair of special coins that I can use to defeat powerful undead.
I slew Lord Erwyn himself and ensured that he remains dead now.
I slew all the undead knights.
I slew Lord Erwyn's commander.
Among his remains I found a strange ring. I should show it to Yolgen.

Yolgen examined the ring thoroughly. He suspects it has somehow come from Mt. Galmore and reanimated the long dead soldiers. I should be wary of the evil grasp of Mt. Galmore and whatever lurks there...
I kept the ring for myself, which upset Yolgen. I should keep looking for its previous owner.
I kept the ring for myself and didn't tell Yolgen about it. He was suspicious but couldn't do anything about it. I should keep looking for its previous owner.
